text: I have been coming here for years and it only gets better. The service is fantastic and it has the charm of a cafe in Venice. I would highly recommend the fillet mignon meatballs and the eggplant appetizers. Great wine list and great prices for AMAZING food. Will be back soon! If you want a great time ask for Lyndsay as your server.

Nice lady that seated us but it was all downhill from there.   WAY OVERPRICED!!!!  They charge $8 for an iced tea!!!!  So we ordered a diet Pepsi instead $4, thinking I could choke that down since this is a Vegas hotel and $4 is standard (albeit criminal)...... Out comes a super tiny glass bottle of diet Pepsi with a glass of ice. I didn't even know they made glass bottles that small. It was sent back.   The linguini bolognese was bland. Plus, we ordered spaghettini (thin spaghetti) instead of linguini, but got linguini.... Maybe that's because the guy didn't write anything down.  He also didn't check on us, despite walking by about 5 times (this place is VERY small) until we were half way through our meals. He offered to remake the meals, but we said not to bother.   Conclusion: A RIPOFF FOR BLAND FOOD. GO ELSEWHERE.

Just finished eating here and it was okay...not impressed at all. It was a cute place but the waiter was unapproachable and seemed annoyed by us every time we asked him something (aka to get the menu again etc.). After reading the other reviews I was expecting amazing food and service but it was very average and not good customer service. Oh and the garlic rolls weren't that great either like others said. Wompssss!!!
Our server Reilly was very sweet and gave us great advice. Reasonably priced and very tasty.
We had a great attentive server. Lobster ravioli was to die for! Did not try the meatballs but they looked good. Garlic knots were delicious
Ordered the gnocchi with pesto and penne with meatballs, both were delicious and large portions. Service was friendly. Food came very quickly.

Alright yelpers maybe we went on an "off-night" and didn't get the experience some of the others have described in their reviews, but this place is terrible! Right off the bat, my husband & I stood around like weirdos waiting to be acknowledged to be seated...when there was an empty table...yes Mr. Waiter we are here to eat & not just standing around in front of your restaurant to watch others eat...jeezz! So we get to sit & don't feel very welcomed. ..money is still green right? Anyways we order the ceasar salad & shrimp scampi, the salad was just like any other you can get anywhere & our pasta dish was blah! It didn't look appetizing and had unnecessary bread crumb crap on top of the shrimp that my husband & I both had to scrape off to taste the flavor of the shrimp. Oh and the garlic bread that I was sooo looking forward to after reading the other reviews wasn't great, I don't know if we got an old batch or they cooked ours differently, but they lacked flavor. We will absolutely never eat here again even if it's the last Italian restaurant left in Vegas. Our waiter never checked on us once delivering our food, only to leave the overpriced bill for our overrated food that lacked flavor & quality. ...to others reading this & craving Italian food late at night...go somewhere else.

Came during our anniversary trip. I was looking for a great non-celebrity chef Italian place for dinner and read all of the great reviews on this little gem. We were not disappointed! It is kind of hidden away from other restaurants, has limited seating but we had no problem getting a table immediately. The garlic rolls were so fresh and garlic-y! Husband ordered a delicious red wine - dont recall the exact name but it was a $38 Primativo. Our entrees came out very quickly and piping hot. Husband had gnocchi with pesto sauce and I the linguini carbonara. Pesto sauce w as extremely fresh and vibrantly green. The gnocchi was the perfect texture, not gummy or pastey. The carbonara was so creamy yet light. Even though we ate all of our entrees and were extremely full, we decided to share the tiramasu. We managed to polish it off quickly! Highly recommend! We will definitely make this a regular stop on all of our future trips.

I'm really surprised, actually shocked, by this place averaging 4 stars after 60+ reviews! I definitely do not get this one at all!!! I guess I must be a little jaded because I grew up in an small town area of New York where probably half, maybe more, of the restaurants were owned by Italians. When I first walked up to this place I was a little reluctant to eat here. In fact, after looking at the plates on the tables my friend and I kept on walking. However, we couldn't make a decision on where else to eat so we turned around and went back. Oops! (why didn't I listen to my first impression?) The dinner rolls that were served at the beginning of the meal were cold and tasteless. I certainly hope they were not the garlic rolls that I see praised in several reviews. If they were then they must have forgotten the garlic with these rolls. The only redeeming part of my meal was the eggplant rotelli appetizer which was rolled up eggplant with ricotta cheese covered with a pomodoro sauce. If I was forced to eat here again then this is what I would order.  The meal I ordered was Chicken parmigiana. I guess I must have strayed too far from their mainstays on this one. The chicken was very tough. It tasted as if it was frozen the heated up in a microwave. The pasta served with it was covered in the pomodoro sauce which actually is uninspiring but goes well with the eggplant and ricotta. The pasta also tasted like it came from the microwave. In fact, the past was so hot I cannot see how it could have been made any other way. It didn't dawn on me that an Italian place could not at least make an edible chicken parmigiana.  The service was okay, but I would not call it a friendly place. I guess their goal is to serve 5% of the people that walk by their establishment at least once in their lifetime which is enough to make a go of the business.  If you ever spent time eating at restaurants in Italian areas back east then run as fast as possible away from this establishment.  By the way, this was $37 each even though we split an appetizer and had no drinks other than tap water. It was a horrible waste of money. This is definitely not a $$ place if you are ordering a meal. I guess it fits the bill if ordering a pizza.
Wonderful dinner place! Delicious food great outdoor seating, good service. Definitely recommend!

I hope I could give ZERO star!! The service is horrible. My friends and I have a flight to catch so we were sit on the bar to avoid the 45 min wait. We got the menu and everything and were excited about the food. Then the manager came to us and kicked us out. He said there was no server to serve us at the bar. Why would they seat us in the first place and then kick us out?! The service management is truly horrible. Which business does that???

3 1/2.  Pros: Good service Nice waiters Dishes have generous proportions.  Two people could split one seafood special. Yummy soft bread smothered in garlic.  Sooooo good.   Con: Pricey.  The dishes aren't worth the price.  It's good food but not THAT good. For a family of 4 it was $160. Crazy. We all got pastas. No drinks.  I feel like the seafood quality should be a little better but that's just me. I'm picky with that cus my parents have a sushi restaurant.  So i like the fresh stuff.  And for the price i wish they would make fresh pasta..

Tried to make a reservation... Called to get some information first. Spoke with a hostess named Kendra. She was very rude. Not helpful. She had an attitude the entire time and before I got to finish asking  a question she hung up on. She was so unprofessional I could hear her talking to other customers in the background as she was suppose to be helping me get a reservation. when I called back she put me on hold and had me talk to another hostess. I ended up not even making a reservation because of this.

The garlic knots are so delicious!! Clams with linguine lacked luster, but the pizzas were pretty good. I like the atmosphere and the convenient location. There is a cute outdoor patio and paper table covers so you could color/draw during your meal; I thought that was a nice touch. Seriously though, I must repeat myself, the garlic knots are pretty insane.

I went here based on the 4 star rating.  The service was ok, but the food was below average.  They had plenty of empty tables visible but still made us wait 20 minutes for one of them.    I ordered the linguine bolagnese and it was not good.  Noodles a bit under cooked and the ragu was very average.    The rolls were good, but they arrived cold.  The salad dressing was too vinegary.     Definitely not worth what they charge per plate.

My husband and I were craving Italian, so we made a special trip here after reading the great reviews. Before writing this, I actually pulled up the photos to make sure we'd eaten at the right place!  We arrived at 8 and found a wait of about 15-20 minutes (after calling about 30 minutes earlier to inquire about the wait and make a reservation and being told we would have no problem being seated); oh well, not a big deal. We went next door to the magic shop and returned at 8:05 to the four parties or so waiting next to the host. The two parties in front of us were still planted inches from the host (including another party of two that had been waiting when we first arrived). As we stood there, we saw two people walk up to an empty table that had just been cleared. The host hurried up to the party and told them that the table hadn't been bused but there was a table in the back that had been and he led them to it. WTH?!  Clearly, this annoyed those of us waiting in line. After seeing this, a party of two that was AFTER us on the list rushed to the host and demanded to be seated. And they were. Just like that. My husband talks to the host and of course we are blamed because he called our name and we didn't answer. Hmm, so he called our name within 5 minutes of us arriving (after JUST estimating that the wait would be 15-20 minutes), ignored the fact we'd been making active eye contact with him since, and somehow he called our name before he called the parties of the same size immediately in front of us in line. Right. Dude, no sympathy for the fact I've been waiting patiently with a big pregnant belly?  For some reason, we stayed and the host did apologize for the wait when he finally seated us--but not for being unfair and likely dishonest about calling us. The garlic rolls were tough and bland except for the topping. The service was polite, rushed. We saw our waiter a few brief times. The gnocchi itself was very good; the pesto lacked bite. The meatballs were the highlight.   Overall, a disappointing experience!

Best Italian food in Vegas. Everything was fresh and the service was incredible. The waiters were these two Italian guys. Hilarious!  This is our new regular stop when we're in town. My wife loved it so much she gave the waiter a hug!

I signed up for a Yelp account just so I could review this restaurant. Best Italian food I've ever had besides my Grama's. I'm so upset that its in Vegas and I can't eat there everyday. ( I tried to get them to let me live there in exchange for free food, they said they'd think about it.....) We had the Caesar salad, spaghetti & meatballs, their garlic rolls and our friends had the warm spinach salad, every single thing was amazing. The server/owner Domenico was adorable and so nice. He called my friend signorina and she blushed and giggled like a little girl. My only disappointment was that I found it on the last day and we only got to eat there once. Can't wait to get back to Vegas!

This place was recommended from a family member and did not disappoint. The food was authentic Italian. Reasonably priced. And DELICIOUS! The service was so sweet. Upon making our reservations, we mentioned it was our anniversary and got a free cannoli! The only downfall is it's in the mall area of the Venetian, so not as secluded  as I'd like, but still worth it. If you're looking for good food at the right price, then def visit!
It is the best pasta I would recommend everybody thank you so much they have the best service They have the best dessert thank you again I will come again I will tell all my family and my friends

My family decided to eat out this Sunday. We yelped Italian restaurants and saw the four stars so decided to give it a try. The restaurant was clean and the staff were attentive.  The restaurant was not busy(maybe a third full). The food had little to be desired.  The food was no better than the popular Italian chain--they even use the same boxed pasta! We started with calamari which were rubbery and greasy and served with an odd colored "red" sauce that was actually orange. I had tortellini with Alfredo sauce which was melted butter mixed with cream and very watery. No herbs or flavor whatsoever.  The tortellini was not house made and over cooked to boot! They were happy to take my tortellini and remake something else but after eating a stick of watery butter from my first bite, I lost my appetite.  My husband ordered veal parmigiana but the waiter brought some odd fried meat with a salad on the top!  Oops. My son ordered chicken parmigiana.  He said it was ok. We were out for a family meal and my son ended up eating alone while my husband and I watched.  Right about the time my son finished eating his meal my husbands actual order came so we got to watch him eat.  Not exactly the family dinner we had in mind.  Very pricey for "chain" quality food.  I would not recommend this restaurant.
I wish there was less than 1 start to give to this place.  "Very rude management," that pretty much summarizes the experience you should expect there.

This is a nice Italian restaurant in Downtown Sumerlin. I have eaten here at least 6 times since they opened. Sometimes it's just me and my wife, and other times with our (grown) kids. When it's just the two of us, we usually start with the calamari. I'm not a big fan of calamari, but at this restaurant, I make an exception. I've tried the calamari at Red Lobster, and thought I was chewing a pencil eraser. The calamari here was better than any other I have tried. I actually finished the large portion (I did have help from my wife).  If we go with the kids, we will oder the antipasto platter. Yes, it is pricey, but it's a generous size, and the quality of the meats is first rate. I'm pretty sure the prosciutto is imported from Italy.    For my main course, I seem to be stuck on the salmon. I really like their spaghetti with meat sauce, and the veal parm is awesome, but the salmon does it for me.  It is always tender, juicy, and flavorful.  It even tastes good the next day for lunch, when I can't finish it at the restaurant because I ate too much calamari or antipasto.  Oh yeah, if you have room, the carrot cake is awesome. Get three or four friends to help you finish it.    I see in a couple of reviews people were complaining about slow service. In all the times I've been here, I have not had that experience.  The staff was very friendly, and the service was professional.  Obviously if the joint was jumping, like on a Friday or Saturday night, it takes a little longer for food to arrive, but that's how it is at any busy restaurant.     Do yourself a favor, next time you have a taste for Italian food, and you're near Summerlin, check out this place.  They have indoor, and covered outdoor seating.  It's a great location to "people watch" while you are enjoying a drink and a great meal.
Ask for lyndsay to serve you great service. Great food  a must eat place. Good atmosphere

This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants in Vegas. Since my last visit about a year ago they have expanded their business to the unit next to them -- business must be good and I can see why. They make one of the best if not the best meatballs. Really no lie! Their meatballs are consistently soft, plump and tasty. I have yet to find another Italian restaurant that makes better meatballs. Good decor and ambiance -- felt cozy inside with opera like music playing in the background. Clean restaurant and attentive servers were a plus. Other dishes (Caesar salad, pizza, etc) were good, too, but I go there for the spaghetti and meatballs.

My husband and I were vacationing in Vegas and our friends said don't leave Vegas without going to Trattoria Reggiano.  We trust them so off we went for lunch today.  Our waitress, Ricki was so friendly and helpful  we asked for her recommendation.  I had soup and my husband had lobster ravioli. OMG food was fantastic but Ricki made our meal extra special.  Besides being helpful with our food choices she is friendly and never got annoyed with our numerous questions.  When we were ready to leave we hugged Ricki, by then we felt like she was family.  We will recommend this restaurant to everyone who goes to Vegas and it is a must to have Ricki as their server.  We will be back.  Ricki is a definite asset to this business and deserves kudos.

My friend and I went here for dinner while we were staying at the Venetian. My thoughts:  - The place is really small - probably 6-7 tables inside the restaurant and another 7 or so in the mall just outside the restaurant (still indoors). But I liked the feel, it's a cute place.  - Our waiter was great. I asked for a wine suggestion and he gave it to me. It was a house wine, nothing amazing, but I did like it better than the cab that my friend got, which was my alternative, so that marks it as a positive. He also joked with us, was very nice and courteous, just all-around good service.  - The food was very good. Granted, I was really hungry, so part of the satisfaction was certainly just getting food in my stomach. My friend got the chicken francese and I got the baked ziti. We semi-shared (I gave her a 1/4 of mine and she gave me a 1/4 of hers). I enjoyed both dishes, although maybe the baked ziti a bit more than the chicken.  Overall, I would recommend this place. Definitely convenient if you're staying in the Venetian or Palazzo.

Went here on a friday night at 8:00. There were a few tables open so the 2 of us got seated right away. Our waiter, an older gentleman, was funny and friendly. I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and my fiancé ordered pesto gnocchi. Both dishes were good but the spaghetti was definitely better than the gnocchi. The garlic bread balls were so yummy so we asked for more and finished it all! As the night continued all the tables got filled and there was a line of people waiting. Our waiter seemed a little flustered and didn't give us as much attention. At the end of the meal when things calmed down he was back to his usual self. Overall we had a delicious meal for a decent price. This is a great place and we will be back when we are in Las Vegas.

I prefer other foods than Italian. Pizza is pretty much the most Italian I'll ever eat. I thought pizza is oh well another pizza  But oh no !!!. The pizza I had was outstanding   It's the Quattro Stagioni. Ummm. Yummy.  Ingredients were fresh. Crust perfect.  Our waiter Wyatt  (and no his last name is not Earp) was very attentive. Overall, am visiting AGAIN !!!   Grace & Pete

I went here for dinner tonight with my son, and I must say I was not pleased. I ordered gluten free pasta with chicken and no butter. The waiter said that the chicken was going to be dry. I said that I would rather have it be dry than to get sick from all the oil and dairy. When the food came, I was surprised to find out that my chicken was breaded. I don't understand why they would give me breaded chicken with gluten free pasta. The waiter never came back after that, so I tried to take off the bread unsuccessfully and ended up giving the rest of my chicken to my son. He got the linguine with shrimp pasta with a watered down sauce that he said was disgusting. $85 later, I feel like I was robbed and have a stomach ache. I wonder if that pasta was really gluten free. My recommendation is that you don't go here and go to the many other places around.

Very good food and service at reasonable prices for a Vegas hotel restaurant.  House wine was very drinkable.  Food quality was excellent.  Very good, properly prepared pasta.  Wonderful service.  The reason for only 4 stars is that the restaurant is hard to find in the labyrinth of the Venetian hotel, which was frustrating.  Parking is free in the hotel lot.

This place is so f*ing good.  Yes I have been to Italy multiple times and enjoyed the amazingly cooked pasta and pizza there and yes 99% of restaurant in America screw it up.  Pasta is supposed to be al dente ok?  Well yes the pasta here was cooked perfectly and the sauce so tasty.  The bread is garlicy just the way I like it dripped in olive oil. I heard the manager or owner speaking Italian which explains the authentic dishes.  The only draw back the tiramisu was just ok

Wow!! This place is a must try. Food was delicious and the garlic bread was great. My dad can't stop raving about the salmon dish. But it was the service that will bring us back!! Eric our server was great! Very attentive and pleasant. My son accidentally spilled my drink and they were there in a flash to help clean up, prepare a new table setting and refresh all our drinks. They really made the night special. Come eat here and be sure to ask for Eric. Dora the manager is also soooo amazing. She was there in a flash to make sure all was ok after the spilled drink. She was nice and talked to us. With the million places to eat on the strip these people really know how to make your experience special.
Excellent service and staff!! And some of the best pizza you can find in Vegas!! Will come back here every time I come to Vegas!

You must try this restaurant! Four of us each had something different and everything was amazing. Be sure to  try the Filet Mignon Meatballs and the Caprese salad as appetizer.   For the main course we covered everything from chicken, veal to pasta and none of us were disappointed. Everything was  fresh and delicious.  Now dessert....try it all.  I had the best Canoli I've ever had and trust me I've had plenty of them in NY and Italy. My friends raved about the Tiramisu and the Cheesecake.  Now to the service...if I could give more stars I would. The waitresses and manager were very attentive and friendly. Thanks Amanda, Riley and Stefano.  I was there five days and had lunch/dinner there three times!   Be sure to check it out

Superb food and even better service. Paolo was our server and he's brilliant. The other staff was very good too, the ladies who served us drinks too.   They served us bread while we waited for our food and it was yum. Covered with Parmesan cheese, buttery.  We ordered fried calamari, gnocchi with red sauce and spaghetti meatballs. The portions were huge and food was very very tasty. Loved the place. Absolutely brilliant.
This restaurant was average at best. Pasta from a box, oil pooling at the bottom of my dish, nothing seasoned well...save your money.

Came here based on the good reviews, and the meal was just average. The garlic knots were cold. My boyfriend had the pesto gnocchi, it was a good portion. I ordered the lobster ravioli and I've had better at berrys in Beverly Hills. The meatball was 80% filet and 20% pork, my friend said it tasted a bit weird. Plenty of other choices in Vegas, we won't be back!

I have found heaven on earth.  There are not enough adjectives to describe the amazing meal my friend and I had last night.  If you are looking for a TASTY gluten free pizza look no further. I have tried endless gluten free choices for pizza and this was by far the BEST I've ever had!   We also had the filet mignon meatballs which were RIDICULOUS and the eggplant rollatini melted in your mouth.  Finally an Italian place in Summerlin that brings you back to New York Italian.  Yummmm!  Can't wait to go back and try more.  My neighbor was eating penne Alla vodka and RAVED about it so that is next!   Oh and did I mention the staff was friendly and service was thumbs up!   Located right next to movie theatre in downtown Summerlin! Thank you Trattoria!!

This was our first time dining here and we were impressed with the service. Everyone was very friendly and efficient and they took excellent care of us even though it was a busy evening. The calamari was excellent. The baked clams were very good. The Caesar salad was good as was the lasagne. The lobster ravioli was the only thing that didn't live up to its billing. All and all it was a nice evening and if you are in the mood for Italian it is worth trying.

No wait on a Sunday afternoon.  Expect to wait if you go on Friday or Saturday night (I tried once before and was told 1 hour wait .... no thanks).  Great selection of Italian dishes.  I had the lobster ravioli and wife had the linguini and claims.  Both were very good.   The flavors were very authentic. Lots of claims.  Also had the espresso martini that was well prepared (not too strong on the alcohol and a good espresso flavor)  Another big thing with this restaurant are the complementary garlic knots.  They are great.  They have olive oil and vinegar on the table, but some butter might also be nice.  Also, when we got our first batch, they were very cold and I mentioned this to the waitress who said "Ohh, they just came out.  So do you want a new one?"  Yeah, right -- they just came out (15 minutes ago).  Nice try.  The correct response is -- "I'm sorry, I'll get you a fresh batch right away."  But they were replaced with a hot fresh batch about 3 minutes later.  In fact, if I had any complaint, I would say that our server was not the most attentive (took a while to bring drinks, took a while to bring the bread, the aforementioned breach comment).  The other complaint was the prices -- almost $70 for lunch for two with no dessert and one martini drink (including tip).  A bit pricey, but this is appears to be the new norm in the bourgeois downtown Summerlin area, so I guess its to be expected.    The dessert tray looked good (and I would like to try the TIramisu) but I was full so will have to be next time.  Anyway, I will definitely go back and try out some other things.

We ate at this restaurant the day we checked into The Venetian.  The meal was so good we returned again the next day.  The service was wonderful both nights.  The food was delicious and worth every penny.  You could tell they use only the freshest ingredients.  Highly recommended!
Had a group of 10 celebrating birthdays. Staff was attentive and professional. Food was really excellent.  Reasonably priced, too.

Food was medico at best, and the service was terrible. Sat for 20mins with no drink refills, and the meatballs taste like they were baked in the morning then microwaved for the lunch crowd. Not worth it...
Speechless. I don't ever write reviews. This food made me write one. I mentioned I was craving Italian sausage and he made me something not on the menu. It was the best pasta dish I have ever had.

10/27/16 Lunch. This is a quaint place.  The food was really good and we shared family style.  They start you off with freshly baked garlic bread - oh so garlicky and buttery.  I could eat the bread alone as my meal.  We ordered the Pasta e Fagioli Soup, Filet Mignon Meatball, and Linguini Carbonara.  The soup was hearty.  The meatball was moist and had enough sauce.  I really liked the Linguini Carbonara because the pasta was al dente and the sauce was creamy but not heavy.  The Italian Sangria was OK.  We also had the Ricotta Cheesecake for dessert and this was delicious.  This restaurant is good for families and I would dine here for lunch.

The food is good, the ambiance is mall-like.   Had the spaghetti and mignon meatballs. Very tasty! Perfect portions, it's nice that they don't overload you with food since leftovers don't really work in Vegas when you're on vacation.  I thought the pricing was good, too.

We eat here every time we are in town. The food is authentic and delicious. The staff is attentive to every last detail. They remember us each time, especially Dora who is wonderful. We just dined here again last night and once again had a terrific experience. All of the pasta options are amazing and so is the pizza!

This restaurant was the highlight of our weekend in Vegas. The caprese saiad with burrata cheese was spot on. My wife (who is Italian and makes homemade sauce (or "gravy" as they call it) loved her spaghetti carbonara. I ordered the veal parmesean and the portion was HUGE. I only planned on eating half of it, but due to it being so good (combined with a weakness I have of overeating) resulting in me eating the whole thing without even realizing it. Our server was very friendly and attentive and if you are ok with the restaurant's location / relaxed atmosphere (that other reviewers capture quite nicely), this one exceeded the expectations of someone that cooks with family Iitalian recipes, and let me tell you, THAT is tough to do!

My family keeps coming back to this wonderful restaurant.   Vito is the best host.  The food is  top notch made from quality  ingredients.  Generous servings.  Excellent service.  Very comfortable  setting.

The worst, over priced, and the kind of service that belongs at a truck stop. Was man handled by a waiter with a attitude like he just caught his wife in bed with his brother. Ordered baked clams that were thrown on the table as was the rest of the dishes like a set of dice and tasted like oiled bread. The shrimp scampi was so salty I drank a gallon of water over a two hour period. The shrimp was hard, rubbery, and chewy. Dropped a $100 bill on that miserable experience. BEWARE !!!

Absolutely love this restaurant. The food and ambiance are fantastic! We usually eat at the bar, No need to even look at a drink menu...we just ask Eli to make us something delicious...and he always comes through with an amazing concoction!!!!!

The bottom line: as far as I could tell this is actually an authentic family joint. The food is basic Italian food. Nothing to write home about, however not bad.  The pros: the service was very friendly, professional, and quick. They made an effort to seat us despite being quite busy. As everybody before us has noted, we also agree that the garlic bread is really tasty. Perhaps too tasty :)  The cons: I've had better Italian food. I had the eggplant Parmesan which was mediocre and much too cheesy for my liking. Another person in our party had pesto gnocchi, which was good but not exciting whatsoever. The Caesar salad was okay, but there were quite a few hidden calories in the amount of dressing. On the upside the anchovy dressing was pretty good.

Ordered the meatball app and arugala and cherry tomato salad.  The meatballs tasted good but they were served barely warm in the middle.  The plate was cold and the sauce was room temp.  Disappointing.  Salad was good.

What a great dining experience. Came here with my family for lunch. The food was amazing. The appetizers mussels, calamari and eggplant rollatini were delicious. Chicken franchise was cooked to perfection. The desserts tiramisu, cannolis and chocolate cake were unbelievable. Our waiter Giovanni was the best. If you are looking for great Italian food and a warm and inviting place to dine I highly recommend you try this place.

We would give this a 4 out of 5 stars. Our first restaurant in Vegas was a great experience. They forgot to bring out the bottles of olive oil and baslmic but made up for it for with extra attention. No big deal, just glad we had a good time!

The reason we went it was because the waiter was friendly and allowing my dog to sit with us outside.  We ordered pizza, it came out buried,  the garlic knots  were  too greasy for us..  The coffee were like hot water, no coffee taste at all. The spaghetti with meatball is nothing to get excited.  The only thing good about this is allowing my dog to sat with us.
A small quaint little Italian restaurant. The prices, wine, and food were outstanding!! I thoroughly enjoyed dinner at this fine establishment.
Great service, great pies, great chix Parmesan and damn fine wine and a doppio.   Loved it.
2.5/5.  Atmosphere was great, bread was DELISH, service was abysmal.  I couldn't hate on the entrée though but our meal was over $100.  Good experience but not worth going back to.

We went here for dinner.   Started off with garlic rolls were good.  Virgin Olive Oil and Balsamic vinegar were provided on the table for dipping.  The Balsamic vinegar was sweeter and not as acrid as the one from DOCG.  I accompanied my meal with a Moretti, an Italian beer and really liking this over Peroni.  There is less of an aftertaste and more pleasing to my palate.  Ordered the Linguine Carbonara.  I wanted to taste it so I have a reference of how it should taste.  Most comments online say why order it when you can just make it at home.  They are correct.   Most restaurants serve carbonara but they often add heavy cream and a whole bunch of other items.  Trattoria Reggiano was the only one I found that serves it how it is should to be, Pancetta, Cheese, Egg, and Pasta, that's it.  Overall, the taste was close to how I make it so I'm glad I'm in the general vicinity.  The criticism I have though is that they a used a little too much pancetta and the sauce could have been a little looser.  Additionally, there was little or no black pepper.  Should have asked for freshly cracked black pepper but instead used black pepper on the table, which didn't add much.  My friend had the Chicken Marsala.  It was very good.  The dish overall was not greasy.  The sauce had a lot of flavor.  Unlike a lot of Chicken Marsala we get in Hawaii where they use too much butter/oil where it masks the Marsala and chicken flavors.  Regarding they other parts of the meal, service was ok.  It lacked in the beginning but picked up later on.  Didn't really care to eat outside in the mall as the tables were too close to each other.  I would highly recommend this place if you are looking for simply Italian food.

THIS RESTAURANT IS AMAZING! Great, authentic Italian food and hospitality as well. It definitely is a hole in the wall, it took our group a while to find it because it's so small! The owner is a very nice, cheerful Italian man who makes you feel right at home. Their complimentary bread rolls are just...I don't know, they're just beyond delicious. Smothered in garlic and full of flavor, plus they were unlimited (not sure if they usually are, but we had a rather large group of 10+) so we definitely took some back to the hotel with us. Our entrees were great as well, truly delectable. You really cannot beat authentic Italian food, the dishes are cooked with care. I was beyond satisfied with my meal, and we left a hearty tip. Will definitely go here again when I vacation in Vegas again :)
After a reply from restaurant, I decided to give them another try.  Last night had a very enjoyable dinner.  The food was very good and they have a great kids menu. I will definitely eat here again

I know I'm a pizza snob coming fron NY area but this pizza (with burrata)is outstanding!  Cooked purfectly with fresh ingredients.  We tried it a few days ago and wanted it again before we left. Service great and prices reasonable.  Highly recommended!

Nice little Italian restaurant in the Venetian. A little bit hard to find as it is tucked behind the food court and surrounded by a couple of other restaurants. Made reservations last minute for 6:30 and was happy that they could accommodate my party of 4 at such short notice. We were able to get a table on the outside of that restaurant that gives a view of the Grand Canal Shoppes. The place itself is a bit noisy with the open kitchen and the foot traffic around the restaurant.   First off, they provide the table with garlic knots. Very aromatic and fresh and warm and soft when I pulled it apart. Very happy that they give it to us complimentary. For appetizers, we ordered the calamari to share. Nice light batter on the calamari so it wasn't too heavy of an appetizer. For the entrees, I had the penne a la vodka. The rest of my party had the chicken parm, linguine with clams, and shrimp scampi. Let me start of by saying that penna a la vodka is my favorite pasta dish so maybe my expectations are too high. Don't get me wrong, there was nothing wrong with the pasta as it was decent but the sauce wasn't as thick and creamy as I am usually used to. There wasn't that much sauce to cover all the pasta and the sauce was a little watery. The rest of the dishes were alright as well but not the best we have had.  On a side note, our waiter was very nice and made jokes throughout the night, which was entertaining and appreciated. He seemed to really love his job. Also on top of the tablecloths, they put a sheet of paper (I'm guessing to keep the tablecloths clean) and provided the table with crayons, which was nice to pass the time as we waited for our food.  Really good garlic knots but other than that your average Italian restaurant. Nothing terrible but nothing superb on the menu.

My boyfriend and I decided to try this place last night,July 26 for our anniversary since we live close by and both love Italian food. We went in at around 8:45 and were seated immediately and were told that they close at 10- which is fine.   Our night quickly turned when we met our waitress. She was extremely rude and was reluctant to answer any of our questions. When I asked "what is the difference between a small Caesar salad and a large?" She rolled her eyes and said a small is a small and a large is a large."As if we didn't already know that. So then I asked another question, "is a small salad enough for two people to share?" To which she replied, "it depends on your appetite." ABSOLUTELY NO HELP AT ALL. So we ordered the small Caesar to share and the portion was so small my boyfriend just told me to have it. After this our waitress didn't check in at our table one time. She walked past and would say "is everything ok?" But wouldn't even stop walking to hear our answers.  This type of behavior would be somewhat understandable if they were busy but we were one of only three tables in the restaurant!   I could go on and on about how rude our waitress was but I think that about sums it up. I will say this however, at the end of our meal when we asked for boxes, she boxed up my boyfriends food and I boxed up my own, which I didn't mind. My boyfriend took his left over baked ziti with meatballs to work with him today and guess what? The waitress didn't put the meatballs in the to go container.  After paying the high prices of the entrees and wanting to take some home one would assume you would get everything you paid for in the to go container but apparently not.    We went here to celebrate what should have been a great night, but our service was so poor, half way through the meal both of us were upset.   I am in the food industry as a waitress and I usually don't write yelp reviews like this but this was the WORST dining experience I have ever had in my life.   I did give two stars however because the food was good, and the hostess and busser staff were very friendly. But our experience was so sour we will never be back.

In Vegas for the weekend with my wife, we decided on some Italian after eating steak and lamb first few nights. We found this little place in the shopping center of the Venetian. Extremely happy with our selection, out server, Paolo, and our food, were more than what we had hoped for. I would recommend this place for the food and decent pricing!
Had the Shrimp Scampi and loved it!  Great environment and the staff was wonderful. Definitely worth checking out!

Ok.  My friend raved about this spot and how she gets it every single time she's in Vegas but I thought it was just okay.  We went for lunch and we were the only 3 people at the restaurant at the time.  It did slowly start filling up since it's a pretty small spot.  I ordered the special, which was a sausage rigatoni.  Nothing special.  It was your standard italian food.  I may come back and try something different if I'm around the Venetian/Palazzo.

Save yourself and eat somewhere else while you're in Vegas.The food was really mediocre. It tasted like mall food court food yuck.   The service sucked, and the seating is awkward you sit outside amongst all the venetian shoppers.  The only good thing was the garlic bread

Hello,  People like Hilda, Danny(Server) Tony, and Manager Daniel G. are and will always be your greatest asset. Their abilities and contributions are an important key to the success of your entire operation. Take a moment to reflect upon your teams accomplishments and take pride in knowing that your people are an intricate reason of success to this restaurant. As I will continue to eat here, it is greatly appreciated how well we are always taken care of, and always have a great experience. Let this not go unnoticed, but let them know how well there service continues to bring us back to this restaurant. Of course the food is great, but the service Ashley and myself are given is even GREATER! I am having family from out of town as I graduate the Police Academy for Metro, I look forward to them eating here. I strongly encourage this letter be seen by your team! Keep up the great work, and see you soon.   Thank you again for your loyal support.  Ashley, & Lance.

I just finished reading a review of an incident at this restaurant on 8/10/15 written by someone patting himself on the back and being untruthful about what happened.  My family and I eat here quite often.  We love the food and the service.  I don't know what place the writer was in but this restaurant doesn't have 15 people working on any shift.  When the lady fell, the bartender (who was an EMT) immediately rushed to her.  At the same time, one of the servers was doing exactly what she should by calling mall security.  The "gentleman" really didn't have to do anything since the staff was very knowledgeable about the appropriate actions to take and took them.   I very seldom write anything on Yelp, but I do read reviews of places we want to try.  It really bothers me when someone writes inaccurate reviews.  That is not to say that things can't be wrong at times with food and service. However, let's at least be honest.  The food at this restaurant is not New York Italian, but rather, true Italian from Italy.  It is authentic and excellent.  The servers, bartenders, and manager are always helpful, polite, and accommodating.    I have tried to correct an injustice by explaining the event and stating our enjoyment every time we dine here.

Sorta disappointed after all the good reviews.  I'm hoping they only had an "off" night but the service seemed disorganized and slow.  In fact the tables being seating next to us noticed our discomfort and asked if they should leave or stay.  The food was decent so I recommended they stay, although I don't think it was anywhere worth the large bill.  Doubt I'll return next time I'm in Vegas.    I will say that the hostess and waiter were very friendly, but it seemed they were short staffed or suffering from problems in the kitchen.  But they never explained or apologized, just acted like everything was okay.  A bit of honesty with their situation would have made me feel a lot more sympathetic.  Hopefully others have a better experience.

Hands down, the best food we had while in Vegas!  Mind blowing garlic bread, pizza, and cannoli.  We also tried the eggplant appetizer, which was both unique and delicious.  The eggplant was pounded very thin and wrapped around a bit of cheese, all topped off with a vodka creme sauce and fresh parm. Typing this is seriously making me salivate... Anyway, it was the first restaurant we tried while staying at the Venetian and we should have just eaten there the whole weekend.  It couldn't get better.  The service was also fantastic.  Our server was very attentive and went above and beyond to make our dining experience enjoyable.  They were out of chocolate chips to sprinkle on the cannoli so she offered to go to Haagen Dazs to get us some!

I came here with my parents for dinner. We REALLY liked the complimentary bread they started us off with. It was garlicky and slightly cheesy, rather buttery - absolutely delicious. I wish I spent more time on the bread as that was my favourite thing during dinner. We ordered 3 dishes to share: carbonara, chicken marsala, and the Arugula & Gorgonzola pizza. Everything was pretty good, but it kind of paled in comparison to the bread.

A bit difficult to find but MAKE the effort - ask directions if needed! Pasta primervera was fresh and light, linguine carbonara was fabulous, so were the meatballs. Save room for dessert though tiramisu & homemade cannoli are to die for!!!

I'd give 3.5 if available, but I'm feeling generous so I'll round up.    4 of us went for a Saturday night dinner.  We had reservations for 7:30 and they seated us immediately.  Restaurant was clean, staff was about as friendly as you could reasonably expect with a packed house on a hot Vegas night.   Here are a few, admittedly minor, critiques. - our waiter was an older gentleman, with a thick, we thought possibly added on and emphasized for 'authenticity' accent.  He clearly struggled with the whole placing the order via iPad thing, especially when one in the party ordered something he wasn't familiar with (but was on the menu and no changes were requested).  - The pasta e fagioli was certainly nothing to remember, which is disappointing with the 'we're in DTS so we can overcharge' pricepoint on all the dishes. - and one of my pet peeves, they didn't bring all the entrees out at the same time.  They brought three and one in the party had to wait for a while until theirs arrived.    Not sure if I'll go back.  Food was solid (save the soup), but the price was rather high for what you get and there are better Italian options in town.

First time here and had a wonderful experience. We sat at the bar and Bethany was our bartender. Service was spot on. We started with a couple glasses of red wine recommended by Bethany. They were exactly what we were looking for. We only wanted an appetizer to share and Bethany recommended the meatballs. This was a good choice as the meat was flavorful and the pomodoro sauce was divine. At 7pm the live music started and it was a great touch. Hi quality lounge music I would call it.  Great food, great service, great atmosphere. We'll be back soon!

The food and service was good.   The atmosphere was nil for the tables were too close together and most of the tables were out in the Venetian mall.  My main gripe is that the meal and one drink for the two of us was $100.00. I think a $$$ dollar rating would be more appropriate for the Trattoria.
This place was amazing. The pastas are delicious. There was a spaghetti with this wonderful garlic sauce, roasted peppers and, roasted garlic. The pizzas are wonderful as well.

OK, I've eaten here twice now.  The first time was about two years ago, and I remember my entree as being very tasty and worth a second visit.  The second time was last week, and my entree this time was just okay.  Nothing special.  However....I have to rave about their caprese salad with imported mozarella cheese.  It was awesome!  My wife and I just returned from a two-week Italy tour, and we ate all Italian food and drank a lot of Italian wine.  We had our share of caprese salads, and I tell you, Trattoria Reggiano's caprese salad is as good, or better, than those served in Italy!  It is worth recommending.  They use imported buffalo mozarella, and it is wonderfully delicious.  You must try it, even if you're so-so on tomatoes.  The combination is terrific and not to be missed.  As for an entree, I would suggest maybe ordering something with a sauce other than tomato based.  Their pasta is very good al dente; I just think a sauce other than tomato-based gives more suble taste and texture back to the pasta dish itself.  Next time I'm here I'll try the veal.    Do not be dissuaded from trying this Trattoria from the setting.  Yes, it is in a hotel mall next to a magic shop and a Coffee Bean, but the food is good and it is run by genuine Italians.  Not as expensive as the numerous famous chefs' restaurants at the Venetian Hotel, not in as nice a setting, but the proof is in the pasta and sauces. Give it a go; I don't think you'll regret it.  Sit "outside" and people-watch.  And don't forget the Caprese Salad!

This place is tiny and doesn't look much from the outside but check it out. I live in New Jersey where good Italian restaurants are common so the bar is set pretty high. We went with a group of 6 people and we all loved it. The food was great and the service was even better. The price is reasonable too! It's a go to spot on my next trip.

Average food, pompous waiter, poor service and overpriced.  A small cheese pizza and three meat balls came to $31.  The waiter never smiled, he seemed to look down on us when we ordered three waters (but he only gave us two), not once checked on us and no pre-bussing.  I wish I could say the food made up for it but it didn't.  The garlic rolls that everyone was raving about were comparable to doughy dinner rolls.  The food was nice but that's about it.  Bummer.  Oh, the quickest the waiter got to our table was when we stood up and he rushed to see what his tip was; that time the bummer was his.  I think the economy brought him out of retirement.

Best Italian food west of the Atlantic.  I go every time I'm in Vegas.  The tortellini Alfredo is one of the best dishes I've ever eaten.  The staff & atmosphere are great too.  No trip to Las Vegas is complete without dinner at Trattoria Reggiano

Trattoria Reggiano must have taken note of my critical review. In my three times being back at this establishment since my less than exceptional first experience, I have found that the service, food, and ambiance has improved tremendously. This location has gone from one that I nearly disdained, to one that I recommend to colleagues without hesitation. The unprecedented turnaround that this fantastic restaurant underwent is nothing short of astounding, and I look forward to enjoying the impressive Trattoria Reggiano for a long time.   (P.S.) My Reccomendations:  1st Course: Calamari 2nd Course: Chicken Francese or Veal Milanese  3rd Course: Tiramasu

Maybe our mistake was eating close to closing time 10pm on a week day. Our 60 something Italian male waiter with a heavy accent seem to care less if we were there or not. When I asked how large the pizza was he seemed insulted like, "what a stupid question, they are10 inches, not enough for two people" he said. Wrong it turned out the pizza is more like 14 inches plenty enough for a late snack for two. This waiter who could have been the owner or manager was unfriendly.rushed, and worse, uncaring. He could care less if we enjoyed ourselves or not. My bill was $38.50 for one dull over cooked pizza and 2 drinks. $8 for a beer $11 for a glass of wine. When he returned my change he couldn't be bothered with returning my 1.50 so he just skipped the .50 change and left a dollar bill. Remember we hadn't said as much as a word or 2 to this guy and somehow he just didn't like us. My suggestion take your Vegas dollars elsewhere!

Having attended Rock of Ages at the Venetian, we were looking for the best Italian restaurant within walking distance. We did our research and hit the jackpot.  The restaurant is currently being remodeled/expanded and so we sat outside along the mall walkway. This was great for people watching.  The rolls are hefty, buttery, garlicky and delicious. But the real reason to come is the authentic and fabulous Italian food.   The filet meatballs are as awesome as advertised and worth the price of admission. The chicken parmesan and lobster ravioli were fabulous.  If there is better Italian food in Vegas, I would be suprised.
My first time here, food was delicious! I recommend this place, if you want real Italian food. Love it...
omg..this place is awesome ..great food .entertainment... Betheny the bartender ...is frickin awesome...love this place .

I absolutely love this place..the staff is friendly..always attentive...Bethany the bartender is always keeping my drink full...Ricky and Hilda are great.the food is terrific..made just the way it was supposed to be made..hot and delicious..they have great live music in weekends..si incredibly fun..youll love this place..go..go now

My brother and I were in Vegas on vacations, and after a long day of walking, we craved some good old pasta for dinner. We saw many places while exploring the Strip, but I went to Yelp to get more options. After reading the reviews for this place, we decided to give it a try. Boy, the reviews were right! The garlic rolls were amazing. We ordered the lasagna and a four cheeses pizza, and everything was flavorful and delicious. Food quality and service were great, and prices were very reasonable. I highly recommend this place!

It was my first trip to Vegas and of the 4 days, this restaurant was the #1 most disappointing part of the trip. PLEASE go to a different restaurant.  4 girls total who ordered similar things: 3 girls ordered the linguine and replaced the clams with shrimp. ($24)  I personally ordered the agio e olio ($14) and added shrimp (+$6) - it was embarrassingly horrible. Oil was splattered to try and mask the low-quality, dry pasta. Even an attempt to make the dish tolerable by adding spices did not work at all. It was beyond disappointing.   The other 3 dishes were just as dry. One of the girls ordered Alfredo sauce as a replacement to the original and let's just say, they all looked the same.  None of us finished.  Our conversations at the table consisted on how much better we could have made pasta, and how awful our waiter was. While asking for drink options, we merely said water. To which he asked sparkling or regular. We said regular and that was it. He brings out a bottle and slaps on a $19 charge for 2 bottles water. Of course we complained and got that taken off, but we should have also complained about our food. That was one of our biggest regrets.   All in all: do NOT come here. There are SO many better restaurants. Even across the restaurant is a much better looking restaurant. Please don't waste your money.  Us 4 will remember this place as the worst Italian restaurant we have all been to.

Found this gem thanks to Yelp and couldn't be happier about it. After reading all the reviews the one constant was garlic knots and meatballs. The reviews did not lie. I never order spaghetti and meatballs out but wow, just wow at how good those meatballs are. Also had the calamari for an appetizer which was also extremely good.   Only thing that kept it from a five star is it's small inside. Like really, really, really small. Outside of that, I don't have a complaint. Thank you Yelp for leading my wife and I to Trattoria Reggiano.

The complimentary bread is AMAZING! Soft, buttery, and delicious.  I ordered the linguini with white sauce and clams and the calamari. The linguini was a bit too al dente for my liking and could have been a tad bit softer, but the calamari was scrumptious. The fresh marinara sauce and the touch of lemon was perfect.    The service was superb. The waiter was attentive and friendly. They were more than willing to give me extra marinara sauce when I asked for take out boxes.
Great place to stop for a drink while shopping. Food was great. Ricki was AWESOME!!! Best service I've had in Vegas so far. I would definitely recommend this place. Ask for Ricki

I came here around 4 times and the food is amazing I tried many italian food and I am really picky about taste but  this is best among vegas italian restautants.  One thing that i did not like is Service from server.  I hope server check customer more often and give nice smile at least

Very good. Service was good. Price was decent especially for being in the Venetian. I had the pasta e fagioli and arugula cherry tomato salad.  They could have used some more seasoning, but other than that very yummy, especially with the garlic bread twists that come with the meal.

After looking at several different dining options in and around the Palazzo, my fiancé and I chose Trattoria Reggiano for his birthday dinner. If you are looking for an intimate and romantic dining experience, this is not the place for you... But all we wanted was good Italian food, so it was fine. He had linguine carbonara, I had linguine in clam sauce. Both were very good, we we went for a cannoli for dessert. I mentioned it was fiancé's birthday (a cardinal sin) so our waiter threw a candle in the cannoli but did not embarrass him by singing.   It was about $20 a person, but good food is worth that price.

On my recent trip to Vegas I had a hankering for Italian food.    We decided to give Reggiano's a try after reading the reviews for casual Italian restaurants.  Maybe we were just Strip weary by the time we arrived at the Venetian, but my lord...it took us forever to find this place!  We almost gave up and went to one of the easier to find restaurants in St Mark's Square.  This place is small.  I think there were maybe 3 booths inside and the rest were tables set up in/outside the main storefront.  There wasn't really any hostess station to check-in at, just a waiter standing guard near the opening on the "street front".  The garlic knots were amazing! I had the bolognese and my hubby had the carbonara and both hit the spot.  The service was nothing special.  In fact, I thought the waiter here was the coldest we experienced in Vegas.  I got over that though, because the food was what I came for and it did the trick.  Casual, hearty and filling.
First time here and we love it. Food was great. I had the gnocchi with Alfredo and side of meatballs. Sam was our waiter and offered great service with a touch of good humor. We will come back.

Not impressed. Food was barely warm, bland chicken parmesan, service was not service, lobster ravioli had ok sauce not what I expected from all the reviews. The balsamic vinegar was the highlight! Disappointed.

Finding this restaurant was like finding a hidden gem.  The thing with Vegas is it's either really expensive, or really cheap, with not a whole lot in between on the strip. Trattoria Reggiano was the one place I found that was neither.  It's a very little restaurant tucked between the food court and the shopping in the Grand Canal Shoppes at The Venetian.  There are maybe 10 or 12 tables total.  It serves what I call Italian comfort food.  Generous pasta dishes and hearty bread served just like a neighborhood Italian restaurant in Anytown, USA.  It was $40 for two of us to eat.  We had Linguini Alfredo and Shrimp Scampi.  Both were tasty and filling.  The service was polite and non intrusive.  No back waiters, no captains, none of that; just a guy who might own the place who's happy to feed you whatever you want, and then leave you be to eat it until you want him next.  Two thumbs up for casual Italian with no fuss!
Excellent. Service, food, beverages. Everything. We order a pizza and spaghetti meatballs.
What a find!  Salmon was fresh and cooked perfectly, mouth watering  garlic rolls , frothy cappuccino. Can't wait to go back and try riccotta pie!
Eli is the best bartender in Summerlin. Creative, inventive, and gracious.  Have him create a berry grappa martini or a chocolate espresso martini for a sumptuous beginning and end. Going back soon.
Love this place! Really small place in the food court but the food is good

Very disappointing for the price and given high ratings of other reviews.   Like many Italian restaurants in the US i'm pretty sure that this all came out of the Sysco wholesale food catalogue and was frozen and so just microwaved out back and dumped on our plate. Nothing was very flavoursome or fresh though all was heavily coated in butter/oil/sauce.   All pretty tasteless and for $150 for two after tip it was bad.   A simpler menu of proper/fresher food would be so much better and italian food is not that difficult or complex so why not do it. I guess it's all about money as frozen food is higher margin.   Anyone serving this food in italy to an italian would be out of business within a week.

We've been back to Vegas a few more times since my last review and have tried our place each time of course.  Unfortunately, things seem to go down a little bit more each time.  I didn't want to believe it at first thinking they were just having a day off, but after three subsequent not so great visits, I really have to knock down the stars from the 5 to a 3.5.  The bread used to be served hot; but now they're cold, hard even.  The last two pizzas we ordered had way burnt crusts, and adding meatballs to a dish was way way overpriced - 4 bucks EACH meatball!!!  This used to be destination eating, but now it's an "oh if we're in the area and want italian" place for us.
We went here based on reviews.  We got a Caesar salad which was to die for.  The meatballs in the baked Zito with Meatballs was to die for.  Maybe the best Italian food I have ever had.

Absolutely fantastic Italian meal! Don't be fooled by the very small footprint. This place is absolutely fantastic! Our group had a wide variety of items from the menu and each one was better than the last. The baked ziti was incredible as were the spaghetti and meatballs. Very highly recommended.

Stopped by this evening to enjoy some great Italian food.  However, they seemed to be in the middle of a team meeting at 6:20 on a Saturday night. There was no notice or sign about the closure so I'm not quite sure what is going on.  If you have plans on visiting tonight, you may want to call ahead!

My wife and I were out for a date night.  We both had the urge for some great Italian food.  Well we found it.  We ordered the burrata, soup, chicken franchese, and linguine bolognese. Everything was delicious and reasonably priced for being in the Venetian.  Would recommend for anyone who's in the mood for some traditional Italian food.  Service was good as well

I was recently in Las Vegas and my friend looked up this restaurant on yelp and it had gotten good reviews and we decided to try it....SO GLAD!  The Italian gentleman who seemed to be the owner or manager was funny and on his game.  The waiter was super fast and the food was DIVINE!  I had seen other reviews recommend eating the doodle out of the free rolls that come while you wait, and boy did we!!  The food was delicious and perfectly cooked and we were sad when we accidentally left our left-overs on the table!  So good, and I highly recommend it!

I loved it! I could totally imagine myself eating at a little restaurant like this in Italy. No wait to be seated. The waitresses were great and on top of everything. She listened and treated my wife and I very well. The food was great! I ordered Tortelloni Alfredo $15. My wife ordered Penne Primavera $14. She added shrimp $6 because the plate is pure vegetables. They also give you their homemade garlic rolls while you wait only 5-7mins for your food. We were very satisfied and could barely finish our plates.   ---5 star restaurant quality but at half the price.---  I've tried Taqueria Cañonita which is a restaurant located close to Trattoria. Their food was good but with smaller portions and double the price.   I recommend Trattoria Reggiano, unless your looking for a pricey romantic dinner next to the gandalas, then go with Taqueria Cañonita.
Great food and great service by great people.  Definitely a must to dine in at Downtown Summerlin.

If there was a negative star,  would have no problem giving that.  Crappy service,  poor quality of food ( infact some of us feel sick at night). Customer service is foreign to this place.  Over priced for what you get.  Please don't waste your money,  you can have a better meal at Olive Garden.
Our server, Giovanni, was delightful. The food was great! I had the chicken parm and spaghetti. Also had the chocolate cake, the cake was very good also.

The appetizer bread is flavorful and good :) Kinda like chips, if you eat to many you might not have room for the main course.   Gnocchi with pesto was great.  This is my 2nd visit.  I need to leave room for the deserts next time.

Pizza and wine...the rest was fine. That pretty much sums up our experience. We sat at the bar and despite it not being crowded, waited quite a long time before we were acknowledged by the bartender and even then had to wait longer for him to take our order...which came out half wrong. Another couple was also waiting at the bar and ended up leaving because the bartender never helped them.   The pizza was very good and I would come back for it but I do hope the service improves.

Absolutely terrible waiter.  Not at all helpful had to ask for water.  Took forever to get drinks.  Waiter spilled a glass of water on my friend  literally the whole glass  and later knocked into her hard barely any apology for any of it.  To make matters worse food was that great if I could give zero stars I would

We got here through a show and restaurant deal.  Really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere.  The service was almost too attentive (the empty dishes were wooshed off the table almost the minute we took the last bite.)  It was hard to find the place but it was worth the mileage we put in to find it in the enormous complex.

We ordered a few dishes, everyone agreed the food was uneatable, I can not believe someone can fuck up Italian food like this, paid the bill and left all of it uneaten.  Those of you who gives 4 stars, are U insane??

We stopped in here for a glass of wine before our movie. We ended up having 4 glasses total, two of which were on happy hour. I will preface this by saying that I did not look specifically at the prices of the wine or the specifics of the happy hour specials. Our bill came to $60! Needless to say I was shocked. I could have gotten 4 bottles (of the same wine) at Costco for that price!! I really do love the atmosphere and have enjoyed their food in the past.  I would go back but definitely recommend checking out a corking fee or have your wine before you go!  The manager stated the pricing is related to the night rental on retail space at this complex.

First off the service was great.  Though it seemed forced or routine. The bread is awesome. My carbanara was ok. The price was expected for small italian restaurant inside venetian. If you're looking for no frills real italian then it's your spot otherwise I would pass.

This place was fantastic.  It is tucked away inside the shops at the Venetian (not a big place).  The meatballs are made with filet mignon and are a must have.    The baked ziti was cooked perfectly (sometimes it can be over cooked).  The lobster ravioli was very good also.  Garlic knots are brought before your meal, it's the bread they give.  Very good try not to fill up on them.    The best part of this meal was the dessert.  The cannoli was the BEST I have had outside of New York.

Great food and easy access from the parking structure. Take advantage of the free valet parking. Enjoy the garlic rolls. The staff was very accommodating of our toddler and made sure we were well taken care of.

My husband and I had a late lunch/early dinner, nothing over the top, but not the usual 'chain' meal. Based on the reviews I read on yelp, we thought we'd give Trattoria Reggiano a go. We weren't disappointed.   Never have walked through the maze of shops within and around The Venetian, so we enjoyed the stroll to find T.R. tucked into a small curve in The Grand Canal Shoppes.  We arrived around 5:00 and had our choice of dining 'in' or 'patio' (which basically means the wide side-walk of the shoppes). We joined two other parties on the patio (it's always entertaining to people watch in Vegas!).   Warmly greeted by Amanda (who was fabulous); gave us time to look over the menu. I wasn't sure about the chianti served by the glass and she offered to get me a sample. Pleasantly surprised to find it was a nice little chianti and was poured a very full glass of wine ($11).   Hubby and I decided on a starter of Filet Mignon Meatballs ($12) since many reviews highlighted them; very good start to the meal. Good flavor, great sauce, and nicely proportioned.    For dinner, my husband order the Salsiccia pizza ($15) while I, based on Amanda's suggestion, tried the special of  mushroom fettuccine ($16).  In the meantime, the home made garlic rolls arrived (yummy) along with the above mentioned meatballs. May I add...the leftover pomodoro sauce from the meatballs is amazing with the garlic rolls. Hey, we're on vacation, calories and carbs don't count, right?  Our entrees were served within 12-15 minutes.    My husband enjoyed his pizza - especially the pieces of fresh garlic that were cooked in the pizza sauce. Said it had very good flavor although it didn't look anywhere as good as it tasted. The crust was nicely browned; crisp but a nice soft center. However, he agreed that my dish was definitely better.  The pasta was cooked slightly al dente (perfect); the sauce was delicious and not too overwhelming (as I've had at other restaurants); and the mushrooms gave a wonderful depth and texture to the dish.  Amanda had said it was her favorite meal but typically is only served once a month. Lucky me - it was wonderful.   The pizza was enough for two as was my pasta. As we (luckily) have a hotel room with a kitchenette, we took the leftovers with us.  Nice late night snack after spending an evening in the casino, lol.  The ambiance of T.R. is quite nice; quaint vibe of a Italian cafe much like you see when visiting Italy. As we visited for an early dinner on a Monday night (10/8/12), there was seating available. But leaving an hour later, all the tables were full and I noted some people waiting.   If you're looking for some good Italian food, in a casual setting, with some top-notch service, you'll want to visit Trattoria Reggiano.

1. The employees were incredibly rude an unwelcoming.  We had a larger group (8) and they were openly irritated at our size.   2. Overpriced!!! An iced tea was $8 and a soft drink (Pepsi products) was $4  3. Apparently they don't have the technology to split checks.   Needless to say, we ended up not staying so we didn't have a chance to try their overpriced food.
This is my new favorite place. The staff is very friendly and the food is amazing. I would definitely recommend as the top restaurant in downtown summerlin!
Great Veal Parm and Eggplant! Service was fantastic ! Only thing I don't like is the seating is a little too close together , otherwise it was delicious real Italian food!

Very authentic Italian food! I spent two years in Italy 25 years ago, and Trattoria Reggiano brought back tastes that I remember and forgot about 25 years ago when I was in Italy. The only difference between a restaurant in Italy and Trattoria Reggiano is the service: Trattoria Reggiano gives excellent, prompt service, whereas in Italy you might have to wait 45 minutes before somebody takes your order. Try the Vodka Pasta - a unique taste that very few American Italian restaurants have.

We were in the mall and came across this restaurant it looked ok so we went in to have a hopefully nice meal for our 20th anniversary. First we were given fresh rolls which were nice. My wife ordered the lobster ravioli I was surprised how fresh tasting and good these were. Then I took a bite of my meal, veal parm which I have eaten and many restaurants around the US. The sauce was heavenly, the breading was exquisite and the veal was so soft, juicy and mouth watering and the portion size was unbelievable. This was by far the best veal parm I have ever eaten. The waiter was very polite and attentive. Then they brought us a k alone on the house that was very tasty. This was the perfect anniversary meal thanks to the staff and cooks at Trattoria  Reggiano

The meatballs were excellent. I don't know what people were talking about. The bread is good but not as good as some reviewers make it out to be. I ordered spaghetti carbonara and it was a little too oily and a little bland for my taste. It was good but nothing so exceptional that I'm inkling to come back again. But if you want decent food at the end of a long touring day and just want an Italian option close to your hotel, this is a good spot

Started strong but the lackluster service.  With all the options Vegas has to offer, move on unless you're really tired and hungry (as I was).  Garlic rolls were good but oily and cold.  Linguine in white clam sauce was average.    Started this review months ago and didn't realize I haddn't finished it. Thinking back on my experience I remember the tea/coffee stall and Quiki-mart next to the restaurant, the rude waiter and slow service and i still think I would have been happier with a soft pretzel and an ice tea from the place we passed on the way there.
Great place, great service and authentic Italian fare. The fresh bread is outta site!!
Still an excellent choice for Italian food.  Recognized many of the staff from previous visits. Veal parm chop was excellent.  My wife's dinner was just ok. Hence the four stars.

My family choose to eat here based on Yelp reviews.  The wait staff was nice but the food was below average and we had to wait over an hour to get our apitizers.  My wife ordered spaghetti and meat sauce and it seemed like it was ground meat with tomato sauce.
Good traditional Italian food. Pizzas are a bargain and pretty large. Fresh garlic rolls are complementary and phenomenal

The food is always amazing. We have been there a couple times. Leave completely satisfied and totally stuffed every time.  Everyone whom works there is very nice. They were super sweet and interacted with our one year old daughter. The Cannolis are to die for!!

I have eaten at Trattoria Reggiano at the Venetian before. Staying in Summerlin, we chose to go to the new restaurant in Summerlin and (finally) found the restaurant in the new shopping mall "Downtown Summerlin". Good food, not cheap, but certainly a place to go back to. What made the evening complete and why we give this 5 stars was Danny, the waiter, who really did everything to make this perfect. From asking the chef to make some changes to a plate without butter but olive oil instead to giving recommendations and helping to clear the table. Great ! Keep this attitude Danny ! Fantastic.
Everyone that worked there was Italian, at an Italain restaurant.  How could it be bad?  The only thing to keep it from 5 stars, the bottle of wine ordered with diner was on the warm side.

Even before I was seated, I was warmly greeted by the owner. When we were seated in the homey, comforting room, we were immediately waited on. The food was exceptionally good and authentic. I felt right at home. Steven C. Is an idiot. The place is great, even though its inside a hotel.
Really great! Very attentive, listened to everything I wanted. The food was great, the wine was great, the ambience was great. Had an awesome time.

We had read good reviews on this place so we took a taxi from Mandalay Bay to the Venetian to try it. The place was good, the service was good. I probably won't take a taxi so far to try it again, however if I am there I would definatly eat there again.

This place is just unbelievable. It really got my attention, as it's really the opposite of most huge, loud Las Vegas restaurants. We decided to try it, and we were amazed. Our server was actually Italian, so we made some conversation with him because a few of us spoke Italian. Very nice guy. The dinner rolls were great, we're still talking about them. The food and wine were overall fantastic, though on the pricey (normal for Vegas) side. Would definitely recommend.

It's been over a year since I have been back in Vegas to go to Trattoria Reggiano again. I've been to many Italian restaurants since but nothing comes remotely close to this place. It's a fairly small and quaint location hidden within one of the most beautiful hotels. It usually has a lengthy wait because it's fairly small, but it's definitely worth it. The staff was very nice and remembers my friends whenever they go back.  I had the Spaghetti Puttanesca with no anchovies and asked for broccoli instead. They brought broccoli on the side and it was the best steamed and sauteed broccoli I have ever tasted. I have tried so hard to replicate it because the chef gave us the recipe but there has been no comparison. The garlic rolls were delicious, we kept fighting over them and the server would keep refilling them.  The food tasted like what Italian food should taste like. I think this is the closest I've been to authentic. I can't wait to go to Italy if this is what authentic is.   I definitely can't wait to go back. I miss this place. It is currently the most memorable Italian restaurant I have been to.

The food is very good quality and the staff is very happy to accommodate particular requests.  The atmosphere is very nice with nice outdoor terrace seating available.  There is enjoyable live singing entertainment after 7 PM.  I like that it is open at those odd hours between lunch and dinner.  My only complaint-- they don't have dark field green lettuce; if they did, I'd give it 5 stars.

Yumm!  I've been there 2 years ago, and I fell in love with the authentic Italian food.. I went there 2 days ago, and I found myself falling in love all over again! The complimentary bread as yummy as it used to be! The chicken Parmesana was so delicious.. The only thing that's changed since my last visit is the restaurant size.. They expanded it a little..
Charming Italian restaurant with authentic Italian. The atmosphere is great. The service fantastic. Loved our waiter.

We ate here for the first time this evening and was not disappointed. The calamari was very good and crispy just the way I like it. The Caesar's salad was bold and tasty. I had the chicken parmigiana. It was tender and juicy. The marinara sauce was thick and with just the right amount of flavor. My wife had the margarita pizza. She said it was very tasty as well. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a nice atmosphere and good food the the price.

Just one meal here and I am now a super fan!  I already can't wait for my next trip to Vegas!!! I just want to eat here.    If I knew I was to die tomorrow, my last meal would be their pizza and garlic bread!  My husband, who is very finicky, LOVED his pasta!   Lastly, the service is impeccable!  It's the Nordstrom of restaurants, they want to make you happy and take great care to give you nothing less than amazing service!   The ambiance is great and it doesn't make you feel like you're in Las Vegas.

Eaten here twice. Filet meatballs are very very good. Service is outstanding and homey. Gnocchi pesto. Frutta di mare and bolognese consumed at our table. All Good, certainly not great, but straight ahead, simple, honest, good. When's the last time anyone said that about anything in Vegas?

Read reviews on Yelp. Took forever to find in the maze of shops, and the location was not  quaint and quiet like we were hoping (it's between other bustling and busy restaurants). But... the food made up for it. Excellent pasta! Our order came out very quickly (5 minutes after we ordered!). The baked ziti with meatballs was piping hot and scrumptious.
