My wife had the Chicken Francese, which, she says, is the best chicken she's ever had. Good service. Great bread. Left stuffed.

We drove from Grand Canyon to Los Angeles, but insanely decide to drive off the path just to come and eat here, not the city (Sorry Vegas!). Well! It's our first time since their expansion. Same menu. Service and food were excellent as always, but food came in not as hot as usual. The great addition as part of expansion is the wood burning pizza oven!!  I love the oven.
Outstanding! Must see Eli at the bar. Amazing appetizers, salad, main course!!! Eli's wine selection was superb!! Bringing friends back here soon...
BETTER THAN EVER! I think I ate there 20 times this year!  Bethany and the entire crew (including managers) make the experience fantastic!!!!
Great spot for food and drink. Bartender Bethany is GREAT!! We go at least 3 times a month.

Amazing!! Been to Vegas twice and out of the many restaurants we tried, this was our favorite restaurant. We actually bought a discounted coupon for it and just figured we would try it out, and we ended up loving it. Garlic bread/knots to start which were very good - always a plus!
Lovee this place. It's kinda hidden in the Venetian. Garlic bread rolls are yummy!! If you like a sauceless pasta try the Spaghetti Aglio E Olio, it's just perfect.
Fantastic food! I use a Yelp all the time, but this is my first checkin. So worth it!

We had a wonderful dining experience for dinner. Everything was excellent. The bread was delicious, calamari was perfectly done, pasta e fagioli was just right, tortellini alfredo, chicken francese, and baked ziti - All wonderfully prepared. Service was also excellent.

Excellent food and service! The owner or manger came by and she was also so nice! The garlic knots are amazing! Calamari was soooooo good and the filet meatballs were OMG delicious!  No wait and can definitely share a meal! Best food we had the whole time! Sooo glad I read reviews and they wee correct
By far my favorite Italian place. Bethany at the bar is the best!  Great service and fantastic food. Highly recommended!!!

This is a lovely little restaurant inside the Venetian and near the Grand Canal. It is set up to seem like a street side cafe, even though it is inside. We ate out on the patio, which is great for people watching, but can be noisy if there is a lot of foot traffic going by. There are more intimate tables inside. Service is attentive and friendly and prices are very good. Portions are huge! There were 6 of us and our favorite dishes included: filet mignon meatballs, garlic knots, kale salad with peanut dressing, pesto gnocchi and pasta carbonara. We also had 2 bottles of a great Sangiovese our waiter recommended.

The food was good,however the place was understaffed.The server really didnt know italian food or wine.We asked several questions about the wine list and nobody could properly answer them.If you work in an Italian restraunt you really should know the difference between chianti and barolo.Surprised they dont hire more experienced serversll

Went here last night for a quick dinner. It was not busy and the service was great. The garlic knots were amazing. We ordered the calamari as an appetizer and it was really good. The best part was the lasagna. It was fresh and is probably the best we've had. This will be our new go-to place when we go to Vegas. Overall great food and fast experience.

Came here with my boyfriend last night and we had a great experience! Everyone was very nice, service was fast and friendly. We had the calamari to share and it was really good. I got the carbonara and my boyfriend got the linguine in clams. Everything was very good, will definitely come back soon for another date!

Ordered the veal parmigiana, waiter commented "it was the best in town", and I was not disappointed. It was DELICIOUS!! The breaded veal was thin and crispy, not oily or soggy, and it was  huge -like 10 inches in diameter - and came with a bowl of spaghetti. It was very fresh and tender. Hubby ordered the spaghetti with meatballs and the Filet mignon meatballs were similarly fresh and very tender.  Highly recommended for fantastic Italian food!
Åt pasta carbonara,den var supergod. Min sambo åt hummer ravioli och tyckte om det jätte mycket.  Bara bra,rekommendera denna restaurang.

had italian a couple times in venetian strip, but this was my favorite place. feels like a mom & pop, no frills italian joint.  the spaghetti and veal meatballs was perfect. the table bread was unbelievable -- already brushed with olive oil and sprinkled with cheese

This may be one of the best Italian meals I've ever had.  Maybe I was really hungry, maybe I had a bit too much of the Fat Tuesday drink, or maybe, Trattoria Reggiano is just that good.  I visited for dinner on a Sunday night and the place was packed.  There was one free table, 'outside' and we snatched that up.  Our waiter very quickly brought us menus, waters, and took our orders promptly too.  About the food:  -Garlic bread (free): delicious.  If you aren't afraid of carbs, which no one in my family is, these are your best friend.  Warm, soft, and garlicky.  These were so good that we asked for another serving after devouring the first basketful.  -Calamari ($14): a very generous portion.  It was almost too much for the four of us, almost.  There was a nice balance of both the tentacles and the rings/body and the marinara dipping sauce was just right.    -Baked ziti ($16): cheesy penne pasta; my sister seemed to enjoy this dish quite a bit.  -Spaghetti and meatballs ($18): the spaghetti is good, but what makes this dish great is the meatballs.  They are certified angus beef filet mignon meatballs.  These meatballs are perfectly seasoned, perfectly soft and flavorful.  I would definitely recommend this dish.   -Gnocchi ($18): they were out of pesto so we opted for the alfredo sauce.  The gnocchi was perfectly soft and the alfredo was nice and creamy.  In fact, the sauce was excellent for dipping the garlic bread into.  -Cannoli (free): it was my birthday and the waiter let me pick out a dessert for free!  He brought out four spoons so that we could all share also.    If you can't tell already, I really enjoyed my dining experience here.  The service was very friendly and helpful, the food was hot, and tasty, plus- I got a free dessert!  The prices are very fair and the food is high-quality.

We stayed at the Venetian in August for our anniversary and were looking for a place to eat for lunch on our last day in Vegas. This place is hidden away close to the Food Court area and behind a few of the shops on Canal street. There is a outside sitting area where you can watch people walking by and some booths inside.   The GF and I were craving some pizza and the pies looked good (yes I was looking at peoples food while walking by :-p). So we decided to stop in for lunch, it was quiet as it was a Tuesday afternoon. We sat in a cozy booth and it was quite comfortable. They brought us some garlic rolls with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. The rolls were just ok, but they were free so no complaints from me. We shared the Pepperoni and olive pizza. It was quite a tasty pizza, the sauce was really good, and tasted great with the peperoni's. I was quite impressed with how good the crust was, thin and crunchy, not too doughy. It was the perfect size pizza for the two of us and I was not overly stuffed when we left. While we were eating an Italian tourist came in speaking Italian to the wait staff, for a second we felt as we were in Italy. Our waitress was great, attentive and provided to the atmosphere.   Overall a good experience, would I eat here again if i was in Vegas? Probably not but that is not because of the food or service but simply because there are too many place to try in Vegas. Why eat at the nearby food court when this is right next to it? If you're looking for an relatively inexpensive, tasty meal, I would definitely recommend Trattoria's.

Best pasta I had in the last few years!!! Was just perfect! I had Linguine bolognese with a looot of meat( filet mignon) and a great sauce. The appetizer was also amazing . Loved everything! I will surely come back.

What a pleasant surprise to find this small place. Their salads are divine, perfectly covered with the right balance of oil and vinegar / lemon. And the whole food is wonderful. I would never have thought they were like that.

Hubby and I searched far and low for this spot based on Yelp, and finally found it!  We were not disappointed either, the food was yummy and generous, the garlic knots were delicious and of course, I had a relaxing glass of the Monterey Pinot Noir!  Eric, our waiter, was polite, provided great service and made our dining experience lovely!! We will return!

Had a terrific meal here. The quality to price ratio is terrific anywhere, let alone Vegas, a barren wasteland of restaurants that actually live up to the hype.  The waitress/bartender makes a terrific martini to boot.  Finally, the place is very family friendly, were one inclined to bring their kiddos to Vegas for some reason.

We stumbled across this place based on Yelp reviews. EXCELLENT, personable service. I love how authentic everything, including the employees were. I have an Italian last name and they pronounced it beautifully. The rolls are to die for- warm and dripping with butter and garlic. Mixed green salad was so fresh and tasted so good with the house dressing. Loved the Linguine Bolognese - it's the real deal! Portions are very large. Servers are super attentive to every detail and so very kind and appreciative. No wait and fast service. I will refer this to anyone who wants an amazing Italian dinner experience!
Fantastic food and stellar service. My fiancé ordered the lobster ravioli and I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. I couldn't be more pleased with this quaint Las Vegas dining experience!

Amanda, the server, is AWESOME.  I had the spaghetti and meatballs, my boyfriend had the shrimp scampi. We loved our meal and the portion sizes were more than sufficient.  The garlic rolls were heavenly. Rolls should not be that damn good.  I had not read the reviews prior to trying out this restaurant. But the reviews are on point. If you are in the area, and in the mood for fantastic Italian food and superior service, you should try Trattoria Reggiano.  If you do, tell Amanda that Don and Yolanda from Chicago said hello, and that we'll never pay for parking in Vegas again (insider).
Had a blessed evening!   The waiter SERGIO is a sweet person! Lovely food!  Huuuuge for those hungry ones lol
So completely average... This place wouldn't get noticed in NYC. Its a decent affordable option
When visiting Las Vegas,this is the place to have dinner, the food was great and so was the friendly staff

This is one of my very favorite restaurants in Vegas! Every visit to Vegas includes dinner here. I'm the type of person who wants to try new places all the time. That's how I found Trattoria Reggiano. It is the only restaurant in Vegas that I can't miss when I'm in town!

Located in Downtown Summerlin next to the movie theatre, I strolled in here late last Sunday night. There's a lot of options for Italian in downtown Summerlin, but I was curious to try this place out after walking past it so many times- I'm glad I did. I tried the Chicken Parmesan and pepperoni pizza, so delicious! Their marinara had excellent flavor and they immediately give you garlic knots upon sitting down, (mouthwatering) but be careful not to get full before your food comes! Portions are on the larger side and the restaurant is nice but not elegant, perfect for just a casual date night or dinner with family. Also, friendly staff! I was one of the last tables and didn't feel rushed at all.

we were staying nearby, so moseyed over for some italian.  the mall/food court-like environment around the place isn't great, but once inside, it feels cozy enough.  we had the burrata special app, garlic knots, and penne vodka with shrimp and spaghetti & meatballs.   Garlic knots were fantastic, and the sauce for the spaghetti & meatballs was great.  penne vodka was also very good.  service with a smile, and not crazy expensive, which we somewhat expected, as it is in the Venetian on the strip.

We went on a busy night during the holiday season but were able to make a reservation for two anyway. They were nice about accommodating. I thought the food here was surprisingly good. I had shrimp scampi and my husband had swordfish. Both were very flavorful and nicely prepared. The service was very good albeit a bit slow (not over the top great, but still good). The ambiance is just okay....we were seated inside and it's very cramped (indoor dining area is really small). Overall, a tasty meal. I would go back again for the food.

This place was perfect for our needs- we were all starving, one of our party is a vegetarain so Italian works for her, the Venetian wasn't that far from our hotel AND we wanted to to stop at Bouchon Bakery anyway so bing, bang, boom Trattoria Reggiano it was!  The prices are a bit high for basic Italian food ($20 for an entree vs. $15) but it was the tasty, saucy, carby mid-range Italian food of our dreams.  And the bread! Maybe it's because I was so hungry but the garlic rolls were extra delicious and buttery!  I liked that it looked like a little hole in the wall and had "outside" seating, we didn't have to wait at all, food came out quickly, I would reccmomend this if you were looking for moderatly priced satisfying meal on the strip.
Love this place, especially the bread. Bethany is the best bartender and we will keep coming back often as long as she's there

The food was awesome, great service, welcoming environment. Our server Victor was so helpful, he gave us great suggestions. The food was amazing! We got different kinds of pasta. They were all so good & the garlic balls were just perfect! Love this place. Definitely will come back!

This is a excellent restaurant but it's very small.  We have never had anything that wasn't good.  I love the pasta sauce, the salad dressing... If u go on a weekend plan on a wait but most week nights it's no more then 10 min wait.  I wish they were able to give a little more elbow space but it's still a great atmosphere.

Not a big fan. Was comparable to a regular food court Italian eatery but with a $$$ price tag. Ordered the caprese salad and was void of flavor. The wine was weak and did not pair well. The eggplant appetizer was soggy but there was potential for something pleasant. The tortellini tasted like a micowaved Marie Calendars. The garlic  knots were under cooked and lathered in a salty butter crust that was nearly defibrillator worthy. I am not going to return and would not recommend.

Such a fun place.  Waiters are yelling in Italian, kitchen is right there and noisy, tables are close together, the bread is freshly heated and smothered with garlic,  so Italian.  Love it.   I'm very specific with food but it is always yummy, fresh and satisfying.

We went to the restaurant at Downtown Summerlin. Daniel G was outstanding!!.he made us feel right at home... the food was excellent, the service was great definitely a Hidden Gem. Good portions for the price, please don't change that and Please keep the Broccoli  Raab on the menu, the Tiramisu was off the chain!! Locals should definitely check it out.

I decided to try this place out for a late Sunday dinner. The outside seating was cozy and the weather was perfect. The bread served before dinner was amazing! The server called it bread but it was delicious garlic knots. Calamari also amazing as an appetizer and finished up with a bruschetta pizza.  It was all plenty of food to share for 2.

Always amazing, we are now long time repeat customers for years to come. Authentic Italian is hard to find. Super fresh food, great atmosphere in downtown summerlin, great staff. Love it! Can't go wrong with the Filet meatballs, calamari is so fresh-you can see them cutting it there, the CANNOLI and chocolate cake TO DIE FOR! Yum.
Very good lunch. Bread is awesome, if you are a garlic butter kind of person. Chicken parmigiana alfredo w/chicken. Very tasty and hot.

Thanks to the Yelp community, my friend and I stumbled onto this lovely restaurant nestled in a far corner of the Venetian right next to the magic store and coffee bean.   I LOVE, LOVE, LOVED this place. As when you're walking through the Venetian feeling like you're "outdoors", strolling Venice, Trattoria Reggiano exuded a relaxing respite from shopping and the many, many frou-frou Vegas restaurant options. The smell of the fresh-baked garlic rolls becomes more pungent as you get closer and the warm, welcoming personalities of the staff definitely made us feel as if we were walking into our neighborhood Italian restaurant. Everything felt very authentic from the quality of the olive oil, the fresh-grated parmesan cheese, and the colorful options of Italian soda and (iced) teas.   Food standouts (SOOOO good my friend and I ate there two days out of our 3 day Vegas trip):   - Garlic rolls: Ridiculously delicious. Served piping hot.   - Spaghetti Aglio e Olio: generous portion of pasta cooked perfectly al dente with olive oil, crushed red pepper, parsley, and fresh grated parmesan cheese. A simple but traditional dish so you know the flavor was REALLY good.   - Penne in Vodka Sauce: another generous portion of pasta cooked perfectly al dente with shallots, vodka, proscuitto in creamy pink sauce. My friend is super-model skinny and she ate the entire dish - it was THAT good.   - Cannoli. Holy eff. This is the best cannoli I've ever tasted. The marscarpone cream was light and fluffy, the shell was crunchy, and there were just enough chocolate chips for sweetness.   Considering all of the trips I've taken to Vegas, Trattoria Reggiano is definitely a standout. I can't wait to visit again. Delizioso!

An older, grey haired waiter with a name tag that read Sergio, ruined my birthday celebration!! My husband and I are a middle aged, well groomed couple. There was no obvious reason why this waiter should decide he did not wish to wait on us or be civil in any way. He took our order after waiting on tables that arrived after we did. Then he said to me, I am not making this up, "What do you want?" He did not ask if I wanted a beverage. HE was equally rude to my husband. He did not check on us after our meals arrived but spent much time doting on the couples who were seated on both sides of us. He refused to make eye contact with me. He did not clear our tables nor ask if we wished to have desert. I was in tears, utterly confused, angry and very upset. We will never return to this restaurant.
Food is very good. Service was excellent. I went with a group of 6 on two different occasions and it was excellent both times. Definitely worth a try.
The garlic knots are to die for! We had amazing service and our food (lasagna and baked ziti) was awesome. We were very pleasantly surprised and will definitely be returning!

The food here was so delicious! I can't wait to come back! The space itself is tiny, but worth the cramped quarters once we started eating. The bread is great, as is the pasta. You can tell everything is made fresh, it's just so good.

Trattoria Reggiano is a great local Summerlin Italian restaurant for causal alfresco dinning. Our bartender and cocktails were fantastic! I love that they allow you to bring your own bottles of wine (for a small pour fee) adds a fun personal touch to the dinning experience. The appetizers and entrées all around the table were on point, well seasoned, excellent portion size and absolutely delicious! This place will definitely be our go-to when in the mood for Italian!

This restaurant just opened today! Service was excellent!! My wife is pregnant and not able to have bleu cheese. The item she ordered had some crumbled on top. Ben took ownership and insisted on remaking the dish without it. After my wife was cool enough to say she would just pick it off, Ben insisted and had the dish remade. Wonderful staff, great food, and most importantly to me great service. We highly recommend this new spot at DT Summerlin, we will for sure be coming back!

Dad says best clam sauce pasta outside of Venice!  Cute restaurant inside the Venetian. I've been to Venice so I can vouch for how much like Venice they tried to imitate!  My parents and I got the Warm Spinach salad, lobster ravioli, and linguine with clams in white sauce. Warm Spinach Salad: huge portion. Meant to be a shared appetizer or a main dish. Not a side salad. All the ingredients were fresh The tomatoes, nuts, bacon, onion, cheese... EVERYTHING WENT SO WELL TOGETHER. Lobster ravioli: good portion of lobster in the ravioli. Did not taste seafood-y at all which was pleasant. Linguine with clams in white sauce. My dad said it tasted like the ones we had in Italy... and that must be a good thing!  A little slow.. but still friendly service!

My very favorite spot in LV. A fresh alternative for all of those lame overpriced places.  Everything is tasteful here. Meatballs, salads, bread, you name it. The prices are pretty reasonable (LV standards) and the setting is cozy, charming and great for people watching.  I like to call this place the hidden gem of LV.

The 4 star rating is for the food, service was more of a mixed bag.  But, let's start with the positive.  The food was spot on and really nice for a casual, relaxed neighborhood place.  The garlic rolls are some of the best I've had in town.  For some reason, most of the garlic knots I've tried here in Vegas have not been up to par.  These are the exception.  They're soft and have that stretch and bounce of a good knot, garlicky with olive oil and a sprinkle of Parmesanm and served with extra bottles of olive oil and balsamic vinegar.  Margarita pizza with burrata was excellent, Caesar salad was tasty with dressing on the vinegary side, kids meals were decent and each meal came with a mini cannoli for dessert.  Meatballs looked great but didn't try. I would absolutely come back for the food.  Ok, here's the scoop on the service.  I think we just had an overworked server that day and that person was not at their best.  I prefer to give them the benefit of e doubt bc we all have our bad days.  Suffice it to say, service and attitude were subpar but not enough to complain to management.   In the end, we just wanted to pay our bill and move along.  The hostess and manager were very nice and courteous and greeted everyone at the door.  Conclusion:  food's great but the waitstaff could use a bit more training.  We'll be back to try again.

Right when we checked into the Venetian I was really hungry. I wanted to eat somewhere close by. Trattoria Reggiano is located on the second floor right next to the escalators near the floors 1-16 in the Venetian.  It's a small restaurant with few seating.  In fact there are more tables outside then inside.  When I say outside it's actually indoors where people walk by.  Their menu consists of salads, pastas, and pizzas.  They bring out complimentary bread to your table.  These small bread pieces are covered in butter, seasoning, and parmesan cheese.  I ordered the bruschetta pizza and it didn't disappointed.  It was freaking delicious! The bottom of the pizza was crispy but not burnt.  The toppings include tomato sauce, shredded mozzarella, fresh cubes of mozzarella, tomatoes, garlic, onions, and basil.  All of the ingredients were fresh.  The service was great because they checked on us often and got us refills on bread and drinks.  I highly recommend this restaurant to everyone.  Can't wait to go back and try other pizzas.

I've walked past this little gem many times while at the Venetian. When we trying to decide on a late lunch, we both thought of Trattoria Reggiano and decided to give it a try. We were both pleased that we did. It reminded us of a small italian family place with great food and a great staff complimented by a cute setting. We had salads and shared a pizza. It was really a great choice. Trattoria Reggiano, ya done good! Thanks for a great dinner.

Do not walk by!!! Go in to eat here. Delicious!! We stayed at the Venetian for 3 nights and while shopping I kept walking by. Finally I had a craving for spaghetti and meatballs....oh baby baby wow!! From the garlic rolls dripping with olive oils ad garlic, to the house salad, to our spaghetti (mine with meatballs, the other with clams). Given how expensive meals can be in Vegas, we averaged $100 each meal while here, our check was a surprising $75 including two glasses of wine. Yeah!! Now i can get my revenge on the blackjack tables.

My husband and I had a great time here. We came here on a rare, childless Thursday night and had a wonderful meal. We ordered the eggplant rollatini to start, which was wonderful. We were pleasantly surprised when they brought out garlic knots as their bread and an amuse bouche of Parmesan hunks, olives and roasted red pepper slices. I had to deliberately not fill up before my entree came out. I ordered the tortelloni and they were perfection. Delicate, flavorful perfection. I speculate that they hand make them because of how well they were cooked. My husband had the gnocchi and he thoroughly enjoyed that dish. We will definitely be back. I look forward to bringing my 8 year old foodie next time.

I had such high hopes for this restaurant after reading so many positive reviews. Unfortunately my experience was that it was just average. I guess it's location near the back of The Venetian Food Court area should have been the first sign. I was seated outside sandwich between two other tables. It took awhile for the waiter to come by with the menu and my water. The complimentary garlic rolls were okay, nothing to rave about. I saw the owner, or someone in management, walking around and talking to some tables. I was hoping he'd stop by mine, but it looked like he was just stopping by familiar faces. I almost always order eggplant if it's on the menu. I must say I was very disappointed. They were length wise slices layered on top of each other with tons of cheese on top - it reminded me of an eggplant lasagna. The great thing about Vegas is that there are tons of restaurants to choose from. Skip this one.

The over all taste of the food was very good.  Lobster Ravioli and Bucatini with garlic knots. Our order was a to go order.  First call had to hang up and call back into place my order because the guy didn't know the menu.  Second call the young lady was on point.  We will be going back to try more items on the menu. I approve this message J K KUHL..

We ended up at eating here after missing our dinner rez and getting out of a cirque show after 11P. One would think there would be several more dining options open and serving late night dinners, especially on the weekends and after shows but the options are a bit scarce.   The best thing here... the garlic rolls! I really liked them. Everything else was just mediocre.  Our drinks - I had a carafe of red sangria. Not great! Didn't finish it. I didn't think I was very picky about my sangria, turns out I am. Perhaps I just like Blake Shelton's version. My boyfriend had a mojito, he didn't seem so fond of it. I was looking for a nice Sangiovese on the menu, they don't have one.  I had Linguine in Clam Sauce. Gotta love a meal that puts you to work after midnight ;) the baby clams sautéed in white wine, garlic and olive oil were yummy, the linguine was lackluster. Did not taste like fresh pasta at all.  My boyfriend ordered the Spaghetti and Meatballs so I refrained from ordering the Meatball appetizer since he'd have them with his dish. Our server was so sure of these meatballs made with filet mignon he even said he'd take care of us if my boyfriend didn't like them. I thought for sure they'd be amazing. My boyfriend wasn't impressed at all and since I don't eat a lot of meat I wasn't going to even give them a try. My boyfriend finished his meal and we both replied politely when asked how things were.  I mean who wants to be the couple at closing to tell them their food isn't great...? Not us, apparently :)  I wouldn't necessarily recommend this place, unless of course it's late and your options are limited. There are other better nearby options.

Two o'clock and we showed up with a scooter that I need from an injury. 2 tables taken. An empty restaurant and they would not accommodate us. Went to Mercato. What a blessing in st marks square. Best Italian dinner in Vegas with the best ambience. Thank you for turning us away.

We ate there last evening. It was late for us getting into town and we wanted something close to the Venetian.  The service was quick, there was no waiting and it was excellent food.  I will agree with the other comments about the meatballs - they were excellent.  It was a little different atmosphere with not a lot of indoor seating but that made it unique and all the better.
Good food and excellent burrata and tomato salad!!  Good service.  Highly recommend.

First off props to the awesome busser Donald! He is the only reason we had any kind of decent service. He is treated so bad by the server Ricki and it's sad to see someone work so hard for someone so rude.    We had a party of nine and from the beginning server Ricki was helping the hostess seat us. They were both annoyed and we just seemed to be an "inconvenience" to them. After we sat down Ricki was our server, and she asked what we wanted to drink. She offered alcohol we said no alcohol. She stated that she didn't ask if we wanted it. Okay well whatever than. After she bossed her busser to get drinks she took our order and we asked for bread please. She stated "once your food order goes in than you will get bread, you will have to wait". The whole time she was treating her busser like he was a slave.   She got our pizza wrong. The food was okay. Nothing to rave about.   We couldn't get her attention for anything she was to busy hanging out at the hostess stand talking and chatting. On the way out I told a manager about the experience and Ricki had the nerve to come chase us down in the walkway to the stores in downtown summerlin to tell us she didn't have an attitude and we were wrong. Talk about uncomfortable and so awful! Horrible customer service. We won't be returning! :(

Service was good. Asked for extra lime, extra sauce, extra cheese... got them all.  We asked for a booth for us 2 and they were glad to do it.    Spaghetti and meatballs was about as good as the dish gets.  Calamari was solid... we get it often.    I got a Bloody Mary and asked for it spicy but it really just ended up being salty, but that happens.   Meal with an appetizer and a drink each was $95... just kind of a fact. The strip isn't cheap.

If you are looking for reasonably priced italian fare or the best Spaghetti and Meatballs in Las Vegas, come to Trattoria Reggiano.  I love Italian food and this place does not disappoint.  From the large portions, delicious food, and friendly service... it's no wonder why there is wait.  If you love Italian food and are able to find this place in the shopping malls of the Venetian, you'll be in for a real treat.  The meal starts with the complimentary garlic butter rolls... sinfully good.  As usual, we shared a number of entrees for the table including a appetizer, pizza, and pasta.  So we ordered calamari, prosciutto pizza, and the famous spaghetti and meatballs.  All were very delicious and are actually making my mouth water while I write this review.  I do have to point out that their meatballs are far from regular.  Their claim to fame is that their meatballs are filet mignon... and I believe them 100%.  The meatballs are very tender and almost fall and you cut through them with your fork.  They are ridiculous good.  Don't miss out on Trattoria Reggiano if you are in search for good italian food in Las Vegas.  I've had my fair share of Italian in the city including Scarpetta, D.O.C.G, etc. and the food here is on par (if not better) than any of those fine-dining establishments.

The food was alright for the price we paid, however the service was absolutely horrible. It doesn't take 2 hours to serve two bowls of pasta. Additionally, they had my order wrong. This place doesn't deserve a 4 star rating.

Came in earlier this week with some girl friends for lunch. We were seated right away at a great table. Our waitress came very quickly and made some great recommendations . I remember her name as Ricky. Short blonde hair. Our food came in a timely manner and everything was superb.  My friends and I have decided to make this place our new regular meetup place. Great food. Excellent staff. And loved the atmosphere.

Delicious italian dinner.  We had the Filet of Sole Meuniere.  Nice friendly atmosphere.  Live music on the patio.  Very personal staff.  Ask for Sam he is awesome. Great place to relax and enjoy at the Downtown Summerlin mall.

There are really some great Italian places at the Venetian.  Surprise, Surprise!  The food at this place was great.  I LOVED the eggplant parm and the penne.  We also got some baked ziti, which I didn't particularly care for.  It wasn't bad, but the sauce/cheese combo just didn't jive with me.  The bread could have been good, but it was very cold; like they took it right out of the fridge.  I do want to call out that the waiter was kind of an ass.  It was strange, because he would do everything we asked and would return relatively politely, but whenever we asked for something he always grimaced, sighed, or pouted.  Very strange.  All the waiters here were old men.  Maybe he was just tired due to old age.  I don't know, but I found this strange and worth calling out.  And it wasn't just him; even the guy we talked to in terms of seating was pretty rude.  He said we could have this "inside" table right away and when asked about an outside "table" he rudely just said, "NO!".  The service is the only reason I bumped my review down to 3 instead of 4 stars.  There were at least a couple of other highly rated restaurants at this hotel.  I wish we had gone to one of those.  I'm sure they would've had great food AND service.  I don't know what it is, but I've been on a really bad streak with restaurant service.
Amazing food well cooked pasta and great service and they really liked this place.. And I got a really big dish

A nice place tucked away in the Venetian.    It came recommended by some other tourists, so we gave it a try.  The food is pretty good for a cafe style restaurant. The pizza marguerite is better than the one at Otto and Reggiano offers a better more casual experience overall: win-win. The wine and deserts are good as well.    Service was smooth and attentive and there are good vegetarian options.  I'll eat here again.

AWFUL!!  The only thing worse than the service is the food. Overpriced bland food served by staff who would rather shoot the breeze with each other than actually wait tables.   Because of the poor service, I left a small tip (I probably should have given nothing) and believe it or not, when I checked my credit card statement I noticed that the amount had been changed. I called the restaurant and after investigating, they confirmed that the waiter had actually crossed out the amount of the tip and written in another amount! Blatant theft and credit card fraud!  If you go (which I wouldn't recommend), pay with cash.
Good food. Absolutely amazing sangria. The restaurant is located right next to the Gondola ride at the Venetian and the ambience is very good.

Love love this place Las Vegas location inside the Venetian great food especially the lasagna and I'm from New York I know lasagna!!! The waiter Victor was awesome pleasant and super helpful!!! If your visiting you've got to go eat here!!
Perfect service, bad food. Didn't like the chicken Parmesan nor the fillet mignon spaghetti.

This a gem hidden in the Venetian of Las Vegas. After doing some research on affordable more personal restaurants in Vegas, this was the obvious go to. After finding it in a mall like food court within the Venetian we were surprised at how small it was! It was pretty packed, but we offered to wait, and it was worth it! The food was great and it was nice getting away from the craziness of Vegas for a little bit without breaking the bank.  Sadly, we were seated by a group of young drunk guys who were spilling their drinks and being loud and rude to the waitstaff. If we didn't have the misfortune of this, I would give the place 5 stars. I understand that this is more common when you're in Vegas, but I have to judge the overall experience fairly, and with the place being so small in size, it was very hard to ignore.. Outside of this, the restaurants was 5 stars itself, keep up what you're doing and maybe throw in a apology or two when your guests have to put up with other rowdy customers ;).

the food is totally average italian, but its actually reasonably priced, and this is a great place to take a big group for dinner. i was having a hard time finding a place in vegas that didnt have a pre fix menu once you had 15 people or more. this place lets you order whatever you want, and no minimum per person. if youre staying at the venetian and you have a big crew, this is your best bet.

This place was fine. Like everything in vegas it was overpriced and I can make much better pasta at home. I got the spaghetti and meatballs, since it had a lot of positive reviews and I found the sauce to be kind of watery and bland. The meatball was huge and dense and also rather flavorless.  I was starving however and the service was quick and friendly.  Frankly, I was disappointed with the food and wouldn't return, but the servers were really nice and made the experience more tolerable.

Best Italian Resturant I had ever dined in.  Small and quaint with super friendly staff. My wife loves pasta and she tried many dishes from many places but she actually said this maybe the best Resturant she ever visited. I gave it a five star. If you are in vegas it is a must restaurant to dine. Do not miss this opportunity; you will regret it.

I had great meals all over Vegas but this place wasn't one of them. I saw the great reviews and decided to give this place a try but it was mediocre at best. The food was pricey considering its simplicity and it lacked flavor. Even the garlic rolls left much to be desired. The atmosphere is odd and the waiter was a little snooty.

On our most recent Vegas trip my family chose to dine here again instead of trying a new place because it is THAT amazing.  About three years ago we celebrated my sister's birthday here and we loved it so much we celebrated my mother's birthday here this time. Three years and it is STILL consistently great!  I made a reservation on Open Table for a Monday at 5:30pm. We arrived on time and our table was ready. There were other guests, but it wasn't too busy - understandable given it was early and a Monday.  The atmosphere is kinda casual dressy - there are white tablecloths and cloth napkins, but it is brightly lit and open. There were children dining as well so it is kid friendly. I think they'll even give the kids crayons.   The waiter was VERY friendly and funny! Made casual jokes but wasn't inappropriate or anything like that. He promptly brought us water and their delicious buttery/oily/garlicky rolls! They're so soft and fluffy! There's olive oil and balsamic for dipping as well. Mmm the perfect way to start a meal. Our food came out pretty quickly too. It's an open kitchen so you can see them preparing everything fresh!  Chicken Cesar salad ($16): a little pricy for a salad, but I had it as my entree so not too bad on Vegas price standards. They give you a big plate of romaine perfectly coated in creamy dressing. It's topped with shaved Parmesan and grilled chicken that was marinated in balsamic. So good and a good amount to share.   Calamari appetizer ($14): perfect size for the 6 of us to share. Each piece fried crispy and there was a good ratio of rings to tentacles. Served with yummy marinara sauce and lemon.   Filet mignon meatballs ($16): my sister and her husband shared this appetizer, but let us all try it. The most tender meatballs you will ever have! Mmm the tomato sauce is perfect with it to. Topped with Parmesan and comes with three to an order.   Penne in vodka sauce ($18): perfectly cooked penne in a creamy tomato sauce cooked with onions and topped with prosciutto. My boyfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed it.   Chicken Marsala ($22): my mother's boyfriend ordered this and said it was the BEST chicken Marsala he's ever had! I tried it and it WAS good, considering it's something I would probably never order. The chicken was tender and the sauce was well balanced.   Spaghetti bolognese ($18): my sister and her husband shared this and said it was very tasty - they ate the entire plate.   Since we were celebrating my mother's birthday they gave us a tiramisu on the house! So sweet of them. It was served in a glass cup with two lady fingers sticking out of it. The cup was held to the plate with caramel which was tasty and cool to look at.   Once again this restaurant did not disappoint and I would return and recommend! I'm sure everything on the menu is delicious, but then I always want to eat my favorites because they're that good! If you're in Vegas and want good Italian food that will not break your bank - go here!

Second time here and it was a wonderful meal for all of us. The bread was delicious!! We had a great salad and split three main dishes that were great. Cannot say anything bad about the place, even our waiter, Victor was a delight! We will go again when we visit Vegas
The worst Italian food and service from Surgio. Olive Garden is 5 stars compared to this place. I could just rant forever but it's not worth my time.

Today was the first day of their opening after the remodel, this is my favorite place to eat and the food was so good the spinach salad was so fresh the chicken with the white Alfredo sauce umm how do I say this the taste was Absolutely amazing!!!  Our server is a sweet heart the whole staff there are great people and we will come back again and again!

Located in downtown Summerlin..has plenty of parking. Came here for an early dinner and was very pleased. You can sit either inside or out...we sat outside because it was perfect temp out at the time. We were greeted by a friendly hostess with a smile. We were immediately seated and brought water and a complimentary plate of olives, cheese and roasted peppers. Very tasty!   After we ordered we were given the best garlic knots I ever had!! Warm, lightly salted and moist. So delicious we asked for more! Perfect to dip in the wonderful balsamic vinegar and olive oil.   We started with the arugula salad. The dressing is light and tasty. We ordered the large size and they split it for us. We really appreciate that type of service. We also ordered the ziti pasta with meatballs. The meatballs are made with filet and pork. The dish comes with 2 huge delicious meatballs. The pasta is covered in a creamy and cheesy sauce. The dish is huge and we all took some home. I recommend you split this dish..as it's very filling. The service is excellent, the food is delicious! I will be back!!

I cannot begin to tell you how disappointed I am with the food at this restaurant. Our waiter was excellent! He always kept our drinks full and our table attended to. Unfortunately, the food was crap. The pictures of the bread looked soooo good on other reviews - I had such high hopes! But, alas, the bread was rock hard and nigh flavorless (more pretzel like). The pasta, I kid you not, tasted EXACTLY like Chef Boyardee ravioli. We will not be going back. Macaroni Grill beats this place by miles.
Beautiful restaurant; food is good so was service however the crowd is 50+ especially at the bar.

Worst service- be prepared to lose your appetite from the frustration!  Asked on three separate occasions to three separate folks for oil and vinegar- got it on fourth try .  Manager offered to comp the bill- I refused !  This high potential restaurant need serious training/corporate attention- it's on a rough start- sorry!
Great wood fired pizza! Small, tucked away restaurant in the Venetian with great service and engaging bartenders.

Here on a quiet Wednesday evening with nice weather so we are enjoying it. It's our first time here and we like it. The pizza was great and the calamari was... Good but not exceptional.   The manager Vito is great.

My favorite Italian restaurant in Summerlin. Great food, great atmosphere. The only complaint I have is the limited bar selection. They carry a good selection of wines and they have your basic hard liquor. I'm a Scotch guy, and I REALLY wished they served Balvenie 14 year Caribbean Cast.

For our last night in Vegas we were looking for something a little on the cheap. The roulette wheel was not kind to us. The Venetian website listed this as a casual dining place in the one $ price range so it seemed like it'd be the perfect place.   For two glasses of wine, some meatballs for an app, and two pasta dishes we walked out $90 poorer. When you start approaching the $100 range I'm thinking of a decent place back home on Federal Hill in Providence or the North End in Boston. While Trattoria Reggiano wasn't bad, it certainly wasn't worth it.   It's a small place with some very crowded tables outside the restaurant. We were quickly seated at one of these and it had all the atmosphere of a mall food court. By the end of the meal I felt as I intimately knew the couple on the side of us because we could easily hear the conversation as well as we could hear our own. Luckily the small children on the other side of us were extremely well behaved because being stuffed so closed to them, it had the potential for disaster.   The service was ok, but there was a team of four guys working the place and each of the four had a hand in our service. We didn't have one set waiter. One of the guys didn't like to talk and took our order with mumbles and gestures, but the rest of the guys were nice enough.   The small plate of tortelini I had was decent enough, but nothing to write home about. The gnocci that the girlfriend had was drowning in pesto and wasn't homemade.   We would've had a cheaper and more enjoyable dinner at Olive Garden. We threw money away like drunken sailors all week and then picked a bad time to try searching out an inexpensive option. We would've been much better off dropping a few extra bucks on a nicer place.
This place was delicious! I got the baked ziti and meatballs. Very good!! Definitely recommend this if you feel like Italian.
Great food but I agree with a previous reviewer, they take the plates and clear the table too soon.  Makes you feel rushed. It's a small place, that could be why..

This is me and my girlfriends go to spot when we come down to Vegas.   The location is a little hidden but the closest  entrance is close to the Tao nightclub. It doesn't have the nicest scenery but the food is what makes us come back.   Since my first time we ate here I have gotten lasagna and it has been my go to dish every time I come! My girlfriend and friend have gotten other dishes such as pastas and fettuccini and although they said it was good, they said it was nothing to rave about. But my girlfriend decided to get the lasagna like me the last time we came and she said this would be her go to dish from on now. She loved it so much!

Out of all the restaurants in downtown Summerlin this is by far my favorite!   Offers both indoor and outdoor seating. Very Italian and fun atmosphere.   For starters I think the kale salad is exceptional. I don't usually like kale but in this form it is delicious. Chicken Parmesan, gnocchi and baked ziti are among some of the entrees I have tried and all are very good! (My favorite being the gnocchi).   Canoli's are also excellent!  I recommend this place if you are ever in down town Summerlin. I will continue to return. :)

Amazing place for lunch service, a good wine selection to compliment most meals. It did take a while to get food but everything seemed like it was made when ordered, with quality ingredients. The portions are very generous, as they should be to meet the higher than average prices.

This is not one of the fancy restaurants you see inside of the hotels on the Strip.  The restaurant itself is super small and you might end up seated outside the restaurant in the aisle.  So if you are looking for an intimate romantic dinner, this place is not for you for sure.  But if you are just looking for a good Italian food reasonably priced, then this place is for you.    My husband loved his lobster ravioli and I liked my dish too.  The dessert was too sweet for my taste but I bet a lot of people like it.  Two pasta dishes and a dessert = $55 plus tip.  The service is good... the owner (I am guessing he was the owner) stands outside of the restaurant, greeting people and keeping eyes on the tables.    This place is a bit hard to find so ask a security guard for a direction when you enter the Venetian.

Fresh and the best Itailian food you will get that is the closest to being to Italy!!  Garlic rolls are awesome!!!  All the salads and pasta dishes are wonderful, especially the meatballs!!  Everytime we come over to vacation in Vegas we make this a must have dinner on our list!!  Very small mom n pop place so big groups is not really ideal, keep it to 6 or less.  Small kids would be bored so be respectful and don't take them.  Good date night dinner place!!

What a disappointment, I was really looking forward to trying this place. All the great reviews for mediocre type of Italian food. It was like eating at an expensive version of an olive garden with the same crappie food. Don't know if maybe it was the wrong time or what but I definitely expected a lot more out of it. (Came around 2:30pm) The price is never an issue for me as long as you give great quality food and authentic...none of that here.

Another amazing meal at this fine italian restaurant. It was a birthday celebration and we had a group of 5. The server was very nice and attentive and provided great recommendations. The kale peanut salad is so amazing. The large portion is plenty for sharing. Also, the server recommened i add shrimp to the pesto gnocchi and it paired perfectly. Everyone at the table tried it and agreed it was a great choice. The pesto sauce is very good and the portion size is large. The garlic knots are to die for. The espresso drinks are made on a fine imported italian machine. Pairs perfectly with a cannoli or chocolate cake. There was great live music and the performer even sang happy brithday to our mother. The atmosphere is very inviting and everything on the menu is delicious! What more can yoh ask for?  This place is always packed for dinner when I've been. I hope they open a bigger location at some point to accomodate more patrons because the food is so darn good!

3.5 Stars but I always round up in the businesses favor. I called in my order and Ricki answered. She stated she would need to put me on hold cause she was way too busy to help me. Umm ok. I'd rather the business pick up and say "thank you for calling xxxx Can we place you on a short hold??" Not say we are too busy to help you. Anyways, I'll give them the benefit of the doubt.   After I place my order for the Margherita con Burrata pizza, I was told 10 minutes. I arrive after about 12 minutes and am greeted by Ricki, who happens to be the waitress. She's serving multiple tables and answering phone calls?? Come on, are you serious? Now I understand why she told me she's too busy to help me. So I sit at the bar and wait about 10 more minutes for my pizza. I ask for red pepper and she tells me "if you want some I would have to go next door and get it" (next door is also their business). I just felt like she didn't care.   Thankfully the pizza was delicious and I care more about the food then the service. I'll be back, just hope for a better interaction.

Great food and great experience, our second visit before visiting the Beatles Love show! Sammy our waiter made the experience great, with his wine and food knowledge his recommendations were spot on! Just a note don't be put off by the fact that the restaurants in the Venetian food court this is a 5 star quality food & service! Thanks again SAMMY !  Grazie... Grazie...Grazie

This restaurant openly discriminates against people with children. If that appeals to you, great, but wait - there's more!  It has terrible service too.  We walked up with our three kids when we saw there were at least six tables open.  We were told "there was a reservation" and that we could put our name on the list.  We did and went for a walk, for about 45 minutes.  We walked by again and guess what?  The same tables were open.  I asked again and guess what we were immediately seated, though the hostess seemed unwilling to do so.  What about that list? It was never mentioned.  They put us in the back corner.  I saw the same open table in the front patio that had been and still was open when we first asked to be seated.  And when I asked, you guessed it, a "reservation."    The hostess had an extremely unwelcoming attitude. She said that they didn't have a kids' menu and we would have to order off of the adults menu.  Once we sat we were ignored for about 10 minutes.  It was clear that we weren't welcome, so we got up and left.   When I walked by an hour later after eating somewhere else, that table was still open.     Let's get one more thing straight - this is no gourmet restaurant - it's in the middle of a mall adjacent to a food court!  There are kids and families everywhere.  Yet another business that has no need for paying customers! Don't bother going there!

Great place, small, but good service and very delicious. Filet Mignon meatballs, and Veal Parm both fantastic!  Highly recommended, one of the best Italian places in Vegas.  Best of all, prices were incredibly reasonable.  Great value, great eats!
It could have been a really good experience but the service ruined it all. I would recommend everyone to double check what they are ordering.
I squeezed in at the end and the sauce had excellent flavor, and they served it well... I did think it was a little pricey but location is the cause...

Had dinner here Sunday night before a show at TI.  We decided to go here based on the reviews, but also because it was close and convenient for us.  As luck would have it a table for two opened up and we were able to be seated right away!  All-in-all, not a bad dinner, but it didn't blow either of us away.  I think it was because of our selections...  Started the meal with the FANTASTIC garlic knots... boy were they tasty.  We then shared the meatballs and chicken marsala.  The meatballs were very moist and flavorful and the sauce was top notch.  The chicken marsala is were we had the biggest issues.  It simply lacked flavor.  There wasn't enough marsala and the chicken itself wasn't seasoned.  The accompanied pasta was bland as well.  After that miss, we skipped on dessert.  With all the great restaurants in Vegas, I'm not sure I will be back to this one.  It's a shame we didn't have a better experience, since there are great reviews.  That's why I think we just made a wrong choice with the chicken...

Yummy!!! First of all let me say I'm super picky when it comes to Italian food -- I love it but I'm so picky. So I wasn't sure how'd this place would be.   The bread they serve is so yummy~ and I think it's all you can eat so that won me over. I shared the spaghetti with my mom and dad and we all had enough. It was pretty good... I keep craving it actually and I want to go back to Vegas just to eat it!! My other family members got the pizza, a salad, and ____ they all loved it.   My aunt and uncle said it's the best they've had since they used to live in Italy. So it's gotta be good!!   I was happy to hear the staff speaking Italian to each other, it really gave it a more unique feel.

Excellent food but very poor service. For the prices I expected a higher level of service. I felt like I was at a cafe style, rather than a resturant. They are very slow and others seemed to feel the same.

Went here for lunch and sat in the outdoor area. The food and wine were great, and the complimentary garlic knots were HUGE. Pricing is the only thing that kept me from rating this place higher. Some of the basic pasta dishes are a bit pricey, but it IS Downtown Summerlin, so it was kind of expected.

This place is so exceptional...have to get the garlic bread with olive oil, they are so good! I ordered linguine clam with white wine sauce, it was like a clam party on a plate. We all agreed that this is the best meal on our whole Vegas trip. MUST TRY!! You will not regret!

Everything was great from the food to the service. The meal started with delicious bread, yes, the bread was amazing, and it only got better from there. I don't go to Las Vegas often but when I do I will come back here.

Kind of  disappointed... wahhh  My expectations for the garlic knots were way too high.  I thought they were going to be warm freshly baked soft bread... they took a while to come, and I saw the server pull them out of some metal container thing which I thought was a little oven or something... The knots were barely warm, I don't even want to use the word "warm", but yeah... sad.  I believe they were tossed in some oil, herbs and garlic.  hmm oily cold bread.. meh.  I ordered the chicken marsala which I did not find anything special about.  It was rather bland and the sauce was not sticking to the pasta.  I also tried a bite of the bolognese and was not wowed by it either.  The pasta didn't really seem to absorb any flavor.  I was pretty sad because I wanted to try this place and dragged my friends there.  Most of them seemed "meh" about the food.  On the other hand, I tried my friend's lobster ravioli, and I really enjoyed it.  There were chunks of lobster inside, and the creamy sauce coated the ravioli well.  I would recommend this dish.  This restaurant is located near the shops.  You can also get there walking through the food court that's next to the parking structure (it is behind the Coffee Bean at the shops, not by the escalators).  It's pretty small but could fit a big party, as we had 10 people and there were still a few other open tables.  Service was good.  I called a little ahead to reserve a table for a late lunch, and we did not have to wait at all.

5 stars for the filet mignon meatballs.  DIVINE.  Best meatballs I've ever had!  So flavorful and yet simple with a simple marinara sauce accompaniment...  5 stars also for the garlic knots!! OMG... so buttery bad for you but so good.  The pasta here is fresh but not memorable.  Wine list is extensive for such a tiny tiny eaterie that spills onto the mall floor.  They do have a few by-the-glass options.  MEATBALLS!  If possible, just come here for the meatballs.  It's so worth it......

This place was great! We did not wait long for a seat and the staff were fun and friendly. The food was yummy. We ordered the ravioli stuffed lobster, filet mignon meatballs, and stagioni pizza every dish was delic. Entree prices were between $15-25. We will definitely visit here again.

Hubby picked this place for dinner, and I'm so glad he did. This was the best dinner here. Yeah it's just Italian food, but the service was so great, I could write forever about it! I won't though, because I'll bore most of you. But our server knew what we wanted and finished our sentences. He was attentive and just very experienced and perfect. Our meal was great and the bread that comes with was excellent. The wine made us giddy for the next two hours. I would come back here again and again!

A-ok pretty much sums up this Italian restaurant hidden in the back recesses of the Venetian. It's moderately priced and the food is just ok. The pizzas are more authentic which is nice, but don't get the gluten free crust, it's nasty. (and really aren't they all??)   The calamari was good and the wine selection was acceptable. I would have wanted more selections, especially more ITALIAN selections from an Italian place, but like I said acceptable.   The desert was quite good and I would have ordered more had I known it was going to be my favorite part of the meal. The after dinner drink selection leaves something to be desired, however.   On top of all of this our service was terrible. Eric was not friendly, greeted us with a strange sense of annoyance and skepticism and was not prompt about his service. The entire time I felt like I was in his way and not welcome. It was very uncomfortable.   Anyway, I know there are other servers, but there are also other Italian restaurants, I probably wont' be back.

I've eaten here twice. Both times I've gotten great service and the food is delicious. They bring out complimentary garlic bread and it's so good! We ordered calamari (crispy, fresh, delicious), gnocchi with bolognese sauce (my favorite and perfectly cooked) and hubby had linguine with clam sauce (he said it was great). Great decor, ambiance and location! (next to movie theater and close to parking) Food is a bit pricey for what it is but I don't mind it being a special night out.

Lyndsay our waitress was amazing from the very beginning. Very warm, friendly & welcoming!! Tables allow children to color, which is great!!! The food us exceptional. Fresh, authentic and simple. This is the only Italian restaurant with canolis. Must have!!!!!

This truly is a delicious pizza. We stayed at a hotel nearby and saw an advertisement dropped off under our room door. (Great Idea) We decided we were staying in and having drinks, playing cards and enjoying each others company. We decided pizza would be a great idea and boy was it. Not only were they quick, but the delivery person was nice and polite. The Pizza was great, wings were crispy and delicious. We have absolutely nothing bad to say about this place, as far as pizza goes. Lol. Definitely a place to order pizza.

Came here for a late dinner with the family after shopping. Very nice ambiance, live entertainment. The service is superb! Ordered a pizza which was suppose to come with ricotta, i appreciated that they handled the situation very professionally. Regardless of the missing ricotta on the pizza they quickly made us a new one to go & we still left as satisfied customers. The only con I had was the price, it was pretty pricey for what it was.

Food is a 10!! Our server, Domenico, was okay, but a little strange. Again, our pizza, arugula salad, and eggplant rollatinis were AMAZING, but watching Domenico touch our leftovers with his fingers while putting them into a to-go box was tough. Two stars off for that grossness. We intended to leave a $15 tip on a $53 bill, but took back $5 once we saw our food get manhandled.  I think we will be ordering from Uber Eats from now on instead of dining in.

I have eaten at this locally owned Italian restaurant four times since October.  My husband's family is Italian and the food here is like eating at Nannie's Sunday dinner.  The Veal Piccata is amazing.

I came here for dinner with my family and we thoroughly enjoyed our experience. You'll read elsewhere, and it's true: they're generous with their calamari which is fresh and delicious. The filet mignon meatballs were naturally tender given the cut. I had the aglio e olio with chicken for my entree which I found good but not fantastic, but I had the luxury of polishing off my mother's and sister's clam linguine and carbonara respectively. I especially enjoyed the latter. For dessert, consider the carrot cake which we unanimously decided is one of the best, most sinfully moist ones we've had. It's also massive. Our waiter, Paolo was fantastic and added much to our experience. All in all, it was a great dining experience.

We were starving after catching The Blue Man Group and decided to stay in the Venetian for dinner.  The restaurants in St. Mark's Square were buzzing and had at least 20-30 minute waits, so we decided to give Trattoria Reggiano a try.  It is off the main canal areas and is definitely lacking atmosphere compared to many of the other Venetian eateries.  I had hoped the tucked away location would mean excellent food to make up for the lack of glam, but unfortunately the restaurant didn't deliver.  My husband's wood fired pizza was good and had great flavor & tasty crisp crust, but my meatball panini was more like a hoagie and was just ok.  The meatballs lacked flavor and the hoagie style bun ended up soggy.  I definitely regretted not going for the pizza!  I felt it was pricey for the quality.  There are so many wonderful restaurants in Vegas that I would choose another.  Trattoria Reggiano left me wanting more.

The food was mostly great and the service was acceptable. They were very very hard to find and right off of the food court. The place is small and somewhat crowded but not too bad. We had to ask for bread which I believe should be brought without having to ask. It was delicious however. My wife ordered the lasagna, which they were out of (I'm still not sure how an Italian restaurant is out of lasagna). She ended up with the spaghetti meatball plate which was very tasty. I ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo truffle, which they were also out of. The substitute was passable but nothing great. Overall I would try it again and hope for a little better, more friendly service as well as a more complete menu.
The food was amazing. The service was great. Drinks never got empty. John our server was very helpful and friendly! Would come again!

I was with the GF looking for a light lunch on our last day at the Venetian.  After scrolling some reviews, this place sounded good and convenient so we took a seat "outside."  It took us a while to find it since it's tucked away, but if you find the coffee bean, it's right there.  Wait staff was good and I'd give this place 4 stars if you want a quick pre-show bite or you're not worried about the ambiance.  That said, you're butted up against your neighbors and I was having to stare at a $150 gorilla suit and a crazy magician trying to sell a disappearing light that got old after 30 minutes (they have a magic shop next door). NOT A GOOD DATE PLACE, it's a cafe.  The tables are small and a bit cluttered (I don't need an industrial size of balsamic and olive oil, but I do need a plate to put it in).  The garlic bread knots were good, but as stated below, room temperature which took a bit away from them.  I do not agree with the other reviews as I thought the balsamic vinegar is a bit sweet for my taste.  The GF got hot tea and it was a packet of the cheapest tea in existence (I don't know that they get many people asking for tea, so wont dwell on that one.  We started with the warm baby spinach with goat cheese on flat bread, it was ok, I'm not a big fan of flat bread that's soggy in dressing, but the first couple were decent.  We split the spaghetti with meatballs which equated to a meat ball each with spaghetti.  It wasn't bad, but nothing to write home about either.  In short, it's a decent quick & easy bite for relatively cheap in the Venitian.  For better Italian, check out Enoteca San Marco or Postrio's pasta dishes in St Mark's square.
Calamari perfect and fresh. Mozzarella and heirloom tomatoes should be paired with a nice glass of wine. Their garlic bread was Amazing.

Very small establishment - probably has twenty tables most of which are located in front of the restaurant (in the mall area next door to a magic shop with a stuffed pink gorilla). The bread was tasty, but served cool/room temperature. Serving the bread hot would have kicked it up a notch. We weren't given a plate for olive oil, so we took one from the adjacent table. The food was decent. Ordered the lobster ravioli and thought the sauce was tasty. Granted we arrived 45 minutes prior to closing, I will pardon the waitress & waiter (we had two individuals checking on us - we were a party of 4 - attentive, pleasant service) for not offering us dessert.

We had Such a amazing experience! Sergio made the experience a million times better . The food was so amazingly great. True Italian dinning . I definitely recommend this restaurant. Thank for the amazing experience Sergio!!

I was unimpressed. The service was disinterested. The food was average. My husband ordered gluten free pasta, but we're fairly sure he was not given gluten free pasta because he was ill afterwards and we were not charged the additional *$5.00* when the bill arrived. If you are gluten free whether by choice or by necessity, be sure to check.
Final dinner during this trip and the best. The food was even better than most restaurants we tried on Italy. Tiramisu was the highlight and must try.

Shock and awe at how great this place was. I always have low expectations with Italian restaurants, but I knew this place would be a winner after they brought out the bread basket. Top notch! I ordered the linguini cabonar I believe, it was delicious! I also tried the spaghetti and meatballs which was also tasty. Overall it was some of the best Italian food I have had and completely a hidden gem.

We read good reviews and went in for lunch in here. It was our Christmas lunch so we were extra generous and patient about everything. The ambience was nice inside the resturant and they had some space outside as well giving the feel of an European street side cafes or resturant. We had ordered spaghetti from the pasta menu and a margarita from the pizza menu. They had decent collection of wine but we went for a cocktail which was nice and refreshing. They had served some complimentary bread which I was very very surprised as it did not taste well at all. Spaghetti was good and the sun dried tomato sauce was very yummy. The pizza was very very average, I would go for a corporate company pizza over this any day. The dough and thus the crust did not taste good at all. All in all I would not recommend this place for pizza and bread crust related food items.

Venetian is full of Italian restaurants, but this one stood out for us to try because it was small and intimate.  It turned out to be a very enjoyable dining experience, a vegas-sized "street side" intimate dinner.  We had simple pasta dishes cooked right (al dente!) and having reasonable prices made it even better.  =)  The waiter even had an Italian accent.  cute! woot.  Conclusion:  Simple dishes for a decent price with a satisfied stomach p.s.  We should have been smart like other couples and SPLIT ONE pasta dish, instead of being lil' piggies and ordering one each.  hahahhahaha

My fellow yelpers have yet to steer me wrong   Trattoria Reggiano was an absolute delight as our last meal in Vegas. The flavors and consistency of their sauces is what going out for Italian is all about! I had the Baked Ziti entree with a side salad- caesar of course. My friend ordered the tortellini alfredo.  We arrived without a reservation around 930pm on a Friday night. We were seated immediately with no issues. There were a variety of menu options to choose with a primary focus on pasta and pizza dishes. Prices very between $10-22 depending on your level of hunger. But considering it's Vegas (inside the Venetian hotel at that) the prices were moderately fair.   Our server was very attentive and courteous throughout our visit and the service was excellent. I would say we were in and out within 45mins-- I'm serious.   Overall, I would definitely recommend this spot for an inexpensive, highly satisfying Italian dinner. The walk along the way also helps too. Soo many photo ops!

I have mixed feelings about this Trat.   Visiting Las Vegas last week, we wanted an intimate dinner before seeing The Phantom at the Venetian, and the Trattoria Reggiano is only a moment's walk from the theater. In light of the other reviews here, it seemed an inspired choice. It was less than that.   On arrival, on a not-terribly-busy Thursday evening after the theater - about 9 PM - it looked terribly inviting: Tables in the walkway as if a true Italian trat, and a few booths and tables inside near the open kitchen. Charming. We asked the Maitre' d for a booth (it helps my hearing, which is very poor), and were told we would not have it, and were shown to a table inside by the wall. OK, but a disappointment, even though it saved me $10 top to the Maitre' d, who seemed oblivious.    Delicious bread, with decent oil and vinegar, rapidly arrived, as did our waiter, who I asked for a recommendation between the spaghetti with meatballs ("filet mignon") and the linquine bolognese. "Eh!" He said. "It's the same sauce, just not in a meatball."  Ummmm. The staff says the food is the same?  Disquieting.   My pasta and my wife's Ziti arrived almost immediately, as we were still on our first piece of bread. Good service is not the same as fast service; this isn't Pasta Now, but a relaxing meal. Still, it was hot and freshly prepared. The Bolognese was tasty, and (as usual) I ate half, expecting to take it back to our room for lunch the next day. My wife, who eats like a bird, ate about a quarter of her Ziti, and as the second waiter came to remove our dishes, I said, "It was delicious, but we want to take it with us." He nodded and left.   A few moments later, our waiter returned with a check - strangely, for an Italian restaurant, without asking if we wanted dessert - and I asked, "Where is our food." I got blank looks; the second waiter said, "Thrown out."  Argument follows. Finally, the headwaiter said, "Wait. We'll recook for you." This time, it takes longer, but when the bag returns, there are two tins inside; I look in the top one, and find bread. "Where is my linguine?" I ask. Blank looks all over again. More argument. Finally, another recook, we take the food, and leave.   The service is obviously challenging, perhaps due in part to there being several languages and accents going on among the staff. The food was good, but not great; the meat sauce lacked seasoning (garlic is not all there is in this world). The Ziti was nice, but as it sat on the table, the cheese started changing from gentle yellow to bright orange. "Cheese powder, perhaps?" said my wife. But it was good, albeit a bit incandescent in appearance.  The ambiance was very good, with a slight hint of New York Italian as a result of the dark stained booths.   Overall, better than the food court next door, but not the place for the intimate and relaxing after-theater supper that many might wish.

Took a few minutes to find, but well worth it! From the second we arrived the hostess quickly made us feel very comfortable and had us seated immediately. Our waiter, John, was super awesome! He was very attentive and his personality made our dinner that much more special. As for the food, amazing...the garlic bread rolls, the lasagna and the chicken parmigiana (chicken was extra delish!) Highly recommend, both for service and food!

My husband is quite Italian and quite picky when it comes to food!! Trattoria is our "stop before the movies" in downtown Summerlin mall. Easy to get to, simply valet at the movies and a few steps your there! Indoor/Outdoor concept and super during this time of year.  Bar is extensive, food has always been amazing and seems like employees love it here because we see the same ole faces :)  Stop by and I would recommend the blackened Ceaser salmon salad for those counting calories + a glass of merlot.  Fun Fact: Did you know the dough for their pizzas are imported from New York!
Amazing Italian food. Not what you would expect in a food court. Filet mignon meatballs are phenomenal and the garlic knots are hard to stop eating.

Food was excellent! Service was phenomenal, a great deal for being within the venetian, authentic Italian cuisine, desert was great, all around a great place for dinner; very reasonable, lots to offer! Highly recommend!!!
The best gluten free pizza in town. You can sit outside on the patio, sometimes they have live music  the servers especially Britt knows her craft!!! Bravo

Had a friend in town and we wanted to go someplace different.  So since she was staying at Red Rock so we chose italian.  Truly great food, good wine selection and a very cool spot with indoor and outdoor seating.  Great service too.  Definitely will go back.

In the mood for Italian food before seeing a show. We decided to try Trattoria Reggiano in Downtown Summerlin. The ambience he's quite nice. You can choose between eating Outdoors on the patio or inside. Both good options. The service was excellent. The complimentary garlic knots  that they serve  at the beginning of the meal  a truly outstanding . Unfortunately the rest of the food did not rise to that level. For my entree I chose the chicken marsala. It comes with a side of pasta. The chicken was chewy and the flavor blah. My wife went with the meatball baked ziti. Also very mediocre. My buddy order the lasagna. He had difficulty eating it and rated it as poor at best. I gave it three stars rather than less because of the garlic knots and the outstanding service period but I certainly would not return here when there were so many other options for good quality Italian food in the area.

Delicious! I really enjoyed this place and the service! The manager came over to our table during one visit to check in with us and was extremely attentive and friendly. I could go back every night just for the garlic knots. I've never had the pizza here but can tell you the pasta meals and appetizers (chicken parm and marsala and the fried calamari) are amazing! Not a large wine selection unless you buy by the bottle which is a bummer for me, but still worth the trip! WOULD LOVEEEE gift cards available for here... especially with the holidays coming up. Also would LOVE a to go menu. With gift cards and to go menus, this place would be that much more amazing. Gift cards please!! :)

We purchased discount tickets at tix 4 tonight that provided 50% off our main entree. We were not disappointed.  My Caprese salad was delicious with the most creamy mozzarella cheese I've ever had. The baby green salad was big enough to share. The garlic rolls were warm and wonderful. We ordered Chicken Parmigiana and Chicken Masala.  Both dishes arrived freshly made and hot. Our waiter, Paolo, was attentive and adorable.  The location of the restaurant was difficult to find. It's near the food court which seems a bit misplaced. I would definitely return to this restaurant again.
Have passed by this restaurant for years ....but never will again.  The service is prompt, the food is authentic and delicious, and without all the Vegas hype and $$$$$$.

I rarely find myself in the mood for Italian, and after visiting this restaurant, I've realized that I've done myself a disservice.  I wonder why the restaurant occupies such a small space when in fact the experience it offers is absolutely sublime. We didn't get very far past the garlic rolls to finish our ravioli and the spaghetti entree. They were awesome in their own right, but what really stole the show were the rolls.  In fact, the garlic rolls were so awesome, we asked the service person to bag what rolls we couldn't finish. To our delightful surprise in our hotel room, we realized they gave us a full serving of rolls!!!  The real server was our bus boy. He was attentive to all of our needs and was practically a super serving robot. Our waiter, not so much.
