Wow ! Had dinner there again last night . The bar was hoping and the drinks were flowing . Jennifer the bartender followed me around the bar and offered me a drink when there were no seats .  They've added live music and added several new dishes . My wife had the Dover sole and I had the veal Milanese .  Both were generous portions and excellent. Highly recommended !!!  Just an update to my previous review . We visited this establishment again this week and probably had the best eggplant appetizer . Perfectly cooked covered in delicious red gravy and cheese . Mmm Best of all was the service , ambiance and of course the prices .  It's the most authentic Italian restaurant in town .

By far the best the value on the strip for authentic Italian cuisine . The service is provided by an experienced staff members who make sure you are well taken care of .  The eggplant is out of this world and the pasta is perfectly cooked.  It's a not to be missed placed in Vegas .
Our group got food poisoning from eating here. The service was great, but we got so sick afterwards we can never come back.   Stay AWAY! there are many other options for eating in the Venetian

Experience was delightful!! Victor was amazing! Dora is the manager was attentive and so kind! The food was outstanding! The kale and peanut salad was a 10, and for a small salad it was generous for 2!  The linguine bolognese was outstanding. Great service and amazing staff  One of our highlights in Las Vegas!

The food and the service was incredibly bad. I sent the pasta back and I should have also protested over the horrible sword fish dish. I relied on the recommendation of the concierge at the Venetian for an Italian restaurant. Did I forget to mention that I was looking for good Italian food?
the best italian restaurant i have ever had. We ordered linguine (in Clam Sauce)and spaghetti Aglio are FANTASTIC!  a must try in Las Vegas, Its much better than any buffet here

Came for lunch. The rolls were a bit too garlicky for my taste.  I mixed up with a combo that wasn't on the menu. Big mistake.  The service was very gracious and attentive.  I think you should order what others did.

Sun @6:15pm, I was within a party of 5 and pressed for time to make our gondola ride (in 45 min). Victor was very mindful by making sure were were taken care of and on our way in a timely matter. This did not take away from the quality of the food which was great! Victor was very attentive and helpful. We were able to enjoy 3 large appetizers (eggplant, soup, and calamari) in addition to the entrees. Don't typically care for eggplant and it was delicious! Calamari was fresh and also delicious. Table garlic bread also delicious.  I will be returning for great food and service! Thank you!

Quaint and tucked away this ristorante serves decent portions with awesome taste. The head patrons are friendly and serve to please. I ordered steak and it was sliced up at serving but it was really moist and flavourful.   Others in my party were pleased with the pasta. The large antipasto however is not good. Prosciutto, cheese, olives  were good but mortadella  and salami do not constitute a good antipasto. Too many pickled peppers just to make the platter look full. All around it was all good.

What an amazing place. Spectacular Italian food. Chicken Parm and Cheese Ravoili is our go to dinner. Wendy the GM is a dream and treats you like family. Bethany tends bar and is the sweetest person we have met since moving to Las Vegas. Always friendly and goes out of her way to make every visit the best part of the day

Sick of the buffet food we searched out a restaurant that was closer to the room in the Palazzo. I used my phone to locate something with decent reviews and found this place. It was kind of tucked back in the hotel compared to some of the other places we walked past.   Once I got past the fact I felt like I was eating in a hallway of a shopping mall and paying $25 a plate for that luxury, I had fun. They were busy and we waited for the table we got. All of us ordered the spaghetti with filet Mignon meatballs. The two meatballs were a decent size. My dad said he wished they had put more sauce on the pasta, which I think I could have agreed.   The drinks comes in cans or bottle so don't expect a regular refill situation here. I ordered unsweetened iced tea and got the largest bottle on the table. The food came out quick. It all felt kind of rushed. The minute your fork was down they were taking your plate away. I enjoyed it, but I would not eat there again even though I gave them four stars. I think there are too many other places to pick from that don't give the frantic feel while you eat. The owner did come out and take our order and was very nice. They were all very nice to us.

I have dined at this restaurant a few times now. I have always been very satisfied. The food is absolutely scrumptious and cooked to perfection. My favorites are the meatballs, rollatini, and any of the seafood dishes. Whether dining with my wife or with friends Trattoria Reggiano is an excellent choice.

- I would come back JUST for the Complimentary garlic knots at the start of our meal. They were huge, fluffy, buttery, garlicky pieces of heaven that definitely filled me up because I ate 2...whoops! - Penne vodka was a solid choice and had a sweet vodka sauce topped with prosciutto - Chicken Alfredo was decent, not the best I have ever had as the sauce was a little thin but the flavor was delicious and rich - Caprese salad came with a generous portion of mozarella and it was wonderfully creamy in the middle, tomatoes were just ok. Make sure to add balsamic vinegar as it did not come with any and their vinegar was divine!!!  - Hefty prices but at least it came with generous portions of pasta - We added chicken to each of our pasta dishes which was an additional $6 and the chicken made the pasta a bit soggy and watered down. It would have been nice if the chicken was sliced into strips instead of coming out as a whole breast  Our lunch was $90 and we didn't even order any alcohol - pretty steep but it IS vegas... Service was just ok. Started out good as she rushed to take our order but then we had to flag her down for boxes and the check. It definitely hit the spot for our pasta craving but we weren't blown away by the pasta. We might come back on our next Vegas trip to try their meatballs since that seems to be their specialty.

Came in to town for the weekend and found this place on yelp. The best decision ever!!! I will fly out to vegas just to have dinner there again! Everything was delicious, from the garlic knots, the salad , to the main entree, even their water was amazing. Great service as well. We will be going back again and again!

I went to Trattoria Reggiano on the strength of its Yelp reviews. How could so many people be wrong?  First, the restaurant is located within the Venetian Hotel, which is like a maze inside. Even a map is unhelpful and we had to constantly ask people where to go to find the place.  When we walked in the waiter asked us are we ready for some "real Italian food." If his statement was right I never want to have it again. First we had Spaghetti and Meatballs, Pasta with Bolognese sauce and Chicken Francese. The Bolognese sauce and chicken had no seasoning. Literally the chicken tasted like absolutely nothing not even a hefty dose of salt and pepper could save those two dishes. The Spaghetti sauce tasted like it came out of a can. On top of that almost everything is in the $20 range. There are so many better Italian restaurants in Vegas than this place.  This was our last meal in the city before we went home. What a way to go out on a bad note.

My husband and I dined here on Saturday night. We were visiting from out of town and staying at a nearby resort. We wanted Italian, but wanted to get out of the hotel. This place was close and had some good reviews. We are so glad that we decided to eat here!!  Our server was fantastic. The receipt said "Dominico" but I forgot to look at his name tag. Anyway, he was an older gentleman with an accent. He made great recommendations and steered us exactly where we wanted to go. We ended up ordering the Italian Kale salad to start and let me tell you....it was amazing! Then we got the Lobster Ravioli for our main course and it was fantastic as well. We were both very impressed. There was also live music and it was perfect.  We only make it to Vegas about 2 times/year and I can't wait to come back to enjoy another meal here. Next time we will make sure to save room for a cannoli!

Atmosphere is amazing...marble countertops, full bar, fans pulling fresh breezes, and tv's with the latest sports. However, as a mid-level wine lover the wine list suffers. Especially the white wine...no Sauv Blancs, no non oaked chardonnays, no Albarinos, no white burgundys...if you're going to be a good Italian restaurant in LV....have a great wine list!!

Great tasting food that even my kids enjoyed!!!. We had a Caprese salad for our appetizer that was great. Some of the freshest basil and creamiest cheese ever. The garlic knots are hot and fresh and with the complimentary cheese, olive and marinated peppers, a great start. Our entrees were piping hot, great taste and filling. We had chicken parmesan, baked ziti and meatballs. All were fantastic. Desert was great !  Finally found a good cannoli and Tiramisu. The price point is a little high, but the location has to be factored in.My only complaint is that my wife substituted whole wheat pasta and charged $2.oo without letting us know. I would pay , but just let me know.

I am in Vegas a lot for business and stay at the Venetian often. I discovered this place in January and have eaten here every trip, including ones where I didn't stay in the hotel (5 or 6 times now). The linguini with clam sauce is the best I've had anywhere. But tonight when I ordered it, my waiter who I think is one of the owners, said no the clams were not good today so he wasn't serving it. That is service with integrity. I had the eggplant parm instead. Solid. Also, the filter mignon meatballs are to die for.  I love this place. Fantastic food, great service. I will be back again and again.

This place just just so...bland. My eggplant parmesan, though a very large dish, was unsatisfying. Very few spices used, and the ingredients just didn't seem fresh. Additionally, everyone in my party had huge stomachaches after going here-we have no idea what from. And it was pretty overpriced for what it was. I had picked this for my birthday meal and was very disappointed. The service was lacking, too- it seemed like we were a bother to the waiter every time we waved him over.  Oh well, maybe we'll choose better next time.

This place have good Yelp rating so we gave it a try. We were very disappointed with the food. The shish kabob was the worst I have ever had. The texture of half of the meat was more like apple than beef. They were a little crunchy. I should have sent it back to the kitchen.

I was staying at red rock this week and went to see downtown summerlin Thursday night. I stumbled upon this restaurant because I could hear the music outside. My friend and I went into eat and loved everything. The staff was so friendly and our waitress Rikki was amazing. We ordered everything she recommended starting with the eggplant rollatini . Our main meal was chicken Francsisse and we finished with ricki's favorite tiramisu. The restaurant outside was a little busy but Rikki was so attentive you would have thought we were the only table around. She definitely loves her job and it shows. I'm coming back to town next month and I will absolutely return to this restaurant.
The staff is very friendly. Food was delicious. Will definitely come here again the next time I am in Vegas.
Food was very good. Eats more like a little Italian restaurant in your home town rather than one of a thousand in Vegas. Highly recommend the Filet Mignon meatballs they were Fantastic!

Cute little restaurant, emphasis on little. Great rolls to start.... they have been dredged in olive oil but I still dipped them in olive oil and grated parmesan. I ordered the linguine filet mignon bolognese and I have to admit it was pretty good. I would give it 3.50 for the food alone. I have to knock off a half star because of the environment. Ambiance is nice and quaint but one of the waiters was pretty snippy with his fellow staff and b/c the place is soooo small it was hard to ignore. At one point it was uncomfortable but it seems that they were oblivious.   Would I come back? Yes
This is some pretty descent food for being in the middle of a hotel mall... great people watching when you sit in the cafe seating and I have to say that the garlic rolls are really good.

It's a small place and as such it's not always to get a table without a long wait but it's worth it.  Crazy good.  The filet mignon meatballs were outstanding... best meatballs I've ever had.  The veal parmigiana was to die for.  Literally amazing.  Some good red table wins and remarkably inexpensive for Las Vegas... like it's actually reasonable!    Do yourself a favor and put this on your list.  It's a great place!

Came here on a Friday night around 6:30pm for dinner. Surprisingly they had a lot of open tables, so we got seated right away!  After we ordered, our server brought us a basket of garlic cheesy bread with olive oil and black vinegar. The bread was warm and delicious!  For the appetizer, we got the filet mignon meatballs. There were 3 big meatballs in marinara sauce. I thought they tasted good but really tasted like normal meat balls to me but a little softer? I'm not really sure haha.  For the entree I got the lobster ravioli. They were very generous with the amount of lobster. The ravioli was delicious and the filling tasted like some kind of cheese with lobster! The sauce was an orange colored lobster sauce.  The ambiance was quite nice. This is in the Venetian so you kind of do get the feeling that you're in Venice. Also the server was very very kind and attentive!   We left super full! The servings here are very generous. It is a little pricey though, since the total for our meal + tip for 4 people was around $140.
This place is amazing from the garlic knots to the atmosphere.  Their bruschetta pizza is out of this world.

Jackpot!  If the slots aren't treating you well, at least you'll hit the jackpot here! After passing this place up many times before, I had to stop in on my most recent vegas trip.    It's easy to miss this place because it's located in the food court behind the Coffee Bean, but follow your nose and let your heart be your guide... either that or ask someone.  Filet Mignon Meatballs -  Holy meatballs!!! They're good.  The pomodoro sauce that the meatballs are served in is delicious but even without the sauce, the meat is tender, juicy and is filled with subtle flavors.   Penne in Vodka sauce - I had to get my alcohol in some how, even though it was only 11am.  The penne was cooked to al dente perfection, sauteed in a pink sauce with bits of prosciutto.  The prosciutto pieces are very small, so if you want some meat, make sure you opt in on adding the grilled chicken, shrimp, or meatball to your pasta order.  Gnocchi al Pesto - How do you say it? GnoKki? GEenotchi?  Doesn't matter, because once you start eating, you wont be saying anything except, "MmmMM."  Probably one of the best gnocchi I've ever had and the pesto sauce is not too watery, not to thick -- divine.  I wish I had enough stomach room to try one of their desserts, but their good sized portions filled me up.  This place isn't "cheap" but it's so worth it.  So, why didn't this place get a 5 star rating?   The bread.   I am the queen of carbs and I love my breads.  The service bread looked like it would be amazing --buttery, golden brown, with parmesan.  But it was actually fairly dense and it wasn't warm.  I'm not sure if this is how they always serve their bread but if the bread was hot and soft, this place would merit a five star rating.

If you're looking for casual Italian, this is a good place to go.  I really wish I could complain more about this place because the waiter messed up my order, but the wrong item he brought me was really good.  Here's what happened: My friends asked the waiter what he recommended for pasta and he suggested some kind of pasta BOLOGnese, and they ordered that.  When he took my order, I said "I'll also have the pasta BOLOGnese," I was craving pasta.  When our orders came, they got pasta dishes and I received something piled deep under green leaves.  Turns out he heard me order the Veal MILANese, and then he gave me attitude about it. Dude, you just recommended some bolognese stuff to half our table and I said I would also have that!  He did offer to replace the item, but I was too hungry to wait and didn't want my friends to wait for me to finish whenever I did get my replacement order, plus I already angered the guy that brings the food, so I wasn't going to risk it.  Conveniently for them, the Veal Milanese was one of the pricier entrees...  It should be a sign to you how good the food is that I gave them 4-stars despite my little kerfuffle.  Seriously, it was not easy trying to maintain a pissed-off front while eating that rather great Veal Milanese.  A lot has been mentioned about the quality of the bread, yes, it is also really good.  The pizzas aren't necessarily great, they're alright, we shared one as an appetizer, didn't really leave me craving more, I didn't even try to fight for the last slice.  Also, and this is very European of them, they serve the tiny-bottled sodas, meaning refills aren't free, and that is annoying.  To recap: great bread, good entrees, meh pizza, tiny sodas, and a waiter you should be REALLY clear with.

Turned away when more than half the restaurant was empty for "reservations" when I counted at least 10 empty tables. Was told the wait would be approx 2 hours! Went to CPK & walked by again about 45 minutes later, all tables still empty.... I understand how reservations take precedence as a former host, but a lot of people no show. I've never been turned away from a restaurant with this many empty tables before. Management seriously needs to reevaluate how you do business with walk ins.

I was pleasantly surprised by the food here. We've passed by in the past during our visits to LV but the place was always crowded. We got lucky this time and got a table for 4. I really liked my linguine with clams, not many places make it the way I like but their clams were very tiny, smaller than a quarter size, so not enough meat, $28. Hubby had a glass SV Cab, $11 and it was really good.  Our companions also liked their dinner: Eggplant parmesan, $20; Spaghetti carbonara, $22.  We shared a fried calamari appetizer and it was excellent. The rolls were good too and our friends could not finish their meal, so they asked for it to go and the waiter, Eric, was so nice that he brought her extra rolls.  Good service, good food.  Must come back next time in LV.

Such great food!  A small unassuming atmosphere with some of the most authentic Italian you'll find in Las Vegas.  Very reasonable prices.  Linquini with clams was super....sweet little neck clams.   Great meatballs, Caesar salad.  Went next day for lunch and sampled pizza, also excellent!

The garlic knots were actual heaven on earth. And they were very generous with providing us more when (or even when we didn't) ask.   Started with a Caesar salad to share and the freshly cracked pepper really made the salad delicious.   I then had penne with the filet mignon meatballs and they were absolutely delicious. Perfect taste. Very flavorful.   It was nice to have such a quick yet delicious Italian restaurant within our hotel.

I ordered Fettucino Alfredo to go. For the low, low price of just $25, I got a 2 scoops of noodles in a tin container - no parmesan, no cutlery, no napkins. Adding insult to injury, the pasta was undercooked. A travesty by all measures... if someone DOES want to have a relaxing meal in the restaurant, they would have to try to find a spot that doesn't have sports TV's as a feature. Nice music and décor but really? The TV's are in poor taste. But then, so was the meal.

Comfortable Italian restaurant. Staff was polite and friendly, service is quick and attentive, food came out timely and hot. I recommend the Shrimp Stuffed with Crab Meat with Scampi sauce. Delicious. Attire is business casual.

This was our second time here and it was much busier than the first time we came but there was not a wait. Food took a long time to come out but we also didn't tell our waiter we had a movie to catch and our food wasn't going to make it out in time. We asked them to hold it for us and if we could pick it up afterwards. They kept it under the heater for us and the manager came by and offered us a $100 gift card for the inconvenience. It was our fault for not telling them we were going to a movie but the manager took it upon himself to accept responsibility. How amazing! We will definitely be back based on the customer service alone!   PS- meatballs and calamari are a must try!

I loved this little restaurant in the main shops area at the Venetian. We went there for lunch and it wasn't crowded; not sure about dinner time though. It was small and cozy with enough tables to fit all 6 of us girls. The garlic rolls were free flowing (huge pieces of rolls) and the plates are big enough to share. We ordered four dishes: the lobster ravioli lunch special, spaghetti and meatballs, prosciutto di parma pizza (absolutely my fav) and the chicken balsamic salad. We even packed some up for the night.
Great Italian option at the Venetian - one of the less expensive places. Not glamorous but the food is really good!

The only reason I gave one star was for the calamari.  I didn't think it possible but this was hands down the worst attempt at white tablecloth Italian trattoria food ever.  The manager and wait staff were attentive and apologetic yet really baffled by our comments.  It's pricey as well however it's Vegas    I want to be more specific however every time my group of four chats about it we all get a wave of nausea.  Too bad.  Again the manager was awesome

Wow! Great Food and Great Service.   Ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. The spaghetti was perfect and the meatballs had excellent flavor. The sauce was perfect.   The garlic not were served cold and would have been much better if served hot.   The waiter recommend an excellent bottle of wine and I ordered another to go, perfect.   I would definitely come back here to try some other food.
This place is a hidden gem..... Come on, Filet Mignon meatballs... NEED I SAY MORE?!?  I loved the sevice and food, we actually visited this restuarant twice during our say in Vegas..

Was walking around Downtown Summerlin shopping and decided to try this amazing Italian place. We were greeting right away and sat outside on the patio. They had several heaters which was great.  Our server was also the bartender. She was super sweet and attentive.  They start you out with some awesome bread accompanied by olives, peppers and cheese! We ordered the meatballs, eggplant rigatoni and the sausage pizza.  Everything was absolutely delicious! For dessert we had the tiramisu which had to be one of the best in town!!! They also had live music which made it so much better. I love this place and can't wait to come back!

Cute patio with air!! I wish DT Summerlin wasn't such a concrete jungle- too hot even before summer has heated up. Good was quite tasty and service was good. Not sure about the free garlic knots with oil and balsamic for dipping? They were already pretty oily. Portions look small for lunch but don't be deceived, it was more than enough food but a little pricey for lunch. I had pasta with garlic, olive oil and cracked red pepper. The chef forgot to add the pepper and the waitress failed to notice so I had to ask for them to bring a shaker to the table. Simple flavors are an indicator of a chefs skill and the pasta was perfect and the sauce flavorful (can't believe they forgot an ingredient though). I'll definitely give them another chance- when summer is over ;)
Awesome authentic Italian food. The bread was on point, food was unique, and restaurant has a great ambiance. This was a fun spot to try out in Vegas.

Came here while on vacation a little over a year ago and thought I died and went to food heaven lol. The garlic knots were to die for!!!had the tortellini Alfredo which was divine. Best Alfredo sauce I ever had and a chocolate cake for dessert for which I have no words. Absolutely delicious and a VERY large portion. The second time I came to Vegas I couldn't wait to go back but they were closed for renovation. :-(  however, I will be back by the end of the month and can't wait to give my taste buds what they have been craving. I really hope the food is still great.

The host was rude and violated ADA laws! My dog is trained for seizure responses, and I had paperwork from my doctor explaining everything. My dog was quietly sitting next to me while I handed the papers to the host, and he asked for an ID card. I explained to him ID cards are not real, people buy those online and are complete frauds. I even informed him that in the ADA website it clearly states IDs are not real. I had paperwork, a vest and leash that have giant letters imprinted "SERVICE DOG" but that was not enough. I told him that I could buy an ID card right now in front of him to show him that's not real. He said "that's our policy. If you don't have an ID you can't eat anywhere." Yeah there's no way possible your policy is to break the law.   Oh and then he has the nerve to say "oh I have a bichon frise at home. Is your dog a bichon? Looks just like mine." No jerk. My dog is a trained for responding to my medical emergency. Just because my dog is small like yours doesn't mean it's the same.   So glad there was another restaurant 1 minute away that knew the laws. Thank you to the unfriendly and untrained host for showing us a better restaurant.   Management, train your staff https://www.ada.gov/archive/qasrvc.htm

I could not sing this place's praises enough. I've now been here about five times over the last four years (each time I go to Vegas with a different person heading here is an absolute must). I have never been disappointed. The place is tucked away in the Grand Canal Shoppes, it might take you some time to find it but trust me, it's well worth it.  Came here early on a Saturday night (5:30) knowing that the place would get crowded as the night went on and we could not have been happier. We (a table of 6) were seated right away and garlic knots were at our fingertips before we could blink. Our waiter was lovely and our dishes came quickly and everyone was overwhelmed by how delicious it was.   We tend to stick to cheaper places but everyone agreed the price was well worth how delicious the food was. Plus, on the strip $20 more or less a person for a great sit-down restaurant is one of the best deals you'll find. A really phenomenal place, if you're going to Vegas make sure to stop here for dinner.

We really wanted Italian food, didn't want to spend an arm and a leg and wanted it to be close to the Mirage where we were staying. Read the Yelp reviews and they were all over the place, some five star, some one, so decided since food is pretty subjective we'd give it a try.  It's in the middle of the restaurant row and it's not quiet by any means.  Service was prompt and our server was pleasant but had absolutely no sense of humor and apparently didn't get that smiling is a nice gesture.   We were immediately offered bread which instead of large hunks or bread sticks turned out to be rolls which were very good.  The server brought oil and balsamic to dip them in.  We each had a salad, big mistake.  They are huge and easily could be split.  Nothing to write home about, just a salad.  My husband who thinks the only Italian food is lasagna had that and said it was not bad.  Actually for him that's pretty high praise.  I had shrimp scampi which was strange to say the least.  Apparently I didn't read the description very well.  It was 7 shrimp sauteed in wine, garlic and butter which was fine, but then they topped that with some sort of odd stuffing.  I've never had shrimp scampi like that and I scraped the stuffing off after eating a bite.  The pasta is obviously home made and tasted very nice, cooked al dente but way too much pasta.  They have a nice wine list and I had a delicious pino grigio.  Would we go back again, probably not.  It was ok, just not great.

The concept seemed lovely with an indoor/outdoor feel, but the food will not make a repeat visitor out of me. The garlic knots and an antipasto plate were very nice, however the salads we ordered were entrée sized rather than starters-would have preferred half the size at half the price. The Kale salad with peanut dressing was difficult to eat as it was very spicy and very heavily dressed. The Margareta pizza my husband ordered which comes with no cheese (lactose intolerant) was COVERED in capers which were not mentioned anywhere. That is a very specific ingredient that serves mention on the menu. He is not a fan so rolled most off and ate half. I ordered salmon and vegetables-the preparation was fine although a lot of oil appeared on the plate mixed with the lemon sauce-not a fan of that much oil. The vegetables were heirloom squash and zucchini-really cute vegetables! Overall just very hefty priced and neither of us was impressed with our items. Perhaps the pasta is the way to go as there is a very authentic vibe-but we'll pass on by next time in Downtown Summerlin.

This was a petty good resteraunt located in the Venetian. It's a little hard to find it but just ask a worker. The bread is delicious. Really liked our waiter Sergio. I got the Alfredo and my husband got the chicken parm. Husband wasn't crazy about chicken but loved the spaghetti.

Decided to come here after driving all the way from Florida. Four of us sat down and placed our order, and then our waitress Hilga disappeared after that. Thirty minutes have now passed and our beers and drinks are empty but no food is present. Finally flag our server down and she looks at us and tells us yeah yeah it's coming it's on the way and she didn't even refill our drinks! Later, she comes back with a notepad and asks each of us what we ordered and began to write it down! 45 minutes in and she hadn't even given our order to the kitchen. Our server was replaced and they gave us a free antipasti platter that we didn't even want - we just wanted our food at this point. No one touched the platter at all. Our food finally came and we were approached by the manager offering us one cannoli or one slice of cheesecake for the four of us to split. One dessert for four people after sitting there for an hour waiting for our food! When the bill came, there were no apologies and no comping on any of our meals, and the food here isn't cheap at all. Hilga has been our server two times in the past and after the third time, we won't be coming back until she is gone.

This place was an utter disappointment.  We had difficulties finding it, and the staff would not answer our repeated phone calls. The food was extremely greasy and resembled something you'd find on a foodcourt menu. There was a limited selection... If you're looking for a good Italian dinner then I suggest you move on to the next review. Thank god the wine was on par.
Delish! Excellent service.  Calamari, eggplant parm, veal bolognese, veal parm, and cannelini bean soup: delicious. WARNING: serving portions are huge.  Share if you can.

Hosted a business lunch there last week, we planned ahead and made a reservation due to having 6 in our group. We were seated as soon as we arrived, and drinks were delivered rapidly. That was about the best part of the rest of the meal. Five of us ordered various salads and one ordered a pasta dish. We waited more that 40 minutes for our food. Once arrived is was good but certainly not worth the wait and not a place to consider for a work related lunch if you are short on time.

Second time here. First time four stars, this time two. It would have been less but Beth came in to save the day! The first time 4 stars due to the horrible tiramisu. This time I would have given 1 star but like I said Beth, the bartender, came in and made the experience so much better with her great personality and social skills. Ricki our "server" was not attentive, OVER charged us, did not bring our antipasto (I had to ask the manager for it). We were there early, at 4pm, when happy hour starts. I recommend waiting until the bartender comes in at 5pm. The restaurant was not busy, there were us and 2 other tables, 6 people total. If you can go Wednesday through Sunday Beth works then, she is amazing. So helpful, always recommending, attentive, pleasant, sociable, etc... Just a fabulous gal all around. This is what I want when sitting at the bar. The kale salad was fabulous, as was the pizza. Last time we were here the Bolognese and calamari was fabulous. The food is outstanding, but Ricki is horrible. If you hate your job, stay home!
Very good food. Chicken Parm is huge. Bread is great but don't fill up because portions are very big. Francesco is a great waiter.

We had an exceptionally great meal here. I had not been to Italy at that point but would later realize that like many of Rome's sidewalk cafes, the food is fresh, aromatic and so delicious.  Above is a ceiling painted to appear like the sky. You will find it after walking past all the shops and if your lucky you will pass living statues and people dressed in baroque/Renaissance costumes. It is very entertaining to sit 'outside' eventhough it only looks like you're outside. The prices are great for it being Vegas.

I don't write many reviews. But the fact this restaurant received 4+ stars is beyond me. First. Olive oil and balsamic vinegar is nearly not palatable.   Costco 's organic Olive oil and balsamic is 100x better. The filet mignon meatballs was good. However the sauce was basic and not much flavor. The lobster ravioli tasted like it came from trader Joe's.   When I inquired about where the pasta came from. .. she looked beWildered and said it's from Italy.  Fresh frozen? ??
Yummy food. Sam was an awesome waiter. The garlic knots were wonderful. The outside sitting area will be a great place to sit in nice weather. Recommend highly.

I am so very happy we went in to this AMAZING place today with my son for lunch! Very pleasant atmosphere, quite, clean, excellent service and attitude. We got all attention, everything was served just right on time, simply delicious! Pizza is just not comparable with retailer's or other restaurants, hand made, thin crust, smells and looks so yammy. Thank you, the owner and our server. We will be back to this little Italy!

Had a late dinner here on Sunday. We were looking for a reasonably priced dinner option and this place looked promising. Had a bit of a wait (20 mins) before being seated. I was impressed with the wait system, they text you when your table is ready which allows you to wander the grande canal shoppes while you wait.  We were seated and our orders taken quickly. Nice warm bread served with EVOO and balsamic to start. Shared a caprese salad to start. Definitely a shareable portion. Buffalo Mozzarella was creamy. Tomatoes were a bit mealy.  I had the spaghetti puttanesca. Yum. Lots of good things like capers and olives. It had anchovies but they weren't overpowering. My mom ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. The meatballs are their specialty and it showed. They were juicy and flavorful. Portion sizes are generous. Both of us had trouble finishing our mains.  Not super cheap -- dinner for 2 without wine and only one app was $80. But overall a solid dining experience. If I was craving home style Italian I'd go again.

Went for dinner and looking for a place that took room charges/comps. Wife and I ordered the Caesar salad, calamari, linguini in white clam sauce, and baked ziti with a side of meatballs. The calamari was great, but the portions were enough for probably 4 people as an appetizer. My linguini with white clam sauce was good and my wife thoroughly enjoyed all her food. Overall great experience in this small restaurant. It was a loud atmosphere so I wouldn't suggest it as a romantic date but a great place to catch dinner. Bill came out to $85 bucks with tip so not cheap but not too pricey considering what we ordered.
It was awesome!!! The food was very good!! And I loved my server Rodolfo and Hilda and Tony and Bethany but most of ALL GM WAS THE BEST VITO!!!!!  I would reccomended to anyone !

I was attracted to this place because it really reminded me of the small restaurants in Venice, Italy. This is a small place, a few tables inside and a few tables outside; we chose inside because i thought outside could be a little noisy. We LOVED this meal. Granted, we had basic items -  however everything was delicious and the waitress was superb. My husband and I split a Caesar salad and split the eggplant parmigiana entree. Dad had spaghetti and meatballs. Loved(!)  the bread and the bottle of Bon Anno Cabernet. of course, i had to try the tiramisu which did not disappoint. We can't wait to return to Las Vegas and have another meal here. The total including the wine ($48/bottle) and tip was $128.00. I highly recommend this place for those seeking an excellent Italian meal.
Charming little restaurant in the Venetian.  Loved the atmosphere.  Italian accents, delicious pasta, old-school Italian music, wonderful service, and decent prices.  We will be back!

The pizza came out late and cold but it was still good just wish it would have been warm. The spinach side dish was great. We also ordered the swordfish silicon which was a little dry but good sauce and nice veggies. Service was slow but we met a nice couple next to us from Australia so it helped pass the time.  Overpriced for the food court location.

Amazing little place inside the Venetian. If you are coming make sure to come with 4 or less individuals as seating is extremely limited. Service is excellent but the food, mama Mia!!!! Wow! Phenomenal Italian food, perhaps the best Italian food in Vegas, the state of Nevada, and just maybe the US. Go for a quick lunch, you won't regret it.

If you want to go to a sidewalk cafe in Italy but don't want to fly.  This is the place.  I love their spaghetti and meatballs.  The pasta was cooked perfectly.  But last time my meatball was a little dry.  (too much bread crumbs or leaner meats maybe)  But the fresh baked rolls were great.  Olive oil served with the bread was very good.    Service was great.  The price was reasonable.  I am glad they expanded.

Good tasting food that I'll probably never taste again as I don't want to subject my family to that poor of service. I don't necessarily think that the place has bad service overall, for I witnessed our server take great care of the tables around us - offered fresh pepper, cheese, refills, dessert, etc. None were offered to us, we had to chase her down for refills and remind her the kids meal came with dessert. But what really puzzled me was the portion size of my entree. My linguine with clams entree was smaller than my 2 year old's spaghetti from the kids menu. Both served in the same bowl that's only slightly bigger than the small bread plate. We were excited to try their dessert but we never got that far. I normally base my reviews mostly on the taste of food and just explain my experience with service and ambiance, but the service was just THAT bad.

Good tasting food, but less than satisfactory service. I wouldn't say that the service is bad all around, I witnessed our server take great care of the tables around ours. Offered fresh pepper, cheese, refills, etc...just not to us. But what really puzzled me was the portion size of my mother's entree. Her $20 linguine with clams was smaller than my 2yo daughter's spaghetti from the kids menu, which was served in the exact same size bowl that is only slightly larger than a small bread plate (see pics). We had to wait 15min, after asking, to receive the check, another 10min for her to take payment, and had to remind our server that the kids meal came with dessert, which we ended up having to take home. The rest of us wanted dessert but we couldn't handle being there any longer (nearly 2hrs). There were only 5 seated tables in the entire restaurant at the time, so it was frustrating that we had to chase our server down so much. Needless to say, we're very disappointed. 4 stars for food (5 stars for garlic knots). 1 star for service.
I give this place a 5star! The food was perfect and out waiter was amazing. It is one of my new favorite restaurants when in Vegas. It is in the Grand Canal area.

We called in a pizza order and everything went well so far. Food was good. But after approaching the restaurant was when the bad service happened. Three workers were outside conversing with one another and did not acknowledge us. We spoke to who we assume as the host who told us to proceed to the bar for to go orders. The bartender was nowhere in sight. When she got back to the bar she did not notice me standing in front of the pizza box that was mine. She started grabbing glasses and assumed I wanted a drink but I told her I had a to go order. She roughly throws the bill on top of the pizza box to give to me and then immediately walks away to take an order of a table far away from the bar top. She spends longer than normal taking their order as I glared her down. I've had my credit card on hand since before she got to the bar so there was no wait in me giving her my card. She scans it and sets it down and proceeds to help other customers again! Needless to say, this to go order took as long as a dine in order. We could have finished our pizza in the time it took to wait for her to ring us up so we could leave. Terrible service at the bar. That woman deserves to be fired. Shorter brunette curly haired older woman. Rude and unapologetic. She is the sole reason we will never return even tho the food was decent and the phone call went normally.

I wouldn't consider this spot a hidden gem but it's pretty damn hard to find if you're looking for it. We stumbled upon this place just walking around the Grand Canal Shoppes and decided to give it a try based on seating availability. Who knew it had such good reviews on Yelp! It's located right before the food court and has a nice patio seating area.   The food came out pretty quickly. Before your entree comes, they give you complimentary garlic knots and they are to DIE for. It comes out super hot, soft and delicious!! Dip it in some balsamic vinegar and oil and I could eat it for days. It's definitely comparable to the garlic knots at C&O's in Los Angeles if you've ever been there. I was thinking of ordering the lasagna but our waiter said they were out of lasagna for the day. HOW DO YOU RUN OUT OF LASAGNA AT AN ITALIAN RESTAURANT? Sure, it's one of your more popular items, so shouldn't you have a lot of ingredients for your popular dishes? To say the least, I was severely disappointed. I settled for the penne a la Vodka which is topped with diced prosciutto. The creamy pink sauce has a nice, delicate taste to it. I wish there was just more sauce though. The penne was cooked al dente and had a firm texture to it. I'd definitely recommend and you can't go wrong with a penne dish!   My heart was set on ordering the lasagna... maybe I'll get it next time if they don't run out... so disappointing.

Trattoria Reggiano is the kind of place you can easily walk past and not even realize it. We were supposed to go to a fancy restaurant but doing all that walking inside the Venetian with my heels was a killer and when I went to take a break I saw bunch of tables and seats out in the middle of the walk way... figured it was close enough, so we tried it. Best decision ever! It's a little weird because it's self seating but it's still an adorable venue. It's also a delightful place for people watching. The staff was super friendly and fast. I ordered the baked ziti... and let me tell you it was the best baked ziti I have ever tried! The pasta was cooked just right and the cheese wasn't too overpowering and the sauce mmmmm have no idea what made it so different but I'm not going to question a good meal. And the best part of the dinner was the bill! It's completely affordable place with amazing food, please try it! Def coming back here when I go back to Vegas!
I went during the lunchtime hour with a co-worker. The food and service were great. The staff members were friendly and attentive. A good spot for a date night with the wife.

We chose this place in the Venetian mostly because the other restaurants were SO loud! My mother in law would have never been able to hear any of our conversation. What a great surprise, the food was great! Probably the best meal we had while we were in Vegas. They were accommodating to a menu substitution and friendly from beginning to end. It's not a destination place, the decor isn't going to wow you, but if you just want some great food then this is the place!

Ambiance was so-so, but the food and the service were great.  Ordered pasta agoglio and they accommodated the request even though the item wasn't on the menu. Our server, Victor, was superb.  I asked for sauce (other than the marinara they provided) for the calamari and Victor made an awesome suggestion and charmed our table.  The best server ever and good food.  I'd definitely come back

The staff is very friendly and it sort of tries to have a family-run vibe despite being on the Strip. I ordered the clam pasta and thought that it was a little bit underwhelming and lacking in flavor. Perhaps they could have amped up the herbs and the butter? I also thought that the garlic knots that they served at the beginning of the meal were too greasy! The paper was covered in oil...I've had garlic knots before, and i know that they're an indulgence, but this was a bit overly oily...
Food was excellent as well as customer service. Fast and friendly! Chicken marsala was incredible!

I never would have considered this place if it hadn't been for Yelp. Thanks Yelpers! ;)  Anyways, this place is tucked away at the end of the Canal Shoppes at the Venetian. No, it doesn't have a big, neon sign and dim lighting. But it does have FABULOUS food in HUGE portions for CHEAP in VEGAS.  FABULOUS. HUGE. CHEAP. VEGAS. YES!!!  I enjoyed the Penne in Vodka Sauce much more than I did the Linguine Carbonara, though that was really good as well. But by the time I was getting really full, the Carbonara was getting too rich and cheesy, so the Penne was a bit lighter and therefore tastier to me.  Service was friendly and the people there are very non-pretentious and warm. The bread at the beginning, although a bit on the greasy side, was great too! Nice place to eat a meal without killing your wallet in Vegas :)

My wife, daughter and I came to Trattoria Reggiano to give it a try after some friends recommended it to us. I would have to say that this place is great. You can tell they are still getting come grand opening details figured out but the food and service were excellent! I have to make sure to mention that Vito the manager went above and beyond to make sure our experience was pleasant. It's not easy going out with a 15 month old and I felt welcome here. I hope they keep it because I plan on returning. Oh and before I forget the meatballs were unreal!
Perfectly prepared chicken for the chicken parmigiana. The ricotta is amazing! Our server, Rodolfo, got everything right

This place was absolutely amazing!   I ordered the clam and pasta. It was sooo good. The complimentary bread was also very delicious. The service that the waiters provided was so caring and sweet and definitely patient to provide excellent care for their customers.   Although this place was very small, it was indeed very nice.

I stopped here for lunch after checking out the Venetian canal and saw that this place had good Yelp reviews. I thought the food was good, but I would not go back. The restaurant is located in a food court so I did not like the atmosphere; there was no scenery and it cheapened the experience even though our pasta dishes were $20. The penne vodka and carbonara were both good, but definitely nothing to write home about. There are so many cooler restaurants on the strip such that I cannot recommend going here unless you happen to be walking by and are in need of Italian. Again, solid food, but was not memorable and the restaurant had a cheap ambiance.

Went for dinner last night with my husband and friend. Small place that was busy! Our table wasn't ready for our reservation and we had to wait 15 minutes, but that was forgotten quickly as the food was delicious. Paolo was a great server, engaging in conversation and making recommendations. We started with the mussels, which were delicious! Caesar salads came, I am not a fan typically but picked off their plates and enjoyed! Not overwhelming Caesar dressing. My friend said she would have preferred it stronger, but everyone has an opinion :) Hubby had lobster ravioli, my friend had linguine &a clams in red sauce and I had the special (rigatoni with mushrooms, sausage and red sauce). We all cleaned our plates! I can be pretty picky about red sauce, and this was fabulous! Just enough sweet to cut any acid from the tomatoes, but still a really delicious tomato sauce! Chocolate cake for dessert. All desserts are homemade daily.   Reminded us of a mom and pop hole in the wall place, which we love. Serving sizes were just right, enough that we could eat it all but not feel over full.  Definitely recommend!

It was worthy of its 4-star rating. We used the half-price coupons from Tix4Tonight. It would have been overpriced food if not for the coupons. Complimentary garlic knots were pretty good. I had the parts carbonara. Very good. Husband had penne with vodka sauce. Good. Daughter had gnocchi with pesto. Good. Son had grilled salmon. Very good. Caesar salads very good. Decent service including a free birthday dessert.

The food here is the real deal. Absolutely delicious. The host helped us trade for a terrific waiter. (Our first one was a grump.) Ask for Victor. He will take care of you. Try the clam linguine and Italian kale salad.

Not sure what the high star ratings are for. Hard to find as it's basically in the food court. Food was quite good. Service was OK on the surface (to our face) but we overheard them talking badly about us when we were leaving because we were Australian and probably wouldn't leave a tip. We did leave a 22% tip. Wish we didn't.   Given how many restaurants there are in Vegas, there would be 500 better options than Trattoria Reggiano.

Go to Yelp or some of the other review sites and look this place up and you'll think, OK this place seems pretty good.  All I can say is that it is amazingly over rated.  We with started garlic knots . . . Bathed in butter.  Not what I call a good start.  We decided to make up for the bread with an appetizer of Calamari.  It came out over breaded and with a rubbery texture.  The sauces were tarter (can you say bottled), and marinara that was close to ketchup.  For the main course I had Salmon.  It was not well prepared and two carrots with mostly potatoes were what was supposed to be a vegetable side.  My son had veal piccata which again was bathed in a lemon butter.  Has no one learned that you can't cover bad food with butter and lemon?  His vegetable was the same as mine so nothing to rehash here.  I know we're in Las Vegas and meals are inherently expensive on the strip, but the quality and value of what we received was horrible.  It belongs in the fast food chain category, not Las Vegas.  The Venetian / Palazzo should be ashamed for having such a restaurant in their venue compared to the other wonderful establishments they have on site.  Run, don't walk past this restaurant to one of the other gems on site.

I am always apprehensive to go for Italian cuisine outside of the Northeast because let's be honest, we do it best here :) But my good friend and fellow Yelper Geri R recommended Trattoria Reggiano and there is no way that I would discount the recommendation of a fellow Italian (and an Italian Yelper, at that).   This place was legit. Everything from the filet mignon meatballs, to the cold antipasto platter, to the pasta, to the chicken, to the veal, to the seafood...it was all amazing. Like New York amazing. This was probably the best dinner we had during our 4 day stay. I only wish we had room for dessert. We were such fatties that there was no way we'd be able to eat something sweet and not need a nap. There was gambling to be done, after all!  Service was efficient and they made excellent recommendations when we were torn between a couple of items. They take pride in their food and it shows. You cannot go wrong here. The only negative is that it packs up quickly so you might have a little bit of a wait. But that's okay - put your name on the list and go shop for a bit. You'll be thrilled you did.  Bon appetit!

Due to our meager mini-meal at Japonais, we came to Trattoria Reggiano to fill our stomachs.  We were seated right away in the last open booth, which was perfect for the 4 of us.  It is very cozy on the inside, yellow walls with lots of framed black and white pictures.  There are also several tables outside.  The bread basket looked very promising but it definitely would have been better if warm.  You get a whole bottle of olive oil and balsamic vinegar to mix at your own will.  We ordered the Pizza Margherita and the pasta with vodka cream sauce and proscuitto.  Both were very delicious!  The pizza was very hot and satisfying, and the pasta was flavorful.

4.5 Stars  I know that the garlic knots are all the rage here but they didn't wow me. They were good but not something to rave about  On the other hand, the bolognese sauce was definitely praise worthy. A copious amount of delicious and tasty bits of meat coated in a wonderful rich tomato sauce. Pasta was done well and portion was good  Overall Thoughts  Would have no problem venturing back to Trattoria Reggiano to see what else they have to offer

What a gem for great Italian food. The garlic knots were great to start with. We had the spaghetti and meatballs and pesto gnocchi which both were amazing. The staff are so nice and warm that you feel you are in Italy. The only thing is the capacity of this restaurant is small, so expect to dine in the middle of a busy walkway but its so worth the taste.

Auf der Suche nach einem netten Restaurant mit einigermaßen vernünftigen Preisen in Las Vegas bin ich durch Yelp auf diese kleine Perle aufmerksam geworden. Das Restaurant hebt sich mit seiner Größe, Intimität und authentischer Führung deutlich von den anderen Restaurants ab.   Ich hatte die "Spaghetti mit Meatballs", die vom Geschmack und auch vom Garzustand sehr, sehr gut waren. Für 18 Dollar und Vegas auch angemessen. Die kleine Weinauswahl ist vernünftig und preislich ebenfalls ok. Nicht zu empfehlen sind die frittierten Calamari, ich hatte einen gegrillen Calamar erwartet und nicht diese deep-fried Häppchen.   Durchaus kinderfreundlich vom Service allerdings kein Kids-Menu oder die sonst in den USA üblichen Stifte/Malbücher. Auf Wunsch wurden uns Nudeln mit Butter aber problemlos für die Kids gemacht, dann aber mit 14 Dollar doch saftig berechnet.  Insgesamt dennoch ein Tip für einen kleinen italienischen Abend im großen Venetian.

We had an amazing dinner here. Bethany was attentive and friendly! I had the bake ziti with meatballs (took half home just as amazing heated up the next day.) great atmosphere we will definitely be back! Thank you!
Awesome! Food bar and atmosphere is great!!!!!!! Lobster ravioli and the bartender was my favorite.

We are generally not big fans of casino restaurants. However after reading the yelp reviews decided to try this. And we are a big fan of this restaurant. Wonderful location great service The meatball appetizer is as good as advertised fabulous!  The arugula and cherry tomato salad with the lemon olive oil dressing is wonderful and bright in flavor.  The salad was easily large enough for us to split.   Prices are very reasonable.     The garlic knots  are also worthy as others have said.    Great flavors and fresh.  We finished with the gluten free bruschetta pizza which was equally wonderful.  Thank you for a great experience!

given the location of this place, I have passed it 10000 times since starting at The V.... I have heard from a number of people that it was good and man... they didnt lie... I had the calamari and chicken marsala.... everything was cooked perfectly and our server was very efficient.   I will definitely head back sometime soon!   Very impressed.  :)

One of the best meals I have ever had. The staff was friendly and helpful. They recommended the special of gnocchi with bolognese and it was AMAZING!! We also shared a warm spinach salad which was different and tasty. The garlic bread was also a real treat. It's kinda hidden and away from the activity of the Venetian, but it was so worth it.

I thought this place was amazing.  We came to Vegas for a race, so we ate a lot of pasta the nights leading up to the race.  This was by far my favorite pasta we had while we were in Vegas.  The waitress was also very nice and accommodating of all my weird requests.  I am a vegetarian and so she pointed out all of the things that had a meat or cheese in it that I wouldn't expect.  It was very helpful and thoughtful.

Great service. Love the decor makes you feel at home. Ordered the filet mignon spaghetti and they were the best meat balls I ever tried they're very tender. I Also tried the sausage pizza and it was very cheesy and crispy.
Remember to buy "Tix tonight" for 1/2 price. But not all booths have this coupon, i went to "fashion show mall" to buy coupon. All the pasta here is good.

Don't let the small size and relative lack of crowds fool you - despite the fact that it's not on the main drag, this has the best Italian food on the strip.  We had pizza, pasta and salad and it was all delicious.  The pasta was cooked to perfection and the pizza had a nice thin crust.  We were also given garlic bread which was delicious, albeit very oil/buttery.  For the strip, the prices are reasonable.  Would definitely recommend to anyone who has a hankering for Italian food in between gambling and clubbing :)

Poor Service and High Priced Average Food. Best thing is the small free cheese and olive plate. Bummer 4 people over $200+ we had 1 appetizer, 4 entries and 4 cocktails. Server could care less if we received what we ordered and provided zero assistance or recommendations. He missed several items and the only time we saw him was for the order and the check? Properly survives due to great location.

This place is really awesome. The food is great, the service is superb. I'd like to shout out to my server Lyndsay. She's very good and attentive and I'm really glad I went with her recommendations!! My cabonara was very authentic and tasty. 10/10 would recommend

A casual Italian restaurant with classic fare - chicken parmesan, spaghetti and meatballs, etc. We ordered a salad, meatballs, and the linguine with clams, and it was the perfect amount to share between two people. Yes, the rolls were good but we didn't over indulge because we wanted to have room for the delicious food. I loved the meatballs; they packed a lot of flavor! I could've honestly been fine with some balls and wine (personal preference). My husband is a huge fan of linguine with clams and theirs definitely measured up. Definitely worth checking out if you want something low key.
Tried this place for lunch today and we had a great experience. The food was really good as was the service. The tiramisu was the best part! We will definitely be going back.
Food is good, but did not knock my socks off. Atmosphere is a little "food court" feeling as they are brightly lit and open into the Venetian food court.

I like this unpretentious restaurant's food much more than the dinner I had at Zeffirinos.  Why?  Because this food actually had FLAVOR!  We started with the Filet Mignon meatballs which were tasty and saucy.  As for the garlic rolls, I found those to be too doughy.  For dinner  my adult children had caesar salads, pizza and pesto gnocci, which they enjoyed.  I ordered the baked ziti which was delicious.  For dessert, we enjoyed the very dense chocolate layer cake, which the three of us were unable to finish.  This place made me wish we had a refrigerator waiting in our room so we could bring home our leftovers.  One of my favorite things about this place is the authenticity of the wait staff.  I enjoyed the energy in the place, including the yelling at each other in Italian, interacting with the patrons with personality and genuine interest, and the attention to the patrons' comfort.  You can tell this is a family owned restaurant and that they take pride in their establishment.

Came here for the first time tonight for dinner. Both pizza and pasta were outstanding. Waiter brought some extra freebies while we were waiting for food to arrive. Placed was packed inside and out which was great for a Tuesday night. Will def return
Great service! Great coffee! Great food!!! Love this place! It's so hard to find such a great Caesar salad and this place has an amazing one!!!!!!

This place was amazing!!! I ordered a cesar salad because I was scared of what to order- YUM!! My Mother in law ordered a chicken and spaghetti dish that blew my mind!! I instantly regretted ordering the salad!   Downside- sodas are 3.50 a pop and no free refills-Iced tea is imported and 8 bucks. Few seats but super cute.  The wait staff was awesome!  I will be back!!!

The food was excellent. I had the eggplant parm and it was delicious. The bread was great and the casear salad was exceptional. The soup with meatballs was very good as well. The only downside was the lack of inside seating. We had to sit outside and it was pretty windy.

Pleasantly surprised, excellent service. I had made a reservation and we were seated exactly upon arrival on a Friday night. Food was large portions, well prepared but I was most surprised by the attentive service. I've eaten at every restaurant in downtown Summerlin and this one just jumped to one of our favorites. Much better than Grape Street both in terms of food quality and definitely in terms of service. Keep it up!

Wow!!!  We loved this place so much we are going back for lunch today.  Fantastic food,incredible service and great atmosphere.  Every entree being brought out looked incredible.    Bread,calamari wine,salad, marinara sauce.   Fantastic!

Judged us and seated guest after guest before us so we left and spent our money elsewhere. Yes real money you know thw thing that this restaurant lost and now has gained a 1 star. I shouldn't have to beg to have someone take my money.

The service alone makes this place a five-star restaurant. However, the food was spectacular as well! Fresh, flavorful, hot and served with style and a friendly smile. Highly recommend this small trattoria amidst the myriad of stores and other food options, don't miss it!
The food was really tasty and service was great!! Teeny tiny place, but we got there early (11:30AM). There was no lunch menu, prices are a little steep for lunch, but well worth it!!

The calamari with spicy marinara was great and so were the garlic knots. Pasta was just okay, a little bland. Paulo, our server/bartender, couldn't care less about his professionalism or even his job, for that matter. We had to ask for water twice and all he said was "oh I didn't bring them huh". We asked for the check and we waited 15 minutes because he forgot it...again. No apology.   The Venetian location is 10x better. I won't be back to this one.

I love Italian food, and this place was amazing! My sisters and I asked for a table of three and I liked how the man (I believe he was the manager or owner) was so outgoing and happy. In fact, throughout our meal, we noticed him interacting with the other guests, joking etc. The bread was nice and soft, and we had the Filet Mignon Meatballs as an app. I'm a picky eater, but holy crap, it was delicious. It had the perfect texture, taste and everything! I had the linguine bolognese and that was delicious as well. One of my sisters ordered the chicken parmigiana and she loved how tender the chicken was. We were stuffed, but we just had to try the chocolate cake. This was like a chocolate mousse cake and that's my favorite kind of dessert. So I absolutely loved it. One slice was plenty enough for the three of us. Safe to say we walked out completely stuffed. Our server was a tiny bit shy, but other than that, food is amazing, service is great, and we will be going back!

Recently ate here this past weekend.. It's a little hard to find but it is a GEM once you find it in the canal!! Located in a small quaint spot underground the canal-- tried this place since we had resort credit for staying at the palazzo. There are many Italian spots in the Venetian and palazzo-- but I highly recommend this one if you crave Italian! From the fresh garlic bread-- you'll want more! My husband ordered the lemon chicken-- which the only thing was the portion-- I guess he expected more- although the taste was on point. I ordered the linguine bolognese-- mind you, not a fan of spaghetti, but this was delish! It had chunks of filet mignon meat , in which I thought was just ground beef. The portion was huge ! Had my husband finish half of my plate. I recommend you come here If you want to try !

Very cute place. The meatballs and Garlic rolls are fantastic! Had the shrimp carbonara, wasn't real flavorful. Would pass on this the next time. My boyfriend had the shrimp scampi pasta and it was fabulous. He is a picky eater and he loved it! Will be coming back again real soon.

I would call it sort of a hidden gem. The place is hard to find inside Venetian....dwarfed by the bigger adjoining restaurants but we were glad that we kept our reservation. Both the food and the service was great.

Tough to find but worth it. It's located by the food court. Came here for early dinner about 6pm. People started lining up around 630pm. Everything we had was excellent: Caesar salad, linguine with clams, lobster ravioli, Veal picatta, and shrimp scampi. Typical vegas resort pricing but food was very good.

We had great pasta and wine at this restaurant last year.  I had to look it up again because we just wondered in and couldn't recall the name.  The waiter was very skilled and professional.  Great dining for a family of four, pricey, but such a relaxing and delicious meal!

For on the strip dining Reggies  rocks. Very authentic style Italian food in a low key semi "out door" environment. It's a small place, feels like you were tucked in a side street in Rome, not like the expansive Maggianos down the street. Its in the back of the blue sky area. Very reasonable prices and wine list too. Our server, Sergio, was the real deal,  from Italy, who knew the food and wine inside and out. We had meatballs, cabrese and the calamari for apps ..perfect way to start off. Meatballs were outstanding, as was the cabrese.  Their pasta dishes were on the mark, pasta primavera... very light and fresh. The pizza was cooked perfectly, the dough a bit thicker that typical romano style but quite tasty the Quattro Stagioni was great. They have many good choices of pizza and pasta. We stuck to the pasta /pizzas mostly. Chicken parm was good as well. I'd definitely recommend this on the strip.

I love this place. Plain and simple. The food is fantastic, the service perfect, and the atmosphere welcoming. The party I went with all got different entrees from the menu and we shared them. Everything was good, and we couldn't agree which entree was the best. I loved the pasta a la vodka, my wife loved the linguini Bolognese, and my brother loved the tortellini alfredo. Bottom line it was all great. Be careful though, I highly recommend saving room for dessert. The cheesecake is one of the best I've ever had, and the tiramisu was delicious. On top of all of this or server made great recommendations, was extremely friendly, and made us excited to return again. The manager introduced herself to us and chatted with us for a minute. It was a wonderful dining experience and I can't wait to come back and try more items from the menu.

I am obsessed with meatballs.  I want to say I have tried about 30 different meatballs in my life.  Some may say, "HA!  That is not many meatballs at all!!"... but you know what?  It's a lot to me!  So yea, I love meatballs so I really wanted to try the Filet Mignon meatballs here.  Yes, they were delicious.  I'm a huge fan of meatballs that taste good without to much seasoning.  And that's exactly the case here, you can taste the meat.  But you know what?  I wonder if it would taste the same if they used regular beef as opposed to Filet Mignon.  My gosh their bread is amazing with the garlic and butter on them.  But it's almost like a heart attack.  Anyway, we got the arugular salad, a pizza with prosciutto, and eggplant parm.  Right now, it's my favorite Italian place in Vegas.  Wish it wasn't in the middle of the shopping plaza at Venetian, seems almost out of place!!    Service great, waiter very VERY nice.  Def will come back here.

Preface: this Italian restaurant is not 2 dollar signs -- more like three or four. And at that , this is way too pricey. 24$ for linguine balagnese ? Geez, even more expensive than Beverly Hills or Santa Monica in Los Angeles.  The garlic rolls come complimentary , which alleviates some of the cost, but I'd rather go off the strip for Italian food that is of equal quality and cheaper.

Table for 3  The pro: -Service   The con: -Lobster Ravioli  *Lackluster on the sauce when it came to flavor and depth.  *Pasta was still doughy  -Gnocchi al Pesto *Lackluster on the flavor of the sauce as well, however beautiful color and consistency that is pesto.  -Seafood Linguini *Oddly there was a pool of sauce or pasta water, I don't recall, but wasn't at all pleasing to see.   Not the best or worst Italian food, it was just okay. The food lacked a lot of the hearty flavor profiles that is Italian.

Delicious!  Best restaurant in the Venetian. Found this restaurant on Yelp and couldn't have been happier.  It's hard to find within the canals of the Venetian.  In fact, we could barely even find it on the property map, it's that small and several employees we asked didn't know where it was located.  I had the Veal Parmigiana which may have been the best veal I have ever tasted.  The serving was huge and the veal was nicely breaded with a crispy crunch.  The sauce was an unusual orange color, but extremely tasty as well.  The bread, to die for...  I travel quite a lot to Vegas for work and have eaten at many of the famous chef restaurants including Batalli, Flay and LaGasse.   This was far better than any of those restaurants and I look forward to my next visit.  Note:  if you are having trouble finding the restaurant, it's right next to Harry Houdini Magic Shop...

New to Vegas, so I'm still exploring all the good spots to eat. Seeing I love italian food, I had to try it here. They didn't have my favorite dish which is chicken piccata but they did have my second which is shrimp scampi so that is the only reason they got 4 stars and not 5 stars.   I started my meal out with their steamed mussels, hot cheesy rolls and with oil and balsamic vinegar on the side. Then ordered their shrimp scampi, the shrimps were larger and cooked to perfection. The pasta tasted awesome with the lemon butter sauce.   They also have a bar where you can come just get a drink and watch a game or something.   The service was on point and they made sure you had everything you need, not pushy at all. Sonic your ever in Vegas and want some Italian food, I recommend you come here.

I seriously love this cute Italian restaurant. Located inside the Venetian near the food court. It is closer to the back, a few shops from near the entrance of the parking garage. (You'll understand when you go there.) We went in and was seated in a booth. The inside was very small, but the booth made it feel spacious. The yellow walls and rustic photos made it feel very cozy and charming. The music was very nice too. It felt like I was in Italy, but not quite. But it made the ambiance a lot warmer.  Our server was very nice and was quite speedy. He had our waters out to us and our bread to us quite fast, but it was okay with me because I was thirsty. I read some of the other yelp reviews, and decided that I wanted to get the calamari. Calamari is probably one of my favorite appetizers. It was a huge portion. The calamari was so crispy and it was just delicious. It wasn't too salty and it had a tomato based dipping sauce which complimented the calamari perfectly. The added lemon juice made it extra delicious for me. This calamari dish was one of the best I've had. My boyfriend and I devoured that, hehe. The bread was wonderful too.   For our main dishes he had the chicken parmigiana with the spaghetti. It was a good sized portion, if I would've known better I would have just shared with him! You could really taste the tomatoes in the sauce. I had a lemon dish with chicken, I forget the name. Sorry! I won't lie though it was a little too lemony for me, and I am a big lemon fan. So rethink that dish if you don't want to be overwhelmed by lemon.   But I do love this Italian restaurant. Would definitely be back in again when I'm at the Venetian!
Great meatballs... A must try. I loved how the waiter split an dish for us with no extra charge. The garlic rolls were buttery and warm, with excellent oil and vinegar.

Weirdly tiny restaurant in the middle of a shopping mall... erm, I mean the Venetian. Though it really does feel like you're eating in a restaurant inside a mall.  ...but it's good! The garlic rolls were quite awesome and the caesar salad and meatball appetizers were also satisfying and tasty. My swordfish was pretty good, though the veggies on the side were boring and meh. Like everything on the strip, it wasn't exactly a great value, but overall it was pretty good. This place wouldn't survive in San Francisco or NYC... but then again, not much in Vegas would.

It was an okay meal. The tortellini with alfredo was a very small serving for the price. Sauce was bit bland and very thin. The pasta itself was tender and very good. My husband had the baked ziti with meat balls and enjoyed it. Calamari was good. The spicy marinara was delicious.   We both agree we will not go back but it was okay for a last minute lunch. $77 before tip for two people. No salad with the meal.  We are Italian, rarely go out for Italian food as it is hard to  find authentic/really good food around here. Can honestly say this is no better than Olive Garden. Olive garden is less expensive and the food is the same quality

We were looking for an Italian restaurant to eat dinner before the Human Nature show in the Venetian Hotel and reading the reviews and having two people I knew who ate here before, sealed the deal and I made reservations for 5:15 pm.  The place is alittle hard to find, but it is located near the food court.    Our server was friendly and attentive and when we first got there, it wasn't busy but by the time we finished dinner, the place was packed!  Luckily, dude found a Tix 4 Tonight booth that had 50% off entrees and pastas at Trattoria Reggiano.  These tickets cost $3 a person and can only be used Monday to Thursday from 11 am to 10 pm.  Menu prices are high for a hotel restaurant.  We started with the delicious garlic knots, then shared a kale peanut salad (crunchy and tasty), veal milanese (light and crispy light batter with arugula sprinkled on top) and lobster ravioli!  I liked the veal milanese more than the lobster ravioli although they were both pretty good.  And I think because I told the server that we had a 7 pm show, the food came out pretty quickly!    Had a very enjoyable dinner!
One of my very favorite places to dine ! Delicious Authentic Italian Cuisine,  attentive service and a beautiful atmosphere. My Favorite Mother's Day Dinner choice.  Five Stars

Great food and excellent service. Being local I've tried many others on and off The Strip yet Trattoria Reggiano is still the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas! Ask for Amanda and she can tell you the best wine to go with anything and maybe even suggest something tasty off-menu.

This place was awesome and I was pleasantly surprised! Probably one of the best Italian restaurants I have ever been to. Everything went right during my visit, and I definitely want to return on my next trip to Vegas!  Pros - The FOOD! I ordered the Linguine Bolognese and it was perfection. Also, the food came out piping hot which I definitely appreciated. I and everyone else in my party loved our entrees  - The garlic bread was to DIE for. I'm a huge garlic fan so their bread was freaking amazing! - Service was great! Our server was attentive without being too pushy or annoying.  Cons - As other Yelp users mentioned,  this restaurant is in more of a food-court type of setting in the Grand Canal Shoppes at The Venetian Hotel. We had to walk quite a bit from where we entered to find this restaurant, but it wasn't a big deal at all.

Maybe I didn't order the right thing. Maybe they were having an off-day. Or maybe...I was just excited to catch up with my friend I just picked the first thing I saw on the menu.  I came here on a Saturday evening. Surprisingly....parking was easy to find. I saw plenty of parking spaces in the lots AND in the garage.   I ordered the Linguine Bolognese-ground beef with some kind of tomato sauce, fresh herbs and spices, tossed with light Parmesan. It SOUNDS delicious but really, it was a let down. Wasn't very flavorful and tasted bland. Too much pasta but not even meat sauce. Also....this restaurant is pretty pricy for what it's really worth. $22 freakin dollars for my entrée. If you want to add chicken, shrimp etc....it's like $6 extra. For this kind of price...I could have gotten a much better quality dinner at Bootlegger Bistro!! Ugh.... =/

Found this restaurant on Yelp when a friend was craving Italian and we wanted to have a nice dinner on our last night in Vegas. This is a great small establishment. I had the lobster ravioli, which was delicious. The garlic knots which came with the meals were really good. The others in my party also enjoyed their meals which included the tortellini and veal parm. The prices were fair and the portion sizes just right. The staff were all friendly, happy, and pleasant. They also joked with us a little which was fun. Our party of 5 had a short wait for a table since the place is very small. It was worth it, but you may want to make a reservation during busy times if they take them.

Great place. It looks very touristic but it's actually really good. When we first ate there we were skeptical how good it would be. But it's almost authentic Italian. Very friendly service. Pizza is great. Pesto Gnocchi great as well. Ate there three times now and it's been great.
