What a pleasant surprise to find this small place. I had the vegetarian pizza, it was a great choice. I definitely recommend if you want to eat not too pricey Italian food.

Paolo was our server and he was nothing short from amazing. Great service and even better food! A must dine for the entire family! First time here but returning every visit to Vegas for sure! Amazing job to all thank you again.

Trattoria Reggiano is one of my all time favorite restaurants in Vegas.  I always get an appetizer of the meatballs which are absolutely amazing and I order the veal parmigiana.  Everything is superb.  I've brought multiple teams here during conferences and each person walks away extremely satisfied and excited to come back the following year.  You will not be disappointed.

First, this place is really hard to find.  Its tucked away far in the back of the shopping area.  I suggest looking for Brighton or the Coffee Bean and you "should" be able to find it.  Was all excited to eat here after reading other reviews but it fell short of my expectations.  I ordered the chicken parm and it came with a small side of spaghetti.  The spaghetti was delicious.  The chicken had a reheated chicken taste to it and I did not enjoy at all.  My hubby had pasta puttenesca.  He ate it all.  Was enjoyable but not fantastic.  Two glasses of wine, our two entree's and and iced tea was $65. Maybe I didn't order the right thing but wont be returning... sorry.  The service was pretty good.  Everyone was extremely friendly but the food just didn't do anything for me.  Plus, I just hate that reheated chicken taste.
This is not worth trip. Sauce tasted canned. Nothing special about the lasagna or fetucinne Bolognese. Wont be back. Better places around

Wonderful dinner. Our waiter was awesome. We were seated immediately and greeted by our waiter quickly as well. I had made a reservation however it probably was not necessary. This was my second time visiting this restaurant. The first time was 5 years ago and I was very pleased that the food still tasted as wonderful as I remember it. I had the fettuccine alfredo and it was wonderful. Not too overly buttery and the perfect size portion. My husband had the chicken parm and raved about it as well. The bread they give is delicious and cheesy. Highly recommend this restaurant. It is tricky to find since the grand canal shoppes have a lot of twists and turns so definitely allow yourself enough time to find it if you're not familiar with area.

Debated between 2 or 3 stars.  Thought this place would be good based off the reviews.  Maybe we got here too late (around 9pm) but that's really not late for Vegas.  Anyways, I settled for good ol' spaghetti and meatballs.  Not a fan of the marinara sauce at all, way too salty for me.  But loved the meatballs.  So I gave them 3 stars since service was decent.  Also, the garlic knots were yummy!

First timers, No complaints here. Food was excellent, service was outstanding, especially bartenders  Eli and Bethany. Spicy calamari, lobster ravioli, and baked ziti with filet mignon and pork loin meatballs were fantastic. Will definitely return!

The veal Parmesan was excellent.  A generous thick portion of veal, covered w/ a flavorful sauce and cheese.  The pasta and bread complimented the veal perfectly.  We were truly impressed with the outstanding customer service.  No wonder the place was packed.  But we didn't feel rushed.  One of the best Italian meals we have had in Las Vegas.
This place has the best pasta in Summerlin! Ask for Ricki to be your waitress, she'll give you top notch service!

Great food.  Get the meatballs.  They are the best I have ever had.  Pasta was perfectly cooked.  Clam sauce was light with excellent flavor.  Canoli was amazing.  Only reason it doesn't get five stars is the ambiance is lacking.

The food was great, and the atmosphere is lovely. Most restaurants of this caliber neglect the vegetables not this place they were cooked perfectly. Unfortunately I couldn't give it five stars cause the restaurant is located across from Dave & busters .

Had spaghetti and meatballs which was way too salty, I understand Parmajano Reggiano adds salt flavor but the salt I taste came from Spaghetti sauce. Prachstto Pizza was unremarkable, arugula Caesar salad the dressing lacks flavor. Barely had any food and lied to waitress I already ate when she asks you hardly touched your food. Best part about the meal is 3 glass of coke I had, and the server was attentive.

Location: Venetian hotel  Hi there! I only have two photos of two different pasta plates due to my other friends devouring it before i got a chance to capture an image of the pasta. Many things i want to say about the 5 different pasta dishes. I am a pasta man.  5 types of pasta dishes we had:  - Chicken Parmesan  Breaded chicken breast in our traditional San Marzano pomodoro sauce and melted mozzarella, served with spaghetti  - Chicken Francese Fresh chicken breast sautéed in lemon-white wine sauce and a touch of butter, served with spaghetti  - Linguine Bolognese Slow simmered ground filet mignon in San Marzano pomodoro sauce, fresh herbs, spices, and Parmigiano Reggiano  - Spaghetti Carbonara Spaghetti pasta, imported pancetta, egg yolks, and Parmigiano Reggiano are combined to create this classic Italian specialty  - Spaghetti & Meatballs Housemade filet mignon and pork loin meatballs with our classic San Marzano pomodoro sauce, olive oil and spices  All descriptions are from the real menu itself.    1. Texture of pasta and meat itself: Pasta was cooked nicely. Softer than Al dente. I'm sure the chef would be able to boiled the pasta to give it a chewier texture if asked. So if you enjoy soft pasta, but not too soft, then you'd like their pasta.  Chicken wasn't dry and had a very nice texture! Any beef plates, such as ground filet mignon sauce in bolognese, and meat sauce in spaghetti had plenty of flavor!  The Carbonara is your typical pancetta, egg, and parmesan mixture. Initially, the plate is bland itself because of how easily the pancetta can make it salty and I felt like an addition of salt was needed but overall, it was a good dish.  Only reason why i didn't give the place a 5 star was because of the amount of lemon was added to the chicken francese. Though reading the menu, i knew the dish was going to be a semi-sour dish, but lemon-wine was also added to the spaghetti making the dish dominantly sour. Don't get me wrong, the chicken was cooked perfectly, i preferred this chicken itself have the taste and maybe the spaghetti should become less sour and more sweet. Maybe add a sauce that would dress the spaghetti and not drench it? My personal opinion of course. I personally had the linguine bolognese, and although i very much enjoyed the dish, i felt like it was drenched in oil. The oils that came from the grounded filet sauce. Near the end i had to take the meat out from its original plate to finish it off because it was very oily.  Overall, i would definitely recommend and would go out of my way to eat here. But not often because it's fairly pricy   Rating 4.2/5  My third picture is the cost of all the plates. You can assume that the pasta dishes are around ~20$ Trattoria also serves other entrees that vary around 25-35$   Tips: GREAT TASTING GARLIC KNOTS AS FREE STARTERS! (Only first order is free) Plates look small in picture, but are big in person. Don't let it deceive you! We order an extra pizza and didn't even get to it!  Bone Apple tea

Best spot for Italian! Service is great, food is amazing and a crowd pleaser (we've told a lot of friends about our find). Located in the Venetian shops, it's definitely worth it to get there a little earlier than you want to eat because there is sometimes a line, but they're expanding which I think will be great for service. Amazing garlic rolls with fresh Parmesan, garlic and butter! You won't be disappointed!

This place is very hard to find but it's totally worth the hunt!   It's strange that this restaurant isn't listed under the Venetian directory but thankfully a nice security guard directed us to the restaurant.  Because it's tucked away you won't be dining next to the tourist craziness next to the gondolas which i think is a big positive too.   As for the food, first off they have one of the best pre-meal breads I've tasted.  Nice and garlic-ey and Parmesan-ey.  It's so good.  If you're with a eating companion I recommend that you share a large size salad.  It's a perfect size to share.  We had the Caesar salad which was excellent.  The entrees were also really great and reasonably priced.  We had the baked ziti and the baked salmon both made to perfection.  Now I know where to go when I'm craving some great Italian food on the strip!
Food was spectacular. The set up was ok. You eat in what feels like a hallway connecting two other places.... But it didn't matter as the chicken Parm was amazing and the meatballs just right.

New favorite place at DT Summerlin request Paolo he treated us like we were the most important people in the room and he's Italian from Milano. Gives the place a REAL vibe.  Felt like we were sitting in Italy.   Great place to go right before seeing a movie, it's literally right next door to Regal DT Summerlin.   They have a Happy hour too which is nice and the outdoor seating is really comfortable a real plus is you can hear yourself talk. Unlike some of the other restaurants in DT it's a great place to connect and meet with friends, we loved it! Service by Paolo was superb, I know I said it again but it's worth repeating. Great calamari, Chicken Parm is one of the dishes they're known for. We had such fun and loved it. See Vito the manager and ask for Paolo you won't be disappointed...
The ribeye meatballs are da bomb!!!!  The pizzas are nice size & the service is fast.   On the pricy side but overall bomb ZA......  "Thunderlips"

This is a small place - about 6 tables inside and a dozen outside. Even though its located in the Venetian - it is independently owned. They serve up some of the best Italian food in Las Vegas - the pictures posted by Yelpers will attest to that.  I had the veal parmigiana, breaded pieces of veal melded with sauce and cheese with some pasta on the side. I would think this is a heavy dish but I found the veal to be light and perfectly battered. I posted a picture of this dish and am embarrassed to say I finished it all. Yup, every morsel. Paired with some great wine, this made for a memorable meal.  I was well taken care of by my server John and will definitely be here next time I am in Vegas to try the filet mignon meatballs.

Looked like a decent place for a meal, reasonable priced. But when we ordered we asked for a substitution on a pizza. Obviously was a crime since we were scolded by an older Italian man (only because he informed us he was Italian and they don't have sorporsetta only salami) I said weird as it says you have it on the menu (proceeded to point out to him) we were repaid by being served scorching hot pizza - enough to cause a 2nd degree burn.
A lot of Italian options in Las Vegas.  Most don't take over an hour to get the main course to the table.  I don't recommend this place.

I went here with my co worker before we went to a concert on New Year's day.  The hostess was a little rude when I said I had no RSVP and seated us in the patio in the freezing cold.  Luckily they had heaters.  The food was good.  I had the Scampi and my co worker had the Frutta de mare.  I'll be back to try the desserts with my husband.  It was pricey but I think it was good overall.

It took almost an hour to find this place and go through hordes of people at the Venetian after deciding not to wait 2 hrs for the buffet at the Wynn. Huge mistake, the buffet would've been a much better dining experience with much tastier food and more variety, for about the same price. Yelp definitely steered me wrong in this case. No idea why they would rate this 4 stars on average?! Mediocre at best and I can make much better pasta at home. The complimentary garlic knots were not soft and pliable like a doughy rollout rather hard and dry. I only ate half of one. I ordered the seafood pasta and the hub got the meatballs. Both were just ok. Waitress was ok as well. Nothing spectacular about this dining experience, and wouldn't come again. Definitely not worth $80 for 2 entrees and a glass of red plus tip.

Yelp you failed us on this one. There is no way this place is not using a microwave. We had the chicken parm and shrimp linguini. The chicken was absolutely disgusting almost in edible. The shrimp fared a bit better but still not up to par. Do yourself a favor for 5.00 more a plate go to lavo you won't be disappointed.

Very good... the 4 cheese pizza was okay.. would have been better with sauce. Cheese and bread .... got a side of marinara to dip it The kids were very pleased, could have split the pizzas between 2 people

Based on yelp-reviews, I decided to give his place a try. I got there but no tables were avaliable. A server asked me to come back in 10 minutes, so I did, and a table was ready for me.   This is a very small, hole in the wall type restaurant with great service and great food. I had the carbonara, and it was top notch. At 19 bucks, it's not the cheapest pasta I have ever ordered, but well worth the price.
Service has considerably improved.  Food is really good. Like the atmosphere.  Happy to see things have changed.

So, I'm not Italian but lived in Rome, Italy from the end of second grade through High School and have returned to visit many times. It is one place I call home. Coming to Tratorria Regiano reminded me a bit of what I come to expect when revisiting Italy. Good food and excellent service are both on display here. Our waiter was knowledgeable about the menu and specials, which was very nice indeed, but I was more focused on the native Italian busboy who cleared the table and supplied the Reggiano to my party's salads and pasts dished. The man couldn't have been much younger than 70 years old and he was totally committed to making sure our table was always well-attended to. I forgot the man's name but I want him to know that I give the restaurant the extra star for his exceptional service. I had the ravioli and it was made al dente just as it would have been made back home, in Roma. The salad was huge and my friend's plates were delectable looking as well. Buona fortuna, Tratorria Reggiano e ci vediamo subito!
Very festiv atmosphere for Christmas shopping, and great Red wine sangria to take the edge off!

The garlic knots are massive and so delicious! The pizza was pretty good, I got the Salame Piccante - Pepperoni but I've never seen garlic knots so big in my life and I'm kind of in love with them now.

Went there with my mom she really picky with Italian food ! Everything taste amazing !!  Mimmo was our server he treat us with worm hospitality and make us feel like In a real authentic restaurant . Good atmosphere great vibe we defiantly coming back again.

I give this restaurant three stars. Although the drinks and the food came out in a timely manner our waitress did not check on us. Our busboy; however, did a great job. He checked on us more than the waitress. I'd eat here again.
Good for the price!  Pretty true italian.

Very happy with our experience here. Unlike the "other" Italian restaurant around the corner, the host staff seated us quickly and at the table we requested. We ordered our meal and were rewarded with some excellent buttery garlic rolls while we waited. The wife's spaghetti with meatballs was pretty good. I rarely order salads, but the Italian Kale salad with grilled chicken, white beans, boiled egg, bacon, and Gorgonzola dressing sounded good, and tasted even better. Our waiter Brandon was on top of his game, and his service easily warrants the fifth star on this review.

Solid 3.5 stars.  I ordered the linguine bolognes.  This dish was a great balance of flavors that were light and full of freshness.  The linguine was perfectly al dente, the quality of beef was on point and the portions were perfect.   There are a few things that I feel could be worked on just a bit and they are all service oriented.  First, I thought it was a nice gesture that they wanted to place your napkin on your lap for you, but, the first napkin was dropped on the ground and we were told they would get us another and well....she never came back.  Needless to say one lap was napkin less and the other didnt even get the attempt the first did.  Second, our server really looked like he hated his job.  I get it...you work at a trattoria in a mall in vegas.  I can see where you get the feeling of despair, but please, PLEASE put a smile on your face.  Aside from these two small things everything else was great and I would come back and dine here again.  After all, we aren't always on point and we do all have a bad day here and there.

Came here for dinner while staying at the Venetian. Super easy to grab a reservation ahead of time via OpenTable. Our waiter was great - friendly and attentive. Food was good too. No kids menu, but our kids liked the pepperoni pizza they shared. I wolfed down my linguine with clams (they give lots of clams), and my wife really liked her chicken salad. The free garlic knots were good too.

A small restaurant with 20 tables so expect a wait. It felt like a small tratorria in Italy. The food and wine were well priced and very good. The meatballs were flavorful and the sauce well balanced.

Just skip the food court!  Don't walk by like we did several times while attending a convention at the Venetian. For a value price, enjoy a delicious pizza to share!  My husband and I only a 30 minutes to eat before an appointment.  The staff was able to accommodate our time crunch and our pizza was out in 10 minutes!  Besides the food being yummy, our waiter, Eric, was super friendly!

Tasty Italian cuisine in a bit of a cheesy spot. Our server, who was actually Italian took the time to describe the difference between carbonara from northern Italy (with cream) and that from Rome (egg, but no cream). The pancetta added an extra layer of crispy texture to the dish. A bit on the expensive side for what you get, but that's to be expected at any Strip eatery. Nonetheless, We would definitely return if we're ever back at the Venetian.

I am so glad we found this restaurant. We took the outdoor seating area and ordered Eggplant Rollatini for appetizers and Tortellini Alfredo for a main course. Complimentary garlic bread was simply beyond words, real good!  Both the appetizer and the main dish were delicious. Service was great. To sum it, it was a wonderful dining experience with mouth watering Italian food!

1 word for this place, EXCELLANT!! Service and food were both very good. The owner makes you feel like you're part of the family. The bread to start was out of this world. I got the Eggplant Parmesan and my boyfriend got the Cheese Ravioli w a side of meatballs, everything was so good and the price was very reasonable. The place is small but don't let the size fool you. I will definitely visit this place again the next time in Vegas. Thanks for a great meal!!

If I could give zero stars I would. Gave the place a try. Wanted a new change of pace to Vegas. We ordered the stuffed baked clams app. Was a daily special at the time they clams where so small and filled with breading there was not any clam at all. We then ordered pasta both our pasta dishes were undercooked. We took one bite of each and could not finish it. Then the waiter came and when we told him they were undercooked he almost laughed and it knew it was going to be. We then asked for the bill. We ended up paying 24 bucks for 8 tiny tiny clams and 2 pops. Never eat here. if you can't cook pasta don't call your self an Italian place. Wouldn't even go back for the bread total rip and I warn you stay away.
Good food. Family friendly. Good service. Only reason not a 5 star is because we were seated close to the walkway.

This little piece of Italian heaven reminds me of Superman. When you walk up the restaurant looks like any other jack in the box Italian restaurant. Then the food shows up and Clark Kent transforms into Superman. I had the Lasagna for dinner and if there had been enough room in the restaurant I would have done cartwheels. It was the second best Lasagna I have ever had which is saying a lot since I love lasagna. Then to top it off the cannoli was unbelievable. The others in my group all raved about the quality of the food along with the incredible flavors. This is great spot if you love Italian, oh did I mention they have real Italian waiters which adds to the enjoyment.
Really good Italian food.  The bread knots with garlic were yummy.  My husband had the spaghetti bolognese and I had a seafood pasta dish.  Both were very good.
Right now a big thumbs down. Our 20 minute wait has turned into 70 minutes.  Dear hostess learn how to judge time there are right now a good 20 angry people outside and pissed

This place is amazing! The food is so spectacularly fantastic! We had a wonderful waiter, Paulo (I believe). He was friendly and attentive. Did I mention how wonderful the food is? It really is and its fairly reasonably priced for the high quality of food received. Our table ordered lasagna, chicken marsala and quattro formaiga pizza. We didn't have a single complaint. In fact, it was funny how many sound effects we were all making (yum, oooo, ahhh). I can't recommend this place enough.

The wait was a little bit long. So we sat at the bar for a couple drinks. It was all just okay. After we finally got seated we decided to have the Meatballs! They were delicious, probably the best part of the experience. My boyfriend got the truffle Alfredo and it was 44$. I had a bite and it definitely was not worth the 44$. I would not come back here for anything in particular. The experience was just okay.

I really wish they would get some servers who had a sense of urgency. The last time we went i swore it off, but its right next to the movies. The food is really good. Ill either get a pizza or the veal chop parm on the bone. All the food is good but they have zero attention to detail and they are so slooooooooooooow. Last time was the worst. This time things started off well, appetizer came out quickly, food came fast too. Then it's just crickets. Sit sit sit sit.. I decided to walk around to find our waiter. No where to be found. I ask the hostess if she can locate him. She came back and said the guy is in the bathroom. I get it, guy has to go, but use ur head and ask someone to look after your tables if u r gonna be 20 mins. Finally, we got the check, i left 10 bux on 70 and a note telling them how slow they are. Im not going back anymore. It good food but not worth guarantees awful service.

My husband and I went here this past sunday we had a 530 reservation, it was not packed at all, The service was great, the food was great and our server Hilda was really nice.   Oh and real cannolis just like NY  yay   we will def be back

Portions were pretty good and their bread was amazing. The food was decent, but I kind of expected better from a restaurant at vegas.   My friends and I (party of 7) went and we ordered 5 items, the waiter was not pleased that we didn't each order a dish and gave us really nasty attitude as soon as he realized our appetite wasn't up to his expectations.
Stuff to try: Calamari and Lasagna. The garlic bread was great too! I will definitely come back for more.
Amazing food and service all around.  Everything tastes high quality and the portions are large.  Every time we go the food is equally delicious and the servers are attentive.  Will keep going back!
I went here because of the rating.  The place is not worth it.  The food was terrible, and it's very expensive for what they give you.  The waitress was the only good thing here.

Not that good. The service was great! The food was just okay. Really expensive for what you got. Had the mussels and they were fishy and still had some sand in them. The meatballs were a weird consistency. Just not that good. I will not be going back.  l

Great little Italian food restaurant!  I got the lobster ravioli and it was fantastic. The ravioli was huge.  Their pizza and garlic bread rolls were also very good, though the rolls were a little cold.  The service was fine, though the host was not as friendly as he could have been. He was a bit condescending when I didn't know how to pronounce the name of a pizza, and was quite unresponsive.  Our other server was great, though.

Beyond amazing! Eat here like ASAP everything you want in an Italian restaurant and perfect service too! Victor was our waiter and he was more than informative with amazing recommendations! We picked everything he suggested and it was perfect. It's awkward to find yelp's location in the corner of the property is wrong. You will have a small adventure through the Canal Shoppes to get to it, but persevere it is 100% worth it and follow he posted maps in the Venetian ;) portions are HUGE keep that in mind and share if necessary. Salad in a small will literally feed 3 if that helps for a reference. All the pasta dishes you could feed 2 on. Again, great service fast and never left our glasses empty! All around epic!

Let me begin with this: I spent 4 months studying abroad in Florence, Italy. I am extremely picky when it comes to eating at Italian restaurants, and I am highly critical when reviewing said restaurants.   Upon arriving, we were promptly seated and pleasantly greeted by our server. The service reminded me of what they offered back in Italia with the tables being out within the walkway of the Venetian itself. The tables were already set up with flowers,placemats, and silverware ready to go. I must say the environment and ambiance seemed to quite right to me.   After being seated, we were brought garlic bread that tasted pretty awesome. I ordered the chicken parmesan while my boyfriend went for the slightly more fattening veal parmasean. We opted out of ordering alcohol- they had a fairly extensive list that consisted of both domestic and imported choices- so that we could allocate our funds to dessert instead.   Our food came and was absolutely delicious. It wasn't dry but both our meats were tender and juicy. We had pasta and pasta sauce on the side, both of which did not overpower the veal and chicken. The sauce atop our meats too wasn't too much- just the perfect amount, along with the cheesy mozzarella slice.  We had to box the remainder of our meals, and order our cannoli to go, because we were stuffed to the brim. It's a good option though so you can return to your room, let your food settle, and enjoy a nice, romantic dessert later.  I would recommend this place if you are in the area. Sure, it's a little pricey, but it is well worth it. Great meals in Italy are not cheap; the same rule applies for the states. You won't be disappointed!

The food was delicious, we ate outside even though it was chilly. They kept the outside patio very warm for us and there was a live singer outside while we ate. This made the experience better and relaxing as well. The server was kind and efficient with our entrees. The dinner overall was pleasant.

I eat at many Trattoria's and Italian Restaurants so I was thinking "same old" as I perused the menu.  I ordered the Bone In Veal Parm as I had never seen Bone In - Wow.  Succulent, tender, and yummy bites by the bone with great cheese and sauce.  I was very pleased.  Their free bread is dough round like a sticky bun except loaded with cheese on top and a butter sauce poured over it - decadent.  My friend had the Clam linguine which was excellent - Little necks loaded with flavor and clams.

Been here before and had a good experience with one of the friendly bartenders. I guess that was our only lucky day here. Things went downhill fast this visit. This time was completely awful. It ruined my daughters birthday dinner! Very disappointed in how they OVER CHARGE for dietary restrictions or substitutions. Since when does it make sense to sub out prosciutto for broccoli florets for $5 charge? Well it was $5, and There were maybe 6 broccoli florets in the entire dish. Felt like I was being nickled and dimed. Had I known that they were importing the broccoli from Mars or blessed in holy water, I could've went to Trader Joe's across the way and brought my own to save money. Anyways, We ordered the gluten free version of penne ala vodka. This item comes with prosciutto. The server informed me I would not even be receiving anything close to the menu item that was already priced at $30. No vodka no prosciutto no pink sauce. So what was it that we were receiving? Still have no idea to this day. The server had such an attitude problem about everything from the start, we should've known it wasn't going to be a pleasant experience. We also put an order in for a Cesar salad as a starter no croutons. I asked if we could add onions to the salad. Insert eye roll from server here. She finished taking our order and walked away. Our salad arrived with our pasta, 30 mins later! The server made sure to bob and weave away from us as to not answer any of our questions. She did not want to come up with an explanation as to why it took 30 mins for a starter salad to arrive! The really nice busser was kind of enough to refill our waters and provide my 5 year old daughter with bread. My husband and I had our food come out before my daughters basic spaghetti with marina! Everyone knows you serve the kids food first before the adults, especially when it's simple pasta with marina already cooked in the back. Alas, our server was unaware of such hospitality. We flagged her down asking where our daughters food was, she said oh lemme check and never came back. The friendly busser came to the rescue with my daughters food. We finished our meal and asked for the check. We were shocked to see a $6 charge for gluten free pasta and a $5 charge for broccoli. We asked the server why so expensive if it's technically not penne ala vodka and substitute broccoli. She said that was policy. Wooooow. We then noticed a charge for $3. We asked what was this about? She said it was for the onions in the salad?!?!?! So you're telling me it was $4 to put 6 onion slices in a small cedar? Was it farmed to table in that very instance? In what universe is this acceptable? I've managed some high end restaurants and been bar manager at others, none of these "standards" would've been acceptable. Broccoli is nowhere near the price of prosciutto. Why would you charge someone for vodka sauce if they're not getting vodka sauce? She might as well charged me for a steak and said well it's the same thing. To round off the crap night, I had to ask the server 3 times if she could sing happy birthday to my daughter. She brought a cannoli with no candle or anything. She was too busy to even acknowledge my kid or smile at the very least. She set the plate before her and did not even try to light the candle. She just walked off! Two tables down it was someone else's birthday and what do you know? They had a wonderful server who got the whole restaurant to sing a joyous happy birthday to them and with a smile! Must've been a nice feeling. Explain to me why she's in the hospitality business again? Thanks for a horrible memory on a special day. Do not waste your time or money at this place unless you're a masochist and love flushing money down the drain. Go to the other Italian places in downtown summerlin or wolf gang puck. They always treat you with respect and never charge you extra.

A jewel in the Venetian you would miss if you weren't looking for it. I was so pleasantly surprised and pleased about the unstuffy vibe and focus on FOOD!   Read reviews about the filet mignon meatballs being the yummiest and juciest. So, of course I HAD to try 'em for myself as an app. Goodness, boy, do I ever agree. You could just eat the serving which comes with three meatballs and share an entree because these bad boys do their justice as a mini meal. The chef and owners of Trattoria Reggiano are not shy about their food. Oh, plus you are treated to homemade, soft garlic rolls as a starter. Mmmm.  A quaint and intimate restaurant, half the dining area is inside the tiny restaurant and half is out in front, what would typically be equated to the "sidewalk". I ate with my family in this latter area which I preferred because the inside seems a little tight.   Ok, on to the oh-so-tasty and al dente pasta entrees we all had. My linguini with clams in white sauce was so light and perfectly seasoned, and came with BIG, fresh clams! Family had the linguini carbonara and shrimp scampi. Sauteed in a buttered, olive oil sauce, the shrimp in the scampi was again, not a greedy amount. They were huge and fresh and not overdone.  The applewood smoked bacon pieces in the bolognese sauce for the carbonara really takes this dish to another level.  Service got better as the nice progressed but I can say see how others thought there was crankiness goin on. It's a tiny place and 2 waiters are pretty much doing everything. So, for that, couldn't give it a full 5 stars. But, i'd have to say that our waiter did warm up and took good care of us!! Highly recommend it!!

My fiancé had the Linguine with Clam Sauce and it was pretty good, but clams were a little overcooked. I had the Baked Ziti, and it was delicious! However, I thought it was a little funny that the pasta was actually penne not ziti. Unless ziti can be considered multiple types of pasta? News to me if that's the case.
Warm friendly service, inside the Venetian resort near the canal but not right on the water,  authentic busy atmosphere and fairly good food. We dined December 2014

I was really hoping to like this place. I had seen the one in the Venetian many times and it was always crowded. I now realize that that was filled with tourists, most likely one-time only patrons. The food here was kind of flat and monotonous. The marinara sauce is bland. This is a beautiful restaurant if a bit pretentious. I get a sense that this place is run by a heavy-handed egotistical owner or manager that cannot see-through to its problems. I watched the management while I was dining here, and they seemed stern and unaccommodating. Our waiter was very friendly, almost too much so. I will probably try it again, just in case I was there on a bad day. All in all however, I was disappointed.

A friend wanted to try this place, I was reluctant. I am SO GLAD that I said OK! Our dinner was really great.  I ordered the caesar and cheese tortellini....I know a little boring I was feeling "classic" (don't judge! LOL). The caesar was dressing was creamy and flavorful. I think the tortellini was homemade. Not sure if it was made right there, but either way tasted very homestyle! Yes, that is a good thing!  My friend had an Arugula Salad - It was SO SO SO good! (better than my caesar) and spaghetti carbonara. Delish as well.  For desert we had a piece of chocolate cake that was as big as my head! There you go, judging again! LOL....It was GOOD!!! And no, we did not even eat 1/2 of it! Although I wanted to!   Great place, and it can get busy because Downtown Summerlin is catching on as the new spot to go play and eat! If you are thinking a weekend night, I suggest making reservations

This tiny hole in the wall is easy to miss with all of the grand displays in Las Vegas.  We stopped here for dinner as part of a bachelorette celebration.  The service was really kind and friendly.  I was very happy with the attentiveness of the staff and how I was treated.  The food was good.  Not great, but the cost to taste ratio is good.  And in an over priced town that is a tough find.  I got the gnocchi pesto and I enjoyed it very much.  The rest of my group was in love with the bread knots they served with dinner.  Over all it was a positive experience.

Wow. First time and last time. Reservations for 6:45. Seated at 7:30. Service was terrible. I ordered primavera pizza. Soggy and tasteless. Sent it back and ordered Bolognese. Husband ordered Scampi. Pasta undercooked and tasteless. Shrimp were ok. Terrible experience. A lady came in with a dog that sat in a chair and we overheard this was a lady with the owner. Wow.

Amazing old school italian food!!! Back to the basics, no fancy reworked recipes, just good old Italian food!!! The meatballs are 100% ground up filet mignon ... OMG good!  The only reason I don't give this place 5 stars is bc it's soooo small.
The food is delicious, the prices reasonable, the service friendly. Get the Bruschetta Pizza or the ziti. We go here everytime we go to Vegas. A perfect spot for a solid lunch.

My boyfriend and I ate here and it was delish!  We were seated quickly and the service was prompt.  I got the spaghetti with  filet mignon meatballs and they were delicious!  I don't think that any other meatball is going to ever compare to those!  I would highly recommend them.  My boyfriend got the calamari and normally I don't care for them - but these calamaris were good.  I would recommend this restaurant to a friend.

Great food, pizza  drinks amd service Moscow Mule was excellent and Garlic bread appatizer / olives awesome!!.. I had eggplant Parmesan which was good but the sauce was very Sweet boarding on A Chef Boyardee vibe!! The entertainment and outdoor patio is a nice bonus at DTS.. Hey Trattoria please just overhaul your red sauce and you got the 5th star!!

Ironically none of us had pasta, but we did have Filet Mignon Giambotto,Veal Milanese, Spinach Salad, Filet Mignon Meatballs.  Meatballs were wonderful.  Tender and melt in your mouth goodness.  Warm spinach salad was great.  Loved the pecans and goat cheese.  Veal was good too.  Tender inside and crispy breading; lots of arugula on top.  The filet was great too.  Just one thing, it appears there were jalapenos or something that was really hot.   Did see green pepper like bits in the dish.  Not sure what was really hot so was surprised because we didn't think this was going to be a hot dish.  Overall, loved this place.  Service was top notch.  I'd like to come back to try the pasta.

A nice place to eat if you are wandering around the Venetian. Not one that I would personally seek out if I wasn't already on the property.   We got a Caesar salad and a pepperoni pizza. Crust is nice and thin. Pizza isn't cheap, but it was definitely delicious. Caesar salad was heavily overdressed, and I don't think they make their dressing from scratch.  Yes, they serve a garlicky house bread... while I love bread and find it a critical element at a nice restaurant, I wouldn't quite spooge my pants over theirs, but you be the judge.
Food was great!  First time here...quick bite in between showing homes today...Joli and I split a chicken parm sandwich...perfect for 2.  Our server Ricki was great!  Thank you!

My first review of this restaurant was in October after we went with some friends and everything was delicious.  Well not so this time.  While the service was good it was not as good as last time.  Last time they brought out a plate of cheese, roasted peppers and red, green and black olives that were fantastic.  This time there was only one of those green olives on the plate and when I asked the waiter for the more and for the other colors he found a few more green ones and said that was all there were which I find hard to believe.  Last time the garlic knots were wonderful.  This time they were very doughy and undercooked although very brown on top.  I had the same meal, baked ziti and while last time it was delicious this time I could hardly eat it.  The other meals were just ok.  Nothing to rave about like our last visit.  Towards the end of our meal they sat a very large party behind us although there really wasn't enough room and the waitress kept bumping into me every time she had to get through.  At one point she told me I needed to move my chair in.  If we were not getting ready to leave I definitely would have said something.  I also think that either the prices went up or they have a higher priced menu because it is during the holidays but I can tell you that we probably will not be going back there.

Went here for lunch and although it doesn't have a view of the canal it felt like a cafe in Italy with people watching from where patio table. We ordered Caesar salads, eggplant rollatini, and meatballs. We are still hungover and didn't feel like drinking but probably wine would have been nice. They gave us homemade rolls that you dipped in high-quality olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Very professional waitstaff and the food was delicious and prepared beautifully.

Never really experiencing Las Vegas done right and from eating most of my meals in Vegas at places off the strip, like dim sum at Ping Pang Pong.. I was excited to eat something at a touristy place.    Loving Italian food and all things pasta, I couldn't wait to be seated at this place.  We chose to sit in the not-so-outdoor dining area to people watch and enjoy the 'view'.    When our server came along he seemed to be nice enough as he took our drink orders first.  While waiting for him to come back to take our actual food orders another duo came and sat in the next table beside us.  He proceeded to take their drink orders and walked past our table even when we tried to flag him down.  As we waited for our drinks to come he once again passed us while chatting away with a fellow server.  WTF?  Finally giving up I decide to use the restroom while I tell my friend to order for me in case that husky slob of a waiter finally decides to come to our table.     When I get back surprisingly my friend has ordered for the both of us and even has his coke he ordered, however my glass of water is no where to be seen.  The other table who came in and ordered after us has both of their drink orders as well as some bread on the table.  20 minutes have passed and we only have one drink and no bread.   We wait another 10 minutes and I still don't have my damn water or any bread and by that time I'm starving.  While during the whole time our incompetent server is leaning at the bar chatting away.    Who the fuck hired this fool?  In the end we ask another server for a refill on my friend's coke, once we get it we proceed to walk out with glass of coke in hand.  I bet the imbecile didn't even realize we left and came to the empty table with both entrees.    I would come again, just because I've heard the food is pretty good, but if moron ends up being my waiter again, I'll be sure as hell to throw a bitch fit with management and insist I have someone else.

this place impressed me so much. all the waiters are Italians, and they are all very nice, polite, and funny!! i've been craving for real italian food, so i yelped and accidentally found this place. i love how this place is so small, so they can keep the qualify of their food and service. you can tell this place is authentic italian from their aglio e olio and their tiramisu. it is the kind of italian that i've always been looking for. i'm surprised that i can find it on the trip to vegas with my family.

Great service from Ricki, even better food. Be sure to order the calamari. The garlic knots hint at how good their pizza must be. Penne ala vodka had a great, subtile guiancale flavor to it. The Linguine with the white clam sauce was perfectly seasoned in a slightly thick bodied sauce of deep complexity. The clams, in shell, were ocean fresh, impeccably clean and plentiful. The linguine was prepared perfectly al dente. Service was like a light breeze, barely noticeable, but just there and appreciated. Consider re training your hostess, as we requested a quiet table and she attempted to seat us in front of the restroom!

We like simple dishes especially Pasta. I love the margarita pizza and aglio olio pasta. Service is good and you don't have to wait very long for the food. The cappuccino is expensive and some of the dishes are a little over priced  but this is Vegas.

Tried this place for the first time last night and I liked it. We were seated outside so it was a little chilly, but at least they had the heaters to make up for it. Their garlic bread is delicious and is a great way to start your meal. I had the chicken francese and really enjoyed it. The chicken was cooked right and it was tender and juicy, while the pasta was alright. It's pretty awesome that they have a live performer as well when I went. I can see this place as a great place to go for a date night.

I have worked at the Venetian|Palazzo for 8 years, and eaten at almost every restaurant here. I can honestly say that Trattoria Reggiano is my favorite. It's got a classic Italian vibe to it, and its location inside the Grand Canal Shoppes makes it a great place to people watch. The food is always perfectly prepared, and I've always had great service (tonight Eric was my server, he's Fantastic!).  If you come to the Venetian|Palazzo, you must try this place!

Stopped in for dinner recently and had some first impressions. The atmosphere is warm and inviting. The ambience was bustling but not loud. There was a guy singing pretty good covers on the patio but not loud as to impede normal conversation. We sat at the bar and the bartender was very friendly and helpful with the menu. I ordered a glass of pinot grigio, a caprese salad and spaghetti carbonara. The wine was dry and crisp, perfect for what I wanted. The salad came out first. Large everything; tomato slices, basil leaves and a ball of fresh mozzarella the size of a billiard ball. The tomatoes were as you would expect in the winter, the cheese was divine. Overall above average for the salad. The spaghetti carbonara was exquisite. Flavors, textures and smells all worked together to produce a fine dish I would order often. Good ambience, great food and friendly staff all come together extremely well. Highly recommend.

Really pleasantly surprised,  that's why I gave this place 4 stars.  This restaurant is located right on the fringe of the "food court" area.  The location leads one to think it's going to be very "bleh" experience.     The average service was what I expected but the food was much more delicious than expected. The garlic bread was great,  the carbonara was amazing, and the spaghetti was excellent.    Honestly, this place was better than Rao's at Caesars Palace and much cheaper too.

Fantastic restaurant in an informal friendly atmosphere. Food sensational.  Everything made to order. Great cocktail menu. All entrees made to order. Veal chop amazing, mussels in white sauce fabulous? Cant say enough good things. Great red sauce and meat balls.  Pasta sensational.  So was the broccoli Rob.  Their manager, Wendy, a pleasure to work with.  Friendly, came over to the table to make sure everything was alright. 5 stars.  Highly recommend! Mike and Beverly, Henderson

Went back again on this trip. And if I thought the lobster ravioli was delicious I was even more impressed with the Penne with Vodka sauce and prosciutto. So unbelievable!!!  Can't wait for my next trip to Vegas so we can come back!

Pork was great. Good experience but not over the top. Not sure why a 3-star but I am comparing it to other experiences that were 4-star. Perhaps it's the cost/experience factor that lead me to this rating.
Great family owned restaurant. Real Italians and real pasta. Al dente to perfection!! Great service too. Will return!
Best Italian food on the strip! The carbonara is great! Not too heavy, just perfect! Calamari is good. However is service is the best!!!

What a major disappointment!  I ordered penne primavera and it was served sitting in warm water. There was no flavor at all.  I pointed it out to the waiter, who replaced it, and also had it taken off the bill.  The replacement was ok, but not flavorful enough to bring me back.  I truly wonder if the food quality is dependent on who is in the kitchen.  The reviews go from 5 stars to "blah". I also ordered the kale peanut salad which was too acidic for my taste.  The two stars are only for the waiter, "Giovanni" who I would give five stars, but I don't want anyone to think it is for the food.  I think management needs to do a better job on what leaves the kitchen and goes to the table.

Went here last night for dinner- we wanted Italian and the other restaurants had to long a wait.  The service and food was very good.  The location should have overlooked the gondolas- I think.  The foot traffic because of the shops could be a bit much. Wife was reluctant to eat here because of that.  Each had a glass of wine, split an appetizer and a plate of pasta each. $80.  Sorta pricy, but it's Vegas and your paying for eating on the strip.

This place was delicious, especially compared to everything I had consumed this past weekend in Vegas... it had to have been one of the best meals I had during my trip. However, know that I had food at 7am like a crackhead without sleep, room service, nasty sushi and crawfish...   I ordered the Linguine with shrimp and my company ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. Both yummy dishes and totally affordable on a Vegas budget.   Also, the service wasn't bad! I read reviews here about the bad service, but our server was great!
Walking away after standing at the hostess station for 3 mins while being stared at by the kitchen staff and not seated or acknowledged.   Guess they don't want our business.

We are visiting from out of town and this was our first experience at Trattoria restaurant and we truly loved it.  The food was excellent, between the 4 of us we had lasagna, swordfish, shrimp scampi and chicken with noodles.  The waiter, Sergio and manager Dora treat all their customers like special guests down to every detail.  We will definitely be dining here again.

My cousin is in town visiting so I got to have a nice staycation since I love in Vegas. We were craving some "good" Italian food so decided to try Trattoria Reggiano based on other Yelp reviews. I must say they more than exceeded my expectations! Every single server who we came in contact with had a smile on their face & a pleasant voice. I asked one of the servers of he could recommend one of their red wines by the glass. He said he could & would be right back. He returned with 3 wine bottles, gave me tastes of each,  & allowed me to choose which one I preferred. I greatly appreciated this! I then asked about bread & he came back with the most amazing garlic knots! Oh wow! Lastly our meals were delicious. My cousin had the chicken marsala, which she said was wonderful & I had the cappollini pomodoro. The tomato sauce was full of flavor, not just tomato. Everything about our meal was completely satisfying. I cannot wait to go to their restaurant in Downtown Summerlin now!!! YUM!!!

In the meandering maze of mercantilism that is the shops and restaurants and kiosks of the Venetian's Grand Canal is hidden a very nice Italian gem.  Although not easy to find, once there you will find a very cute, mom and pop vibe eatery with tables extending out into the walking area.  Depending on the time of year and body mass index of those strolling the shops, this can be good people watching or good impetus to cut down on portions eaten.  We arrived and were immediately seated by a quiet, older gentleman with what seemed to be an old world accent.  The orders, food, and flow continued seamlessly sand resulted in a very satisfying dining experience.  The Good: Cute atmosphere.  If you prefer not to be on display in the walkway while you eat, sit inside and enjoy a cute kind of deli feel. The bread they bring with the meal tasted fresh, hot, and garlicky/buttery like good bread should.  Our waiter was very kind about accommodating our individual requests ("no ma'am I'm afraid the kitchen does not have any fettucine pasta today, but the tortellini is excellent with the alfredo sauce" and "I'm sure we can substitute the puttanesca sauce with your Chicken Parmesan"), and his helper kept our drinks filled. Everything flowed nicely from start to finish.  The tortellinni alfredo was good as advertised.  They used the large pillow style pasta that I normally associate with ravioli, but they were cooked perfectly.  The sauce relied heavily on butter for it's flavor, but then it's alfredo.  If you want diet food, order sliced fruit. My Chicken Parm had nice flavor and the breading was not as thick and KFC-like as I have had at many spots recently (although sometimes that heavy fried/batter thing can be a guilty pleasure.) They were nice enough to make my side of spaghetti with the puttanesca sauce instead of the normal pomodoro which makes me a fan from jump.  I'm going to give the puttanesca a 7/10 just because I like a little stronger garlic flavor and more fresh basil ribbons, but that is just my quirkiness.  Did I mention the great bread?  The Bad: Nothing.  The Mediocre:  Getting to the bathrooms to wash your hands before the meal requires navigating about 4 right turns and not missing the passage off top the side, but then that was my experience of the whole Venetian Grand Canal Shopping area itself.   Overall:  Nice Italian food, in a difficult to find location, but still well worth the effort.

The service was top notch. No complaints there - our drinks were always filled and my brother took his last sip of his beer just as the waiter asked if he'd like another. Really on top of things. However... The prices they charge for their food is a little ridiculous. I got the chicken parm and while it was good it was just your regular chicken parm, not worth the $26. The salmon my mom got was dry and flavorless. The pesto gnocchi my sister got was super bland. The pizza my brother got was good but didn't really have much to it in terms of flavor. The entire meal was definitely over priced. They had an Italian band playing too. And his voice was nice, but it was really too loud. We can barely talk to each other without screaming. It kinda threw it all off. Maybe it would be a better ambience for a one on one date? But not for a family. We won't be back, unfortunately.

We have been here three times and all three times I have been very disappointed.  The service is great but the seafood dishes have been very disappointing!  The first time I ordered linguini and clams. at least six clams didn't open and the sauce was bland and flavorless and the clams had a very fishy taste and smell.  They did give me additional clams but half of them had broken shells that led me to believe they took the ones that didn't open and just broke the shells to get the clams out. I didn't eat them because if a clam shell doesn't open on its own it is because the clam is already dead and who knows how long it has been dead.  Second time there I had the shrimp scampi. The shrimp were not over cooked but they were stuffed!?  The breading they were stuffed with were soaking in oil.  There was no delightful garlic/wine sauce it was just butter and stuffing.  So I removed the stuffing and ate the six or seven shrimp.  The third time I ordered the shrimp and linguini in their red sauce.  The shrimp tasted very fishy again and the red sauce was utterly bland! It was extremely disappointing.    My husband had their veal parmesan and said it was good except that the veal wasn't pounded down and the thickness was a little off-putting and a too thick breading covered the veal.  He also had, on another visit, their carbonara and he liked it a lot and on our third visit he had the baked ziti and thought it was very good but the meatballs were  horrible.  Our friend had the lobster ravioli in a pink sauce.  The pink sauce had a very mild flavor and he said it was okay.  The garlic knot bread is good and the service is good.  The manager or owners ask you how everything is and we always say it's good but I just don't like to make negative remarks in front of their customers so this review is more for them and I just pray the read it.    We love everything about the restaurant but the seafood dishes need a major overhaul and they need to remake their meatball recipe.

This place was awesome. Its very tiny- only about 5 tables inside and then a more tables outside in the venetian.  We got the arugula salad which was very fresh and simple, the pasta e fagioli soup which was very light and scrumptious.  All the food seemed to have been made very authentically. My sister had the swordfish, my mom- the linguine bolognese, and I- the spaghetti alili e olio.  Everything was really good. The best thing about this place was our server- an older Italian man who was so accomodating. We wanted wines by the glass that were not on the "wine by the glass  list" and he said, you can do whatever you want. I thought that was really nice of him.   Cool ambience, great food, and great service.
Food was good but service was terrible. Took over an hour to get our food. I don't suggest coming here unless you have three hours of spare time to eat a half decent italian meal.

A friend of mine recommended this place to me. I was hesitant at first, but then just decided to try it out. I was very pleased. I went with my husband and our 9 yr old son. I had the Gnocci al Pesto and...OH. MY. GOD. It was so delicious. My husband had the Baked Ziti with Meatballs - it looked do good, I had to taste it. Oh the cheesy goodness! And my son had the pepperoni pizza - normal 9 yr old boy food. He loved it too! He ate more than half of it which is a miracle in itself, because he's not a big eater. Our server, Theresa was very nice and very pleasant. The restaurant is small and quaint but felt authentic and welcoming. We couldn't have been happier with our experience, and will definitely be returning soon...especially since it is our new favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. I even like it more than Maggiano's.

This restaurant has great food, great service and great ambiance. I love the garlic knots instead of bread. Our server was nice and funny. I love the open kitchen and the classy decor throughout the restaurant. My food was delicious. The chocolate cake is AMAZING!

Nice restaurant, very good service. Food was good. Pizza seems to be their best menu item. Garlic knots were very good. Baked ziti was good. Portion sizes are decent. Surprisingly, filet meatballs weren't as good as I thought they would be - caprese was presented nicely but lacking in flavor.

Came her for dinner after a family friend's wedding. I ordered the "your way" with strawberry. Had to send it back since it was awful, but I got the Italian sangria. It was much better. I ordered the swordfish. Freakin delicious. My bf ordered the chicken parmigiana. It was tasty, but there was nothing special about it. Other people at our table ordered the lasagna (said it was the best Italian food they've ever had), linguine bolognese (couldn't stop chowing down) and the linguine in clam sauce (said the clams were delightful. All-in-all a great experience. Very kind and attentive staff.

Cute cafe style restaurant across from Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf at the Venetian. Expect friendly staff and cramped seating. The pizzas are great, I specially enjoyed the veggie one. We also had the clam vongole which offered a handsome portion of seafood over perfectly cooked pasta. Great to see many Europeans eating here!

The original Trattoria Reggiano location inside the Venetian is pretty popular, and has had a 4 star average for as long as I can remember. So, when we first arrived to this new second location, it wasn't too shocking to hear we'd have a little bit of wait (30-45 minutes) even on a Sunday at 7pm. But it wasn't until nearly an hour and fifteen minutes later that we walked in and got seated on the patio of what might be the smallest restaurant in Downtown Summerlin.   Up until we got seated, there had only been one other party that put there name down to wait. In the time that we waited the place really started to clear out, and shortly after we got seated, there was only a handful of tables sat. The place was pretty much dead. But for whatever reason, a table of about 6 people had the whole staffs attention. They had been there the whole time we waited for a table, and were there during our whole meal. Obviously either very close friends, or family of someone associated with the restaurant. Food was coming out to them in waves, and nearly every staff member was waiting on them hand and foot. It took 20 minutes just for our waiter to come over after being sat, and throughout the meal, it didn't improve. Drinks and food took forever to come out, we had to ask for refills multiple times, and the guy seemed to barely know the menu. To put it lightly, the service sucked. Even if every waiter here was new, this restaurant has enough experience that they shouldn't have untrained staff, or even crappy service in general.   When it comes to the menu, it looks like it's pretty much exactly the same as the original location. They have a variety of classic Italian dishes, some pizza, seafood, etc. Pricing doesn't seem to be any different, and is about average for this style of Italian restaurant.   We were brought out an order of complimentary garlic knots. The flavor was actually pretty good and they had good texture, but holy friggin' grease. These things felt like they were made and then just rolled in oil. They also brought a little pepper, olive and cheese tray. It was okay, but I'm glad I didn't pay for either. Not really an impressive start.  I had pretty much already made up my mind on what I was going to order before we even came here. The filet meatballs sound good, and usually get great reviews. So, I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. The noodles were cooked well, obviously not hand made or anything, but decent. What really let me down was the meatball. I'd say mentioning filet mignon in the title is just a way to sucker you into ordering them. If there is filet mignon in them, the amount is so little it's impossible to taste. They really just taste like straight up pork meatballs with no seasoning. At $14 for an appetizer order of meatballs, and $18 for the spaghetti and meatballs, there should be no doubt that filet mignon is in them. Their supposed house made pomodoro sauce is alright, but this is far from an $18 plate.  At this point, I was done and not even thinking about trying their dessert. But most of my table wanted dessert, and oddly enough, it was the best thing about this place. Sort of. They have a "homemade" chocolate cake that looks just like the garbage Claim Jumper serves, so I passed on trying that. Their tiramisu was excellent though, and really was the saving grace of the night. I'd literally come back just for that, and would likely try the ricotta cheesecake too.  Maybe I expected too much...but with a pretty dang successful restaurant, in the Venetian of all places, I thought TR would have a lot more to offer. Long waits, horrible service, and below average food just wasn't what I had hoped for.

Absolutely fabulous food!!!!! Must eat here when in Vegas. We will be back. Excellent service and our waiter, Eric, was very knowledgeable and had great recommendations for pairings of dishes and wines. We had the lobster ravioli, spaghetti and meatballs, and tortellini. The tortellini was out of this world!!!  A must eat!!

We came to Vegas for 4 nights and we had such a good meal here our first night that we came back for our last! So yummy! They even accommodated my special requests, no extra charge and no funny faces for not ordering directly off the menu. I can't rave enough. The wine list is superb, the pasta is fresh and the service is excellent! We will be back for sure!!!

I don't even know where to begin. There is nothing better than good food and even better service. The filet mignon meatballs are a must! We ordered these based off other yelp reviews and were not disappointed. The food was authentic, flavorful, the pastas are cooked to perfection and the service here sets the standard for all great restaurants to follow.   Id like to give a shoutout to Eric, our server, who was personable, funny, attentive and fun. His recommendations are great and he gives exceptional service.   HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Do not come here unless you want to be intimidated and made to feel stupid.   I give this establishment 0 stars but Yelp won't allow me to give less than 1 star.  I came here tonight (December 24) for our first meal with my mother after we arrived in Vegas. I found a killer vacation deal over the Xmas holiday and thought why not do something different this year. Anyways,  I found this restaurant on Yelp (like most restaurants I visit while out of town). It had great reviews and I was also very excited to try the buttery buns Yelpers raved about.  My experience here was terrible. I have never felt so unwelcomed and ridiculed. The buttery buns arrived at our table with a bottle of balsamic vinegar and olive oil. I asked our middle aged Italian server if I could have another plate to pour the EVOO and vinegar in. He flat out told me "this is not how we eat our bread. Use the same plate you have". I was completely floored and just looked at him. I guess he realized that wasn't a good answer. He then grabbed a side plate from the empty table near me and pretty much threw it on the table. The underlying tone of his comment was condescending and made me feel like the way I like to eat my bread was completely irrational. I should have asked him who this "we" is. I didn't know a oil and vinegar police existed.  Our server then ignored us while being attentative to all neighboring patrons. I was quite peeved and blurted out loudly- "the service here is TERRRIBLE" so that all my neighboring patrons could hear me and also conveniently while he was serving them. This quickly changed how he treated us. He quickly came over and asked me how the pizza was. I said "it's OK", then he has the audacity to say "it's ONLY OK?". There was no underlying joke behind his comment. I just ignored his comment and he left.   We quickly finished our meal and asked our busser to send the bill. I paid, leaving a 5% tip (the bussers shouldn't be punished, even though they only get a small cut of the tip).   On my way out I flagged down the manager, a middle aged Italian woman, and told her the situation. The first thing she says is "what do you want from this?", as thought she thought I was expecting a comped meal. I said "nothing, I already paid and am not happy with the service". She then defended our server saying that he is very good and that I misinterpreted him and that he was probably joking. I was thinking in my head what a joke THIS IS. No wonder service is so bad when management can't set an example of basic customer service and makes the customer feel stupid. I told the manager we are leaving since this was hopeless. The manager then clues in and says "let's discuss this with the server and have him apologize to you." I declined and she told me to come back tomorrow and she will make sure we "get served right". No thank you and we walked away.   Do yourself a favor and don't eat here.  There are plenty of other delicious Italian choices on the strip which provide excellent or even decent service and good food.
Wow! Pesto was GREAT! But for $22 I don't think so. If you want something a little better than Olive Garden COME! But also CHEAP ALCOHOL

While waiting on friends and deciding what to eat the first night in Vegas, our friends in our group recommended this restaurant. Take the escalator in the Palazzo forum, above the waterfall, and it's not hard to find, but it's a small restaurant. Even though they have additional seating out in the corridor/walkway, you're there for the food. If you come during rush hour for dinner, be prepared to wait depending on how large your party is. We had 6 and it took us about 45 min - 1 hr. Wait was totally worth it for the following reasons:  1) They serve hot fresh bread, garlic olive oil bread with option of dipping in balsamic  vinegar and olive oil  2) The portions are filling and very affordable for Las Vegas prices - $16 - $30ish for entrees (I recommend the pasta)  3) Service is attentive and they speak Italian (great sign for an Italian restaurant)  I personally had the Linguine with Shrimp Marinara and it was the highlight meal of the trip. I would love to take a date to this restaurant or a small group of friends. It's not the most romantic environment, but the food is delicious!

I leave very few reviews as you can see...  THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!!  Every part of it from the garlic bread that starts the dinner to full bellies after perfect lasagna, the best kale salad you'll ever eat and crisp/light calamari...and so much more...  This place is legit.  Every time we go to vegas this is our ritual. Run, don't walk to this joint. :)

Love this place!!! We were visiting Las Vegas for 4 days and ended up eating at Trattoria Reggiano 4 times! One day we ate lunch that was so good we went back for dinner. From the spaghetti and meatballs, tortellini and cream sauce and lasagna to the cannoli you can't go wrong! If it would never embarrassed my wife I would've licked my plate. No matter what Italian restaurant we go to. I always compare our food to the Trattoria Reggiano and it never matches up! We will be going back many many times!

Alright, decided to try this place out before seeing 'O'.  Here are my thoughts:  The bread was ok, I guess I was hyped up by the yelp reviews and let down once I got there.  The bread reminded me of the garlic knots at Sbarros, or the crazy bread at little caesars..lol and it was a bit worse because it wasnt even warm/hot.  So, I guess if i wasnt all hyped up by reviews, i wouldnt have been disappointed.  Either way, it was just ok.  I had the chicken parm and my husband had the chicken fresca (something like that).  We both enjoyed our meals.  My husband ate his and then finished mine.  I dont really think there is anything special about this place above and beyond major italian places like Maggianos.  Overall, good food, tasty, would come back, but nothing to write home about.  Oh! and the seating was kinda strange out in the open.  Maybe if they had some of those movie theatre ropes there would feel like some separation between you and the women with the baby in the stroller walking by...
Try to eat here last night since it got good reviews. Just letting you know the place is CLOSED. They are expanding!
This place a excellent! The spaghetti and meatballs were the best I have ever had. The staff were very nice and helpful. My husband and I both enjoyed the food and we will definitely be back again!

We always saw this place while staying at the Venetian.  Decided to stop by when we saw some tables available; and let me tell you: we were not disappointed! Small place, but very delicious food!  The staff is very courteous and attentive.  The pizza Marguerite: nice and crispy crust, very good tomato sauce and cheese.  The spaghetti and meatballs: mmmm delicious! The linguine carbonara: very tasty and yummy.  Will definitely recommend it and come back to eat.
One of my favorite places to eat lunch in Downtown Summerlin. Rikki is always so attentive and friendly. She knows what I like to eat, and how I like it prepared. Always a great experience.

Yummy!  The garlic bread and the Chicken Parmesan very really good.  The Pizza primavera, I have had better, it wasn't comparable to the other dishes we had.  Pricey, as expected from a restaurant at Venetian with ambiance and all.  Would recommend to eat.

Happened to be in Las Vegas again with family who had never dined here so I told them they had to try it.  We made a reservation although it didn't look like we needed one for as early as we had dinner.  We had the meatballs for an appetizer and actually had to order a 2nd portion because we devoured the first order.  I had the linguine bolognese for dinner and it was phenomenal.  My dad had linguine with clam sauce and really enjoyed it.  My mom had a pizza and said it was the best she'd had since we got back from Italy.  My aunt had the eggplant parmesan and said it was outstanding.  Our food was superb, service was great.  My aunt actually wanted to go here again the following night but didn't want to walk all the way back to the Venetian.  Going to this restaurant is my favorite part about coming to Vegas!  You can't go wrong eating here!

Recommend:  Tortellini Alfredo: was my favorite last time and it's still good. Cheesy on the inside with the middle just perfection.  Spaghetti and meatballs: I looked at my friend with a face that said " really?!" But it turned out to be so good. Definitely will get again.   Service as always was excellent. Once again I had john who took care of us. Very friendly. One of those servers with the kind of great personality that is hard to find.   Restaurant has expanded since the last time I came. PROMISING!   Other items:  Latte: my friend ordered this. Very coffee taste.  I like my things sweet. My friend loved the taste though. Probably more recommended for those who prefer black coffee (but not too harsh)

One of the new additions to the Downtown Summerlin dining scene. The dining room is nicely decorated with warm colors and is brightly lit. The outdoor patio has comfortable seating and  has some privacy from the adjacent foot traffic. Ceiling fans and overhead heaters make this a year round venue. Our party of four chose the patio on this evening. We were seated immediately and welcomed by several staff members. Our server Amanda was attentive and helpful. She had a up beat attitude and I felt that she was truly interested in providing us with great service. Amanda along with her associates  followed up throughout the meal.  The complementary dinner rolls with bottles of olive oil and balsamic vinegar were provided  for the table. We ordered the Filet Mignon Meatballs as a starter. The three large meatballs were plenty for sharing. The shaved Parmigiano Reggiano was offered as a topping. Four different entrees were ordered. Eggplant Parmigiana was  layered in traditional pomodoro sauce and lots of melted mozzarella. The Chicken Caesar Salad included several large pieces of grilled chicken. The Lobster Ravioli was topped with shrimp, sauteed in a pink sauce and white wine. The ravioli pillows just melted in your mouth and the shrimp were tender and juicy. The Chicken Francese was a breast sauteed in lemon-white wine sauce and a touch of butter served with spaghetti. Both the Eggplant and Chicken Francese were especially large and resulted in some to take home. All of the entrees were cooked perfectly to our satisfaction. Freshly shaved Parmigiano Reggiano was also offered as a topping for the entrees. Two desserts were ordered for sharing. Ricotta cheese cake was moist with a long lasting cheese flavor. The tiramisu is served in a goblet with two sticks of cookies. The saucer on which the goblet sits has drizzled caramel sauce. The location of the caramel adds eye appeal but scooping it up is not easy. I would rate the tiramisu as just OK.  One note on the restrooms. A restaurant this size should have more than one restroom. As I waited in line a server mentioned that there is a public restroom next door to the restaurant. The woman behind me decided to check it out but she returned to say the line at that one was longer.

This had many good reviews so decided to check it out. The service was friendly but very slow and forgetful. When the food came- we ordered the veal Marsala special- it was very bland. One of us ordered the baked ziti with the same response. Nothing here to write home about.

Came in for lunch. We ordered Pasta Fagioli soup. This is my favorite soup and this was by far the best I ever ate.  I  then had Spaghetti Aglio E Olio and surprisingly (I felt) was a very small portion but it was very flavorful. I had a side of meatballs  which consisted of 2 nice size meatballs. Everyone has their own preference of how a meatball should be made/taste  and to me these were perfect! My husband had chicken parmigiana with spaghetti and the chicken was huge.  He said it was good. Our server was Ricki and she was great. Though quite expensive.....$70.00 for lunch! (no dessert, no drinks except for one soda) we enjoyed the food and service.

The food was delicious, the service was awesome, the prices were a little too much in our opinion.   I also do not agree with restaurants that charge for gluten free options. Being gluten free for some isn't just some fad diet. They charge $5 for gluten free options. It's not fair for those who have no choice in being gluten free. That's why I gave 3 stars.

We were walking back to hotel when we passed this small Italian restaurant and decide to eat there especially when we saw other customers food which appeared to be appetizing. The offered fresh garlic bread, which was delicious! We ordered the calamari which was really good yet bad for you because it was fried. The texture of the calamari was soft, well seasoned and hot. The shrimp scampi portion was huge. Depending how you like your pasta some like it with some flavor but I like my pasta with flavor. I guess the only good part of this is that they didn't use that much butter! :) The shrimp however was perfect not over cooked, nicely stuffed and well seasoned. We also had the Salsiccia pizza which was delicious. It's a pretty small restaurant that serves pretty good food. But when the employees speak Italian you kind of know the food is legit.

Best place in downtown summerlin for food quality! The place is small but it's nice!   All the items we ordered were fresh and tasted amazing! We will travel here even if no plans at DT summerlin...recommend for everyone!  I recommend a reservation due to the lack of size

This was a pretty solid Italian restaurant in the Venetian! It's a smaller restaurant and I believe that is why the service was on point. Some of these bigger restaurants in Vegas are not dishing out good service. We walked in around 8:30 with no reservations and got seated right away. I took a look at the specials menu and as soon as I read Cavatelli, with turkey sausage and broccoli rabe I was sold. Cavatelli is my favorite pasta and it's something that you may have a hard time finding on menus. They also bring you complementary garlic knots. These knots were so warm and covered in Parmesan cheese. They give you really nice portions so you will not leave hungry. Portions are important to me. If you are spending big money on a pasta dish there better be lots of pasta to go around. Our Italian server was my favorite too! He was very tentative and even brought out a cannoli for dessert. Cannolis are the way to my heart and this was probably one of the best cannolis I have ever had.

The food here was very nice and the service was second to none. But never order a glass of wine you will only get a quarter glass at $11 for a Zinfandel. Not good. And the food also is a little high someone has to tell them that they are not on the strip. This is my second time there and I will return after I get a loan from the bank. LOL. Give it a try just bring a little extra cash. The first time I came here I love it and still do. I just don't remember it so pricey.

We stopped in to the restaurant with my wife and two small girls (5 & 9 years old) on our family vacation. We were not sure what to expect, but it was one of the best meals we have ever had.
