First, the staff was very friendly. Our server could not have been nicer. Also, everyone who stopped by our table with food or drinks were very nice as well. So great with our kids. Our server suggested a nice bottle of wine which was amazing, yet reasonably priced. My wife and I had salads while the staff brought the kids out fresh blueberries to eat while we waited for our food. In addition, they also brought out the most AMAZING garlic knots I have ever had. They were almost like garlic muffins with butter and garlic...WOW!  Our dinner was great. I had spaghetti with the filet mignon meatballs which was very tasty. My wife had a delicious vegi pizza. Kids has basic pasta which they ate up quickly. Overall, just and amazing meal. I really wish we lived closer so we could dine at this restaurant all the time. Great food, good prices and kid friendly...what could be better. I highly suggest restaurant and can wait to visit when I am in Vegas again.

Went here after reading the good reviews. That was not a good decision. The food was only Ok. Not bad, but not the quality I would have expected.  The rolls were not warm which I would think they should be with the garlic and all. One was flat out cold.   The server was horrible. Didn't seem to care that we existed. I asked if there was a special and he just shouted to a coworker and came back with basically "brocoli and something." I had to finally flag him down just to ask for the check.   Would not recommend.

I've been here twice. First time I had the spaghetti and meatballs, and the latter was supposed to be filet mignon, so it was tender and juicy. One of the best meatballs I have had. Second time, 11 months later, I had carbonara. I don't think it is traditionally made, as in the cream seemed to thick to me, and the pork did not seem like guincale, but it was OK. On the noisy side and not really a top-notch romantic place, not truly "fine dining", but good old robust Italian eats, worthy as regular Vegas place to re-visit.

The second star is for the garlic knots. We ordered a pizza. I've lived in NYC, I've had great pizza. Been wanting to try this place for a while. I'm not exaggerating: the pizza came to the table cold and soaking and flimsy as a wet noodle. Literally like a cold, wet noodle. The "crust" was so incredibly thin and floppy and wet and cold that I started to take a photo for this review BUT before I could do that, a woman collapsed in the restaurant and hit her head and wasn't getting up. Please understand this next part and read carefully: I was sitting at the far end of the restaurant and there was a ridiculous amount of servers working in this place. Like two servers to a customer. At least 15. The bartender, servers, hostess, and manager just stood there like stunned sheep, so I was the first person to call 911. After running across the restaurant by myself, they obviously had no kind of training in place for an emergency situation. People acted like I was a hero for merely possessing common sense. After the ambulance showed up and took the woman away, the general manager commended me and comped our entire bill. I explained the pizza issue to him and he acted like he knew about it and was embarrassed, but here's the kicker: the guy was from New York....and he allows his kitchen to serve sloppy cold pizza!? But hey, the free garlic knots were incredible!

Not the best, not the worst.   -Garlic knots- good but if you've been to C&O trattoria in Southern California then these garlic knots have nothing on C&O. I was able to stop myself after two pieces which is saying a lot. It's good but too doughy and not enough garlic -lobster ravioli was pretty good, especially the sauce  -calamari was just ok- don't like it when I get more tentacles than rings (btw if you're ever interested in a this American life about calamari.... )   Overall, it was an average meal for Vegas. My travel mates picked this restaurant for a Friday night- I would have chosen differently. Save room for dessert if you can- the chocolate cake looked amazing

This place was great. The atmosphere is very welcoming. The staff was professional and accommodating with  menu items. If your a seafood lover please know there is no scallops and lobster on the menu. We were celebrating a friend's birthday and they gave her cute bday card ...."Classy touch"  All this after we arrived 15 min. late for our dinner reservation. .. Party of 9
Great dinning experience, the service was amazing and the food was great

Great Italian restaurant! Last time I had antipasto platter & penne a la vodka which both were amazing! Tonight's calamari & baked ziti were equally as good! Friendly staff that was very personable! Bethany at the bar was awesome and had great suggestions! Easy to see why there were so many regulars at the bar recognized by name !  Can't wait to go back!

The food here was ok, nothing to write home about.  We had a large party and we got several different items.  The biggest problem I had is why I'm giving them 2 stars - their bartender apparently doesn't know what Blue Moon (the original wheat) is.  They had both the regular wheat on the menu and the "seasonal", which is a white IPA.  I told him that I wanted the original Blue Moon, to which he proceeded to argue with me telling me that Blue Moon IS an IPA. He said that they'd been getting people complaining because they thought it wasn't an IPA.  That's because it is most definitely not!!  He assured me that it was the regular Blue Moon so I ordered one.  It was the seasonal.  I didn't want to argue with him any further so I just let it go and someone else at the table drank it.    I hope that management will take this review into account and train their staff about the difference here.  This isn't an uncommon beer and most places carry it, so for it to taste like a completely different type of beer means that either your lines are mixed up or your staff doesn't know what they're serving.  If you're out of the regular that's fine, but don't try to tell me that something I've been drinking for over 6 years is something that it's not!  Please see my picture for proof of what I'm referring to.

OK... first of all, garlic knots. They're denser than most places but really really good. If you like garlic, get these.  Their lobster ravioli with crab and shrimp is really good. I liked this the most of all the things we got. Not a huge fan of their pizza. Their Linguine Bolognese was good, but not something I'd stay up at night and hunger for.  They also serve a special italian bottled lemon iced tea. It's good!
The staff was very friendly and the place had an awesome atmosphere. The food was also top notch! We are vegetarians and had some great options to choose from.

This review is for 3.5 stars.   Very good food with a good atmosphere, but the overall experience of the meal just didn't meet the standard of the other location in the strip. We had he house specialty pasta which came with a red sauce, sundried tomatoes, and spinach, as well as the gnocchi in a vodka sauce. Both pastas were delicious and fresh but extremely bland, with not much going on besides the pasta and sauce. I guess that's normal for good Italian but I usually enjoy busier dishes. The bread, garlic knots, were actually quite good and I devoured 2, especially dipping in the entree sauces. We were finally given a complimentary olive and pepper dish to start out that was just par. Drinks are expensive and not very good to be frank. I ordered a Manhattan and it was just alcohol thrown into a glass, with no real craft. The house wine is $11 and truly is a house wine. Meal came to around a surprisingly expensive $70. Not worth the cost in my opinion with service underwhelming as well. But nonetheless a strip type of restaurant in downtown Summerlin.

I will be back next time I'm in Vegas.  The garlic knots were to die for and the lasagna was probably the best I've ever had.  The atmosphere was also very nice and romantic.  We went around brunch time so the shopping area wasn't too busy yet, but I imagine if you go later in the afternoon or for dinner you can do plenty of people watching.  Don't waste your time looking in the food court for something to eat, come here!

Food was very good and reasonably priced for Vegas. Very large portions so come hungry! Our waiter Sammy was the best part of the experience and took wonderful care of us! He brought the Italian hospitality and service to Vegas. Thank you Sammy for treating us like princesses the morning after a long night in Vegas! :)

I really really really wanted to like this place.  The wait time and the other reviews made me salivating for a meal at Trattoria Reggiano and I insisted that the rest of my group eat here at least once before we left Vegas the last time I went.  AMBIENCE: The Venetian was my home away from home for the weekend last month when I was in Vegas, so it was in a convenient location.  Walking past the place, it looks like a small, quaint little restaurant, but inviting at the same time with the warm lighting.  There are also tables that sort of stretch out of the restaurant, so people walking by can get a good look of what people are eating and the diners are able to people watch.  It was a little bit awkward waiting for a table because there really isn't any designated "waiting area".  Standing too close made me feel like a stalker and standing too far keeping watch on whether my name would be called also made me feel like a stalker.  Recommendation - get there early to avoid the awkward wait.  FOOD QUALITY: First thing we got on the table was garlic bread.  From my previous posts, you'll know that I love carbs/bread with a passion.  I was sorely disappointed when I took my first bite out of the garlic bread.  I was expecting warm, delicious bread - what I got was cold, oily bread.  Gross.   I thought maybe it was just an off day with the bread, but the bad didn't stop there.  If the pasta sauce that I buy at the grocery store tastes better than Trattoria, then you know there is a serious lack of skill in the way they cook pasta here.  This is especially disappointing considering it specializes in pasta and Italian food.  My group and I all ordered pasta and ALL of our pastas were undercooked.  Andrew D. ordered spaghetti and meatballs and the meatballs were a little bit cold? - How does that even happen??  All of our dishes were not hot.  All of us didn't want to finish our dishes, but we also didn't want to just throw away $20 per person for our dishes right down the drain.  So, we all just sucked it up and ate our subpar pasta.  SERVICE: Service was poor.  The hostess seemed a little spacey.  The waiter also took forever getting to our table to take down waters and when he dropped off our food, he was basically MIA for the rest of the time.  I had to wave down the hostess after she was done zoning out to bring us our check since our waiter went MIA on us.  I was not on my Yelp game that day and my group let me have it.  It is safe to say that I will probably not be returning to Trattoria again.

Went with a group.  No white wine by the glass, Fail for an Italian joint especially in vegas. Had to remind waiter twice to bring me water.  2d fail.  Then they brought my dish 5 minutes after everyone else's.   just a disappointment.   3D fail.   Eat somewhere else - so many better choices.

Simply fabulous dinner and service. Sat out on the patio, immediately greeted by our server Tony and he brought us a bottle of Pellegrino within a minute, with ice on the side and extra (very fresh) limes.  Ordered garlic bread, small side Caesar salad and fettuccini Alfredo. Bread was perfectly seasoned, large portion and baked to a nice golden brown. Salad was exceedingly fresh, perfect amount of dressing and just the right size for a side salad. The main course, the fettuccini Alfredo was simply the best I have ever had, and that includes comparing this dish to restaurants from all around the world. The combination of ingredients and the preparation demonstrate an exceptionally skilled chef. Likewise, the Tiramisu is not to be missed, complemented by superbly prepared cappuccino.  To top it off, the service was excellent, left a 40%+ tip - well worth it!   A restaurant not to be missed on a visit to Las Vegas.

I was disappointed when I came here! I came here because we wanted some food after a long night and somewhere close!  We were staying at the venetian and we also wanted something not too pricey as well!   We came here and all their dishes were around $20 or so.    I got the vodka pasta which was ok.  Nothing great.    The boyfriend got the pizza which was way too cheesy!    I don't think I'd be returning to this place in the future.

We all came back here again for my parents 40 year wedding anniversary.  These guys are great!! The food is superb as ever. Cooked on order and fresh. It was like eating mama's cooking at home. We love this place.

Pleasantly surprised by the food.  The filet mignon meatballs are the best I've had and olive oil was very good.  Pasta was nice as well.  I stayed at the Wynn for a few days, and felt the food and value here was noticeably better than the wynn restaurants I frequented. That said, ambience at most wynn restaurants is hard to beat.  Mojito had room for improvement though...

Service = A+. Food = A+. If you are looking for some legit Italian food that is amazing and delicious, this is the spot! The meatballs made of Filet Mignon literally melt in your mouth, and our server John was a doll with an Italian accent. The entire staff made us feel welcome and took good care of us. For an affordable and delicious meal I highly recommend!

First, our waiter Paulo was the best......we accidentally left a tip on the bill, not paying attention to the auto gratuity calculated. He ran out after us to let us know of the mistake.  My faith in humanity restored!! Order the shrimp scampi and chicken parm!  FANTASTIC! Atmosphere is great.....just like being in little Italy in New York. Service was prompt and professional and Paulo took care of us. Maybe Morrels in the palazzo should have Paulo come over and teach them what service is all about.

I think it all started out on a bad note and there wasn't a recovery during our visit.   Asking guests to wait outside until a table inside is ready (aka 108 degrees) while there is only 1 other table of 4 seated in the restaurant (should have been my first clue) is a bad start. Being pressured to order= I really hate that. It was my first time here,  I needed some time. I was also confused why the host is asking for my order minutes after we sat down? If your host is going to take orders, they should know the specials of the day! Alright, so that was an awkward start...  They bring Garlic knots that are generous and appear very appetizing. Overly greasy, soggy in olive oil, a raw garlic flavor; lighter on the oil and some nice crisp on the bread would be a big improvement.  Fella ordered the meatball sandwich (comes with fries); I went with a Caesar salad because I was already suspicious. (AKA: servers and line cooks talking about their dates last night loudly by my table in a big empty restaurant, doesn't make me feel like kitchen is strong on their game). Our food arrived so quickly I was surprised and a little suspicious (microwave?); the cheese appeared oddly coagulated, melted but not bubbly like a nice toasted meatball sam.  The salad- flavorful dressing but overdressed and I wasn't a fan of the full anchovy presented on top. Top it off- last bite was a sour tomato. Trying to eliminate that flavor from my mouth, I took some fries from my fella's dish, and sure enough the oil had a strange taste. I couldn't get the strange oil taste of my palette from these fries.   My favorite things from the experience were the fresh flowers on the table and the Andes mint that finally neutralized the weird fry oil taste.

Great Italian place in the Venetian! As other reviewers have said, it is a surprising little place tucked away near the food court. The service and food are really great, if on the pricey side. The garlic bread they give you to start is fantastic, but the pasta was not to be outdone. I got the chicken marsala, which came with spaghetti, and I licked the plate clean of that good good sauce. Lots of mushrooms and shallots make the dish really flavorful!  It might not be the most exciting restaurant to try in comparison to the other big-name places in Vegas, but they definitely serve some delicious classic Italian food.

We loved this restaurant.    Sometimes what you really want is a good meal that, while decadent, has a home-made comfortable feel.  Add to the experience an intimate atmosphere (yes, it is possible to find intimate atmosphere somewhere in a hotel restaurant on the strip), a personable chef and staff, and a sense of authenticity (not post-modern authenticity, but the actual authentic kind).  We go to Vegas to do two things:  play poker and eat.  And we pack a lot of both into each trip.  It's safe to say that for all of our eating in Vegas, Trattoria Reggiano has no rival.  When you go, it might be tough to find in the maze that is the Venetian.  Head for the food court in the canal shops.  It's a few doors down from the food court seating area, but don't let that fool you.  Fake al fresco is fine, but for a nice quiet meal, see if there's a table inside.  Another online review that says it all, by "pepprdine" on yellowbot.com: "The Best of las Vegas.  Trattoria Reggiano is one of those street side cafes that you think of when you are strolling down the streets in Italy. Instead of traveling to Europe you can now just visit the Venetian to find this outstanding restaurant. Excellent service, original menu and true Italian owners who care about their heritage are just a few of the reasons you should visit. Acclaimed Chef Jack Borruso is there most days and nights ensuring that every diner is satisfied. If you end oup visiting the restaurant you need to sit down with Chef Borruso and let him tell you some of his stories about cooking in Italy. You can sit there for hours listening.  You can go to those other "trendy" restaurants in Las Vegas and take out a second mortgage on your house to pay the bill and you might be satisfied or you can go to Trattoria Reggiano and get a taste of what a true Italian Trattoria conveys; chbefs visiting your table, authentic Italian Cuisine, smaill, intimate atmosphere and a menu that is better than most high end Italian eateries in Vegas without charging you so much that it would be cheaper to fly to Italy and dine in Rome. This is a must visit when you are in Las Vegas. "

My boyfriend and I gave this place a 3 star review solely because of the food. It looked really nice inside and because of our Italian craving, we found this spot to be something new to try. The food was presented wonderfully, but the taste just doesn't match its good looks.  To be honest, this was nothing special. Their food, for the prices that they were, didn't seem to really be worth it. My pasta was mediocre, our pizza was as well.   I think the one thing that stood out was the really friendly customer service from our server for the evening. She was very attentive and accommodating. While we waited for our food she brought us out a little tray of cheeses and olives to snack on.   I don't think we'll find ourselves here again, but it wasn't a bad place. Would I recommend this to anyone else? No, because it wouldn't be the first Italian restaurant to cross my mind, BUT if someone were to ask me if they should eat there, I don't think I would try and dissuade them.

Simple, classic Italian cuisine. Nothing fancy as it is a corner of the Grand Canal Shops. Sangria was pretty good-- not the typical over sugar-ed type. Garlic twists were a nice break from standard pre-dining bread. Lots of variety in the menu so something for everyone!

Truly enjoyed our meal here. Ate out on the patio. The venue is is really nice. It was nice to be outside as there aren't very many good outdoor venues in Vegas. The service was good as was the food. Prices are reasonable. We will definitely be back.

Absolutely delivered on the food quality.  Hard to find meandering through the canals of the shops at the Venetian!    The ambiance isn't as nice as the more expensive Italian restaurants in the area but the tasty food makes up for it!

My girlfriend and I were seeing the Blue man group and needed a place to dine before the show. We were in the mood for Italian and happened to stumble upon this little joint. It's rather peculiarly located-- as though it's purpose as a restaurant was an afterthought in the tiny enclave's design. It almost feels like a genuine old fashioned mom and pop-- if it weren't located in a major strip resort. It's a quaint and intimate little dining experience with all the decorations you need for a casual italian dinner.  Aesthetics aside, let me simply say that I give this place my stamp of approval. The bread is tasty, and the food arrived fairly promptly. Our waiter seemed to be an authentic Italian immigrant who had an excellent knowledge of the menu and provided valuable dining advice. My girlfriend went for the tortellini and I settled for the swordfish piccatta. The food arrived promptly and did NOT disappoint. The swordfish was succulent and the seasoning was just right-- so as not to overpower the flavor of the fish. Delicate capers draped over the fish helped me finish my portion in no time. I tried some of my girlfriends dish as well and was pleased to find that the alfredo sauce was rich and well crafted. The portions are just right to fill an average appetite and you probably won't have leftovers. For the price I paid I was quite satisfied with the quality of the food and would recommend it to anyone in the area.

Great food, but the restaurant charged me for my bill twice and caused lots of frustration and time spent trying to dispute it. When I called to notify rthem, they said that there was only one charge on their system and that it was a mistake by the waiter. Beyond that, I wasn't given much of a solution.  Too bad that this problem spoiled my experience with them. Check your bank statements after visiting!! Update: No resolution to the double-charge issue after a week even though I was told it would be dissolved within 3-5 days. Management was very defensive and unhelpful when I called a second time to follow up.

The service was very good,the server was also helpful, but there was a lobster shell in the lobster ravioli. He laughed it off and said yeah it happens a lot,not the first time,sorry. Ok, that's it?... I'm thinking well is there some kind of compensation, and are they CPR certified here, what if someone chokes, there's no warning written or verbally about eating the ravioli. Smh, anyway the lobster ravioli was the best tasting out of everything we had from here. The chicken Caesar salad was ok, the chicken had a VERY grilled smell to it, very strong, not sure why, but the chicken was also a tad bit dry. The cheese on it was yummy though, and I expected to see a smaller salad but it was meal sized. The caprese salad was just ok , the cheese was fresh and moist,the tomato was ripe,but I added a little balsamic vinegar to up the flavor . The shrimp linguini was not too bad, not as much sauce as I expected and a smaller plate than I expected but I was still satisfied and got full. They gave us soft garlic bread in the beginning while we waited for our food, it was good with and with out my dip(olive oil,balsamic vinegar and black pepper). We also had "Italian lemonade" lol don't even waste your time on this mess, I've seen these in the 99¢/dollar stores where I live, not just that, it's just not that good. Well in the end it's will I go back or not. Like all places we all go to, there's pros and cons to every spot, so even with the cons to this place I'd give it another shot.
Essay is the worst waiter I have had in Vegas. Rude and unaware of the customers needs.  Would not recommend!

If you've never been here before, be prepared to take an extra 15 minutes to find this place because of how huge the Venetian is. This restaurant is in an indoor mall within the Venetian. Though it's indoors with a controlled climate, most of the seating is still "outside" of the restaurant on the patio, so you might have a bunch of random people and kids and strollers walk right past your table. If you don't mind that, the food is great and the staff is kind and attentive.  I went with my friend and her mom, dad, brother, sister, sister's husband and their baby girl. The menu is big but not too large, but big enough to make it hard to decide because at least two things sound awfully good. I teetered between gnocchi in pesto cream sauce and lobster ravioli. I absolutely love ravioli and thick, chewy pastas. I went with the lobster ravioli. The texture of the ravioli pasta was just right, and the filling was a mixture of cheese and lobster. I forget what was in the pink sauce, it was tomato and a bit creamy or buttery and I think they put some shrimp on it as well. My friend enjoyed her very cheesy rigatoni, her sister's gnocchi in pesto looked amazing and I wished I had ordered it, her husband got the same thing I did and ate it all up, her mother I think got the eggplant parmesan but don't quote me on that... I believe it was gooey and flavorful and cooked to her liking. My friend's brother ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and of course that was done very well with al dente pasta and a good sauce. The meatballs are very large and a bit more delicate than they seem from looking at them. I accidentally dropped half a meatball someone had ordered on the side into my water glass due to underestimating the strength of the meatball in relation to my fork. The waiter smiled and just brought out another big meatball in sauce free of charge. I believe everyone was satisfied with their meal. I I didn't end up finishing my ravioli however, but it's my fault because I ordered something too fishy for my tastes. On occasion a bite of the lobster ravioli was too strong and lobstery for me. Don't ask me why, I'm picky and mild with my seafood flavors. The shrimp were fine. Ultimately I had hoped they had my favorite on the menu, mushroom ravioli. I order those everywhere I see them, they always have such a rich nutty taste and they mix so well with cheese and make a great filling! I think that's the reason I ordered the lobster ravioli... I really craved mushroom ravioli. Anyway, I think I should have gotten the pesto gnocchi, that looked INCREDIBLE! I bet it was. If I ever go back I'll try that.

We went to Vegas to celebrate our tenth wedding anniversary.  While purchasing tickets at one of the discount ticket booths on the trip for a couple of shows, we were offered a discount at this restaurant.  We walked to Ceasars (granted it was mid August, so we were in shorts and sweaty) to go to dinner and didn't have time to change clothes. When we arrived at Trattoria Reggiano, we were graciously greeted by the host.  While the host was grabbing menus for us, a server walked up to the host stand and rudely rolled his eyes at us and then he whispered something to the host.  Luckily we didn't get that rude server's section.  We were served by Paolo.  He was EXCELLENT.  Gave great suggestions, didn't snarl his nose up at the fact that we had a discount dinner ticket and treated us with respect (even though we were casually dressed).  He made our dining experience pleasant.  The reason I left off a star was because I asked for a specific pasta (penne) but I got something totally different (fettucine) but Paolo graciously apologized.  I will go back next time we are in Vegas.

Don't let the location fool you.. this is one of the best Italian restaurants you will dine at.  Everything about this place is great... the food. The service, the ambiance.  I ordered the lobster ravioli and it was incredible. Large raviolis with an awesome sauce and a very generous portion of lobster. We also had the red sangria and it is very very good.  If you are looking for Italian on the strip then come here.  UPDatE. The dessert tray is awesome.  We had the carrot cake which was very moist and exceptional.

I'm torn between 2 and 3 stars. I wasn't impressed but I wasn't really disappointed. It's closer to A OK, but I've definitely had better. Everything was just alright. It tries hard but falls short. They do offer complimentary garlic bread and an antipasto plate. The cheese on the plate was not good at all. The olives were eh, and the canned roasted peppers were just that....canned...or jarred..whatever. Not fresh made. So, as much as I enjoy free stuff, I like free stuff thats good. I'd pass on the antipasto next time. There were 8 of us so we tried a bunch of stuff. I really enjoyed the eggplant rolatini, that was so good. The calmari were OK, but I didn't think the meatballs were great the way people raved about them. I ordered the fruit de mare pasta dish. It was alright. I'd try something else next time if I decided to come back. We had a couple of bottles of the sangria (half price during happy hour), and we enjoyed that.  I'm a HUGE fan of eggplant rolatini, and theirs was good, so if I did come back, it would be for that. Service was alright. Cost was what you'd expect for Summerlin. Oh, be mindful of prices. They differ from menu to menu.
Nice little place to sit with wine, bread, and  good Italian food. Salad and the meatballs alone are enough.  Delicious.

The best thing you might eat here are the garlic knots. I think I came close to eating two baskets worth all by myself. I didn't care if I wreaked of garlic or that I'd be sweating it out of my pores the next day, they were pretty damn good. As for the rest of the stuff I tried... meh. The menu is typical Italian-American food, the kind of stuff you'll see in a million other spots. Perfect for the non-adventurous eater -- the kind of diner who thinks not eating at a national chain is a bit risky.   The kitchen plays it safe and turns out unremarkable food. Meatballs ($14) made from a filet mignon and pork loin mixture were too hard and dense with a sauce that lacked depth. The small portion of the kale peanut salad ($8) was plenty to share, but the underdressed dish had me reaching for water to wash it down. The end of the meal took a turn for the better with a satisfying, but uninspired, lasagna ($22) with ground filet, ricotta, and mozzarella.  Kid menus are available as well. My son's spaghetti (ordered sans tomato sauce, just butter) was a sizable portion that he devoured. Each kid's meal comes with a beverage and mini cannoli.  Located steps away from the movie theater in Downtown Summerlin, it's a nice looking space with a large patio and a smaller than expected interior, with a bar and open kitchen. The food is more paint-by-numbers than Monet, but is just good enough to satisfy a suburban customer base used to eating recognizable Italian.  2.5 Stars

The truth is we went there because I bought my self a %50 discount coupons from tix4onight. But oh boy, the pasta is the finest I had in Vegas. You can have better pasta at Mario Batali's rest but for quadruple the price.  The vodka pink sauce is amazing. The tortellini with cheese is amazing too. We also had veal Milanese and it was good.  I would come back anytime if I crave pasta.

This place has been really busy every time I passed by this week because of conventions. I finally put my name down on a wait list for a table and the hostess gabrielle was very nice when telling me the wait was 30 mins. So she took my phone number and sent texts about our table availability. While waiting I was inquiring about the menu and the manager Dora and the hostess knew a lot about this place, only making me more excited to eat here. The table was finally available the hostess kindly showed me to the table. I promptly got my order taken and soon after the delicious garlic knots arrived. Then a little later my tortelloni came and I was offered fresh Parmesan to top it off. The overall service was great I hope to come back soon.
was hard to find, but so worth it ! food was delish and the service was wonderful. loved the experience.

Long time Las Vegas resident (over 33 years) and must say this is a wonderful place. Great food, terrific ambiance and service. Never had a disappointing meal from pizza's to spaghetti and meatballs, seafood, and more. Great bread, olives and peppers to kick things off.  Thanks!
Wow! Great food. Great atmosphere. Do not go there without trying the meatballs, they are fabulous!  Oh, and the service there was the best.

small restaurant, no reservations inside the venetian shopping area. waited about 15 mins and were seated and served fresh bread with balsamic and oil. ordered some pasta and it was delicious! so delicious i ate the whole thing hahaha

Dinner. Table for 4.  This was some of the best Italian food and service I've ever had! It felt like a mom and pop hole in the wall Italian restaurant run by a tightly knit family. Loved all the old black and white pictures on the walls. Made me feel like I was having dinner in someone's house.  Tried the Eggplant Parmigiana and tasted my friend's Tortilloni.  Both were absolutely delicious! Every bite was just as good as the last. The filet mignon meatballs were tender and full of flavor as well. The garlic knots were too good - unfortunately we filled up on the garlic knots that we couldn't finish our main course.   So worth the stop if ever at the Venetian.

Great little place in the Venetian.  Our meal was a little expensive, but the service was great and the food was great.  I would recommend this place if you are looking for some good Italian food in Vegas.

I was visiting Vegas to ring in the New Year and we wanted to get some dinner. My parents decided to let my brother choose the food that night and he wanted to eat Italian. After looking up some places, he chose this one, and I am extremely thankful that he did.  Looking at the menu, I immediately freaked out because of the pricing (double what I usually pay for). However, I decided to roll with it, as we don't splurge that often, and it was Vegas, after all.  What we ordered:  Starters: Filet Mignon Meatballs ($12): These were absolutely amazing! It comes with three plump meatballs, much bigger than we were expecting, with a delicious tomato-y pomodoro sauce and some spaghetti. We wished we ordered it from the Pasta menu, but maybe next time?  Pasta Specialties: Gnocchi al Pesto ($18): Soft ricotta dumplings with a creamy pesto sauce in a large plate that I simply could not finish! These are a meal on their own, and in my case I had leftovers. These cheesy dumplings should not be underestimated, as they do fill you up!  Individual Brick Oven Pizza: Primavera ($16): A light vegetarian pizza loaded with flavors. I have had a pizza with similar toppings, and that pizza absolutely pales in comparison. This pizza was not very greasy and seemed to be quite authentic.  Drinks: Cappuccino ($6.5): The most expensive cappuccino I have ever had, but one that I will never regret ordering. After having that cappuccino, I have craved it many times over. The drink comes in a small cup with a small piece of biscotti on the side and a small stick of rock sugar. It was the perfect cup of cappuccino in my opinion.  My family (4 including me) shared these dishes and we had leftover pizza and gnocchi, which we (I) later on devoured at our hotel room. The service was great, with our server giving us time to eat and periodically refilling our water glasses. I was surprised that he didn't come by to check on our food as often as people usually do, but it was a nice change, and I'm guessing more authentically Italian? Anyways, I highly recommend this place!

Our service was great and the food was good but I feel like it was a little over priced.  Maybe it is because Trattoria is in downtown summerlin but $18 for a salad seems excessive to me. We ordered the Kale salad, a margherita pizza and a cannoli. The garlic knots served before hand were amazing! I could have eaten a whole basket of those and left content. They were warm, fresh and smeared with butter and garlic. Carb heaven.   Our server was great and split the salad for us so we each had a good portioned amount and the pizza came out perfectly with a chewy crust and a little char on it from the brick oven. They use authentic Italian tomato sauce here and the flavors and unmatched. The cannoli was authentic and perfectly sweet and a nice finish to the meal.    I forsee enjoying the patio here when it isn't oven temperatures outside and I would like to come back to try a happy hour here as well. I appreciated how well our server took care of us.
Came here after 5 years. The place has gone bigger. It was small nice corner before. Now its full blown restaurant. Great service and great food. Our favorite in Vegas.

The Hubby and I went to get him his alfredo fix on his birthday.  We noticed everyone was sitting outside once we walked up and asked for a table inside... It worked out nice because we were the only ones inside and it felt like we had the place to ourselves :) I ordred the carbonara and the Hubby ordered the alfredo.  Our meals came out fast.  They loaded my pasta up with bacon, it was yummy.  The sauce very thick and creamy, different that what I am use to, but it was good.  The Hubby LOVED his alfredo.  I didn't love the garlic knots, but dipped in some balsamic it was good.  They seemed to be over steamed so they got hard and dry.  Overall, we were happy.

Loved this little hole in the wall restaurant! It's tucked away in a corner of the grand canal shops on the Venetian side. It's a family run business and authentic Italian as they're actually from Italy, including the wait staff. They made great recommendations and we loved all of them! I ordered the linguine fruti de mare (clams, calamari, and shrimp in a spicy marinara) while my mom orders linguine in clam sauce and my aunt ordered the swordfish piccata style with steamed vegetables. I loved my dish and I usually don't like red sauces. I also loved the swordfish, the piccata was so flavorful and perfectly cooked! The garlic knots were also really great, which came free! We ended up ordering the tiramisu for dessert even though my aunt was hesitant because the example looked really creamy. It was really creamy, but surprised us in how delicious it was! It was a light cream and my aunt was glad we ended up ordering it! I was happy to hear that they would be expanding because they deserve to be seen! Great service and food and decent prices for Vegas!

We love this place. Everything from service, food, drinks and  atmosphere is excellent. I don't love everything on the menu but we LOVE the meatballs, soups, several pasta dishes, caprese salad and the pizza is excellent!! Tiramisu is fresh, homemade and unlike all other restaurants. The indoor/outdoor restaurant always feels cozy. We love the patio but when it's chilly we like inside just as much. Saturday night with live music is fun and relaxing for date night. We've even run into a few famous folks here while enjoying the live, old school (rat pack type) of music. Great for people watching too:)  We've been many times, and I failed to write a review sooner. However, after visiting another Italian place also in DTS that left us regretting our need to try something new,  I felt compelled to write this review before I forget again.

I had the Stromboli and a slice of pie. The pizza was good! The service could you some work, but they did the basic job. I did have a couple flies flying around the place when I was inside so they need a door fan or something like that. Good prices for its location in downtown Summerlin! I would come back!

This was a great decision in an area with so many options. Fine dining Italian at it's very best with a beautiful decor.   We didn't have a reservation on a Friday early evening and we were quickly accommodated on the patio which has heaters. We shared a few dishes including the fantastic meatball app, some of the best ever! Gnocchi with pesto was perfect, finished with fresh roasted pine nuts and the pinot noir matched nicely the dishes we selected.   Service is top notch and the staff works as a team. Our server was right on, checked on us and knew when to leave us to enjoy. She was awesome! I'm very picky with Italian, this was the best we've had in the area. We had a very delicious and comfortable experience and we'll be back soon. Highly recommended!! 5 star all the way!

This is an amazing restaurant in downtown summerlin!! Love the open atmosphere enjoying dinner and looking out at the shops. The food is 5 star Italian with great dishes, favorites are chicken parmigiana, pesto gnocchi, and old fashioned spaghetti and meatballs. Bethany at the bar is an amazing server and will keep you entertained with great conversation and good company. This is my favorite spot for dinner go check it out for yourselves!!

Went here because of the good reviews. A little hard to find it is deep within the Venetian Grand Canal Shop area. The staff was really friendly and we had an awesome waiter! He was very attentive and accommodating to my pickiness. I ordered the Gnoochi with meat sauce and it was awesome! The wine list was a little pricey (nothing under $50) but at least it was good! I will definitely be retuning next time I am in Las Vegas!
Yummy food. Great for dinner before a movie. Pizza was amazing. Service exceptional.  Love meeting friends on the patio during spring and fall.

A great, affordable option for Italian-American fare in Vegas. The staff are friendly and service is fast. The boyfriend and I went twice during our stay and enjoyed our dishes so much that we got the same things both times: spaghetti and meatballs for him, eggplant parmesan for me. The second time we went, we also started with the baked clams special, which was delicious.

My best friend and I were doing a lot of running around and needed to grab a quick lunch so we came here. We heard they were great for the meatballs and garlic bread.   The garlic bread was in the shape of a knot and they where huge and very garlicky. They tasted really good but  a bit too much garlic.   The meatballs honestly weren't the greatest and they where overly used with garlic!  The pizza was just a normal brick oven pizza nothing special at all.   A little while latter man was I sick. I think it's way too much garlic used in the food. My friend and I were vomiting from the food. It was so bad.

The food here is absolutely scrumptious! My family was aching in the hot Vegas heat and was craving I nice filling Italian meal. Luckily, we stopped right by this nice little restaurant and all our needs were fulfilled.   We began the meal with some delicious garlic bread with olive oil and vinegar. For our entrees I ordered a kale salad while my wife ordered baked clams, my son ordered baked ziti with meatballs, and my daughter- spaghetti bolognese.  My kale salad wasn't extraordinary but exactly as I expected: healthy. very healthy. My children on the other hand had delicious plates of cheesy, meaty, pasta goodness. I highly recommend the pastas. My wife's clams were also delicious with the bread crumb and cheese toppings.   The service was great. The waiter was very polite and the food came very quick. An overall great experience and delicious meal. 10/10 recommend!

Very small tucked away in the Venetian shoppes area, this place was a good find for us. We ordered three dishes for four people, but was more than enough for us. Garlic pasta - simple, seasoned, and delicious! Clam linguini - i am allergic to shell fish but my party LOVED it. And margherita pizza was crispy, thin, and simple.  If anyone is looking for simple italian but don't want to deal with the vegas wait or publicity, check this place out.

My husband and I were in Vegas, enjoying the sights, when we decided to try out this restaurant for dinner. We were dressed casually in t-shirts and jeans. We did not have a reservation, but the hostess was friendly and told us it was a 30 minute wait. We put our name down and we waited maybe ten minutes tops before she texted that our table was ready. We were sat and our waiter came over. We explained that we were still pretty full from all the good food of Vegas, but that we wanted to split the chicken parmesean. We chose to not get anything else, and to drink we had water. The waiter took our order, and then he spent the rest of the night giving fantastic service to the table next to ours, while ignoring us completely. A couple of helpful bus boys brought out our garlic rolls, and then later our waters. The female manager brought out our meals which they had split for us, and she grated fresh cheese onto our plates. The food was delicious, and fresh. We loved every bite. We finished our meals entirely and the bus boys cleared out plates and still our waiter had never checked on us. He arrived to ask us if we wanted dessert and then gave us the check. We paid with cash and left. The two stars is for the great food and the little bit of good service we did receive, but clearly if you get the wrong waiter and you are not dressed to impress, and buying tons of food, do not expect to get good service at all. Such a disappointment.

Omg!! Wow!! Those bread knots are awesome!  Excellent ambiance and great service... had a delicious large Cesar shared w my parents and we shared two pizzas... lovely... enough said.  Check it out and don't forget their Long Island... washes down perfectly w those bread knots!!! Bam!!!

I made reservations online via open table and I get there and they would not honor it.  As I was talking to the manager and I showed him that there were reservation availability for not only my seating at 8:15 but for 8:30, 8:45 and 9:00 he proceeded to tell me the wait is an hour because he has a waiting list.  You guys need to get your act together or stop using open table as an option for your customers. #palazzolasvegas #venetianlasvegas #fail

The first place we ate at in Las Vegas. The service was wonderful. We were 20 minutes late and they understood and still seated us. Our waiter was very attentive. We ordered two house glasses of wine which were great. The food we ordered was penne al pesto and whole wheat penne w/ shrimp and marinara. Those are not on the menu and they did not hesitate to change things up for us. The food was amazing. The pesto tasted absolutely homemade. The shrimps were fresh and the marinara sauce tasted authentic. Finally, the whole wheat pasta was cooked perfectly. It was not hard and it did not make me wish I ordered white pasta. Thank you!

REALLY enjoyed our meal here last Friday.  We were seated quickly and served promptly.  Our waiter was super nice and attentive.  The food was really delicious.  We had chicken parm and baked ziti with meatballs.  I love every bite of it.  Would absolutely come here again and recommend without hesitation.

Do yourself a favor - and when in Vegas - dine here. So many places to choose from but everything is so overrated. This, THIS place gets it. The service is impeccable and the dishes even more so. Be sure to enjoy and Aperol Spritz before your meal.

If this isn't "real" Italian food I don't ever want to try "real" Italian. I went twice on this trip to Vegas. Both times we had the Caprese as a starter - I've never had such good mozzarella. For entrees, I had the spaghetti and meatballs and chicken parmigiana, both of which were delicious.   If you're looking for a quick, delicious bite on the North part of the Strip you have to check this place out!

Good small Italian restaurant that's affordable. I wanted to try this place because everyone said this place was good and this place didn't disappoint. The sausage pizza tasted good and wasn't too heavy. The pastas also tasted very good. Steamed mussels were also fantastic. Only minor negative was that this restaurant is really small and I can definitely see this place packed during a busy weekend. I'll definitely try this place again next time I'm in Vegas.

This is my favorite restaurant. Very kind and thoughtful waiters. The lasagna is the best in town. If you're coming for lunch, it's not on the menu. Ask for it, and they'll take care of you! Also, the chocolate chip cannoli will literally and figuratively save your life.

Not only good location great environment friendly staffed and the food excellent , one of the best Italian places I've eaten not only in Vegas but I'm glad they got this one in downtown Summerlin closer to my home. Definitely another one of my favorite restaurants.

Just so good. We hadn't been to Vegas in a while he the last time we stumble upon this place when it was one third the size restaurant that it is now. It was absolutely incredible back then. The best kind of surprise. So when we went this time it was intentional. And our expecttTions were really high. AMAZING AGAIN!

Very good Italian food.  Had the pasta and clams and it was very good but at the high price paid I would have expected it to be a bit better.  Caesar salad was delicious but the croutons could crack a tooth!

Just the best food and dinner experience of our 5 day stay in Vegas. Like another Yelper, we were a bit skeptical given that it is a very small restaurant tucked by the side of the food court - so we actually checked it out the night before. We were not disappointed in the least. Sat inside (only a little claustrophobic but not bad), hubby had veal parmigiana (the biggest piece of veal ever and absolutely delicious), I had the shrimp scampi and we shared a caesar salad - no room for dessert but would have liked to have tried one of the many choices and John was attentive and had a sense of humor (hard to find in most of the stuffy Vegas restaurants).  If you like authentic Italian food and atmosphere, you will like Trattoria Reggiano. Will definitely return!

Watch out! Our boss took 8 of us to dinner tonight. I was very much looking forward to eat a juicy steak. For $40 they gave me a salt meat!! It was so salty I had to force it down my throat and drink with each bite!! As my boss was paying for it and I was with my colleagues I did not say anything I just eat it all and stayed quiet . I told the waiter Keith who was nice but I am not sure if he let the manager or the cook know about the salty steak!  Just because they are in Summerlin in Vegas and charge $40 for a price of steak that does not guarantee a good quality food. Such a shame !!!
Best Italian experience ever! The closest you can get to Italy without actually visiting the country. PAOLO will take care of you and your guests. Try the ricotta lemon cheesecake and Italian coffee.

Trattoria Reggiano has been on my list for awhile, and it was fantastic.   Tucked away and tightly run, this restaurant understands how to move people right through their meal, which I think is great. I was coming off a cold and wanted nothing more than the homecooked feel of spaghetti and meatballs, which I had with the house chianti and the famous house garlic knots.   Best spaghetti and meatballs ever. The sauce was impeccable, balanced but distinct flavor, and light enough not to stop your stomach a few bites in. Pasta was just as perfect - you know you've had a good meal when you remember how much you enjoyed the experience of simply eating it. I'm not usually capable of putting a lot away, but I finished the entire plate, and got a congratulatory, "Good job, boss" from my cameriere. Much better than the chiding he gave the Italian sitting next to me, who was apparently letting his pizza get too cold while texting.  The bill was on my table in a flash, the real boss told a waiting guest "This table will be ready in 30 seconds," and I was on my way. Grazie!

After dining at the very average Canaletto, we decided to give this place a try.  It always looked packed and crammed, which is unappealing but we just had to try it for all the reviews.   Why not 5 stars? The seating, although cute, is kind of invasive and too close for comfort.  We were seated next to a couple that was arguing "quietly" and I heard everything...awkward. Also, what's up with these bottled soft drinks? Major AUGH for no refills.  The service was pretty great! Servers were attentive and friendly.  How could they maneuver amongst such a small space?!   I ordered the Shrimp Scampi with a side of Grilled Chicken Breast. I LOVE that you can add chicken breast to ANY menu item! More protein to counteract the pasta carbs, please!  My food was so damn delicious! Sorry for the damn, but damn! The pasta was so al dente and flavorful! The shrimp was BAM! And the chicken was DOUBLE BAM!  My boyfriend had the Chicken Marsala and he liked it a lot! No, he did not love it but at Regianno's defense, Marsala isn't that flavorful in any place and my bf was kinda drunk lol  I think we'll come back! Can't wait to try those filet mignon meatballs!

Last year when I was in Vegas for a tradeshow my coworker suggest going here for dinner since the steakhouse we originally want to eat at had a 2 hour wait. Oh boy am I glad we did. The food was phenomenal, it was probably one of the best meals I had during the trips. Even better than those steakhouses that we spent $75 for a piece of steak.   Garlic rolls: Hot, soft and garlicy, it was pretty amazing. It was so hard not wanting to eat it all but I had to control myself since I wanted to save room in my stomach for the other dishes  Meat and cheese platter: Huge platter! So much meat and cheese!  We shared it between three people and still had a lot of left overs  Linguine with clam in white sauce: Typically I am not a white sauce kind of person but this pasta dish was too good not eat. The sauce was light and the clams were fresh. They were really generous with the clams too. I totally recommend this!  Veal parmigiana: My coworker ordered this dish and she kept raving how tender and delicious it was.  Calamari: Fried to perfection and the portion was huge.  Lobster ravioli in a creamy tomato sauce: Sooooooooo good. There was chunks of lobsters in every bite.  Tiramisu: Hands down the BEST tiramisu I have ever had, ever. I am not a tiramisu person whatsoever but this tiramisu was beyond amazing.  Overall, this place took me by surprise. Yes, I would go here again and yes, I recommend that you check this place out.
Great food and excellent service! Also, the patio is a really nice spot to relax and have a drink!

I love this place! I live in SF and visit a few times a year in Las Vegas by business and private. I have always lunch and dinner there. The staff are very friendly and their past are perfect!! Recently, they did expand the restaurant and began to take a reservation! I will be there soon.

This restaurant was beautiful with a quaint feel. But what I appreciated was our server.  When I told her we were vegetarians she said, "ok, I can make a special dish for you. What kind of pasta do you like?" That was such a kind gesture. We sat on the patio and enjoyed the romantic open air. And when the food came it was perfection!

This place is good, but definitely not what it used to be. Before I lived in Vegas I used to visit this place a lot about 3 years ago. During shot show this year I took a friend here because I remember it being so good and I rarely visit the strip now that I live here. The positive thing about going back is that they have expanded the physical restaurant and so it was much easier to get a seat. It just didn't feel the same however. I always loved the 2 Italian men that would serve us and they were nowhere to be seen. Maybe it's just me, but I kind of miss the ambience that used to be there. The food is still nice but I probably wouldn't drive out of my way anymore to go here.

This is one of my favorite local spots to go to. Ricki the server and manager Dan are the most welcoming and dynamic team. I love their meatballs and they have the BEST Italian kale salad that is simply a must try!!! The service is always incredible and I can count on a yummy meal and delicious wine. It's definitely a great place to hang out for happy hour or enjoy a nice dinner!

The food was absolutely fantastic and the waitress was phenomenal in fact, she's the reason I didn't walk out. I ordered the chicken parmigiana (fantastic!) but it needed some spice, so I asked for the only hot sauce, Tabasco. They brought it to me in a [insert profanity of choice] cup! They were happy to give me a bottle of balsamic vinegar and olive oil but not Tabasco. As a Louisianan, I find that insulting and inexcusable. Tabasco must be spread with the original nozzle, not a [add profanity] cup. There's more traditional in that bottle than anything else in that restaurant. Fix or I shall not be a frequent guest.

I've been here several times and they continue to impress! With the customer service being top notch, and the bartender ( I think her name is Bethany) the food, atmosphere, and all the people are very friendly! The food is delicious and my fave is the lasagna!!! You cannot go wrong in here!

Used to be five stars!! We have been here many times over the years. Our family dines here about once a month. We know all of the long time staff and they have always been impeccable. The food is delicious and consistent.  Each family member has their favorite dish.  I am confused though because although the staff is still perfect the restaurant  has been downgraded. The last 2 times we have been there our mineral water was served in plastic cups. We ordered wine and got one glass. When we asked for another glass the wait staff was very apologetic and almost seemed embarrassed. They brought a glass that wasn't a red wine glass. We ended  up with 3 different glasses for 3 people. Buy some wine glasses.  This is a  restaurant ??   I felt like I brought a bottle of wine to my teetotaler Grandma's house drinking it out of juice glasses. Then the kids went to a Kool Aid stand and brought me a glass of mineral water in a Dixie cup.

Chose this restaurant based on other reviews but disappointed with my Pesto gnocchi. I ordered it to -go.  Though the sauce was very light and creamy, the gnocchi tasted like it came from a package you buy at the store. I make my own soft fluffy pillow gnocchi at home,  and these tasted pre-bought not freshly made. It should've had pine nuts and parmesan, but it didn't have any. Was also hoping for bread with it but didn't receive any, nor did I get a fork to eat with.  For $18+ I expected: freshly made pasta and more on my plate. I will be heading to the food court soon for another snack.  Side note:  the servers were coming back with empty plates so maybe I ordered the wrong dish.

LOVED this place located inside the Shoppes at the Venetian!   Very busy joint which speaks volumes for the food.   Had an "authentic" italian waiter, accent and all (either that or a very good actor)...white tableclothes....shared two pasta dishes and a bottle of chianti which the waiter kept pouring for us.    Dined "Af Fresco" and had an additional guest, a pigeon that kept walking back and forth past our table which added cute ambiance.   Would def call this a "date" place.

While I have always loved this restaurant, my last experience was a little underwhelming. I went to dinner there with a friend, and the service was not great. Our waiter was very nice and friendly  but seemed overwhelmed.  I actually had to ask for a drink refill twice as he never offered. At the end of the meal, he asked if we wanted  boxes for our leftovers, to which we agreed, then left, came back a second time and asked us again. The cherry on the cake was when a skinny, blonde hostess (who sounded also a little scattered)  inquired if I was someone's mother (who happens to be only 9 years younger than I. Clearly she did not get the memo that you never guess or assume a person's age. Not impressed and not sure I will be going back.

Pricey Italian restaurant tucked away by Coffee Bean in the Venetian. Interior is pretty basic, with wall of wine. We thought the restaurant would be more romantic. This location is more quaint with a mom and pop feel maybe? Half the seating area is also outside where people are wandering through the Venetian.  Nothing was terrible, but for the price and 4-star Yelp rating I expected better.  Garlic Bread: I hyped this up a lot in my head, but the bread was, well, bread. Not super garlic-y as I'd hoped, but very soft for sure. Spaghetti and Meatballs: the filet mignon meatballs were nothing special. Spaghetti sauce was a little on the sour side. Nothing out of the ordinary. Linguine in Clam Sauce: lots of clams, which were delish! Linguine was good, pretty standard.  I most likely will not go back, however the service was excellent! Several of the waiters were sweet older gentlemen who were so kind and cheery. One extra star for being so hospitable!

super cute little spot hidden in the venetian canal shoppes. only decided to check it out because of good reviews on yelp. my friend and i came here for dinner on a monday night. we were seated right away. service was good. the food was decently priced considering everything is so expensive in vegas. good portions too. the garlic bread they serve was yummy but a bit too greasy. it tastes great dipped in olive oil and balsamic vinegar though. i ordered the linguine with shrimp, my friend ordered the linguine carbonara. based on all the comments about how good the meatballs were, we decided to get those as an appetizer. definitely a good call on the meatballs. =) the pastas were both good. nothing spectacular with either dish. the carbonara was a bit heavy since it had a white sauce. we were way too stuffed to get any dessert.

I am a little baffled by all the 4-5 star reviews for this place. It's a tiny (really tiny) restaurant by the food court in the Grand Canal shops. The service was okay but not great. Someone in our party ordered a pizza with chicken and the waiter forgot to add chicken, then brought us a side of chicken after they were finished eating the pizza. Plus the pizza wasn't very good (the 90 second pizza place in the food court was better). I ordered a pasta and wasn't very impressed either. It wasn't bad but wasn't anything special. After eating (keep in mind I split a plate) my stomach felt terrible as well.    Overall I would suggest looking for a different Italian place. I'm sure there's other Italian places here with a lot better food and atmosphere.

Very good Italian food and service. I had spaghetti and meatballs and others had ziti. Two kids (3 and 19 months - and the mess associated with them but the staff was great about that) shared ravioli off the kids menu. We dined outside in pleasant weather. Pricing is spot on for what you get. Highly recommended!
This was really good. The individual pizza can easily feed two. The thing to know is this is located one second floor in the food court. Not much ambience.

We went there because it has such good reviews on yelp, but the reality was the opposite.  We had calamari as appetizer, we waited too long and we noticed the other table came and ordered their meal after us actually got their calamari around 10 - 15 mins earlier than us. By the time we got our calamari, it was another big disappointment, it tasted like it was sitting there for a while, it was just warm and not crispy, passes the best timing. We had pizza and pasta, the pizza also passed its best timing like our calamari, just warm....they didn't bring it to our table right after it was ready. We are pretty sure it was sitting on their kitchen counter for at least 5-10 mins.  We kind of pointed our concerns to our waiter, we asked him why other tables came after us actually got their meals earlier than us, and he just gave us some ridiculous excuse saying it was the kitchen, he doesn't have any control of it. I don't know if it's just our bad luck or maybe because we were the only Asian there. Other tables seem being taken care of nicely. Well, maybe I'm over thinking about this, but just saying, if u are Asian, do yourself a favor, go somewhere else. They don't really care, especially if you are not their own people.

We came here after getting a coupon for 50% off of our main dishes. I ordered the pesto gnocchi and my date ordered the chicken francese. If it weren't for the coupon I wouldn't come back here, $26 for a piece of average chicken and a small side of spaghetti! The best part of the meal wasthe complimentary garlic bread rolls they give you, can I just order a side of those to go?

Pretty satisfied with this restaurant. I normally don't venture out to Summerlin, but a group of my friends wanted to meet up since it had been a while since we all saw each other. Although it was warm outside, we sat in the outer dinning area and felt fine. The fans kept us really cool and we were shielded from the sun. Every table gets free bread and a plate of olives, cheese and other little vegetables. I ordered the pesto gnocchi which was just okay. I'm allergic to dairy so it is often hard to find a good meal without cheese in it at Italian restaurants. I think next time I will try the spaghetti and meatballs.   The prices are definitely high, so it's more of a place to celebrate a special occasion. Our waitress was super nice and patient with us. I would definitely go back for a date night

Best Italian style food. If you are around venetian then don't miss this place with nice environment and delicious foods. Our waiter was an middle aged man who was truly kind and polite. I'm happy that my friend told us to go there and enjoy.

My husband, granddaughter an I came here for lunch an let me say it was great. Loved the gact you can sit inside or outside. From the moment you walk in the place you know your going to have great food an Excellent service. I had the grilled chicken Cesare salad which was oh the hook. The flavor of the chicken was very good an cooked perfectly.  My husband had the Philly cheese  steak minus peppers an mushrooms an it was also good. An my he spaghetti our granddaughter had was good as well. The garlic knots omg...yummmm...The manager checked every order before it went out to make sure everything was perfect. Our server checked backed often to make sure we were ok as well as the manager. We will definitely be going back. All the food even the pizza looked amazing. Can't wait to try it all.

I will come here every time I'm in Vegas! I think it's probably the best italian food I've had! The staff is always so wonderful and accommodating; this is how all restaurants should be. My family went for my sister's birthday lunch and upon hearing this, our server brought out a huge slice of chocolate cake with a candle in it at the end of our meal.   Since we were all going to an early dinner later that day, everyone in our group decided to share a pasta dish with another person. Instead of bringing out an extra plate with each dish, the kitchen had perfectly portioned out half of each pasta for us.   This time around I ordered the linguine bolognese. I think this is my second favorite dish after the carbonara. You can't go wrong here. I think everything will be good.

I simply love this place. Like every review you have probably read about the place don't judge it by its location. Of all the restaurants in the shoppes this one is kind of hidden away but the food and the service is terrific. It has an old Italian restaurant feel. It judging by what happened from my last visit I owe them a great review. For starters the bread rolls are excellent they give you a lot and they oil and vinegar is kept at the table so you can add more to your plate whenever you want. Like every Italian restaurant I go I got the calamari. I can tell you that it taste terrific and they give you a huge portion. I was almost full from eating the appetizer with my wife. I got the Italian sangria to drink a very different but welcomed taste from other dark sangrias I'm used to. For dinner I had a Frutti Di Mare here they use bucatini noodles instead of the thinner linguini most restaurants do. It was excellent and is loaded with clams and mussels. Now to my wife's meal she had a moscato to drink and ordered something off menu a swordfish in piccata sauce. My wife doesn't like seafood at all but wanted something different. Of course she didn't like it but I had to do my due diligence and taste it and as far as fish dishes go I thought it was delicious the swordfish really sucks up all the piccata sauce making it very flavorful. My wife stated that she did not care for the meal and the excellent waiter ( what's up Victor) replaced it with a filet mignon which was cooked to perfection with potatoes and veggies in a pool of a sauce I can't describe but it was amazing. If anyone who works there reads this review to me explain that sauce to me. Tl:Dr Great restaurants

Yum!! I love trying new Italian places because I feel like every restaurant has something unique about it! Really enjoyed our dinner here. We ordered quiet a few things. My daughter had the chicken parmesan, I had the chicken Alfredo, and my husband had the shrimp pasta with linguine. My kids ordered pizza and we also had the calamari. I loved the chicken, it was tender and the alfredo sauce was perfect! My husbands linguine and shrimp was absolutely phenomenal!!! I thought everything was delicious!  Service was good but, I felt like we could have been waited on faster. It took a little while. They were very polite and apologetic. Will definitely visit again! It is definitely something you have to try at least once.
This was a real treat hidden deep in the Venetian. The spaghetti with tenderloin meat in the sauce was really fantastic. A great alternative to a buffet.

Enjoyed our dinner last week.  We started with the meatballs for our appetizer and knew we were going to love this place. We enjoyed people watching the spaghetti and baked ziti.  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was due to our waiter forgetting my soda.  The food was so good that I didn't point this out when the bill came.

Spending Labor Day weekend at the Venetian and saw the great reviews so we decided to have dinner here. I had the Italian Sangria for my cocktail and it was delicious. Lyndsay was our server and she did a fantastic job explaining the menu. We have been to many restaurants and the bread was the most moist and tastiest we ever had. The starter meat balls lived up to all the other reviewers comments  so it was well worth the money. My wife and I decided to share the Lobster Ravioli as she wanted to have room leftover for dessert. As it turned out we were stuffed and couldn't eat another bite. Everything here was fresh and tasty so we highly recommend this restaurant.
Nice little restaurant not in a restaurant area of the Venetian. Good food. Service was almost too fast, mainly due to the small size. Cozy.

After an hot Vegas afternoon of shopping my friend and I decided to stop for a salad and glass of wine.....so glad we passed on our original stop and tried something new.  We were promptly seated and waited on.  We ordered the peanut kale and caesar salad (added shrimp) and split a carafe of red sangria.  Everything was very fresh and well presented.  We really enjoyed the complimentary garlic knots.  Will be bringing more guests more often.

Loved the ambiance! Makes me feel like I'm in a family kitchen. The food was good. Nothing spectacular, but I wasn't disappointed. Drinks were strong, but you paid for that.  The only real issue was that we got lost trying to find it. The Venetian shops are a complicated place, but I've manage to navigate it before. We literally had to call to push back the reservation because we were wandering around lost. Even after getting directions, we got lost. That's not really a reflection on them though, just make sure to plan a little extra time.  Last visit: March 2015
Loved the veal Milanese and swordfish entrees. Very good service and nice ambiance. Would return again.

I'm so glad we came here for dinner! We were trying to fine somewhere to eat at the Venetian, which was not easy with so many places. We had Calamari, lobster ravioli (a must) and filet mignon (amazing). This will be my place to dine for sure my next visit!!! Can't go wrong, amazing food, friendly service, nice and cozy. And our server Amanda was absolutely wonderful! Thank you Amanda

Before a show at the Palazzo, I came here for dinner.  First impressions were not that good as there was no one at the podium.  A waiter came up to me, didn't say anything, and then turned and left.  Another waiter came over and showed me to a table on their "patio" along the Grand Canal Shops at the Venetian.  The tables are very close together in this area and as has been stated in other reviews, this is a high traffic area.  I tend to like people watching so I didn't mind the traffic.  It would have been nice if I didn't have to pretend not to hear the conversation of the two women at the table an arm's length from me.  I was brought a menu and asked about drinks.  Soon a server came with three cheese and garlic rolls and some balsamic and EVOO which he left on the table.  My iced tea was brought and I ordered.  Asking the server what was the smallest appetizer, he suggested the caprese.  I ordered the caprese and the pesto gnocchi.    The caprese was OK.  The tomatoes were hot house tomatoes and not very flavorful and a bit hard.  The burrata was quite good.  The pouch of cheese pulled apart and I could place it on the tomato slices.  My server had done some freshly grated pepper on the caprese and that helped.  The best appetizer would have been simply the cheese with some bread and EVOO and let the tomatoes die on the hothouse floor.  The pesto gnocchi was pretty standard.  There wasn't a strong pesto flavor, but the gnocchi were soft and tasty.  After dinner, the server brought me a tray of dessert replicas and I chose the tiramisu.  It's done in a manner you don't see very often.  Instead of a cake like dessert, this version is mostly cream with lots of chocolate powder and some pieces of cake and chocolate near the bottom of the cream.  This was the best part of the meal.  The cream was perfect.  My only complaint is the dessert was served in a fluted goblet, but in the manner of drizzling syrups and sauces over dishes for looks, the plate on which the goblet rested was lined with caramel sauce and confectioners' sugar.  Why decorate a plate on which there's no food?  In fact, I got part of my hand on the caramel and I needed to find a washroom after I left to wash it all off.  Service was good except for the start.  The place is OK but it's not a place I need to return to for Italian food.  Too many choices in this complex alone.
The food was excellent. I ordered the shrimp scampi and the sauce was to die for. The server was nice and attentive.

The location in the Ventian Hotel is lovely. You can dine indoors or in the outside area and watch people go by (it is not actually outdoors, it is just outside the eatery.) The service is great, every server is kind and knows the menu well. They can make great suggestions for you, but the menu does speak for itself. There is not a bad meal to be had (I don't eat veal, so I can't comment on that, but I have been told it is great). They have some great pizza and eat pasta offering is fantastic. Like most places in the Ventian Hotel, you will find exceptional service, food and you will not be rushed. Enjoy.

What a disgusting experience. First of all, disclaimer, my boyfriend and I always tip our waitresses for their service. And I can proudly say we tip very well. Our total came out to be $52.50 and I have gave the waitress $62.50 making this $10 back in cash. We waited 5 minutes while he continuously passed by our table taking care of the other customers, mind you this place was not busy at all. Finally my boyfriend spoke up to another person asking for our receipt,  and our change. A few minutes go by and our waiter comes back to our table with a crumpled up receipt. His response was " I always throw away the receipts, here you go" and I quickly respond, "What about my change?" He hesitated and mumbled upon words and began to explain of how he was confused that I have give him $62.50. And I responded once again "To get  $10 back" he then REACHES into his OWN pocket and pulls out HIS tip money and gives me MY $10. I took that money got up and gave it to the busser who actually helped us. I'm sorry but last time I heard it's an option to tip and not a requirement. He didn't give me the option, he just jumped right into it.  This man is an older man with white combed back hair. I am disgusted.

What a pleasant little restaurant.  The prices were very reasonable given the other restaurants in Vegas and the food was delicious.  The setting is like a small street side restaurant in Italy.  The staff look like they are all family.  The meal starts with warm bread and olive and balsamic vinegar for dipping.  The lasagna and penne vodka were delivered very quickly and more then met our expectation.  The lasagna was loaded with cheese and meat.  the pasta was al dente like you would find in Italy.  The only downside to the experience is the view which looks out across to a fast food lobster restaurant and being a small restaurant  you hear conversations from nearby loud tables.  But this is certainly a restaurant we will visit again.

Trattoria Reggiano is located inside the Venetian, but in a part that is somewhat out of the way. We stumbled across it on our way to find the passage to the Palazzo, in which we were staying, but I don't think that we would have discovered it otherwise. There is a limited amount of "indoor" and "outdoor" seating available, in quotations because the entire thing---which is basically doused with that charming mom-and-pop vibe---is inside a hotel, all decorated with a retro-Italian theme.  I ordered the Penne Primavera, a veggie-full dish with no sauce but just a dash of garlic for taste. It came fairly quickly, which was a relief because we were so hungry, but they also give you unlimited baskets of bread to eat with olive oil and vinegar. The Penne ended up being the slighlty-bland you would expect from something so healthy, but as I am trying to eat clean I decided it was a good choice and jealously eyed my friends' spaghetti and meatballs and Linguini Bolognese. I only had a taste of each, but I can attest that Trattoria sauce is exceptional. The meat is tender and perfectly complements the pasta.  There are no refills on drinks, however, because they come in bottles. (Water, of course, has refills).

Our new favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas!  The prices are very reasonable for being in the Venetian, and the service and the food are great.    They are now serving their buttery garlicy rolls warm after many requests from the customers.  Warning, they are so good that you may finish them all before the appetizer comes out and you will ruin your meal.  My wife always gets the penne with the vodka sauce and I try something different everytime.  So far, we've been pleased with all of our choices.

Love the service and the atmosphere. I indulged myself in the calamari and gnocchi. My wife had the tortellini. Both were so good. The pasta was very fresh. I have a new favorite Italian place to eat at. I will be coming back here for many more years.
