If you want authentic Italian food this is the place. The pasta is all homemade and as fresh as you can get it. The baked ziti with meatballs was incredible. I wish I could have finished it all, but I had to save some room for all my beer later. The fresh bread was also very good and my wife loved her ravioli too! It's a nice little Italian place with the feeling of a small town place. The service was great too.  The prices are very reasonable for Vegas. If you are looking for a super fancy dinner though, this isn't the place as it's more casual. We had a pretty bad dinner the night after, and said we wish would have just gone back to this place for the second night in a row. We will be going back next time we are in Las Vegas for sure.
Amazing food, great ambiance and friendly excellent service. Pizza and pastas were delicious!

We had just checked out of the Venetian and were looking for a nice place to have lunch on our last day in Vegas. Yelp led me to Trattoria Reggiano, conveniently located inside the Venetian, near the food court.  omggg UNLIMITED garlic knots!!! so. amazing. I'd come back just for that.  Our waitress had a delightful New York / Italian accent and was very charming.  Please note the usual 18% gratuity on parties of 6 or more.
The food was okay. The grilled chicken salad wasn't that good, it was too dry and burned. Overall the paste were about average.
Great service, amazing food. I'm Italian and from NY. I would say hands down this is the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas.

Went here for Valentine's Day on a second date.  The setup was not ideal for relaxing and getting to know someone.  The two tops are INCREDIBLY small and there were were surrounded on both sides by other two-tops, about 8-10 inches away.  I felt claustrophobic and it was uncomfortable to talk because the tables on each side of us could clearly listen in on our conversation. We might as well have all been at one big table together, that's how close we were. They need to spread things out a bit more if they want their ambiance to be better.  Stop trying to squeeze so many people in!  The food was pretty good, I told the waiter I wanted a pepperoni pizza and it came out smothered in kalamata olives and pepperoni ( I absolutely HATE olives!) Not sure why they did that...I did'nt want to complain in front of my date so I just picked them off but all I could taste was olives  :/  Pasta fagioli soup was decent, not the best I've had in the city.  Garlic knots were awesome.
Fun Italian restaurant. Great interaction with the staff.  The pizza  had a nice tomato sauce and crust that you wanted to save for bread sticks the next day. Will come back next time in Vegas.

Food was awesome! What a cute date spot. The tables are in the middle of the walkway of the grand canal shoppes, which is loud... But we enjoyed ourselves nonetheless.   Hubby ordered calamari- for $15, the portions were HUGE, and he said they were cooked perfectly! I got the marinated balsamic basil chicken salad for $16, which was one of the only gluten free items on the menu. It was delicious! The olive oil is some of the best I've ever had, and I couldn't stop pouring it on everything. The rolls that come out gratis are hot and melt-in-your-mouth delicious. Hubby also got a moretti beer- his favorite!  Amanda our server was so sweet and accommodating. I really appreciate how knowledgeable she was about the menu, especially with my severe gluten allergy. She made sure I knew exactly what was safe to eat, and what wasn't. I truly appreciated her concern.   Unfortunately, the other waiter working the lunch shift yesterday, a tall thin man with spiky hair, was so rude to everyone, yelling at his tables and then yelling right next to our table when the hostess seated a couple in his station, screaming that he couldn't handle any more tables and that someone needed to help him! It was so sad! I'm so glad we had Amanda as our server and not him; he would have ruined our meal.   The espresso is illy but it's watery and not worth the $4.50 price point. It does come with a mini cantucci though.   The other disappointing thing about the restaurant was the horrifically rude floor manager/hostess, in a brown striped top with brown hair. She yelled at us when we asked about gluten free options before sitting down, as if she couldn't even waste her time talking to us, and told us to leave- thankfully Amanda saved us and said that yes there were gluten free options, albeit few, and that she'd be more than happy to help us.

Excellence in all aspects of a restaurant. Food was excellent. Service was excellent.  Not to be missed: the Eggplant Rolatini appetizer and the cannoli, (insert vulgar descriptive word here) AMAZING! Eat here, you wont be disappointed;)

This place is kind of a hidden gem at The Venetian. I would never have thought to give this place a try had it not been for the thick "Yellow Pages" type book in the hotel room (where it was listed) and for Yelp. My friend and I came here around 5:30 on a Saturday and were, luckily, seated right away (I don't believe they take reservations). It is a small restaurant, but quaint. I love that the waiters spoke Italian; it made it more authentic to me. Also, our waiter was funny and really nice.  As for the food, it's yummy. The portions are big and you won't hurt your wallet eating here. Thank you to whoever suggested the meatballs. I think they are, by far, the best I've ever had. They were full of flavor and super moist. The garlic rolls were delicious as well. I was torn between the Penne in Vodka Sauce and Linguine Carbonara and the waiter suggested the latter. I am definitely glad he steered me that way because it was really good. If I had more room in my stomach I would've devoured the last three or four bites. My friend had the pepperoni pizza (I can't remember what it was listed under on the menu) and that was good as well (super big portions, it's like ordering a medium from Pizza Hut). The tiramisu was a perfect ending to the meal. I'd love to come here again and try their other dishes.
Amazing food and absolutely loved the staff. Great portions of food and lots to choose from. I tried many dishes and deserts and I can't pick a favorite cause it was all delicious.

Had a nice lunch here. It's tucked in just past the food court in the Venetian. We had a couple of pizzas and a pasta dish. The service was friendly and attentive. Definitely a good option if you're looking to sit down and get out of the busyness if the Venetian.

Garlic bread rolls: They were warm and buttery.  They served good quality olive oil and balsamic vinegar with it.    Chicken Caesar Salad: tasted good and, the chicken was freshly grilled.   Linguini with clam sauce: lotsa clams and it's very good.   Shrimp scampi: best we've had.  Shrimp was fresh...   Free cannoli for dessert: yummy!  we got it free when they honored a coupon from the Grand Canal Shoppes Premier Passport which you can obtain from the concierge (it has coupons for shops and restaurants).   A bit pricey with the whole meal at $70+ but it was worth it.
Had a great time this past weekend! Loved their new singer. Beautiful voice! I hope this will be a regular for the weekend. I'm still dreaming about my amazing pizza. Great addition to downtown
Authentic Italian and freshly made! Recommend to anyone wanting good Italian on the Strip

I'm not really a fan of Italian food but I absolutely loved this place!! The Venetian is wonderful to begin with... but there's something so charming about the illusion of being in Italy, throughout the dinner we actually wanted to believe that we were in an authentic Italian street side café, with perfect blue skies (although it was already night time).   We sat in the "outside patio" portion of the restaurant and even though there was a lot of hurried-people watching, you couldn't help to feel that the ambiance was still relaxing, as if time had stood still. The service was great and the servers were not at all worried to rush their customers out of there.  We had wine, the Chicken parmesan, and gnocchi's.... all very delicious. The portions are big so we didn't really have room for dessert.  I would definitely go again!

This is the real deal! We started with the Calamari and the Caprese Mozzarella. The calamari perfectly cook and the Mozzarella creamy and delicious.  I had the linguini with clams. The pasta perfectly cooked and the little neck clams overflowing!  My husband had the eggplant and pasta that was to die for!  Then on the to dessert!  We shared a piece of ricotta cheese cake that was smooth and tasty. One of the best I have had in a long time. We also had the cannoli that had great filling and a nice crunchy shell. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. It is definitely a place we will be coming back to time and time again!

Sucks! That was my overall experience! I am sorry! After we have been seated we waited about 10 minutes and no one came to greet us and to take orders!! What!!! We went around 1 PM on a Sunday and they were not even busy at all! I wonder how bad it could have been if they were actually busy! After 10 minutes here came this waitress who looked like just woke up from a nap or something. So unprofessional! She looked like she didn't want to be there!! Wow!! And the food sucked too!! Chicken was so burnt!!! Literally black! And tasted burned! Too small portions felt like its kid's meal or something!!! I will never ever go there again!!

Oh what a disappointment Summerlin location  Server very nice but clueless. I ordered a stella Artois. It was hot out and I so looked forward to a chilled glass of beer. What did a get.. I hot mug that belonged in a German beer haus (must have just come from dishwasher) and within seconds my beer was warm. Not to mention that glass itself was heavy as hell. Strike 1.. Asked server for a "stella" glass and she said sorry we don't carry them. Well then don't offer then beer if you can't serve it properly.   Next ordered the Cesar. That was ok but soooo much dressing I was scraping it off with my knife. Also for an Italian restaurant not much of a selection for Salads.   Next. they are supposed to be know for their . I ordered spaghetti and meatballs. The spaghetti was not fresh or home maid and for the meatballs.  Flavorless. I actually had to salt them and the sauce. I'm 100% Irish and my "gravy" is way better. This sauce was so sweet it tastes like tomatoes and sugar.   Finally.. Cheap plates and Togo bags for leftovers which I didn't mind since I had no desire to eat mine.   Sorry but I will not return which is sad because it's a beautiful mall and location.

Update to my review -  We came back to this restaurant for lunch on a 2nd trip to Vegas, which i NEVER do (like to try new spots). Again, very good. Super casual lunch, nothing too wowwing about it ambiance wise, but i had an amazing salad, we got the chicken parm again, and the garlic bread knots - wowwie so good. It takes us forget to navigate thru Venetian to find it but worth it.   (original review): HANDS DOWN... Best ever. Highly recommend. Very casual feel, small place, but absolutely amazingly delicious food, charming server, and just an all around authentic traditional italian feel. From the olive oil and vinegar on the table for fresh bread, the delicious sauce, their tiramisu - delicious. 3/5 of us got the chicken parm - it was delicious. Salads were great and shrimp scampi meal also great. If you're staying in or near the Venetian, you've got to go here. I had just a wonderful experience... thanks to Yelp, because that's how i found it!!

In the Venetian, do like Italians do: late dinner in a trattoria. But, we we're probably very late for American standards. Although we had to wait for a table upon arrival, within 15-20 minutes half the restaurant was empty. This was around 09.30/10.00 p.m. But we didn't mind. Good atmosphere, nice staff, excellent food.  We shared half a family platter with charcuterie and cheeses. More than enough. Only thing that could have been better were the roasted peppers and bell peppers. Unfortunatly not fresh. An it's so easy, and so cheap to make them from scratch......:(. And after ordering they ran out of eggplant. So no parmigiani melanzane. My favorite dish in the world.  The bread is very nice. Warm, preparered with a lot of garlic and butter. Served with olive oil and balsamico.  Both the appetizer and the entrees were excellent. The swordfish came with a nice choice of vegetables and potatoes. The soup with beans and pasta had a nice taste and bit.

Had it not been for yelp, we probably would have never tried this place and I'm so glad we found it.   The food was great, they have a nice wine selection and the service was good. The meatballs were delicious and so was the carbonara. The atmosphere was not what I had expected, but overall this is a great spot in Vegas.

This is our favorite go to Italian restaurant whenever we visit Las Vegas.  Foods are delicious such as Spaghetti with meatballs,  Linguine with clams and their pizza is amazing.  It's very authentic and traditional Italian.  Love it!

Great view, nice seating, but the service was bad.  John was uptight, and mumbled.  He was slow to get our order, and never asked us if we wanted a second drink.  Our glasses where empty before we got our meal, and never once asked.  Its too bad, because the food was great.

My boyfriend and I just finished a late lunch at this restaurant and let me tell you.....it is now our new favorite place!!! We were completely blown away by the atmosphere and the excellent service we received. Our servers name was Heather*** (I'm sorry heather!) and she was terrific. We also got a chance to meet the restaurant Manager, Mimmo. He is one of the main reasons we will be returning to this restaurant, besides the tasty food, of course! Mimmo is from Rome, Italy and he makes you feel like part of the family.   The atmosphere is outstanding. I absolutely love the layout of this cute little restaurant. The kitchen is open so you could see everything which is a really great touch.   They bring free garlic knots to the table, which they are so soft and accented with Parmesan and Romano cheese. We decided to start off with some calamari as our appetizer. It was the best calamari I have ever had! It was so tender and perfect. So, compliments to the chef.   For our entrees we ordered baked ravioli and baked ziti and those were excellent as well! I am completely impressed by this cute little restaurant and I will keep returning to enjoy their great food!
Don't let the proximity to the food court fool you- this is a nice, sit down restaurant. Yummy Italian food & great service.

AMAZING Food and amazing service. Beautiful place, relaxing and delicious. Italiano at it's best. Next time I have to try the desert but the food was so good that I over ate. Worth every penny in my book.

Took a party of 3 around 8pm last night. Outdoor seating was perfect for the weather. Nice area to eat. However both hostesses were either completely new to the business or new to a customer service job. No smile .... No nothing ... Barking out seating times. The alcoholic drinks were great , the food was average. The server was good and made me feel like I was in New York. Accent attached!! Wouldn't recommend the lobster tortellini.... But the meatballs and spaghetti were great.  Overall .... Would return only in a pinch.

The food is pretty good, not really mind blowing.  I had the pasta carbonara and we had calamari and the filet mignon meatballs as appetizers.  The filet mignon meatballs were great and everything else was just OK.  Prices were high for what it was and other than the calamari the servings were small to meadium sized at best.

Subpar Italian place located in the Venetian Hotel. It was fine for a dinner out with nothing glaringly wrong, but just didn't impress.   The atmosphere is nothing spectacular and even kind of strange with no views except a gift shop and other stores. Our server was very friendly and attentive. The garlic knots at the beginning were probably the best part of the meal- very fluffy and flavorful.   I wasn't feeling so hot so I just got soup and a Caesar salad. The soup was 12 dollars for a bowl of pasta e fagioli. The soup was good, not great and had way more beans than broth. It almost didn't even feel like a soup because of how many beans there were! I'm all for beans in a soup, but I want to feel like I'm eating soup at the same time. The salad was just alright, nothing special. My friends felt the same about all of their dishes. Just meh overall! Wouldn't come back.

First time here and really enjoyed the food. Service was great but we sometimes waited a little bit for the waiter to return - it wasn't all that busy, but he was very attentive to each table and was wonderful otherwise. I didn't realize the place was small inside, but that kept it quaint. Definitely looking forward to going again.

Excellent food!  Meatballs and bread for starters.  Wife had the Eggplant Parm and I had the Chicken Parm.  Both were amazing.  The Canoli for desert was the best I have had.  Fresh and Delicious food...would definitely recommend!

Me and my wife go there once a week to have a couple of drinks, and a pizza.  The food is very good.  Bethany is a great bartender.  Recently they added live music, which, in my opinion makes the dining experience worse.  The musicians are pretty old, have way too much hair dye, and sing songs that attracts an older crowd.  The sad part is that after a while, the sixty-somethings begin to dance, and let everyone know how drunk they are.  Hopefully they can trim down the number of nights that they have live music.

Outstanding Italian food in the Venetian Mall! If you're lucky enough to be in Vegas and at the Venetian, don't skip this very popular spot in the Mall. The atmosphere on the patio has the urban street scene feel with all the mall customers walking by; lot's of hustle and bustle but it's not distracting like having a slot machine ringing in your ear. It was loud, boisterous... but nice! Very cool joint that I can't wait to visit again.  WHEN YOU GO- Ask for Sergio and wait if you have to. The guy's worth it! DO NOT skip the Filet Mignon Meatballs. They're as good as they sound. Lobster Ravioli, Chicken Parm and lobster ravioli are winners as well.  Very nice spot that is from now on in my regular Las Vegas resto rotation!

Food is great but the speed was unacceptable. The appetizers come out timely but the main dish takes a bit too long. The people to the left and right of us sat way later than us and got their food before us. We only ordered pasta. Nothing that takes long to cook at all. Seems this was a one-off situation but it was properly made up to us when brought to the manager's attention. Since the business practice of taking care of customers was satisfactory, I adjusted the review to 4 stars.

Customer service is the only reason I'm giving 3 stars, not sure if I came on a bad day but when I came here 2 years ago and the quality of the food was 10 times better and cheaper. Definitely not worth the $20+ pasta plates or $14 calamari.  Unfortunately will not be coming back or recommending this place to friends and family.

The service was amazing here. We came here during their lunch time on a Sunday. They had a brunch menu, which was basically similar to their dinner menu but in a smaller portion. However, this portion was definitely not small at all. It just seemed like they served dinner portion food in a small plate. We ordered couple beers, and they were served in a cold icy glass, which we loved for a sunny Sunday afternoon. Also, we ordered their carbonara pasta with shrimp and Vongole. The linguine was cooked perfect, and so was the spaghetti. I love their shrimp for some reason, since they cook it so tender.   Our server-I believe his name was Anthony- was friendly, attentive and caring. We found a random piece of thick thread in our vongole, but didn't really care. It was not a hair or anything. We killed the dish, and at the end of the meal, we told the server that the food was amazing-however, we still went ahead and told them about the little piece that we found so they could prevent it from happening to other customers-since some people do rage about nothing.  The manager came over to our table and apologized. I do not think it was their fault, since things like this can happen. He comped the pasta dish for us, which made us feel horrible. However, we left the amount as tip, and left very satisfied.  TIP! The Andes Mint Chocolates they give at the end of your meal are perfect dessert!  Love every aspect of this restaurant. I specially like this location better than venetian one. Definitely give it a try!

Not sure if some people dined on the wrong day, but my family and I had a great dinner at Trattoria Reggiano. It was my second time dining here, and they impressed me one more time. We ordered pasta al aglio e olio, linguine with clams (with white sauce) and the oven grilled bruschetta pizza. There was nothing special from the appetizers or the salad section so we did not order anything, but their garlic knots were more than enough for us to start the dinner. I personally loved their bread. It was tasty with just enough oil as well. The flavor went very well with the balsamic and olive oil.   Food was served very promptly as it should be for pastas. The presentation did have anything special but the food smelled delicious. I didnt add shrimp to my aglio e olio this time because my sister is allergic to shrimp, but you can also add some for 6 dollars, and their shrimps are always cooked very nicely. We wanted gnocci but they were out of pesto sauce, so we didnt, but I would definitely try it next time. Linguine was tasty as well, the clams were cooked right and there was enough juice on the dish that the linguine was moist until we were done eating. The bruschetta pizza was recommended by our server, it was one of the greatest oven grilled pizzas I have had so far. The fresh mozzarella went well with it. I usually am not a big fan of onions, but even the onions tasted so yummy.   Service tonight was great as well. The staff fulfilled our needs promptly and friendly. We had a great dinner here. I am going to try their new location in Summerlin next time and try their gnocci.

I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could.  Felt like I was sitting on an Italian street, cute, quaint and good food.  Had a cheese less pizza and some meatballs.  The meatballs were good, good sauce and warm garlicky rolls.  Sat out front, great people watching.   There are a lot of restaurants in the area (in the immediate area) and this place can hold it's own.  It's solid food, cute location and good service.

Been here 3-4 times in the past. Today's visit was disappointing and underwhelming. Service was quick and attentive BUT somewhat cold and unwelcoming  Spaghetti with meatballs was okay, liked it before but not so much tonight. Shrimp scampi had decent shrimp but sauce was bland. Bread, as usual, was consistent and good... A little oily this time but still good.  Better than most italian restaurants in Vegas BUT not the best I have had in comparison with restaurants in Los Angeles. SF and NYC

We've been coming here since our honeymoon 2009. It was a little place that grew into a wonderful open restaurant...we have never been anything other than blissfully happy with our meal and experience.. it seems to be family run and they really care that you are happy with your service and food... my husband loves the spaghetti and meatballs and I have them make linguine Alfredo with shrimp. My only bad experience was dripping balsamic vinegar on my favorite top... love this place and will never go anywhere else in Vegas for Italian...

What's a girl to do to entertain herself while her husband is at a boring convention?  Why, go out solo for a romantic Italian dinner, of course!  After a little online research, I stumbled upon Trattoria Reggiano.  The reviews looked good, and the price was right, so I decided to check it out--I'm so glad I did!   I was first taken aback by how tiny the restaurant is. Seriously, you could legitimately call it a "hole in the wall" because it's just that small-there are only seven tables inside and a handful of tables outside in mall walkway. As it turns out, sometimes the best things come in small packages!    When I walked in, I was immediately seated and served some fantastic bread! I placed my order and started a glass of wine. Before I could even finish my first piece of bread, my spaghetti and meatballs were already brought to the table! The service in this place was great!  My food was fantastic (apparently, previous posters weren't joking about the filet mignon meatballs)!  My check was a total of $27--not too bad at all, especially in comparison to the other Italian spots that are found all over the area.  All in all, it was a great experience. Also, this place is legit--the servers were all speaking to each other in Italian--I loved it! I definitely recommed paying Trattoria Reggiano a visit!
3 star Italian. Food and service was good. Bar was slow at getting drinks to the table. The live entertainment had a speaker that was cracking so it was distracting and we didn't stay for dessert.

I am shocked at how many good reviews are on here. This place is very overpriced for what you get. The service was terrible, our waiter ( or the owner?) was un-friendly and abrupt. The food was really mediocre. I find it hard to believe that this restaurant received an average of 4 stars.       The only good thing was the garlic bread  This restaurant was a major disappointment

After a long day in the vegas heat, me and my girlfriend were starving, tired and needing someplace to eat. We headed to the Venetian since she knew some good places there. Unfortunately all of the places she wanted to go to had long waits and we just wanted someplace to sit down and eat good fun. We were almost ready to eat at the food court when we saw this small italian cafe right next to the coffee bean. I looked at the menu and the prices were perfect, with everything under 15 dollars, best of all, no wait and we were seated immediately. Instantly garlic bread balls were brought out and they were amazing. The service was incredible, it felt like we were in someones home even though we were a few feet from the food court. We split a caeser with nice big chunks of italian cheeses along with a simple pasta and it was the perfect meal. I recommend it to anyone who just wants a place that is nice, easy and reasonably priced.

1) Most importantly, food was an A. Pesto gnocchi was flavorful, texture was perfect. Then again, it would be hard to mess gnocchi's texture up, wouldn't it? Lobster ravioli too was full of flavor, came out pleasantly warm and both dishes were good portion sizes. As were the filet mignon meatballs, which make quite the appetizer (if you are considering ordering them, just do it). Wine prices by the glass and bottle were typical. Garlic knots were a little too reminiscent of a local pizza parlor's, but I'll take it. A little dressing of balsamic vinegar and Olive oil will do the trick.  2) Secondly, service was a B. Our server was very friendly, but simply put, we just didn't see enough of him. Of course we want to enjoy our meal privately, but more intimate interaction would have warranted two thumbs up instead of one. 3) Atmosphere was a B-. If you're sitting inside I imagine it's a little more cozy than the outside tables that are uncomfortably close to the passing Venetian guests walking by eyeballing your entrees. I hope your dining guest is easy on the eyes, for he/she will really be all there is to look at during your meal.

We had our annual Las Vegas trip and of course Trattoria Reggiano was on the agenda...dinner was delicious and wonderful as ever!  Scampi is my favorite and the arugula salad is exquisite.  Always a treat, always a luscious meal.  Thank you Trattoria Reggiano!

Great food, wonderful staff, very welcoming. I can't say anything bad about this place. I would give it 5 stars but it is noisy due to the surroundings. This place isn't 5 star fancy dining, it is very good food in a friendly, welcoming and informal atmosphere.
Wanted to get wowed by this place. The food was good, but I can get the same food at my neighborhood pizza place. Again, it was good, but nothing special.

We frequent this place. It's located in Downtown Summerlin and is next the the Regal 5. The eggplant appetizer is the best! We also like the pizza. Everything we have tried has been good. The service isn't the best but not bad enough to not go back.

Ok.. I'm Italian so to me to rate an Italian restaurant is really something.  I will say only one thing... Not in New York, not in Seattle... But the best Italian restaurant I have ever been is here in Las Vegas.  The clam linguine were something amazing.. Pasta al dente... It was delicious.   Pizza... Was the nearest one to the real Italian pizza. Perfect ingredients, perfect sauce and perfect mozzarella.   5 stars.. Without doubt.

We had a great meal last week.  Vegetables were cooked perfectly and the waiter, an older gentleman, was great with the kids.  Everyone's meal came out on time and was nice and hot.  Prices were fair.  We will be back again.

Went there for an early lunch to avoid the crowds during peak mealtimes.   Not a bad idea since the restaurant is on the small side and they do not appear to take reservations.    After reading all the rave reviews about the meatballs, well of course I had to get them as an appy!  The server was kind enough to offer the option of cutting down the standard order down to only one or two meatballs from the usual three, so that I can enjoy the entree that I really wanted without killing myself ; ).   People weren't kidding about the meatballs -- they were great for sure, but in my opinion,Trattoria Reggiano truly shines with their killer bolognese, bar-none.    For the main, I decided on their daily special, which happened to be mushroom ravioli bolognese.  Boy was I ever in for a spectacular treat!!!  It will definitely be difficult to go back to the usual pink slime bolognese that the average restaurant serves, where the ground "meat" simply melts into the sauce for the most part.  Not only were the al dente ravioli large enough to be nicely stuffed with that aromatic mushroom/ricotta/goat cheese mixture, the generously portioned pillows of pasta were heavily blanketed by the other star of the dish: an uber thick and hearty meat sauce made with nothing other than abundant chunks of  high quality ground filet mignon.    Each bite was full of lean, solid meat and juicy tomato chunks.   Insane depth of flavours and textures....best pasta I've had to date, short of traveling to Italy.    The bill came to $34 but there was enough left over to cover dinner.  There was no microwave in the hotel room to heat it up but that did not diminish the food's taste by much. Still thoroughly enjoyed it unheated as much as I did at the restaurant.     Two meals of this heavenly goodness.......  OMG what a dream food day!!! =)

Loved it!! Great spot. We got a 50% off entree coupon at Tix4Today-- you spend $3/person to get the coupon, but it certainly helped us save. Garlic knots were to die for, penne vodka was some of the best I've had-- smooth and silky sauce dente pasta. The Caesar was a little over dressed, but the dressing was good so I can't complain. Nice service.   The only thing I'd say is that for the Venetian the "views" aren't great. It's situated right near the food court adjacent to a gift shop. They did a nice job with the decor and adding some green shrubs to shield a bit. And the prices were very reasonable (all pastas were $15-$22, chicken parm $26, small Caesar $8) so for us the small tradeoff was worth it.   We will definitely be back if we are in Vegas again!

The food here was pretty good, though we made the mistake of arriving about 10-20 minutes before close. We wanted to sit inside because it looked cozier than the tables in the middle of the walkway, but we were told actually they were starting to clean up in there so we would have to sit outside. No problem!  However, we felt immediately like the few waitstaff were visibly upset we had been seated, particularly our waiter. He looked tired, and annoyed he had a table. So much so we literally asked him 3-4 times if it was really OK that we were sitting down to eat. He assured us it was OK if we put the order in quickly.   Overall, they pushed the food out quickly, and we all enjoyed our pizza/pasta. For the price, this place is quite the deal on the strip. You get a lot, it's in a nice indoor location, and the food was very good. If this was a normal restaurant I would give it 3 stars (entirely because of the feeling like we were a burden, the food was great), but the value vs others around make it a 4 for me.
Great spot!! To have dinner we shared the Ceasar salad , meat balls and baked ziti!! Delicious I'm just saying.

Amazing first experience here tonight. I brought an out-of-town guest so I was looking to make a good impression, it did not disappoint.  Danny was our server and Ricky worked along with him to make sure our drinks were never empty and we had everything else we needed. They brought a lovely plate of olives, cheese and peppers along with the MOST AMAZING garlic knots to munch on before our meal. I had the Chicken Parmesan; it's really tasty and the portions are huge!  I will definitely come back. Thank you to Danny and Ricky for takin care of us ladies and making us feel welcome.

My wife and I went here and really enjoyed it.  It's a small restaurant with limited seating but the wait was not bad at all.  The service was great with a friendly staff.  The food was really good.  I had the spaghetti and meatballs which was really good.  For dessert we shared a cannoli.  I have been to Italy and have my favorite places in New York to get cannoli's and this place was just as good.  I recommend this place for sure.  Great service, good food and great price for the meal.

Wow! From the moment you walk in to this place you know you are going to eat real Italian food! The smells in here are stunning! The kitchen overlooks the dinning area so you can see your food being cooked right in front of you! Very cozy intimate spot, great for a date night and great food! Staff was excellent and took care of all our needs. I had the chicken parm, it was very tasty, chicken was juicy and not fried tasting. Red sauce is very Southern Italian, pizzas are big and flavorful. This will be a weekly spot to eat at! Finally real Italian food in Summerlin! Looking forward to trying other dishes!!! Yum!

This place is SO good. We came here on our first night in Vegas since we were craving Italian food. The staff was super friendly and happy to answer any questions we had. They give you bread while you wait and it was delicious! Buttery and covered in Parmesan cheese. I ordered the linguine with clams and my boyfriend got the chicken Parmesan. Seriously amazing. I ate every last bite! My mouth is watering just thinking about it haha. If you're in the mood for Italian food go here. You won't be disappointed!

Authentic YUMMY Italian food!!!!  A nice refreshing change from your typical Vegas strip choices.  It's a very small place, so be prepared for a wait.  But the wait won't be as long as the crazy waits at big, popular restaurants.  This place is definitely worth it!  We had the spaghetti and meatballs, a grilled chicken salad, and seafood linguini.  The pre-meal bread was quite delicious as well.  Prices were very reasonable as well for being located in the Venetian.

Once again "thank you" Trattoria Reggiano for making my dining experiences a pleasure each and every time I eat here.  Each time I visit Las Vegas I make it a point to eat here; although this year I was only able to make it in once.  The service is fantastic and the ambiance is certainly like visiting a small Italian restaurant in Italy.    It is always a pleasure to see server John, whom I mostly always have wait on me, even if we have to wait for an open table in his area.  Also it was nice to see and say hello to Carl, who has also waited on me when John was off for the night.  The service was just as wonderful as always and it is so nice to have John and the other staff remembers me from year to year.   The new manager, Flavia, who has been there about 1 year, replaced the previous manager, Stephano, who went to one of the family's other restaurants.  Flavia was a just a pleasure to talk with and I enjoyed her.  I look forward to seeing her and the rest of the staff on my next trip.      Menu items chosen on this trip:  Arugula and Cherry Tomato Salad and Spaghetti Puttanesca.  Great salad and fantastic Spaghetti.  Be sure to stop by and have some garlic pizza dough rolls slathered with olive oil once you sit down.

Their food is very good. They provide a complimentary plate with cheese, olives and peppers for a small starter. After, they give garlic knots (which are only ok. Not the best I've ever had, but still yummy. Besides, they're free.) I ordered a pasta & a pizza. The baked ziti was FANTASTIC! I really enjoyed the sauce, and it's very very cheesy. I had the Salame Picante Pizza, which was also very good. The crust is really why it was fantastic. It's a thin crust pizza, but not super crispy and hard to eat. The olives are definitely fresh, italian olives. Unfortunately, the food does not make this place worth going to. For a 75 dollar dinner (for two people) I expect MUCH more.   The reason I'm not giving it 4 or 5 stars is because of the atmosphere, lack of unprofessionalism, and the manager. Our server, who was from North Carolina, did well. No complaints there. My complaint is mostly in regards to the open kitchen and the manager, Dan, who truly does not care at all. With an open kitchen, you must teach your cooks how to behave. When I sit down in front of an open kitchen, I have zero desire to listen to the cooks personal music blasting from their phones. If you're gonna have an open kitchen, you should probably tell your cooks that if theres guests sitting four feet away, the music restaurant should suffice.   Something else that was frustrating was having the football game on. I personally don't care that the football game was on - especially since it's the beginning of the season. What I do mind is when you allow your staff to walk around yelling "TOUCHDOWN!" Again, there are guests here. I paid 75 dollars to eat my dinner in a nice restaurant, not buffalo wild wings.  LASTLY, my biggest issue of all - the manager Dan. When I expressed my concerns, Dan just stood there. After about 30 seconds, he says "I'll address it." Not a "Im sorry. You're right, that's not acceptable." Nothing. I already paid my bill, I had zero intention of a comped item. But Dan is by far the most lack luster, uncaring manager ever. Perhaps Trattoria Regiano in Venetian holds their staff to a higher standard than this location.  In sum, If you're going to Downtown Summerlin and are looking for a nice meal - go anywhere else. You'll actually enjoy the atmosphere of Shake Shack better.

try this place, you won't be disappointed! lobster ravioli was amazing, meatballs and ziti were so darn delicious, pasta was cooked perfectly, complimentary garlic rolls and a mini charcuterie plate of olives roasted bell peppers and parmesan chunks are the details that make this Italian restaurant truly special. The service here is warm friendly and welcoming. I love this place!!!

This place is a slice of Italy. The service is awesome and only second to the food. Small, elegant and better than mama's cooking. Affordable and a little hard to find but worth looking for. Ask for John.

5 star quality food at this little restaurant tucked away in the Venetian.  The garlic knots are the best I have EVER tasted!  My sister got the spaghetti and meatballs, I had the chicken parm. Both of our plates were cleaned! Highly recommend!

I try my best to be honest and detailed so that other tourists can make an informed decision regarding visiting an establishment.   My wife and I were in Vegas looking for good Italian food. We searched Yelp and other resources and decided we wanted to try this restaurant.   Our journey: this is not the restaurants fault, but worth noting. Not knowing how to get to this establishment we relied on the directory. BIG MISTAKE. no joke it took us 20 min to find this place. After asking, and looking at several directories ( that show "you are here" backwards from where you really are). At one point my wife and I were tempted to just eat any place, but it became a game to find this restaurant. Once here it was smaller than expected and kind of exposed to the mall. But we were happy to find it!   The service was superb! Wish I remembered our waiters name. A younger Italian gentleman. Super nice, checked on us at all the right times. Overall very good service.   Food: we both had Caesar salads that were very good. I had chicken parmesan which was great and my wife had chicken Marsala. It was honestly very good food.   Our bill came and it was "cheap" for Vegas, around $80 or so. Considering we had great service and good food I put $120 bucks in the binder and we finished our drinks. Our waitress took the bill, asked if we needed change and I said no you're all set. 2 min later he walked pasted us and thanked us which was nice. As we left he made it a point to thank us again saying he really appreciated it. I wasn't looking for that, but it was very nice of him.   I recommend this place. No frills, small, but great food with good service.

Yelp found us a wonderful place for Father's Day dinner as we began a two week road trip. Service was EXCEPTIONAL! Hilda was sweet and attentive as were the bussers. She even brought a small cannoli to my husband for dessert.  Food was great! You start with a little appetizer dish of peppers, olives and parm cheese chunks along with the best garlic knots ever. Could have stopped there. So good! And Hilda brought MORE!! Swordfish Siciliana was delicious - tender, juicy approx 8oz piece was plenty to share with capers, olives and tomatoes. We shared it along with the eggplant pizza which had a crispy thin crust and sliced eggplant and riccota. Lovely. Kid had what looked to be house made tortellini. Can't tell you much more than they disappeared quickly.   Wonderful experience in Vegas, away from the drama of the strip.

I'm a creature of habit. So when it's winter time in Vegas,  the intense craving of warmth draws me here biweekly until the ice thaws. My go-to order is meatballs, garlic knots, broccoli rabe, and pasta e fagioli. I'm pretty sure everything on the menu is good, but I can't risk ordering my go-to items. You have all your food group to feel good about your meal especially after good workout session. The atmosphere is beautiful with just the right amount of class but not stuffy. I picked up a togo order on a Thursday night once and it was bustling with life music. In Vegas, there's no shortage of Italian food, but this place has the right amount seasoning in all categories.

This place has just served me a delicious meal. The garlic rolls were very good and the swordfish siciliano style is out of this world. The wine selection was small but I was able to find a nice one to go with my meal. The vegetables that accompanied the entree were perfectly steamed.

I must say this trattoria inside the Venetian is quite delectable. Both the food and the service were excellent!  The more notable entrees were the 4-cheese pizza, linguini frutti di mare (contains shrimp, baby clams, and calamari tossed in a spicy red clam sauce over pasta), linguine carbonara (linguine al dente, imported pancetta, egg yolks, and parmigiano reggiano).   The dishes tasted more authentic Italian than one would have expected. The garlic bread knots served were so good I wish I had the room to eat more of them.  All in all, terrific restaurant in a very nice hotel with very reasonable price!

This was soooooo good! It was by far my favorite meal in Vegas. I enjoyed everything I tasted--the garlic knots, calamari, salad, and cappelini pomodoro. What a lovely meal! I'll definitely make a point to go back here if I'm ever in Vegas again.

I am confused by the high rating on here. The tables were sort of in the middle of a food court. The food was very mediocre and Italian is one of those types where it's hard to go wrong. The pasta was nothing to brag about. The pizza was eh... And the soup was bland. The best part about the meal was the bread... Now that was delicious!   Our server had major attitude. Told me to "chill out" when I was trying to move items on the table to make room for the food, then he spilled Parmesan cheese in my drink. When I asked for a new cup he rolled his eyes and told his busser, someone had put cheese in my drink and "I want a new one" like he was mocking me. It was just bizarre. He seemed miserable. Anyway... There are way better places to go for Italian in Vegas. Checked this one off the list!

Excellent food! The garlic knots were so delicious, it was hard to stop at two.... ok, maybe four. No oil/vinegar or butter required. I ordered a custom pizza... pepperoni w/ mushrooms and artichokes. The mushrooms were so fresh, that I would order a basic mushroom pizza some other time. No complaints whatsoever when it comes to the food. We got a table quickly, but the wait time for service was a bit slow, I guess because they were so busy. It was a Thursday. My boyfriend and his mom loved the bolognese sauce. Oh, and one more tip... they close at 11, not 12 (at least, not on weekdays) like their site states. The night before we ate there, we got there too late because of this. Update your hours!!

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner and were happy with the awesome service and the satisfying food.  We made reservations last minute, were seated immediately, and had a really attentive waiter throughout. The food came out super quickly which was great because we were definitely hungry!   They started us off with some complimentary bread - soft, fresh, cheesy, and oh so fluffy! A wonderful start to the meal!   We ordered the meatballs as an appetizer. This came with 3 generously sized meatballs. PACKED with flavor and high-quality filet mignon and pork loin. Delicious but a little on the salty side! The meatballs came with lots of marinara sauce, making it perfect to pair with the bread!   For pastas, I ordered the daily special - a penne with pine nuts, spinach, sundried tomatoes, and tomato sauce. I asked for the penne to be replaced with spaghetti and they did it with a smile! This was simple, nothing spectacular, but definitely memorable because THIS WAS HUGEEEE! It came as a mountain and I was overwhelmed by how much there was. Thankfully boyfriend was around for me to funnel most of the mountain too!   My boyfriend ordered the linguine bolognese and I loved his dish so much more than mine. Delicious, high-quality bolognese paired so wonderfully with the perfectly cooked linguine. Definitely recommend this dish! This also came as a mountain of pasta.   You will not leave Trattoria hungry at all!

Food was good- the food alone i would probably consider giving 4 stars for actually!   However, customer service was absolutely abominable.  We literally only saw our server 3 times while we were at the restaurant- for our drink order, food order, and to give us the check. We sat at our table for quite some time before our server came by, we had to ask 3 times for water for the table, he didn't ask us if we wanted another round of cocktails, he basically ignored us the entire time we were there.

Finished a spa afternoon at Canyon Ranch Spa in the Venetian, was thinking of going up to my room to get some preparty zzz's but the smell of olive oil and garlic coming from the tiny little paper stand size Trattoria Reggiano pulled me in like a fish with a hook in it's mouth.  As I approach I see two italian guys (one a manager, the other a venetian executive) talking, the waiter is italian, and the 3 groups of people who are sitting at the florentine style lunch tables are italian.....where the hell am I again????  oh right, cheesey version of italy and italians are eating here...done and done.   Sit down, get a glass of Nero d'alvola and some unbelievably garlicy buttered bread with smooth peppery olive oil and thick not at all vinegary balsamic (good quality for you neophytes).  I could of had the bread and wine and called it a day...but I didn't...good thing.  We had the warm spinach salad with goat cheese and it was perfect as well as splitting the Linguine Alle Vongole in Marinara... littlenecks very fresh (lived in Boston for last 4 years and these smelled and tasted like the ocean) and perfect arrabbiata style marinara.  Cannoli was crunchy and filled on location.  Espresso not that great for a place that has so many italians in it, compared to the places in italy i've had coffee, but slight oversight maybe.  Being so close to our neighbors I made a comment about the caprese looking awesome...and they gave me some, I felt rude but I ate it anyway because it was really good.  Moist mozzarella, red soft straight from garden smelling tomatoes and large pieces of basil with same awesome Balsamic....it was a perfect mid lunch/dinner and will go again when i'm back up in Vegas.

Come for the Garlic knots and complimentary antipasto plate...they are the best things offered here. The location is great (next to movie theatre) and I can see why it would be a goto spot in Downtown Summerlin. The patio seating with live lounge music is a nice place to hang out during the weekend...make sure to place reservations. The singer will politely ask for your favorite songs but then play her own lol...it's her thing :) A bottle of wine and great service from Sam and Daniel, the manager, plus the Garlic knots make this place worth revisiting. The food is lackluster and overpriced but TR's crowd doesn't seem to mind.  Chicken Marsala, Veal Piccata  - Both very pedestrian. I think these dishes cater to the older crowd that doesn't like bold flavors but enjoys shuffle board. It reminded me of something I might get at a buffet.   Overall, I wouldn't recommend TR to anyone that wants good Italian food or knows how to cook. But if you want ambiance and don't mind making a meal out of the Garlic knots, then this is your place!

I'm going to echo the other million reviews - this place is difficult to find. If you're going to find this place sans directory, it's sandwiched between the food court and the main shopping area accessible via the Casino.  Food was good, but not exceptional - except for the garlic bread - though I may just be a sucker for pre-meal bread.   The chicken parmigiana was crispy and moist, served alongside a bed of linguini, doused in tomato sauce and a generous helping of cheese. It's not the most amazing chicken parmigiana I've had, but it was done well. Noodles were al dente and complemented the chicken, though there seemed to be a half portion of noodles to a whole portion of chicken.  Prices are typical Strip prices, around $25 after tip/tax which is decent since this was in the Venetian.

Our waiter, John, was great. There were plenty of reservation options available for dinner on Saturday night through Opentable.com. I started with a Cosmopolitan that tasted like a delicious, sweet candy concoction. John brought us some warm garlic knots that were soft little pillows of heaven. You could also dip them in olive oil and balsamic that were brought to the table. I ordered the pssta fagioli soup. It was hot and hearty. I appreciate when food is served hot... I then tucked into a bowl of pasta carbonara. The pasta was a little thicker than I prefer but cooked just right and the sauce was spot on. My dining companion enjoyed a white sangria thst was visually appealing with beautiful fruit followed by lobster ravioli. Needless to say, there were no leftovers. A great dinner option while in Vegas!

Usuallly love this place but when you're #glutenfree and you order gluten-free food, even asking them to double check, send it back because it's not gluten free, get another one, eat it and then find out it wasn't gluten free #gonnabesick #glutenfreefail

Considering the much more expensive alternatives around the Strip, this is probably the best Italian place for the money. We both had the Spaghetti Puttanesca with Calamari for starters. The spaghetti was delicious and the calamari was super crispy. Would definitely go again.

After reading all the reviews on Yelp and TripAdvisor about Trattoria Reggiano, I had to give it a shot...and I'm sure glad I did!   Since I arrived into town late for a convention and wanted to grab a quick bite to eat, I was dining alone. This caused a bit of a problem because while there was a small line (maybe 10 people waiting), I did not want to take up an empty table of 4 or 6 if there were other parties behind me that would fit the table better. So I suggested to the hostess to seat the parties behind me until a smaller table opened up for me. She felt so bad that she immediately brought me a complementary glass of wine! After about 10 minutes of sipping my wine at a coffee shop across the way, she excitedly waved for me to come over. Upon seating me, she immediately poured me another glass of wine and thanked me for being so nice. THIS is the way a restaurant should treat its customers! In fact, while eating my dinner, I noticed how friendly the staff was to each other. What a great group of servers!  Now onto the food... Having been raised by an Italian mother in New York, I was cautiously optimistic about all the rave reviews. I ordered the linguine with shrimp marinara, which not only arrived piping hot...but with perfectly cooked pasta and about 20 LARGE shrimp. Now, this is how I'd normally make it for my family at home...but for a restaurant, this was outstanding! What really made the dish was the scrumptious was the pasta sauce with its chunks of garlic and fresh cut basil. Watching other dished being served, all I could think of was how fresh everything was. Sooo good! The garlic rolls that were served were the perfect accompaniment.  I was so pleased with my meal ($24) and the friendly service that I made sure to tip the waiter well and I even sneaked the hostess $10 on the way out. I felt it was the least I could do for the two free glasses of wine she served me!  What a delight this restaurant was. Small, cozy, romantic and very friendly. It reminded me of many of the small restaurants I used to visit with my family in NYC's Little Italy as a kid. It's a MUST if you are looking for good, basic Italian food in Vegas!
This place is a great find! We will surely come back. It's very small but packs big flavor. Everyone was really nice and your not paying crazy prices.

Amazing!  We went off yelp reviews and menu Choice last week.  It's a little less pricey than a few of the others in the Venetian.  We were craving good Italian food and got it!  We ordered the ziti and ravioli with cream sauce.  It was superb.  Our server, Sabrador, was fantastic.  He was very attentive and kind.  He recommended a great wine since we all wanted red (diavolo I think) and got us the bottle.  He said he was an assistant server and that the regular server was busy but I'm glad he served us. He deserves a full spot!  The experience turned our night around because we were Ll in a bad mood and hungry.  We left full, a little tipsy and happy.  Keep up the good work Reggiano!

felt like carb-ing up after a fun-filled memorial day weekend!  This little restaurant was tucked in behind the lobster me stand. There were about 6-8 small tables outside, and 2-3 booths inside. The ambiance was interesting, it was somewhat an authentic italian feel but was off put by the venetian traffic walking by. The staff was attentive but seemed hastened. Nevertheless they were very sweet.   Our noms:  Complimentary Bread: Garlic knots - should have been a bit warmer. I'm a seasoning nazi and I think if they added more seasoning to the dough and added lots of garlic it would be delicious. Outside was very buttery. I took these guys home and baked them and added some garlic seasoning which made them bomb!  Starter: Fried calamari appetizer - Large portion, lightly breaded and fresh tasting. Not bad but not the best i've tried either. Marinara that came with it was warm but strange. I had to add some more s + p + crushed red. I'm starting to think I just have a salty tongue!   Entrees: I can't help but get pasta at every italian restaurant I come across. The man got the spaghetti + filet mignon meatballs. He thought it was OK, but then again we are spoiled by Enoteca Adriano in San Diego's spaghetti and meatballs. (Best i've ever had) For filet mignon meatballs I thought they would be moist and tender, they came out a bit dry. Spaghetti was nothing special.   My entree: linguini w/ shrimp in white sauce. This usually comes with clams but I had a bad experience with eating clams far from a coast. I loooved this. It was light and refreshing. Linguini was perfectly al dente. I finished the entire thing and even mopped up the sauce with some garlic knots. A squeeze of lemon and fresh parmesan made it even better! (refer to picture posted)   All in all, I would come back for the linguini. 3.5! Ohh the struggle of rounding up or down for a 3.5 star place. I'm gonna have to round down because of the boyf's lackluster spaghetti and meatballs. Sorry guys!  Honorable mentions: Olive oil + balsalmic were absolutely delicious. They were obviously imported. Yum.  Note: Pasta dishes ranged from $18-28. $18 being the most basic pastas, so I would say it is almost towards $$$.  Happy eating! xo

The food was good not great and the service was horrible. The server did not ask for our drink order he just assumed we wanted water. We waited quite a bit to order and for our food but it was a busy time and it didn't bother us. What bothered us was the server never came to check on us once. We had to ask for what we needed. He never even gave us the check, we had to ask some other server for it. The table next to ours ordered lots of alcohol and he gave them lots of attention and was so friendly with them. So I guess you just need to order boos to get good service. Disappointed.

Food was very very good!! Fast service, super cute and intimate place. Our servers name was Ricki, she was attentive and all. Although they couldn't figure out which tables were their own and what their rotation would be, and there was a little bit of bickering. Other wise they would have gotten 5 stars.

Last day at the Venetian and still had not had any Italian! We asked the conceirge to recommend some good olf fashioned Italian, not too "foo foo" and reasonably priced for lunch before we had to head to the airport and he pointed us here saying it was the best. Small little cafe where the tables spill out into the canal shoppes walkway. The garlic knot bread brushed with olive oil and butter and pamesean was a yummy start. We had spaghetti and meatballs made with angus beef filet mignon and a linguine bolognese. Both delicious and filling. Quick service too. The only down side was in sitting out in the open, I kinda felt lots of eyes on me as I ate my pasta (which is hard to be too lady like to do!)

We stopped by here for lunch on our last day in Vegas. It was not the easiest place to find but we decided to give it a try because of all the positive reviews.  First off the garlic rolls are delicious and they will keep bringing them to your table. We ended up ordering the gnocchi and spaghetti with meatballs. Both dishes were good but nothing special.  The biggest downside of our dinning experience was our waiter. He barely checked on our table. We had to constantly hunt someone down to help us if we needed anything. If the service was better I would have at least given this place 3 stars. With all the other italian restaurants in Vegas I would skip this place and try your luck somewhere else.

Very dissatisfied  about its food. I asked Chicken Marsala, not flavor!!   The lasagna and  meatballs/ too  . It's priced high  for the quality of food.  The location and ambience keep us there. But I would not recommended
This was a great find. Not as expensive as most of the other restaurants visited but the food and service was great .... especially the service. Very entertaining. We'd go there again.

Difficult to find, and not worth the effort. My cheese tortellini was bland and unexciting. I had to season it and add evoo for any amount of flavor. The meatball app was good, but nothing to write home about. The couple sitting next to us (I was practically sitting in their lap) happened to be loyal patrons. They loved it. We simply didn't.

I loved my meal at Trattoria Reggiano! I ordered the shrimp risotto and although the shrimp were a little tough, the risotto was absolutely delicious. The bread in the basket which came with the meal was soft and delightful. I really regretted leaving it behind, since we were traveling we couldn't take leftovers with us. My dining companion ordered the sea bass and loved it, it was prepared exactly the way he likes it. Our server was lovely and very attentive. I almost passed by this restaurant thinking a meal downtown would not be so great but I'm so glad we didn't. It turned out to be the best meal of our trip and I would highly recommend Trattoria Reggiano.

Best tasting ice water at any restaurant I've ever been to! It did not have that usual nasty tap taste and actually tasted better than any of my favorite bottled waters! I normally drink only half a glass at most at any given restaurant, but I drank 3 glasses here! I wasn't even that thirsty!  We tried the filet mignon meatballs people keep talking about; they were above average but we did not experience the whoa factor. Chicken marsala was also above average and was the best tasting one I've ever had at a restaurant but it wasn't as good as the one my cousin makes. He notes, however, that the sauce was really well made.  The free bread was also pro, predipped in oil and very tasty. The olive oil and vinegar were also very nice.  P.S. Hiep, my cousin, wants to add that the service is excellent. The inside is small but the atmosphere is homely.

I'm giving this 3 stars only because of the bar service I have experienced on other occasions which was worth 5 stars... With that being said I would give dining on the patio 2 stars at best. First of all, when I ask about bread and water and the server responds with "the busser will bring that out soon" you've already rubbed me the wrong way. Which by the way she brought out 2 minutes later.  The food is very mediocre and overpriced for what it is especially, with Grape Street being across the street at the same price and higher quality.  I had the bolognese- average. The man had what seemed to be a chicken breast and dry pasta couldn't even tell you the name of the dish.  We had to ask for our check and to-go boxes ourselves in an empty restaurant.  Should've just cooked at home.
Wasn't so thrilled with the quality of food. Bread stale and food average. Hyped up because of the Venetian.

Took my friend for her birthday and we also celebrated Mother's Day.  We both agreed that we would come back again!!  She had the Eggplant Parmigiana, which she said was delish and I had the salmon. So deeelish!  My friend doesn't like Salmon but she tried it and  she liked it!!!  Yummy!!!

Great place!  The food was excellent - my wife had the linguine carbonara which was tasty, but I had the pesto gnocchi which was just superb.  The price was very good as well (considering most other places on the Strip).  The only bad thing here was the wine - I got a bottle of Chianti that was about half our bill but was not good.  I'm giving it a 4 only because of the wine.

This place is good.  Vegas is such a bazaar place. Want to eat outside, inside next to a small river? Visit Trattoria Reggiano.  The pasta carbonara was really delicious and well priced for Vegas. The complimentary garlic bread is very, very tasty.

Made reservations for this place before seeing Rock of Ages at The Venetian. Had decent reviews compared to other Italian restaurants in Vegas, so we decided to give it a try and it was a short walk to the show after.   First off, the place is near impossible to find. We walked around for about 10 minutes before finally stumbling upon it. Since we had made a reservation, we were seated pretty quickly. The service was good at first, but that didn't last too long. Regardless, we got our drinks and meals in a timely manner, but no follow up once anything came out.   The food: They bring you out garlic knots, which were pretty delicious. We ordered the Spaghetti & Meatballs and Linguine Carbonara. The meatballs and sauce were tasty. The Carbonara was a little too oily and didn't actually feel or taste like a true Carbonara.   I would probably return, but would order something different. Reservations are highly recommended as the place was packed!

First,we love this place,the food is phenomenal. My wife, ordered wine instead got champagne. But it was taking forever just to get water and some bread. So she just went with it. So we had to ask the hostess for bread. Because Andres took FOREVER, We were there for almost 2 hours. Never asked how our food was, we had to ask for refills when we did see our waiter Andres. We also had to ask the hostess for our check then that took over 20 mins just to get that. We are so disappointed, our girls didn't even get the cannolis that they usually get after there meals. On a side note the food was great. We watched people leave because no one ever came over to at least get there drink order. I don't know if we will be back, this was our favorite for Italian but maybe have to loom somewhere else.
great Italian food in a comfortable environment. great friendly service.

The good: Staff is great, super friendly and attentive. Food is really good, not great but you would be a complete food snob if you thought it was bad. Decent wine selection.  The bad: Small location in a high traffic area. Not good for privacy, romance or intimate conversation. Overall: If you're staying at the Venetian, shopping, or at the Sands Convention Center, this place is worth checking out. If you have an appetite definitely order the meatballs app.

This restaurant has really given me a standard for review s and quality food at an affordable priced restaurant..My husband and I came in sometime around 2:30 on a tues for a late lunch. I had been debating with myself for a couple days (I am truly such a foodie) as I often do. If I'm going to spend the money I want above average food. Well I am so glad my husband and I came here while in vegas..The service was spectacular ,everyone was very accommodating and helpful,they kept drinks filled and brought extra bread and croutons without a hint of complaint or frustration..On to the location although inside the Venetian cobblestone shopping area the restaurant is open and it is in a busy area near the food court behind lobster me and so while the restaurant itself is very nice it can become an incredibly loud meal with all the bypasses( this I would say would be the only real issue. On to the food,wow my taste buds were awakened with exciting flavors,I so wish I could give this place a 10 star review. They start u out with from scratch Gaelic knots and they don't cheap out on seasoning and flavor. They were so epic that when they brought the arugula Caesar salad with truffle oil I had a hard time putting the bread down which I can say rarely if ever happens . When I finally came out of bread coma I bit into the salad and more amazing flavors,the truffle oil complements the lemon flavor in the caesar dressing..with anchovies on top,perfect amount of dressing this salad I would give a 10 out of 10 if I could absolute food perfection. And know we get to the lobster ravioli ,I am not usually a huge fan of tomatoey sauces(I  aware that's not a word) how ever the creamy tomatoes sauce on this was heaven,the pack the ravioli in beautiful flavor and an amazing amount of lobster and the precede to puns on loads more on top of the ravioli.i give this what I wish could be 11 out of 10.   So case in pint you are missing out if you don't come here while on vegas,the price is great and the food is out of this world amazing.. I have eaten at very expensive restaurants and not come out this ecstatic and happy.. I haven't been able to stop talking about it. And knowing me I will be coming back soon even though it's a four hr dr from Southern California..

My wife and I went here for the first time tonight. We have gone to many other places in Vegas and this was by far the best. Dora and Reilly made the whole dining experience even better. Dora recommended the eggplant rollatini appetizer. I don't usually order that in a restaurant. It was the best eggplant I have had. We had chicken Parmesan, chicken francese, mussels, pasta fagioli, penne vodka and an amazing chocolate cake. The portions were huge and delicious. This is a must if you are in Vegas!

Trattoria Reggiano is my new favorite Italian restaurant.   BEST SHRIMP SCAMPI EVER! They coated the shrimp with bread crumbs. The sauce was not greasy at all because it had a hint of fresh lemon juice. I devoured it!   The meatballs were very juicy and the meat sauce was great. The meatballs are actually a mix of filet minion and pork.   The spaghetti and meat sauce was great as usual. The noodles were cooked perfectly and the sauce complimented it very well.   The atmosphere was great and I loved the live music during dinner time. The service was very good and our server made sure to ask us and the tables around how the food was. He also made sure to keep our water filled which I know is something minor but it shows they are paying attention to our table.

The Food is Amazingly unreal  . Sergio is amazing! We love him so much . The service was amazing we enjoyed it so much and we enjoy Sergio so much . We had a unforgettable dinner and we had a awesome experience. Ask for Sergio her makes everything so much better !

Decided to come here since I didn't want to be eating Grand Luxe Cafe every meal being that we were situated at the Venetian. Place is super close to the regular suites in the Venetian or Palazzo. Located inside the grand canale shops, the place is actually pretty small. Large groups might take time for them to accommodate without reservations.   I had the lobster rav which was pretty bomb. Sauce was tasty but wasn't overly heavy and lobster chunks were meaty. Also had a bite of the spaghetti meatball. It was bomb too. I think I had a small bite of some other stuff and just remember everything being bomb. Including the unlimited garlic knots. Holy shit they are good. Just remember to triple rinse your mouth with listerine if you're clubbing later.  If you even remotely enjoy a good pasta and aren't trying to break the bank, come to this place. Also the manager talked like super mario. What more can you ask for.

I had baked ziti & the wife ordered the meat balls. Ziti was good, nothing fantastic. Balls were ok. We had the balls at Little Tony's in Palace Station the week before & they were great. We'll try something else next time we're there & give them another chance.
A small restaurant in a nice casino (Venetian). Great service and very delicious entres. We had the penne primavera and the lobster ravioli, and we both "licked" our plates clean :)

I came here with a group of colleagues and overall enjoyed the experience.  We ordered burrata and calamari for the table which was good - not the best I've ever had but still tasty. However the bread they gave before the meal was delicious, I had to stop myself from eating more.  I ordered the carbonara as my entree and thought it was fine. Its obviously a very heavy dinner and was good but it's not something I came away from thinking "wow, I need to have that again." However everyone at the table all really liked their dishes so I'd go back and try something different  They portions are generous and almost no one finished their meals.   One thing I didn't like was the atmosphere. The restaurant is completely open to the mall with a small gate closing it in and tries to give a neighborhood-esque feel. However, the amount of foot traffic and noise outside the restaurant really doesn't allow for that.

This place was great! I did have trouble finding it, but that turned out to be half the charm- it was so nice to eat in a relaxed, quiet environment. The prices were high, but not ridiculously so- I had the Spaghetti Carbonara, a glass of the house pinot grigio, and tiramisu for $50 including tip. The food tasted excellent. Their bread, which was lightly garlicky, drizzled with olive oil and parmesan, was great. They set some very nice olive oil and balsamic on your table for you to dip it in. My only complaint- I ate there alone, and they seated another couple directly beside me despite other tables being open. Overall, I look forward to eating there again!

A trattoria is an Italian-style eating establishment, less formal than a ristorante, but more formal than an osteria. There are generally no printed menus, the service is casual, wine is sold by the decanter rather than the bottle, prices are low, and the emphasis is on a steady clientele rather than on haute cuisine.  The above is Wikipedia's definition of a trattoria.  Some of it fits what we experienced at Downtown Summerlin Reggiano.  I'll start with the positive.  At the end of our ordeal Danny the manager refused our payment with apologies.  It would have been about $200. I did tip accordingly.  It was a birthday celebration and our small party of three chose to try something new that a trusted friend raved about, Trattoria Reggiano.  We had reservations and we were seated promptly.  But I should have guessed what was to come when our table, covered with the traditional sheet of meat wrapper, came with a can of crayons.  Our attentive server (Dan, not the manager) was prompt and pleasant. He brought menus which are printed with impossibly small print.  He took our drink orders (wine, martini and water) and soon returned with a basket of the wonderful garlic buns.  Fifteen minutes later, still no beverages.    We were seated near the bar and I could see the person behaving like a bartender wondering about the trattoria, bussing tables and socializing with the foursome at the table next to ours.  I could also see Dan giving her furtive glances to see where the drink order was.  He feared returning to our table because he knew we would also ask.  In the meantime a woman brough her very young daughter to the bar area and said, "Wouldn't you like to sit on the stool that (famous Golden Knights hockey player) sat in the other night?"  Hey, isn't there a law prohibiting minors from sitting in a bar area?  As a bartender or manager I would be nervous about risking my permit over such an infraction, I don't care if you are the Duchess of Summerlin.  In the meantime the bussers would come around the corner with a load of dirty dishes, silverware and glasses which then would be unceremoniously dumped with an accompanying cacophony of disturbing noise.  I'm European and I can tell you that such behavior in Italy would have been the cause of immediate dismissal of that employee.  Finally, Dan came over, apologized for the slow cocktail service and pressed the barmaid to produce our order.  The water came first followed soon by the glass of wine and my martini.  I ordered a martini up.  It was in a stemmed glass, but it had ice cubes in it.  Hello?????  I passed it off as sloppy pouring and said nothing.  By this time we had put in our entree order and waited...and waited...and waited.  I ordered another martini.  It was served identically only with more ice cubes.  Not the way I have ever had a chocolate espresso martini.  More than an hour after entering the premises it occurred to me that the can of crayons were there to help pass the time.  Maybe some doodling, hangman, anything to take our minds of our growling tummies.  I must say that the food is prepared in generous proportions.  Our order included a Caesar Salad and Dan advised wisely, that one order would feed two and offered to split it on two plates.  It came on one and we did the honors.  My pasta dish with meatballs lasted two additional meals after take out.  The food was slightly on the bland side.  In the meantime, I observed Dan and the other working server (only two for the whole place).  He was quite industrious working his tables but the holdup in the kitchen made that a challenge.  His serving associate however, was another story.  She would disappear for lengthy periods.  Twice I watched her go out the front door to talk on her cell phone while customers were waiting for service.  I'm assuming she was mining for another job.  After nearly two hours we just wanted to get out of there and none of us finished our food.  Took awhile to wave down Dan for the check and the to go containers.  He apologized for the slow service and we acknowledged his apology by briefly expressing our disappointment.  He asked if "The Birthday Boy" would be interested in a dessert.  This was the fourth time he used that moniker with me and my 71-year-old child within was about ready to bop him one.  I just said, "no".  Soon after Danny the manager came back with our check and  acknowledging that they had staffing issues.  He assured me when I asked that my drinks should not have been served over ice.  When it was obvious that even when offered a free meal we would never be back, he withdrew the check.  Kudos to him.  There are too many good places in this town to put up with that kind of service.

This restaurant is located at the Summerlin mall which makes it a very convenient location after a long day of shopping. In the summer time the ambiance is even better as you can sit on the outside patio. The price point is reasonable, you can find several dishes priced from 18 to 40 dollars per plate.   They also have a large selection of items so there is not an issue finding anything you would like. The size portions were very generous, I would say most people would have a hard time finishing their plate. I ordered the Lobster Ravioli which was very good. There were large pieces of lobster all over the dish. The sauce was tasty and the ravioli was perfectly cooked.   If you are looking for a simple but tasty dish I would recommend this dish. Overall, the food was good but not memorable.

My friend and I came here after a day of shopping, it was the first time for both of us. We had a wonderful server by the name of Ricki - we weren't sure what to order and she recommended the lobster ravioli which was what we both ordered and it was fantastic. We then had to have some dessert and our server Ricki recommended her favorite- tiramisu- well now it is my favorite!! So glad we decided to check out this place - will definitely be returning when Ricki is working and asking for her recommendations again!

So many amazing things about this spot! Let's start with the quaint location. It isn't some huge chain Italian restaurant.
