It's a small spot with inside and outside seating (of course, the outside is still technically inside since it's in the Venetian.) We were seated immediately and multiple servers greeted us and made sure we were taken care of. I ordered the special: cheese ravioli with roasted tomato marinara and fresh buffalo mozzarella. INCREDIBLE. My husband had the pesto gnocchi--also incredible!! The garlic rolls that came out before our entrees were delicious. They were warm and cheesy and served with balsamic vinegar and oil. Our meal, start to finish, took no longer than 40 minutes. I was impressed by the service, the food, and the whole experience.

This restaurant was soo good. Just randomly stopped in and it was Amazing! My sister and I got salmon and arugula salad (best salad I have ever had) and Shrimp scampi and we shared both. The linguine and sauce were so good. The sauce was light so it did not feel heavy like an Alfredo sauce. The shrimp was not cooked that well and that's the only reason I did not give it 5 stars. It was super crowded but the service was still great. Never had an empty drink which is a big plus. My daughter had spaghetti and she could not e happier.

Our meal was delicious! We ordered spaghetti pomodoro and chicken Francese with a mozzarella caprese starter. The entries were perfectly prepared. I will dream about those flavors! The ricotta cheesecake was incredible! Our server, Victor was terrific. Great experience!

First time here. Amazing food and Bethany at the bar is awesome! Great service and food recommendations. There was a live musician on guitar who was amazing. My wife and I are still here having a wonderful night. Thank you trattoria reggianno!

Celebrated my birthday with a friend.  It was my first visit.  I am a fan.  We shared a pizza, it was a very generous in size.  And very tasty!  But, what I really want to rave about is the service  we received from everyone.  The server, the bartender, the host were outstanding.  They have a lovely outside seating area with coolers so we were not hot at all.  A big thumbs up, can't wait to go back again.

Hard to find unless you know it is right at the end of the food court.  Great food and value.  Service was fantastic.  The place actually has expanded, it has plenty of seating.  You won't go away hungry.

We've been to Trattoria three times recently and have been so happy every time! The food is amazing and the staff is super friendly and really helpful! Plus the restaurant is nice and the patio is nice as well.  I called on the phone to make a reservation and Angie was really nice and kind, and when we went in, she was just as sweet in person when she was greeting the guests and seating them. The manager Daniel was very, very nice and friendly as well. Our servers were great and very helpful (I have a food allergy so I had some questions), and I really appreciated it!  We can't wait to go back again! :)

haha 4 stars? is that a joke?   I ordered their pasta w/ pink vodka sauce. I could've made a better pasta than them and i'm culinarily challenged!!  As most reviewers have noted, this place offers bread that looks hot, but is actually served cold. Should've been my first red flag to dash outta there. The price is expensive for the quantity of food as well. My friend finished her linguine w/ clams in two bites.   I would suggest a local olive garden if you're looking for a better italian restaurant- at least their breadsticks come out warm.

We sat at the table, after a reservation, for 20 min before the waiter even considered taking our order. He gave us a no for almost every drink we wanted saying his mixer was not working! Me and my husband had different prices on the menu, and the server shrugged it off saying we'll see what the system says when we put in the bill!! Bad food! We ordered an eggplant appetizer and an eggplant parmesan. Both dishes were way too oily and soggy and just not worth eating. Both dishes were very evidently reheated and given to us.  We left half of our food on plate and the server did not even bother to ask why. Most horrible service and food I've ever had, and believe me I've had my bad share of both!

In Vegas and was short on time, hit the food court in the Venetian and found this diamond. The service was GREAT (pleasant and fast) and the food was AMAZING? The fillet mignon and pork meatballs were the bomb and the broccoli rabe was perfect... Ciao Bella

You can't find a bad place to eat inside the Venetian if you tried.  Our host/waiter was great. Very informative. Very knowledgeable. Almost felt like he owned the place.   The prices were fair in comparison to most of Las Vegas. Dinner for two (no drinks) was about $35-40.  Complimentary bread with oil and vinaigrette.  Great pasta dishes. Pizza was pretty good too. If I ever go back, I would stick to pasta for sure. Pasta outshines the pizza.
I loved this place! If we go back to Vegas, we will definitely stop here. It's small, but the food was good. My fiance ordered the "personal" pizza, but it could have easily fed three of us!

The food was excellent! I ordered the peanut kale salad and the margherita pizza, and I tried their grilled salmon. I loved the atmosphere, but service could've been better. The downtown summerlin location always has better service. It's important to make reservations for the place because they are always busy, but well worth it

Had a wonderful lunch this afternoon!!! After a dietary concern, our waitress said she'd speak with the manager to see if they could accommodate us. Daniel the manager was very happy to oblige!! The food was excellent and we ate it before thinking to take a picture. My friend had a lemon something martini, which was excellent, and a kale peanut salad. I had chicken parmesan. Daniel checked on us several times to make sure everything was just right. The ambience was quaint, the staff friendly and personable and the food very good.  Excellent place for a date night or a casual girls afternoon outing!

Yelp needs more stars!!  Omg! This place is so amazing I am reviewing from my honeymoon!! We were at "tickets for tonight " getting tickets for Rock of Ages, and a worker suggested this place, as both are in the Venetian.. They had a voucher for half off 2 entrees, so we went through the maze that us Venetian and found TR. Delicious Caesar salad, filet minion meatballs, pasta bolognese, veal parm. Unreal! Just as good or better than some places back home in NYC. Lots of dishes made with San Marzano tomatoes. Sooo good! Huge portions, took leftovers back to the hotel! Cappuccino and the best tiramisu we ever had. Very friendly staff. Victor took good care of us. Will def be back before we leave LV. Def recommend!

Small place but the food is amazing! Our entire party agreed this was the best food we have had in Vegas. We are not ones to eat at high dollar places that are more than 30 dollars for an entree. Didn't have to wait at all and service was prompt. All meatballs and meat in sauces is filet mignon and those were the best meatballs I have ever had in my life. My only grip is the price for beverages like soda and it is not fountain but just small glass bottles. I assumed no refills but I didn't ask. Enjoyed my Pepsi and water. Beer is the same as everywhere else. Either drink water or be willing to pay. I will have to eat here every time I go back to Vegas.
basic italian food. nothing new nor special. i ate it though and was happy and full. probably wouldnt go back. the garlic rolls that come with your meal are the bomb though!

Best advice is to avoid Italian (fake) places in Vegas. We ordered marsala, baked ziti, linguine bolognese, bruschetta pizza.... and it all tasted like food you might barf up after a drunk night on the strip... Well, that is, after you washed it off in the sink.  I'm serious. It tastes like you washed it with water. And in the $20 price range.. where you could make this all at home with no experience for $1-2, they are sheistering you big time.  We were a group of four, and our server was hesitant to give us seconds on the bread rolls... which by the way I recognized as frozen Pillsbury dough boy dinner rolls  covered in butter and garlic powder salt (not even real butter).. it tasted chemical-ly.  Another in our group recognized some of the flavors as Stouffer's frozen food.   This review is written by native Los Angelinos New Yorkers and Europeans... maybe our expectations are too high.  You'd have better luck eating next door at Grand Luxe Cafe. I guarantee your food will be better there, even though that's a chain. After all, this is a fake boutique Italian restaurant in an indoor shopping mall.

The service was excellent.   Rikki did a great job.  Started with Eggplant Rolotini.  Moved on to Pasta Fagioli.   Both excellent  Veal Marsala for the entrees.  Very tender and generous portions of pasta.  Ricotta Cheesecake and Cannoli for dessert. Again. Very fresh and delicious.  Very impressed.  Will return.

This is high end for the mall restaurants here, but the nice decor and friendly staff outweigh the food and service. Unfortunately, it's one of those places where they notice your water glass is empty and refill it after you finish your meal and drank 3/4 of the water from the person next to you.   My friend kept trying to ask the server questions and ordering but the server kept walking off where she was getting pretty frustrated. The place was 3/4 full maybe but not overly busy as it was already 7:30.  The whole table heard me ask for shrimp scampi since they had to come back to take my order, except our server so when the food came out I stared at it and thought these are either mighty big shrimp (the menu did say jumbo shrimp) or I got chicken. I ask the server to double check and said server apologized and insisted in making it right. It came out in 6 min. It was fast. I got 6 jumbo shrimp...maybe I should've told them to take their time and cook it for 12 minutes (to get 12 shrimp).  Shrimp was fine but it was overpowered by this stuffing placed on top which was salty and totally out of place. The shrimp was simply overpowered in this case.  The appetizers of calamari and cheese and olives were very good though. The mozzarella pizza was ok but it certainly is no Grimaldis or even Pieology. Yes, I would gladly take the pieology pizza. The pizza is thin slice but the tomato flavor is not there. It can use more sauce or tomato paste. The next day when I reheated it it was soggy due to to much water from the cheese. The lobster ravioli was very good.  It does not stack up against the middle ground Cheesecake Factory in my view. The service is friendly but lacking. For $300 for a group of 7 (not including the bar tab) it was nothing to write home about. Very disappointed as the place looked like a really nice place.

This was good, not life changing, but good Italian. My wife had Lobster Ravioli. It was very rich, creamy, w/ a good amount of Lobster. I had the Veal Milanese. It was HUGE! Veal was hanging off the plate. The Arugula Salad piled on top was fantastic. Slightly over cooked, the Veal was very tasty but a touch dry. The ambiance of this place feels like a mall because it's just off of the Grande Canal shopping area and near a food court. I wouldn't go here for a special occasion or date night, but it's a GREAT spot for casual dining or a little respite from gambling and shopping.
Food was excellent. Service was great as well. It is rare to find a place in Vegas that has quality food at a decent price!

Overall very good experience. The food was good and the service was great. Off the beaten path and not overhyped like some of the "big name" restaurants that are pumped up but then result in a letdown.

I stopped in here with my boyfriend for what we thought would be a light-ish meal. As always, our tummies were too small for our ravenous appetites, so we ordered a tad bit too much food. Nonetheless, everything tasted great and we had a good time! We stopped by around 2 pm on a Saturday and the place was basically empty. As a result, we were able to snag a comfy booth and our server was really attentive throughout our meal.  I knew I needed to check this place out because they have filet mignon meatballs. Yup, you read that right. Filet mignon meatballs. My boyfriend and I got an order each (three meatballs for $18) and split a dish of chicken marsala ($26). The filet mignon meatballs tasted as heavenly as they sound. Juicy, flavorful, and tender; just how a meatball should be. We originally ordered the chicken marsala dish on the side to share since we figured three meatballs wouldn't be able to fill us. However, these meatballs were huge! After finishing one of my meatballs, I felt like I already ate three. I ended up unfortunately wasting one of my meatballs since the Venetian doesn't have a refrigerator or microwave in any of their rooms :( Nonetheless, this is a solid 5 out of 5 star dish and potentially my favorite meal I had in Vegas.  The chicken marsala was decent, I'd give it a 3.5 out of 5 stars. Everything was cooked nicely - the chicken was moist, the mushrooms had a nice amount of chew to them, and the noodles were perfectly al dente - but compared to the filet mignon meatballs, this dish just fell a little flat. It also didn't help that I was already stuffed to the brim once this dish came out!   Other smaller notes: - The complementary garlic bread is delicious. It's super soft and they definitely don't skimp out on the garlic butter spread. If you're looking for a cheap, delicious, and filling meal on the strip, I'd just order the filet mignon meatballs for $18 and stuff yourself with yummy free bread. - My boyfriend ordered a mint mojito from here and he rates it as the best drink he had during our trip to Vegas. - Prices are cheaper at lunch compared to dinner if you're looking to save a little bit of cash!

The service and the ambiance I would rate at 4 stars. You step into this place and you can almost forget that you are in the midst of the artificial decadence called Vegas. It has a very authentic feel to it and the owners seem to be Italians.   Tried the seafood spaghetti and asked for a white wine sauce instead of tomato sauce. The seafood and spaghetti itself was good, but the sauce was watery and added no flavor to the pasta.

To start let me say we found our new local favorite!  We recently found this little gem after seeing a movie at Downtown Summerlin.  We plan on visiting for dinner prior to our future date night at the movies.  The restaurant is literally right next door to the theater.  Service is top notch!  We started with a drink at the bar so we would have a chance to look at the menu.  The bartender was very gracious and answered our questions about their specialty drinks and wines.  After looking at the menu we decided to have dinner and were promptly seated.  Our waiter was right there to greet us and answered our menu questions.  He also asked if we were seeing a movie so he could time our dinner if necessary.  I ordered my fave, eggplant parm which was awesome.  Perfectly cooked and not loaded with cheese.  My better half had a kale salad which was actually very good.  I rarely order healthy dishes but may rethink this as the salad had a great dressing and was a nice change from the standard caesar.  The manager Vito stopped by twice to check in on us and offered us a complimentary plate of olives and cheese which was a nice touch which you rarely see these days.  My only complaint is the lack of restrooms.  They only have one unisex restroom which is located in a busy hallway so it was bit awkward with a couple of us waiting in line.  I have already recommended it to friends so I would give it try.  You will not be disappointed.

We found this hidden gem of a restaurant from Yelp. Let me just say that the food and service was top notch!!! If we had more time we would have eaten here everyday! My husband and I ordered the baked ziti, spaghetti pomodoro, and the pasta e Fabiola soup. All delicious!!! At the end of the meal, my husband had the hand pressed coffee, which he said was delicious. This food is worth every penny!!!!

Was very disappointed.  Advertising as an authentic Italian eatery. Shame.  The pizza we had, tasted like it was just pulled from the freezer aisle.  Dough was bland and not very good eats.  Beware all.  Go to the lobster shack next door and save your mulla.

We had a great waiter I didn't catch his name but we had the manager just make our restaurant dining experience so nice his name was Ben Martinez food was good liked everything except the Ceaser salad.

Very good restaurant with authentic Italian food. Olive oil and vinegar imported from Italy. The filet mignon meatballs are a must as is the Pasta e Fagioli soup. The spaghetti bolognese and the pizzas are great as well. Very friendly and attentive service. They don't take reservations so go early.

It was late and we were about the go out and wanted to grab a bite to eat. So we came here, I ordered the standard spaghetti and meatballs and my friend got the pizza. I would have to say... for ordinary spaghetti and meatballs, with meatballs being made from ground filet, it was so soft, it melted like butter in your mouth haha. The pizza wasn't as crispy as we wanted it. But this place got an extra star because the owner came up and talked to us after dinner and asked us how everything was. This place is a bit pricey but it is the Venetian so you have to expect that a bit.

$$. It's more like $$$ with meh food and no service to speak with!  We arrived there at prime time 7pm without reservation, was told about 20mins wait even though there were a few tables. They were good enough to have texting service when table is available so we could roam around in the cancel shops.   After being seated, service was slow from start to beginning!  Food was not good at all   $25 for clam linguine, $16 for 3 filet migon meatball (nothing special as expected), $22 chicken Parmesan.  Portion was average only. For this kind of money, I had to eat at table spilled over to the outside, bad service. Won't be coming back.

Came here on my birthday for a quick dinner before hitting the club.   I was pretty impressed. Their meatballs are delicious made with filet mignon meat, however if you really like Alfredo sauce like me... don't skip out on the Alfredo Tortellini like I did! Big mistake!!!   Good thing my friend had ordered it, it was soooooo good. It looks small in the pictures and in real life, but you must remember you do get unlimited garlic rolls which pair really well together. And what kind of Italian dinner would be complete without some calamari???  Our server was insanely nice and accommodating as well.   This place was just a bit hard to find. I think the shops at Venetian are so confusing... I had to ask 3 people for directions before I found it. Just look for Lobster Me and the Magic Shop, this place is right between.

Was looking for affordable Italian on the Strip and I'm so glad we chose this place.  I know people said it was small, but it was TINY.  Looks like they're getting ready to expand, which is great because the food was fantastic.  Everyone in  our party loved what they got.  The meatballs were great, the Parmigiana was great, my son loved his Scampi as well as the cake he had for dessert.  And the prices were better than at many (much worse) places I've been in LV.  Hope this place stays put...  can't wait to go back!

The food and the service were both excellent!! I had spaghetti & meatballs and my husband had the veal, and everything was just delicious. Our server was super nice, and we had a lovely experience all around. The place may not look like much from the outside, but it's cute and reasonably priced and a great place to eat!

Wait a minute people - 5 STARS for this??? Uhmmmm...I think the 5 stars are a TAD bit over-rated.  The food was good, it was fine, and I was hungry but no way would I put this as 5 STAR Italian food. This makes me wonder about some of you and what your 'worst Italian food' is like.  Anyways, the restaurant is tiny and they don't take reservations.  We weren't inside the restaurant but were seated "outside".  It made me think that I was in the overflow  The filet mignon meatballs are good but I wouldn't rave about this place as if it's better than Scalini Fedeli in NYC.  Garlic bread was overhyped and I thought this place was okay - I have absolutely experienced better than this but I still think this was okay.

Got food poisoning there last night. Have eaten there before and thought the food was so-so, but never expected to get food poisoning. Threw up 4 times. Had eaten the salmon. Definitely will not be going back. A friend of mine told me her husband got sick there as well. They really need to change what they're doing. The place lacks a "uniqueness vibe" and the food is not commensurate with the prices. Out of all the places to go and eat, I can't imagine they'll survive with the quality they're producing.

Easily the best meal I enjoyed in Vegas this past week. I was on a vacation with my sisters. Knowing we would be eating out for 6 days we tried to keep the budget in check. This restaurant was recommended by a friend of my sister did not disappoint as far as the food was concerned. It is tucked away in the back of the food court. Location isn't great...I suppose that is how they keep the prices down. "Outdoor tables" are actually inside. Lighting in the interior of the restaurant is way too bright. Service was very average...our waiter was a hyper-macho Italiano who kept himself busy fawning over the young girls eating next to us, and chatting with his buddies out in the food court plaza. At the end of our meal he was so carried away with his buddies that he had totally forgotten about us, and need to be retrieved by a bus boy.  The Caeser Salad that we shared was good. Filet mignon meatballs with spaghetti and red sauce were delicious, as was the wood-fired Quatro Stagioni pizza. I highly recommend the food...the service not so much.

My family and I dined there July 8th for lunch. the food and service were fantastic!  Our server Victor, seated us right away and helped us chose our appetizers and entrees.  He was very pleasant and knowledgeable. With his help we chose the perfect amount of food.  He brought us the most deliciously warm seasoned rolls that we had to have a second serving. We ordered calamari, ceasar salad, chicken parmigian, shrimp with linguini in a marinara sauce.  My family loved all of it! We're from NYC where there is no shortage of good Italian restaurants so we have a pretty good idea about what good Italian food should taste like.  Did I mention the rolls???? We ordered pretty standard stuff and they executed these dishes to perfection.  Victor took care of us by being very attentive and predicting our every need. My only regret was not having enough room for dessert. For 5 of us the bill was $90 including tip, a steal! Remember this is the venetian palazzo complex where restaurants can make your wallet cry all the way to the bank.  When I go back to Las Vegas, I'm definitely going back for round 2, this time with a little extra hunger to squeeze in dessert.

Some of the BEST Italian food in Vegas! ! !  My boyfriend & I went on a Monday for lunch, there was no wait. Our server Lyndsay was AWESOME!  The bread was amazing.... our entrees chicken parmigiano & linguine shrimp with marinara sauce was also AMAZING! The prices were good for Vegas. I will definitely grab a bite to eat here whenever I'm in Vegas.

Hilda our server was on point and knowable of the wine list. Spaghetti with meatballs was perfectly hot. Red sauce was just about perfect and not a mushroom in site,bits of garlic and see through onions. The wine was Bon Anno, Nappa Valley price at $50.00 a bottle. Antipasto, roasted and marinated red, yellow bell peppers,olives green,red and black and perfect hard cheese. The bread was a type of hard roll pretzel type. It did lack butter in the baking process. The double dark chocalate cake was perfect not overly sweet. Coffee was average but doable. I would have gave a 5 stars but the rolls bread gave it a 4.

its in the Venetian. Daughter and I felt like pasta with Bolognese sauce. well, I think we came to the right place, this was incredible. and the portion was perfect for slipping.  We split a salad, some wine and pasta and we were stuffed.  very good food. Would like to actually come back and try other items on the menu that looked good.  our dining neighbors had the wood fired pizza that looked and smelled amazing.

This place gets a solid 5 stars. Excellent setting, both times I've been there's live music, and he's actually good. They have these fucking off the hook garlic knots that are literally the best things ever, THAT THEY GIVE YOU FOR FREE. The food, while some may be a tad expensive, is amazing in every aspect; presentation, taste, freshness, etc...  And honestly, the absolute best part, is the service. The waiters are the fucking shit. Dined last night with Hilda, I believe, and she's amazing. Super accommodating, I'm an asshole that modifies everything, and she had an answer for every question I had.  Believe the hype. Way dank.
Meatball!!!!!  Very small restaurant, and very hard to find.  But, one of the best Italian restaurant I've ever been to.

Cute Italian restaurant in downtown Summerlin. I believe there is a location on the strip as well but I like this location better.  It has outdoor seating but since it's winter we opted to sit inside. There is a bar inside and as well as an open kitchen.  I started with a glass of wine. The waiter was very helpful in picking a glass of wine. I told him I was ordering penne al vodka and he suggested a red pinot. It was a great pairing! The pasta was also good.  Dessert was, of course, my favorite. We ordered tiramisu and it was the best tiramisu I have ever had. If you order dessert you must try this one.  The prices were moderate. Not overly expensive but not cheap. The service was good but we did have to wait a little while at the end of the check. Overall a good experience. My pick for best Italian in downtown Summerlin.

By FAR the worst meal I've eaten in Las Vegas. I ordered a salad and the bolognese. My husband, the pizza. Salad was dull and the bolognese was completely bland. No developed, rich flavor. Just ordinary, cheap quality ingredients. I even tried my husbands pizza--nothing special. This place was highly recommended, but I will never go back.

Found this Italian restaurant on Yelp. We were looking for something within walking distance of the Wynn, so made a reservation.  When we arrived at 6:30, there were only a few patrons dining.  My first instinct was to cancel and go somewhere else, but thought what the heck, the reviews were 4 stars.  The restaurant is situated near the Welcome to Las Vegas gift shop at the Venetian.  Not a nice view of anything, but I was hopeful that the food would be outstanding.  Fail.  Not awful, but definitely not worth a rating above average at best.  Even the bread knots weren't special.

Never fails, the food here is beyond delicious. Words cannot express the quality of the food as well as the service. I always get the Linguini Bolognese or the Chicken Parmigiana. Good selection of wine and other drinks and the rolls of warm bread served with olive oil and vinegar are amazing.

Nope.  My girlfriend and I were at The Venetian and came into Trattoria Reggiano after browsing on Yelp for a bit. Reason? It has a solid 4 stars the gf was craving Calamari and I hadn't had spaghetti and meatballs in a long time.  Upon arrival we stood at the hosts' podium waiting to be seated the hostess was busy looking around and up at the ceiling so I gave her a minute... then I asked for a table for 2.   I get the feeling we'd still be standing there had I not said anything.   I'm unsure what our server sounds like because the only word she muttered was "sure" when I asked for both the calamari and spaghetti to be served at the same time.  She literally did not say ANYTHING else. Not when I asked for a refill not when I said thank you as she dropped off the check... nothing.   The food was mediocre.   The service was horrendous.   The star given is for the aged balsamic and complementary garlic knots... but mostly the balsamic. It was really good. I mean, they didn't make it but they had it? Idk. Go somewhere else.
The garlic bread was too doughy for me.  However their mussels and linguini were delicious.  The portions are more than plentiful.  Hubs enjoyed his spaghetti and meatballs.

After walking by this restaurant many times over the years, we stopped in for a late lunch. We opted for a booth to avoid the traffic flow outside the place and people fresh off their highs from the oxygen bar around the corner.  Food was excellent (we both had the carbonara), portions were generous, and service was amicable and sincere - from the host to the server to the multiple staff members that thanked us on our way out. Definitely an experience we'd repeat.
Authentic Italian feel to this great restaurant!  Pizza and the breadsticks are great

Great little place near the food court in the canal shops.  Service was great and staff was very accommodating.  Excellent wood fired pizzas and salads.  Solid good in a casual environment.  Would definitely  return.

Starting off with the good.  The service was amazing!  I read the reviews before my husband and I picked a place to eat.  We wanted Italian and this got great reviews, but I don't see what all the fuss is about.    If you have been to Vegas before then you know that eating in the middle of the Venetian shops might not be the most romantic dinner.  Yes the restaurant is small.  So small that you are seated basically in the middle of all the tourists.  I think they want you to feel like you are in Italy sitting outside in a European cafe, but this is Vegas!    Food:  We ordered the meatballs that everyone raved about and they were so acidic that I couldn't even get 2 bits down before the heart burn started.  They aren't the hearty meat taste you might imagine.  They are made with Filet Mignon so they are just bland.  Then we had Linguine with Clams.  It was like water and the noodles were starchy.  We stopped ordering after those things, paid the bill and got pizza late night.    I wish we would have gone to a buffet....

Good food, great service.  Vegas is expensive, so if you are watching your dollars - we found this place on Yelp! allowing us to make the right decision to eat here vs the other many Italian restaurants and we feel we got great value.  VENUE & SERVICE:  Cute restaurant and our server was really friendly.  You are right in The Venetian close to everything so it made for a good pit stop.  BREAD: We appreciated the garlic knots and they even asked us if we wanted more but we had ordered enough food.  MENU: Lots of choice and prices were reasonable. Big portions - great if you are hungry and great if you like to take home leftovers. (We were both.)  We got:  - Meat balls - Baked ziti  - Linguine bolognese  In hind site, we could have got the baked ziti with the meat balls since we were sharing food. But if you are more than two people, get this appy for 3 large meatballs.  With all that we were stuffed, so we didn't try any dessert.  AND BONUS (for us)... we took home leftovers that got us through two other meals. Our hotel had a kitchen, so I was able to transform leftovers into a second slightly different big meal with some items picked up at the local market.  Awesome - that's important to me :) that's good value!  Buon appetito!

Just okay, we made a reservation for 7 of us on a weekday night, and it was full when we arrived. We all shared the filet mignon/pork meatball, and I ordered the pesto gnocchi. Pesto sauce was very creamy but not too flavorful, and the gnocchi itself was pretty good. The meatball didn't taste too special but it was quite chewy and it was very tender. Complementary bread was good too, especially with olive oil and vinegar. Price is very high for the quantity though.

After perusing the Yelp reviews of Italian eateries in Las Vegas, the hubby and I decided to give this place a try on a recent trip there.  I'm pretty sure this place makes it money on their wine and alcoholic beverages because I was all geared up for a glass of champagne until I discovered that the only brand of champagne they carry had a price tag of over $100.00 a glass (I believe it was actually $130.00!), and I seem to recall the cheapest glass of wine being somewhere in the vicinity of $13.00!  O.k., so I settled for water and a cappaccino (sp?) as an after-dinner drink!    We ordered their "greens" salad ($13.00) and it was gigantic, so plenty for the both of us to share.  For our entrees, I had their baked ziti ($18.00) and the hubs ordered his usual favorite, lasagna (same price).  The baked ziti was a very generous serving, but the lasagna looked kind of lonely on the plate, so hubby downed what remained of my entree after devouring his lasagna.  They were both very, very good but I was disappointed in the sauce, which was a light, pale, almost pinkish color.  I was thinking it was maybe either a vodka sauce or pomodoro, but the waiter told us they mix ricotta into their marinara sauce; hence, the paler sauce.  I'm not a huge fan of ricotta outside of it being contained in ravioloi or layering it in lasagna.  I prefer my Italian sauce deep, dark red and rich, so this took away from the dish for me, but that is just my own personal preference.  There were large layers of melted mozzarella covering the baked ziti, which was delish!  Now for the best thing at Trattoria Reggiano - DESSERT!!  And, yes, a "specific" dessert at that!  It's spelled C.A.N.N.O.L.I!!!  This was the highlight of our dinner experience at this restaurant!  If you eat here, you simply MUST - and I can't stress this enough - M.U.S.T. indulge in one of their cannoli's!!!  Absolutelyo TO-DIE-FOR - the BEST cannoli to ever make acquaintance with my palate!!  And for a Bostonian gal, this is really saying something as Bostonians take their cannoli's VERY seriously (just ask anyone if you ever happen to be in Boston!).  In the several decades of living on the west coast, I had never yet experienced a cannoli that could compare with the way they're made on the east coast.  But, I'm here to tell you that at Trattoria Reggiano, they are pure HEAVEN!!  No. 1, they are huge.  They are filled with marscapone, as they should be, with a few, very few, chocolate chips scattered throughout, whipped cream on top and a light drizzing of  caramel syrup on the plate to make it look fancy!  I was NOT happy about sharing this with the hubby, especially when he's never really cared for cannoli's before!!  I wanted to be a glutton and eat the entire thing myself, but I decided to be nice!  Lastly,their bread is also noteworthy.  They're small roundish little knots of bread with a buttery, garlic topping.  Very yummy!  The only thing that prevented me from giving this restaurant more stars was the fact that I wasn't crazy about the sauce, but that is just my own personal taste.

Amazing pastas. The garlic knots were huge and awesome...we had the linguine frutti di mare , linguine with clams, carbonara, and chicken parm. The noodles were cooked perfectly and our server was real friendly and attentive. It looks like they are expanding the restaurant which is even better. I will be back the next time I'm in Vegas.

Great place for Italian. Nothing fancy at all. Like all the reviews state... tiny inside seating, with tables set up along The Grand Canal Shoppes between Venetian and Palazzo. Wonderful bread and oil to start off with. Shared the spaghetti with meatballs and the carbonara. Next time we are in Vegas and craving carbs, oil, garlic, and cream... we will plan to stop here!

Amanda was super nice .After that  here comes the best garlic rolls I ever tasted!!!!We had to get a 2nd order.I had the shrimp scampi which was good.And my girl had the spaghetti and meatballs which she enjoyed.

Wonderful evening !  Food was delicious, steamed clams, eggplant parm, fettuccine, chicken Marsala. Rosanna, Friday's entertainment, WONDERFUL. upcoming, Diana Krall, Michael Buble style.  Casual yet very special evening. Outdoor eating, fabulous weather. PERFECT EVENING.

Found this on Yelp, as we were craving Italian food that was within walking distance of Treasure island. This place was a little hard to find. I get that it's in the Venetian, but some signage would be nice. If you hit to Palazzo from the Venetian, you're going the wrong way!  The place is pretty small, so we were happy to have gotten seating on a Saturday evening. The host that seated us was super friendly and our server was nice. Everyone that helped us here sounded legitimately Italian. Either that or they had a legit Italian faccent (fake accent), which was so good that it may be real.   Food here was a bit pricier than I expected (but was it really? It's dining on the strip...), but was good. They start you off with these garlic bread rolls. Make sure you're limiting how many of these you eat. They will come to suffocate you later when you try to fit more carb into your body. The pastas here come in pretty large sizes and are so tasty you just want to keep eating them. Don't. Trust me when i say to box about half of your pasta. I did just that and I was full after a while, and my family finished theirs and I almost had to roll them to the car because they were so full. It may not have helped that we finished with the tiramisu, which was a custard mixed with ladyfingers served in a wine glass. Everything we had here was delicious. I had the carbonara, my mom had a seafood fettuccine, and my brother had the bolognese. All were really tasty and plentiful.    One of the things I would change about this place is pricing (but I know it's hard to complain about pricing on the strip). Each pasta plate cost around $17-20+. The other thing I would point out is being able to hear the staff get yelled at/scolded since we were seated near the kitchen. It's almost shameful to the staff to face the customers after they just got scolded!  Otherwise, food was great here and service followed through. Give this place a try if you're in the area!

I specifically went to Yelp to find an Italian restaurant while in Vegas.  I am shocked at how many fantastic reviews are on here.  Either most people have never had real italian food OR they had an off night because my husband and I were thoroughly disappointed.  I had the carbona, and despite it being made with pancetta, it really needed salt!  My husband had the spaghetti and meatballs and it was just ok.  It was also kind of difficult to find.  Sorry guys...
Loved this place! Excellent service, excellent food. The bread rolls were fantastic. I highly recommend this restaurant if you are looking for good Italian food!

One of my favorite places to eat at Downtown Summerlin. Its by Regal and Dave & Busters. It's great for a simple date spot... nice little outside area. The garlic knots and calamari are really good. I keep it simple with the personal pizzas, like the margherita and bruschetta. Always great food and service!
Fantastic and quick service. The food is very good. Nothing more to say than EAT HERE!

overprice and mediocre.Servers were pleasant but not very knowledgeable about Italinan food or wine.We asked several about Italian wines and no one knew what we were talking about .Very surprised they dont hire more experienced  service personal..some Italians!

Paolo, our Italian server, was an amazing host towards the dinner my girlfriend and I had last night. The best shrimp scampi plate I've tried (since it was her plate) and i had the Cesar salad and sausage pizza which was terrific as well. Will come next visit good job guys!

I thought the food was good, but not especially noteworthy - tough competition in Vegas. The carbonara was authentic (no cream) but isn't the best I've had. The balsamic and olive oils left tableside are high quality. And the antipasto platter is huge; even a half order would feed four people!   But the entire experience was marred by awful service that felt like being at an Applebee's and having a waiter-in-training. When we sat down, the menu had barely been presented when we were asked if we wanted to order - he totally misread us and thought we wanted a fast service instead of a relaxing meal (or else he just wanted the table turnover). I am able to look past that, we took our time, ordered, and when the antipasto platter came out, they had substituted a hard cheese for the fresh mozzarella which was disappointing.  When my waiter finally reappeared I asked him about it, and he said "well it should", shrugged, and walked away - no offer to fix it or even query the kitchen for an explanation. He also never offered a refill of the raved-about garlic knots - I didn't particularly need them given the size of the platter, but an offer would have been nice and appropriate.  He also brought our entrees prior to the appetizer platter being finished - poor timing by either himself or the kitchen, again expecting fast turnover instead of a relaxing meal. Definitely the opposite of "authentic Italian"!  Finally, older reviews talk about a hard to find quiet spot, but the current location is in the food court so there is a lot of foot traffic walking by. In conclusion, even though the food is good (three-star), there are many good Italian places in Las Vegas to dine at, so I can't recommend Trattoria Reggiano.

Probably the best chicken and vegetables in town. You know what I'm talking about once you take your first bite. I always sit at the bar since the bartender is like 10 across the board with her service and personality. Amazing singers as well Wednesday through Saturday.
Small and quaint! A nice change of pace from the usual vegas mass herds. The spaghetti carbonara is fantastic. The prices and very reasonable and the staff was attentive. A hidden gem!

I love this place..Authentic Italian.  Everything is so fresh..Rickie is an amazing server.  She is one of the reasons we keep coming back..try the Eggplant Rottini as an appetizer.  Great happy hour too....
They have the best balsamic vinegar. The ambiance is a little loud  and the tables are somewhat crammed together but service was excellent and food was good.
love the service and the alfredo was good, however the filet mignon meatball wasnt as significant as it claims to be.
Get here early, they don't take reservations. Don't be mislead by this tiny spot- the food is authentic and totally on point! Sit with Amanda, she's the greatest!
Very Good Italian food done right. Not fancy or overdone. Just really good comfort food.

The food is great but the service needs much improvement. The staff is friendly but need some training to be more attentive. Not enough menus for all guests, water refills are few and far in between, it took a while to figure out who our server was.

When in Vegas and in the Venetian you gotta eat Italian -- right?!  Vegas is know for restaurants large enough to seat the population of a small country, not the case here.  It's an open kitchen with a few tables and a few booths.  Sure the alfresco dinning is in the middle of a mall but it worked. Sometimes you need to get away from the bustle of Vegas and just enjoy a meal and the company you're with.    The service was great especially since we were a party of 4 chatty women wanting separate checks with a bottle of wine.  Ok he couldn't split the bottle across 4 checks.  The waiter handled all our questions by saying, "I've been married for 30 years ask away!"  The perfect amount of cheekiness!!!!   The food was traditional Italian  - Few people had eggplant parmigiana.  Huge potions.  Those that had a fridge in their hotel room, they took it home for lunch the next day. Those that didn't, took it to go and gave it to a homeless guy on the strip.   The pizza with eggplant and ricotta was good.  Bonus points for the fact that they removed the skin from the eggplant.  I had a few slices and the rest went to the homeless man mentioned above.   We washed it down with a Chianti sans fava beans!

Tucked away in the Venetian is this treasure. I like it so much I have been not once but twice. On this most recent adventure to Las Vegas I got to experience it again so I went a different route and didn't have a rerun of the filet mignon meatballs that I fondly remember from my first visit.  Once we found the place I think I even got the same charming Italian server that I had the prior year. With a very good imagination you could envision yourself at a small bistro in the middle of a village in Italy. The servings at this restaurant are very large so it would be most ideal to share a meal with a friend rather than feel like you need to be wheeled back to your hotel.  The garlic knots/muffins are so darn good I could probably be happy just eating a Caesar salad and this garlicky piece of heaven. But noooo.....eggplant parmigiana was calling my name and it did not disappoint. My friends ordered veal scalloppini piccata and an eggplant ricotta pizza and were all pleased with their orders. There was no room for dessert but I am sure it would be delicious if only there was room.

The food was fine but the service was horrible! We arrived at 6:30pm on a Thursday night and the place was totally empty. We were just trying to grab a quick bite before our movie at 7:45pm next door.   Our server Zekke was awful. The second we said we didn't want to order any drinks he lost all interest. I know that's where restaurants make money but it's not like we were taking a table away from other guests with a higher check. There was probably only 4 tables the entire time we were there. It took 35 minutes to just get a salad and another 20 for the pizza. When the pizza finally came out our server tried to give us tiny bread plates to eat off of. When I asked for a normal sized plate, he rolled his eyes and walked away. I honestly couldn't believe how rude he was!   We left and mentioned to the hostess how horrible the service was but honestly I don't think anyone in that place cared. We won't be back.
For the price, four stars. If it were more expensive three stars. I had the calamari and veal parm. Both were good. The bread was also very good.  If I could give 3.5 stars I would.
Fantastic service by Victor!   Pastas were cooked to perfection and garlic knots were superb!!   Had a Ruffino Chianti which was fabulous.

Great atmosphere here. We sat outside, they had warmers so it was perfect. They had a guy on a keyboard and another singing, they were awesome. Our server was great. I ordered a cheeseless pizza and she asked if there's was an allergy they needed to know about, which I thought was awesome that she asked. My friend ordered a pasta dish that looked and smelled amazing, but my pizza was awful. Usually when you order something with capers, they're just kinda sprinkled on, but this was like an entire jar of capers had been dumped on the pizza. That was the only thing you tasted. The crust had no flavor, the mushrooms had no flavor, the sauce was barely visible.  The crust was hard and flat, it was like a cracker. I couldn't cut it with a knife, and it was difficult to pick up to eat. But both the pizza and the pasta dish were huge portions and everyone was super friendly so I would recommend this place, just not the pizza.

This is a great little restaurant tucked away in a corner of the Venetian Grand Canal shops. The staff was very friendly and very attentive.   I was really looking forward to a plate of lasagna and was disappointed when none could be found on the menu. I ended up having the spaghetti with meatballs and it was very good. The garlic bread they serve is fantastic as well.   All in all, I liked it. Definitely recommended.
Amazing service! Excellent bread for starter. Calamari was on point. YUM!!!! As far as the portion it was perfect for one serving. Nothing more, nothing less. I would dine here again.

Vegas is like the Great Glass Elevator from Charlie and the Chocolate Factory.  Push a button, any button, and *whoosh* you're off to some exotic destination. Is it the great pyramid of the Mojave or will it be a poolside oasis in this devastating heat?   Well, my mama and I wished to be whisked away to the canals of Venice. *Whoosh* and off we went to Palazzo via the Monorail. Although only 1 stop away from MGM Grand where we stayed, we wanted to avoid the 92º heat at 8PM. Sure we still did some walking, but it was nice and cool amongst the marble laden hallways.   After viewing pictures on Yelp of the foods served here, we we're insatiably curious to taste them for ourselves. Our tummies were VERY happy with this choice and so were our wallets!   Trattoria Reggiano is a hole in the wall, tucked away within the Grand Canal Shoppes. Although it has a limited number of booths inside, the seating spills out into the hallway, creating a street cafe effect that seems both authentic and quaint.   We sere seated immediately and we dove right into the menu. And the garlic balls! We both started with wine, ahhhhve cooooourse. To share, we split the meatballs.  Oh, the MEATBALLSSSSS. So tender. So simple. So hot. So meaty. Smothered in the house "gravy" or "marinara" sauce, these went perfectly with the garlic balls served complimentary. The best things in life, come in ball form. They almost always come as a pair too.   For our entrees, Mama went for the chicken marsala and I, the carbonara.   Mine was so rich, creamy, and the right amount of salty bacon. Although I was extremely full from the meatballs and bread rolls, I don't know how I scarfed this amazing bowl of pasta down, but it was DAMN DELICIOUS.   When all parts of a restaurant (ambiance, service, food, timing) come together in serendipitous unity, it's pure bliss. It's also the button I wanna press all the time in the Great Glass Elevator.

We ate here yesterday and was presently surprised at how good it was.  We ordered the bucatini carbonara, linguine with clams and the eggplant parmesan and all were excellent and large portions.  The garlic bread was great but I would just prefer the choice of just plain old  Italian bread.  The balsamic vinegar and olive oil was good but I asked for butter which was brought quickly. Our server Zeki was professional, attentive and polite.  We were also given a dish of olives, red peppers and hard parmesan cheese to our delight.  We will try it again soon.

We went to this joint recently and I'm on the fence. I've heard nothing but great things from the one on the strip. This one is much closer to home.   Service: Our waiter was Jason. The poor guy seemed so stressed and the entire restaurant seemed understaffed. First downside. Jason was great though. Even though he seemed rushed, he was very attentive and quick to make sure our drinks were filled and our food came out in a very timely manner.  His manager or whomever the older gentleman was at the window for food was not. He kept yelling out at the waiters. Which I felt was insanely unprofessional because that window is right next to tables. This is a very open restaurant and you can see all of the cooking staff.  There was a time that Jason was taking our order and the manager yelled out "Jason! Order up!" And Jason kind of glanced over at him to show him that he was in the middle of taking our order.  Who does this? I don't know. But I hope he sees this and realizes that it makes him look horrible and the restaurant in general.  Also, hire more people or staff appropriately. We went during prime time, 7:30ish. You should be fully staffed. Otherwise, you have a bunch of waiters running around trying to serve a ridiculous amount of tables and people are going to start to get frustrated.   Food: I wasn't really that impressed. The calamari was good, but a bit too peppery. The marinara was very good and very flavorful. We also had the lobster ravioli and the lasagna.  Ravioli...it was good. It was probably my favorite dish. But the lasagna kind of lacked in flavor. It was very mediocre and pretty plain. Which in my experiences in Las Vegas, it's all roughly the same for lasagna for some odd reason.   The restaurant itself isn't very large. They have a nice sized patio if you want to dine outside and they do have a nice selection of wines. The best was they have a nice description of what the wine is, so that is very helpful. We had the Barbera D'Asti. I highly recommend if you like red full bodied wines.  The prices we reasonable as well.   Overall, I'm sure I'll go back to try other dishes. It's a nice location and another good addition to the Summerlin Downton Mall.

Quick and friendly service.   The atmoshere was excellent, with nice lighting and being able to do some people watching while enjoying a dinner.   The food was average at best.  Veal parm was good, but the sauce wasn't above average.  The spinach and zucchini soup was purred and very bland.   Chocolate mouse was tasty but too thick and rich instead if fluffy and light.   Chicken Marsala was overcooked and small.  Although I was disappointed in the food, the atmosphere made the experience worth a try.  I just don't think it lived up to authentic Italian cuisine.

I was a bit skeptical because this restaurant is so small and located to the side of a coffee bean. Moreover, it is next to a service door where lots of workers come in and out with garbage. However, don't be fool because this place is wonderful. The portions are big and the service is warm and friendly! The pasta are audente and the marinara sauce that I had is fresh and tangy! The meatballs are dense and packed with flavor. My bf had the clam linguini which he claims is the best he had (he always orders the clam linguni at every Italian restaurant).   The bread that comes in the beginning is also very good and comes fresh and soft!   It is not cheap but it is a great alternatives to the over hyper restaurants nearby. I really enjoyed my experience here.

OMG! This is the best Italian food I have ever had!,,, I love Italian food and travel quite a bit. The food was excellent! The sauces were flavorful without being to overbearing. The restaurant was quaint and personable. We had great wine and service was excellent. Can't wait to go back!

Service is absolutely excellent. However, the food was really really salty. I wish I had sent the carbonara back, but I was really enjoying my anniversary. They did however send a nice complimentary cannoli for our anniversary per our reservation notes. I was thankful of that for sure. Food is a little for the quality.

The garlic knots were amazing. We ordered the lobster ravioli and the shrimp marinara, both delicious and the shrimp we're cooked just perfectly. Friendly staff and very attentive. Definitely a place to check out!

OMG Omg authentic Italian food. U must go here, this is the best Italian food I've ever had. Everything is made fresh to order, even the pasta!!! I will definitely be back. Everything on the menu is amazing and a party in my mouth!!!

A very mediocre "Italian" restaurant. This place was a disappointment unfortunately. No energy here at all and the place was almost empty while I was there. There are better options elsewhere in Las Vegas for sure.
Very yummy. You feel like you're under the beautiful skies. The ambiance was a bit tight and awkward when tourists would come and take pics all around us...

The food was mediocre and overpriced. I had a four cheese pizza. I have tasted better in other less expensive restaurants.  The service was meh. The guy pushed the higher cost menu items even after we refused. Also we went fairly early for the dinner rush and they were already out of salmon and truffle. It is disappointing that they were already out of main ingredients for the dishes we truly wanted to get. I will admit I liked seeing Copa America on the TV, but that isn't enough to make me want to try this place again.

Place is beautiful, no doubt. $16.00 for the Kale Chicken Salad is too pricey for lunch. The pizza looked great but I have to say the tomato sauce was very bland and had no flavor. I had to salt the pizza.

My friend and I are creatures of habit and loved this place so much last year that we had to come back.  We got here around 6:45 on Saturday night and there were a couple groups ahead of us.  Despite this, the host/manager said to come back at 7.  We arrived at 7 and he said it'd be a few extra minutes.  There was an empty table for 4 being cleared and I knew we were next on the list, but he sat a party of 4 there before us, leaving us waiting for a party of 2 to get up.  I realize that they don't have many tables and it would seem like a waste to sit a party of 2 at a 4-top, but it was poor service since they rushed a party of 2 out after that, though we still waited another 10 minutes for them.  The server wasn't nearly as friendly as last time.  He was a little rude when I asked for bread and said, "Lady, this a busy store!" in his Italian accent.  I realized it was busy, but we'd been sitting there over 5 minutes before he even came over and then he didn't bring bread the first 2 times he stopped by.  And I was damn hungry.  We both lightened up and he got a nicer toward the end of the meal (probably to bring up his tip).  Food was still excellent.  Got the penne primavera with grilled chicken.  I wish I got something with red sauce, though, because it looked so good, but I remembered how good the primavera was.  Big portions and despite my hunger, I couldn't finish it all.  Pinot Grigio wasn't as good as I recall, but maybe I've just had better since then.  Overall, I'd still recommend for a cheaper, solid meal in Vegas.
Great food....prices are a little too high for what it is.....and selection of wines Way too small

Mmmmm, carbs! i likee (= i am such a carb whore. I could probably eat pasta and bread with butter all day long, which is perfect for an Italian food! Trattoria Raggiano is such dainty little restaurant that it was kind of hard to find in the Venetian. Honestly, I totally did not except the restaurant to be that small, but nevertheless Trattoria did made me feel like i dining at Italian grandmother's home. (=  Our waiter was nice and patient, even though we kept on asking questions about their menus and had more people joining our party. he brought us a basket of yummy garlic rolls with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Woww, i could munch on those garlic rolls all day!  Filet Mignon Meatballs - Oh geez, these meatballs were so soft and fluffy. It felt like my tongue was sleeping on a pillow of wonderful meaty and tomatoey goodness! Lobster Ravioli - Yummy! The Ravioli was perfectly formed with just the right amount lobster to pasta ratio. The texture of the lobster was so soft, in contrast with al-denta ravioli. The sauce was rich and creamy. (= Four Cheese Orecchiette - The Orecchiette was stuffed with four different types of cheese! For all of you cheese lovers out there, this is the perfect pasta dish for you. (= Neapolitan Pizza with Sausage and Mushroom - The crust on the pizza was thin and crispy. The ingredients were fresh and flavorful. Simple, delicious, and it just hits the hunger pangs (=

I stumbled upon this little restaurant in the Venetian last year and went back twice this year when I was dealing the series.  Everything is pretty good, HOWEVER, this place has the best baked ziti.  My friend Sandi, also went back multiple times just for this dish.  The place has great tables that feel outdoors, and fun if you like people watching.  It has a fun, Italian feel, with good service, and tasty dishes.

Thank you yelpers for recommending this place. Stopped in tonight and had the spaghetti and filet meatballs. Delicious. The garlic knots come with your meal and they are a must with the olive oil and balsamic they provide. I sat at the bar and my experience was excellent, thanks Heather!   It's a small little place hidden in the shops at palazzo/venetian. Check it out!
Came here for some drinks and a appetizer before a movie.  Really enjoyed it here and we will be back.

Normally love this place. The quality has gone down. The garlic knots are not as soft, garlicky or buttery. They were fresh and warm though.   I tried the Shrimp Scampi for the first time and was disappointed. Very salty, the garlic butter used to toss the pasta lacked flavor and was barely on plate. My husband got the swordfish picatta which was good. I will say that the fish is always enjoyable. We shared a Cesar salad and was pleased with this. I wish I would have had the eggplant parmigiana. I have had this in the past and loved it. I had issues overnight after my shrimp scampi. I will not order again or recommend that dish. Service was ok. Just average.

We almost walked away... My dad wasn't impressed with its size nor its quaint decor, but I can be persistent and with the help of yelp we did circle back around and sit down. Thank you Jesus!  It is a tiny establishment with but a few tables inside sight eh majority of the others lined up out front where people pass you by often checking out the sights and stores of the mall but you soon get over that once the food starts being delivered in the quickest fashion I have ever seen. We had at least two waiters working our tables, making sure we had all we needed. The wine was a bit expensive, only a few we're offered by the glass, but my nevola was damn try and perfect with my entry.  The food... The food... Ummm... Wow... The pillow-like garlic knots buttered to perfection, the 3 large filet minon meatballs in a red sauce that fell apart in your mouth, and the stuffed to bursting lobster ravioli with actual chunks of lobster inside covered in a creamy vodka sauce were all just too perfect. I'm soo glad we stopped, even my dad who went healthy for this particular meal was impressed with the large thin-cut swordfish covered with olives aNd tomatoes in a white wine sauce and large helping of squash And zucchini left him a bit impressed too. Yay!   The food made it worth the time we spent trying find this tiny little gem but for 5 stars the ambience and overall dining experience need to be top notch and this place just really needs a new location in a much bigger area so that all the tables could be inside and not in the main mall hallway.

Great place for an in-and-out casual meal. Made reservations on OpenTable and seated right away. Yum garlic knots provided with GOOD! olive oil & balsamic to temper our hunger. Ordered specialty arugula salad with truffle infused dressing, couldn't really taste truffle. The amazing shaved parmesan and anchovies made up for it. Authentic Italian sausage pizza with fresh mozzarella...we added fresh basil. Kudos to our server Victor for taking time to chat with us and make our meal memorable!

I love the ambiance and the delicious food! From the garlic knots to the chicken Parmesan, everything was perfection! Make sure to try the chicken tortellini it's my favorite! And don forget the dessert, from cheesecake to cannolis don't end the night without trying one of their signature desserts! I'll recommend this restaurant to all of my friends and family.

This place was a cozy little place tucked away near the food court of the Venetian. Our server, who also seemed to be either the manager or owner, seated our party of three immediately. He was very friendly and nice, and spoke with what seemed like a legitimate Italian accent!   The overall atmosphere was authentic and cozy feeling, with light Italian and classical music playing.   I ordered the linguini bolognese and it was served promptly. It was nothing spectacular but thoroughly satisfying. The bread they served was pretty good too, brushed with garlic butter, but not as warm as I would've wanted. Overall a great place with above average food at reasonable prices!
This place was Great! The food was excellent, Bethany was great. Would happily recommend this place to everyone.

Delicious food and awesome service!  Our server was Paolo, he was nice and professional with a good sense of humor. The reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the garlic rolls on the 1st round were not warm, We will be back again when visiting Vegas.

I wanted pasta in Vegas, but I didn't want to spend an arm and a leg. So I yelped Italian and found Trattoria Reggiano in the Venetian. It was a bit pricey, $18 for spaghetti and meatballs. But the meatballs were made of filet mignon, so they were way better than normal. I really wanted to try the Frutti de Mare, but that was $29. Yikes...so it was worth it, since me and my boyfriend shared it. I also like the garlic bread! It's so classy, and served in a cone. I don't know if I'll go here again though, probably a one time thing.

Service - Very Italian.  Short and to the point.  Never trust someone who tells you EVERYTHING on the menu is good.  Reservation - None taken.  Expect a wait because the place is small.  Food - Hit or miss. 1. Filet Mignon Meatballs - A must.  Really tender and moist.  2. Linguine Bolognese - Not acidic.  However, the meat was not very tender.  3. Lobster Ravioli - Doused in sauce.  Ravioli had minced lobster and not chunks. 4. Linguine with Shrimp Marinara - Bland and really garlicky. 5. Complimentary Garlic Knots - A complete joke.  Soft but really dense.

Awesome, awesome!!! Truth be told I already cooked dinner for myself and my other half tonight, yet I found myself stuffing my face with delicious meatballs! We were out and about shopping and my BF wanted something sweet, I was in support of a restaurant so I could have a glass of wine. The restaurant is very intimate, which I love!! They offer outdoor seating, another plus, plus a great happy hour. We decided to share the spaghetti and meatballs and let me tell you, hands down best meatballs in Vegas. My BF grew up in a very strict Italian family and he could not stop talking about how great the meatballs are. We have no desire to go to another Italian restaurant in Vegas. We of course got our something sweet in the end where my BF chose the Carrot Cake and I went for the Cannoli. Both were amazing!!!! Danny G. the manager helped me to decide to order the Cannoli since he was bragging about how good it is and that they make it fresh in house, SOLD!!! Danny G. was a delight who went over and beyond any expectations to make a casual stroll into dinner #2. Thank you all for a fabulous time!!
Very rude.dont bother asked a simple question and the waiter was very condescending.  Got up and left.bye bye
Great Italian food & service!    I can not wait to go back with  my family & friends. You will not regret it.

"Was excited about the swordfish carpaccio.. It was horrible! No flavor whatsoever! Service was not great either.. Overpriced for no good reason..the linguine with seafood was mehh...nothing out of the ordinary to wow me! I never got a waiter to come over and ask how I was doing, did I enjoy the food, did I want another glass of prosecco? Needless to say, I'll never go back!

Food was excellent. I had the spaghettti pomodoro and my husband had the spaghetti puttanesca.  I really liked the sauce.  The wait was less than twenty minutes but the host served a group of people to their seats before us - that made me angry because we had been waiting and they had just arrived.  The meals arrived quickly and the dinner rolls were yummy too.

We went to grape street in January and let me just say you have it all over them. Our waitress Teressa was wonderful and Mimmo is my new favorite person very classy. The food was absolutely amazing. The garlic knots with the oil and vinegar just wow I couldn't stop eating them. I ordered one of their signature drinks it was delicious we went during lunch time and had the balsamic chicken salad. And also one of their pizzas. I cannot wait to go back for dinner! This is a must place to eat!

Last week we went to trattoria reggiano and it was amazing. We had such a great experience. I ordered the filet mignon meatballs and I can't wait until we go back and I can get them again. What made this experience stand out was how personable the manager, Flavia, was. She checked on us and gave us pointers and advice on what to see on our vacation. (we had much fun playing tourist that weekend we didn't tell anyone we are actually locals)
They have really nice servers and the food is great. The pizza here is very tasty and their arugula salad tastes very good. I have had much better pizza before but the service is great.

I got here a lot because there always seems to be a shorter wait than with the big restaurants in St Marks Squared and the food is priced similarly and just as good.  It's a bit hard to find but it's right next to the Coffee Bean, just past where the gondola water ends.  We've ordered the spaghetti and meatballs for years because the meatballs are amazing and now we always get the chicken parm.  We were there over the weekend and tried the baked ziti, it wasn't for us.  Not sure what type of cheese they used but it just didn't care for it.  I have had problems with service because when it's busy they are a bit inattentive but the food always makes me turn a blind eye.

Great little Italian joint. Polite servers. Good service. Good food. The spaghetti and meatballs and vodka infused penne were both very flavorful, especially the meatballs themselves. The burrata appetizer was good overall except for the burrata itself being super small - for the price of the plate, it should be either been 2 pieces or a much larger piece. Overall, absolutely recommend it!

My sister and I were in Vegas this past weekend and wanted to have a nice meal the first night we were there. We felt like Italian so on to Yelp we went and found this cute spot! We went around 9pm and it wasn't very busy, the hostess was also friendly. There's a small "patio" with hedges outlining it and it also where we sat. The decor was nice and felt homey. The menu wasn't huge, but had a nice selection of pasta and pizzas. I ordered the carbonara and my sister ordered the eggplant parmesan. The carbonara was delicious! It really hit the spot because I was craving something richer so I'd be satiated for the late night we were about to have. The prosciutto was crispy and the noodles were perfectly al dente. The portion was just enough to not have leftovers or feel too full. Oh, and as you've probably read in majority of reviews, their complimentary garlic knots were awesome! You can't have Italian food without garlic bread and these were the best I've had anywhere, they're packed with flavor! The price point was decent considering it was in The Venetian. BTW, you might miss this spot but it's on the way to the food court upstairs. It was a toss up between this place and Casanova which was across from it. I'd be happy to eat here again!

A Bit Hard to Find and Average"  This is the kind of restaurant that is not exciting. Definitely a bit hard to fine. The Decore is average, the food is average and the services is average. When you go out in Vegas you want to be in a place that is exciting, alive Vegas style! we went their because of the 5 star rating but we were both disapointed. My pasta Carbonara was a bit greasy and my wife very simple pomodoro was a bit blend! Our server was friendly. Italian food is not very complicated. fresh ingredients, good seasoning and great pasta...

Located in the Venetian, this is a cool, casual spot to grab a sit down meal without all the frills of Vegas dining. Our server was great. Very attentive and super nice. The food tasted like good ol' comfort Italian food - which is exactly what I was craving. All in all, a great chill dinner success story

Best food and staff in town hands down!  I am gluten free and they accommodated everything amazingly and made me feel so comfortable.  The bartender Bethany took time to make sure she had everything right and was so helpful and an absolute pleasure to be around. The GM Wendy and the manager Daniel were accessible to everyone in the restaurant and were so courteous, they immediately make you feel like you are part of a big Italian family, which I actually am! First time here but 100% not the last. Thank you so much for an amazing experience.

I have been meaning to write this review for a long time. My husband and i got married at the Venetian resort, which is an amazing hotel, and we continue going there every year. The night before our wedding we and our four friends decided to go to this cozy looking Italian restaurant mainly the atmosphere seemed very nice and we love Italian food.   However, I ordered a pasta dish not sure which one, with chicken and it came without, which I instantly noted to the waiter. Of course the waiter was apologetic, went to the kitchen to ask for the chicken, which I found very strange, perhaps even more strange when the chicken came out in a bowl, they had cooked the already frozen cooked chicken in cream in the microwave, so basically I was meant to add that to my pasta, It was hilariously disappointing, and our friends weren't very impressed about their pizzas either, and barely touched them.

Excelllent service  It was a little cozy spot we didn't even plan on going to, but it looked inviting so we went for it.   I ordered seafood pasta, and my boyfriend ordered the lobster ravioli which was amazing!   Our server was great which our dinner more enjoyable.
Simply the most authentic Italian restaurant you will find in Las Vegas.  Buon appetite.

Went to dinner here for a company dinner while in Las Vegas. The wait wasn't too long considering how busy they are. They provide lots of delicious sides such as garlic bread, grilled artichokes and salad. I tried their lasagne. It was pretty good but not the best I have ever had. It's a bit pricey.

Why?  Why did my yelp app point me to this place among all the other Italian places in LV?  While I cannot answer that question, I can tell you that we were not fans.  First, the service was terrible.  Our waiter was un-friendly and abrupt.  After we were seated, he came to our table and asked if we knew what wanted to eat.  He never asked us for a drink order.  We had two friends join us who had already eaten, and in the time it took our waiter to come over they were able to walk over to the coffee bean, order drinks, pick them up, and enjoy them.    So we ordered, and we placed our entire order at that time - drinks, apps, entrees and desserts.  Then we waited.  And waited.  And then we got our entrees with no appetizer.  The waiter seemed pissed off, and made a comment about the kitchen staff.  Well, what about his job of checking on our table?  Ugh, annoying.  So we canceled the appetizer order and just ate the main course.  We had the pesto gnocchi.  It was bland.  The gnocchi was nice though.  The bread was also delicious, if not a tad bit oily.  But still, warm and yummy.  Our friends ordered dessert and one of them liked the Tiramisu, but the other did not.  She was expecting a layered-caked style tiramisu, vs. the layered in a glass tiramisu they received.  The atmosphere also brings this review down a star.  The majority of the tables are set up in the hallway and it makes it feel like you are eating in a shopping mall food court.  Lots of people milling around staring at you while you eat, from an arm's length away.  Not really what I would call charming ambiance.    This was by far my least favorite meal in LV, in terms of service, food and ambiance.
Found a wire in the served spaghetti. A waitress took it away without any apology. Really bad service and the food is plain. We don't recommend this restaurant.

Literally the worst dining experience we've had in the 3 years we've lived here. If I could give 0 stars I would. Please don't mistake this place being good just because it's in the Venetian. I'd much rather go to Olive Garden or Brio over this place in a heartbeat. The waitress was just awful. She places olive oil and balsamic on our table when we get there, only for us to receive bread 30 minutes later. She has no personality and seems bothered by us even being there. We're ignored the entire time while she's laughing with coworkers. We put in for appetizers, and when she finally stops ignoring us and comes back to the table, her response is, "So are you ready to finish ordering or what?" I'm glad I had my back to the kitchen because my husband saw them literally opening a bag of pasta to serve! My lobster and his shrimp were frozen. The lobster was so chewy it was barely edible and the shrimp were very minuscule. It's very easy to determine what's fresh and what's not when 1) you're Italian and 2) you lived in Florida for 20 years and know what fresh seafood is. All in all, I wouldn't let my dog eat their food, and I'm still killing myself paying $135 for the worst meal ever!

This place was lovely, I think the hole Venetian mall is, plus the service is amazing. I went with my 7 month old baby and they really did a great job. The food was delicious, although for my the pasta needed a little more boiling. However, the salsa , meat , eggplant was so yummy! Good menu.
Amanda is the best!!! Great service, friendly, and very helpful. I definitely recommend this place.

Have been coming here for over 10 years.  Good Italian eatery if you are in the shoppes at the Venetian.  In the food court area and reasonable prices for the portions you get.  4 stars because food had been a bit salty last few times, but very good.

This place feels Italian, looks like a great place for dinner... and then disappoints in every possible way.   The short version: overpriced, terribly RUDE service, and bland food will definitely keep me away from this restaurant.   We visited this place to celebrate having family in town. What better place to celebrate family than in an Italian restaurant, am I right? Well, today I was sadly mistaken.   The place was half empty despite being a busy Saturday in the Venetian. We were seating immediately after our arrival and an older waiter came to our table to drop off the menus as well olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Not the friendliest of greetings, but I let it slide.   While we were waiting to decide on our meal, I asked our waiter for some bread (thought it was odd we got the oil and vinegar, but no bread) to which he abruptly replied "bread comes to the table after you place your order". What's this all about? Was he afraid we were going to dine on free bread and water?!? Anyways, we then placed he order and things got really awkward.   After waiting for our food for a few minutes, the waiter came to our table, literally dropped my girlfriends plate in front of her from about an inch above the table top, and set my plate as well as my brothers. He left without a word.   Upon a closer look of my dish, something seemed off with the ingredients, but before asking I thought I would try it. This dish was bland, tasted of canned sauce and was not what I had ordered. Before I could even say anything, the waiter rushed to my table, took the fork from my hand and then pulled my dish of the table... without saying a single word.   That was it for me. I raised my voice and asked him what was going on only to hear him utter the words "the chef made a mistake, I'm fixing it". While I appreciate him trying to fix it, his gross demeanor and terrible attitude interrupted the mood in the table, and upset everyone.
