To add insult to injury, the manager came over and tried to brush the incident off by justifying the waiters behavior and telling me not to worry about it. Not worry about it? Why would I be worried? I didn't do anything wrong!!!!  The worst part of all? The manager was within feet of our table the whole time, and he apparently knows this waiter is terrible.   DO NOT VISIT THIS PLACE!!!

I was browsing through recommended Italian restaurants while visiting Vegas with the family and ran into Reggiano's reviews and decided on it from a long list of options. We had some trouble finding the place and almost gave up on our search by entering a more visible (and quite busy) Italian eatery, but we persevered and made with the location.  The restaurant area is small which in my opinion helps it with its mom & pop feel (just ignore the food court traffic). Tables were close together but I have to admit I did not feel crowded in there. I do believe we scored a very good table in the small patio area - we may have gotten really lucky there. We were seated promptly, server was prompt to our table and overall very pleasant. Ok, let's talk food now, shall we? One of the main reasons we decided on Reggiano's was the hailed filet mignon meatballs, so that was a must order item for us.  We ordered the appetizer meatballs and before even trying them, I was brave (and confident) that ordered some more in my spaghetti entree, since I decided to go simple and take full advantage of the raved meatballs. I'm afraid I couldn't tell you what the fuzz is all about. The meatballs we simply OK and nothing to write home about (yet I am writing about them here). Equally blend and unimpressive was my spaghetti entree. Expecting to taste a traditional and flavorful sauce, I felt I was eating something only barely better than a fast food joint pasta plate. I do regret not having the opportunity to try some of the other entrees mentioned, but I did try the tortellini with chicken in alfredo sauce and that is a plate I can stand behind. The chicken was perfectly cooked, soft and juicy and was an excellent to the delicious cheese-filled tortellini. I was not alone in this verdict, as we all shared our plates (as any sensible family would do). This makes me regret not ordering a chicken based entree, but I hope to get the chance to try other recommended plates on the menu in the future.

Service is terrible.  Fettuccine was chewy and the shrimp scampi was very fishy.  I would not go back here.  Thought it would be quick and easy before we headed out for the night but Yelp failed me this time.

The Caprese appetizer isnt something traditional but the cheese was delicious. The tortelloni alfredo was good. The waiter checked on us periodically and they brought a complimentary veggie/cheese dish which was ok. The garlic bread was never replenished that was given in the beginning. The calamari smelled awful - too fishy. I wanted meat with my dish and they couldnt add it for extra. I had to buy meat balls on the side just to pair it with something. My friend's spaghetti and meat balls were plain sauce wise and my other friend's white wine pasta dish was not appetizing at all. Ended up spending almost $200 between the 3 of us. There was definitely nothing special about this place. I dont mind spending good money on quality italian but I think its more hype than anything else. Overall mediocre. I dont think Id come back again. Im usually not a complainer/nit picker but for someone who loves Italian food and doesnt mind forking out the money it was a big let down.

We came here for dinner on our last night and it was a mistake. Should have stuck with The Barrymore. Overall review of this place is that it's overpriced subpar Italian food with average service. The garlic bread was hard and tasted like yesterday's bread. I got the penne with prosciutto and didn't see any prosciutto ugh MEH.COM is more like it. Never again...

Simple and straight forward. To be honest we stumbled in here after gambling and drinking for a few hours in need of carbs and water. Thankfully they delivered. The spaghetti and meatballs was excellent as well as the bread. Finished it off with cappuccino. Excellent service to top it off. Perfect mini Italiana!

decent prices for Vegas with a decent ambiance, and the food was really good! The gluten free pizza crust is a hard one to do well, but I absolutely loved it! Service was quick and impersonal, but efficient! Can't expect much more in Vegas! Would definitely recommend!

This place is fantastic. I'm so glad my friends and I stumbled upon it. We were expecting a much bigger restaurant, and were very surprised to find it was so small and intimate.  Our host and waiter were very friendly and gave us honest feedback on our dinner choices. All of the meals tasted fantastic but the swordfish I ordered was a bit dry.
Amazing service & amazing food. Definitely will come back to this place when I visit Vegas again.

This place was Highly recommended, from some out of town guest, we live here and never have gone. Mixed reviews I would say.... The tiniest place I've ever seen to dine semi fancy.... More workers then tables so FABulous service!!! I had lobster ravioli it was ok, I never tasted any lobster just a lobster flavor stuffing type filling. My mom had eggplant parmesan, she said hers is better and other party member had chicken parmesan I tasted his, just so so. The sauce to me tasted a little like chef-boy-ordie, it's vey light in color and I like rich robust tomato sauce. However the cheese cake I give a FIVE to, it is fantastic, I say have dinner at one of the wonderful restaurants there in The Venetian and come here for desert and the coffee was fab as well!!!!

Don't be fooled by the location inside the mall, this is a legit Italian restaurant. It's a small place which gives you excellent and very friendly service. The garlic knots are some of the best I've had anywhere.  The linguini bolognese was first rate and goes perfectly with a glass of malbec.  Don't spend twice as much for lesser food at one of the mega-restaurants in a casino, go here for an excellent meal at a reasonable (for Vegas) price.

This place is a gem! We went and it was about 9:20 pm and they were supposed to have stopped serving but the hostess (who was super cute btw) took pity on us and sat us. The waiter was wonderful! He was from Modena (also ridiculously handsome) and he gave us some wonderful advice. We were going to order two pasta dishes and a soup and he told us it was a lot of food so we wouldn't over order. The mussels were amazing and the Pasta Bolognese (probably misspelled that) was divine! Also, last but definitely not least the prices were the most reasonable we've seen so far! Go here. It's well worth it!

I have been to their Summerlin location. It was a Sunday night slow and almost closing time but the manager greeted us in, the bartender Bethany was very good and service was prompt and friendly.  They decent selection of wine, I had the Veal Piccata and my wife had the shrimp scampi. Both turned out good however as a authentic Italian restaurant I was expecting in house fresh pasta as oppose to packet pasta, but again not sure its because it was almost closing time. Since this restaurant location is close to my home I am sure I will visit again.

My girlfriend and I decided to eat there before leaving sin city. Seeing 4 stars on yelp, we thought that we were gonna enjoy good Italian food.   She had the veal milanese and I had the spaghetti meatball. My question is why 4 stars ? Has anyone ever tried Italian food ??? I only give 2 star because our server was good. The food is really basic and is definitely not worth the price.   My girl said that this place should had been in the food court along with burger king.

On our trip to Vegas we planned on going to eat at this place for lunch after reading the reviews. This location would've received a 5 star of the actual service would've been good. When we arrived the gentlemen and lady in the front took us to a booth. We didn't have to wait at all. The waiter took our order and once our food arrived at our table the waiter was just standing in the front watching golf and talking. All the other waiters went to the tables a few times while our waiter did not come once to check if we needed a refill or anything. The only reason why he came back, was to give us the bill. The food was great but the service....can't say the same.

This place is pretty freakin' adorable and pretty damn good, too.  I wandered in around 6:00 one night and grabbed a table.  It's a cute little place with not many tables (probably about 10 inside, and 10 or so outside as well).  I started with the filet mignon meatballs and was very happy that I did.  Three large meatballs, tender and juicy, covered with a yummy marinara sauce.  Very good, and well worth the cost in my opinion.  I ended up ordering the gnocchi, and the host/other waiter heard my order as he walked by and actually exclaimed, "Oh!  The Gnocchi!  Yes!"  I thought it was pretty funny.  He was right, too, though.  It was a large bowl filled with gnocchi and a basil pesto sauce that tasted as good (or even a little better) than it looked.  The rolls were good, and the price was very reasonable for everything as well.  I felt like I was at a real Italian eatery, which was pretty fun too.

Seating is a bit limited but I really like how the tables are out in front of the restaurant, almost feels like you are actually sitting outside. It's an adorable, relaxing setting even in the middle of all the chaos. Good choice for a sit-down dinner after walking around the shops.  It was so hard to choose what to order. I love pasta and everything sounded good to me. Decided on the tortelloni alfredo - creamy, smooth, and very cheesy. Taste-wise, I would have enjoyed it even more if the dish contained some vegetables or chicken. But it was delicious and extremely filling.

We wanted a somewhat casual not quite fancy Italian restaurant in our hotel and this did the trick! The food was good, I had the lobster ravioli. The lobster was a tiny bit over cooked in my opinion but the ravioli itself was delicious. Bonus for playing the UCLA game (this may not be your cup of tea having a tv in an Italian place but it was perfect for us at the time). They even brought out cake for my friends birthday. Our waiter Brandon was fantastic! We raved about him to the manager, who, herself, seemed absolutely lovely. The service here was truly excellent. I would definitely return.

Absolutely one of the best dinners ever.  Food was prepared perfect. Appetizers were Calimary with marinara sauce and a Caprese Salad, stunning.  I ordered the Shrimp Linguini Marinara with crisp golden French Fries and the wife had USDA NY Steak with Vegetables.  Steak was a beautiful medium rare; vegetables were crisp clean and sautéed perfectly. On to dessert... Tiramisu, Ricotta Cheese Cake, Lemon Sorbet and Gelato... wonderful and an absolute symphony of flavor. You know all the ingrediants, foods and sauces were prepared fresh and with passion.   I would like to compliment the Chef, kitchen staff, servers and Management for outstanding food and service. I will be back with family for sure.

Soooooo delicious! Hands down one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. Ordered the Mussels and Fried Calamari for an appetizer and they were equally delicious. Mussels were cooked perfectly and the calamari was tender, crispy and seasoned well. For the entrée, we split a chicken parmigiana... perfection. The service was A1! We will visit this wonderful establishment every time we come to Vegas, for sure.

Quaint little Italian restaurant in the Venetian with good food and very good service. Had the spaghetti and beef meatballs which tasted fresh and clean. Not the most flavorful dish but certainly delicious. It's not super expensive but it is Vegas

I find it hard to believe that this restaurant received an average of 4 stars.   1) Food - the food was decent, although $18 for spaghetti and a couple of meatballs? Filet mignon meatballs? This was an average dish, but supposedly one of the 'go to' dishes.   2) Service - terrible. We never were offered additional bread, and perhaps after we didn't order wine with dinner, this caused the poor service. Our waiter never came to our table again until it was time for the bill.   3) Value- see #1, sorry. I've been to Nora's in Las Vegas before (should have gone there instead). That's awesome Italian food. This place is very overpriced for what you get.   This restaurant was a major disappointment especially considering the price. It looks nice from the outside before entering, but afterwards, it was a major disappointment.   Too bad I took my wife for an occasion dinner here.

Average food at above average prices, and below average ambiance.  It's a tiny restaurant with a few tables inside, and several more tables "outside," if you can call it that (but not even in the fancy Grand Canal area).  It really felt like I was eating a fancy dinner seated in the middle of the mall.  The service was spot-on, but that can't make up for their more fundamental shortcomings.  Next time, I'd rather eat at a restaurant with classier ambiance, like Canaletto along the Grand Canal... or at just about any Carino's or Macaroni Grill...

We went to the restaurant at the Venetian this time and it was sooooo good! The service provided by Santina was attentive and well provided. They have a great wine list, a bit pricey by the glass but good. We had the calamari for the appetizer and it was breaded lightly and tasty. We had the eggplant and chicken parmigiana both had pasta and were prepared flawlessly. I highly recommend this restaurant

Excellent food service is good. You have to get the Calamari it's the best I got the chicken parmesan it was super good. Great environment for friends and family I will come again. We came here for a company dinner much better place then usual lol.

Don't let the location of this italian eatery inside the Venetian mall-area fool you.  It may be small, and if you choose to sit "outside" you may have groups of people walking passed you as they peruse the other stores, but Trattoria Reggiano turns out some really good food.  The complimentary garlic parmesan bread are big soft pieces of pillows -- be careful, you could get full off these alone -- but even that wouldn't be so bad because they are very good.  Though I only tried two pasta dishes - the carbonara and spaghetti with meatballs - both were delicious and more than enough to where you will surely have leftovers.   The sauce alone in the spaghetti tasted homemade and had so much flavor you would think a sweet Italian grandmother was back there whipping it up -- ya never know -- coulda been.  We all know that eating out in Vegas can add up, whether you're doing buffets or restaurants, but I'm happy to say that Trattoria Reggiano's prices are so reasonable that you will have plenty of paper leftover for the casinos and cocktails.  And the owner is a very friendly and accommodating man.  Don't sleep on this place, I know I won't, and am looking forward to coming back when I find myself returning to the city of sin.

Service was great.  Friendly and fast.  Did not think it was crowded like some thought but we did come  at 5pm.  The meatballs are really good and have to agree with most here a must.  Garlic bread was also good.  So get the staples for sure. My wife had the Penne with vodka sauce and added some changes, she loved it.  I went with the pizza Quattro Stagioni.  Good but if you love super thin cracker style cruse this is not it.  A bit thicker than I like.  So it gets a 3 but for service and friendly people it's a 5.

My first impression was, "Cute cafe like Italian restaurant subtly inserted in a wall of the Venetian!"  You might just walk by this little restaurant if you don't pay attention. Among the many shops and little stores within the Venetian, Trattoria Reggiano may only catch a glimpse of your attention because of their "outdoor patio." It's more just some tables set up nicely outside. Not bad, but I think they do that just to seat more people. Inside the restaurant seats just a few parties because there are about 10 small booths more or less. Their kitchen is tiny! Their ambiance definitely catches the intended theme of an "Italian street side cafe."  It's a cute little place if you're craving some Italian food. Great garlic rolls, almost drenched in the oil and seasonings, some might complain. But I personally really liked it. We ordered the margarita pizza, and a pasta dish that I cannot recall the name of. But neither of the dishes were memorable and I really can't see myself ordering anything other than the basic spaghetti or Alfredo the next time I go there. Mainly, I'd be back for their garlic rolls. The food was okay, the service was okay (slightly rude), the ambiance quaint.  The lasting impression? "I'll be back for some good ol' spaghetti and garlic rolls. But that's about it."

Seated right away.  Seats were not cleaned.  I had to brush off food remnants from bench seats.  Ordered calamari which took FOREVER.  Not bad taste, but not great.  Wife ordered spaghetti and meatballs.  Meatballs were not too bad.  But spaghetti sauce was like it was out of a can or Ragu.  Not impressed.  I had linguine with clams.  Pasta not cooked right and the sauce lacked salt.  I had to salt it myself.    Overall:  2 stars.  Mediocre service from staff.  Very slow kitchen.  Mediocre food quality.  Contrary to other positive reviews, I would not recommend this place nor would I come here again.
This is one of the best Italian restaurants in Vegas period.   Authentic cooking and quaint service and nice prices.  We loved the great home cooked food!!!

The Margarita Pizza was one of the best I've ever had. The baked ziti was incredible. Excellent garlic knots before our meals arrived. So good that we went there 2 days in a row for dinner.Reasonable prices and great wait staff. Worth the trip.

This place is a hidden treasure. A very authentic Italian kitchen. I love the Penne alla vodka. The staff is friendly. Everything is super fresh and tasty. Rarely I find pasta al dente as they should be. I visit this gem every time I am in Vegas.

Love this place! My favorite restaurant for the past year as I am very picky about my pasta but every pasta dish here is to die for! Best waiter is Mimmo, he's wonderful and sweet and attentive. Everyone I bring loves it. And the live music is very enjoyable. Especially sitting outside just enhances the experience, beautiful restaurant and mall to shop at after!

Today they just opened. We tried the soup , meatballs, chicken melanesse and eggplant rolatini. The eggplant is a must and all the food was excellent. So glad that they are here in downtown summerlin. This will be a regular for us. Welcome to the neighborhood! Staff is wonderful  and love the interior.

VISUAL AESTHETIC: 3/5 Trattoria Reggiano is located within Downtown Summerlin, right beside the Regal Cinemas. The sign is properly displayed and easy to find, while the parking lot is also convenient and just steps away from the restaurant itself.   This can be positive or negative, depending on the party dining, but the restaurant is coddled between the theatre and an adjacent restaurant while across the way is a set of buildings. Although this is the layout of the shopping center, the wall creates a short of "block" in the space for the outdoor patio seating.   The seating arrangement outdoors and indoors is quite small, and the bar has a wall that slices through it which divides the visible advantage of space. Tables are covered with a paper and have a cup of Crayons which offers a "family friendly" aspect for those that have children.   Overall, the atmosphere is average. The dining decor is comfortable, and the level of noise is also average.  FOOD: 1/5 It was my first time dining here. The reviews drew my mom and I to this restaurant and we decided to celebrate my birthday here. We wanted to take our time ordering as we expected to eat and drink for a prolonged period.   We ordered two martinis, which were fine, and we also picked two starters, the mussels and calamari. Just a clarification, the serving sizes were HUGE; our server DID NOT mention anything at all when we were ordering so we ended up full with the two appetizers alone.  We were given garlic knots and a plate of antipasto which contained cheese, olives, and cooked peppers. This was perhaps the best part of the meal because the mussels were not fresh. They were soggy and the meat lacked any texture other than "mush". The calamari was alright, but room temperature when we received it -- Which was 40 minutes after we ordered. The sauces for both of the dishes were nothing special, though we ordered the "spicy" sauce for the calamari which had no spice whatsoever and looked like it  came out of a can.  SERVICE: 1/5 The service here was awful, which is an understatement. Upon arrival, the hostess was extremely slow and chatty with the party before us. I understand customer service and catering to patrons, but there were people in line behind us. You cannot take fifteen minutes to seat one party and hang out to talk to them at their table when others are also waiting. This was unprofessional.  After we were finally seated, we didn't get to have a waitress until we had read over the entire food, drink, and wine menu several times. When she finally did show up, she made it obvious that she did not want to spend time at our table because we watched as she catered to every table around ours from getting drinks, refilling bread, to serving the actual entrees.   And this is picky of me, but every time I have ever been ID'd on my birthday, I am typically told "Happy Birthday"? I believe this is a typical service at most restaurants, but I suppose she didn't bother to actually look at my ID when she had asked for it, glancing and handing it back to me immediately.  We had stated that this was our first time at Trattoria Reggiano's and our server made no effort to tell us about the serving size of their portions. But had the audacity to come back later to ask if we wanted entrees. When we declined, she proceeded to say that she didn't think we would since she "wanted us to see the amount of food for ourselves". I was completely appalled at that sort of answer.  OVERALL EXPERIENCE: 1/5 I have dined at other restaurants within Downtown Summerlin and this has to be one of the worst experiences I have had. The food was mediocre, the service was less than sub par, and this place really doesn't deserve the raving reviews that are going around online. I am completely disappointed and will not be returning to such an unprofessional restaurant.

Simple but eloquent dinning in an open area of the hotel.  Service was prompt professional and personal. Food was very specific in taste with a good selection of wine.  Server was helpful but not overbearing and attentive to needs.  Highly recommend.

I'm tired of wasting my time at sub par restaurants. The food was not very good and over priced. Ordered calamari was too salty and greasy. Then ordered the sausage pizza, when I picked up the first piece the entire contents of the pizza slid off onto the plate. The sausage slices were uneven and it just tasted bland. I would not recommend.

Let me start with admitting that I've been here more times than my check-ins : I simply forget to because as soon as I arrive, I'm immediately hugged by (and happily hug back!) Paolo, who is my fave person at the restaurant  Paolo came to our table the first time we dined at Reggiano, and since then we have always dined in his section when possible; but even if we can't he and I always find time to greet each other and catch up!! I grew up in Milano (I'm an oil brat, my Dad worked for oil companies ) and Paolo is from northern Italy too, so we reminisce together... The FOOD: really good, honest, Italian food. Pasta cooked properly, al dente and not drowning in too much, overwhelming sauce. My fave is the Carbonara, but I've had excellent Spaghetti alle Vongole and other pastas.  As a starter, I'm very very partial to the Calamari: perfectly crispy, with a good ratio of rings to legs, and the lemon halves covered with an elasticated 'cheesecloth' so the seeds don't get on your calamari! Of course the Caprese is soooo good too, lovely tomatoes and creamy, luscious Burrata that melts in the mouth... mmmm, I can almost taste it !  Reggiano also has my fave cocktail and liquor, too : Negroni and Limoncello respectively. Without further ado, I wish you Buon Appetito
I had the filet mignon giambotto and it was amazing, so tender it almost melted in the mouth.  The garlic bread you get as a starter was also great.
One of my favorite Italians restaurants in LV. Pretty much everything he is great. You can go wrong here.

I visited here recently and wow, so yummy! I was on a trip and went on a double date after reading the good reviews and choosing it after looking at several Italian restaurants in Vegas. For those who say it is hard to find, we did not have a problem at all. If anyone does, just ask a staff member! I give it 4 stars because we are all recent college grads and it was definitely pricier for us. We knew that walking in, but if you're used to Italian as Buca Di Beppo, Olive Garden, and even Dominos (lol), then you'll want to save this restaurant for your classy dinner. I also could be inaccurate with my rating considering we haven't tried any other "nicer" Italian restaurants in Vegas. For our meal, we had the filet migon meatballs as an appetizer, chicken parm, penne bolognese, and tortellini Alfredo. Those garlic knots were also incredibly! Large portion and enjoyed some leftovers. Overall, very satisfied!

Had a late lunch today (a repeat visit from over 2 years ago).  Just as good as I remembered!  Reminded us of a of a local Trattoria in Rome, Italy that we visited in May 2013.  Great staff.  Thanks Amanda for all your help!

This restaurant is literally a diamond in the rough.  Last year, we stopped here when we were craving pizza. We were blown away with what we ordered and this year we swore we would go back. Upon arriving in Vegas, this was literally the first place we went after checking in at the hotel.   We ordered a Margherita pizza to share, a glass of wine each, and also munched on the complimentary bread (with olive oil and balsamic vinegar). We were worried that our memories of the meal last year were clouded with time and we were building it up, only to be let down. No, no we weren't disappointed. Oh. My. Goodness. The pizza was a beautiful medley of cheese and sauce with the buffalo mozza standing out SO MUCH. We were so happy it was exactly what we were hoping for.  This small little restaurant is worth going out of your way for if you're looking for Italian or pizza. We will be coming back!

Somewhere in the maze and warrens that is the combined Venice and Palazzo hotels just off the food court is Trattoria Reggiano. They are known for their filet mignon meatballs but their other dishes are also very good. You can order spaghetti and meatballs for your entrée but you are better off ordering the meatballs as an appetizer and get the lobster ravioli or other dishes for your main course. Make reservations, loud and friendly like an Italian family gathering.

This place was really expensive...but I think the food and service were worth it.  It's a very quaint little place, with a small "inside" and a few more tables just outside to give it that feeling of a little street-side Italian restaurant. Said tables are technically out in the shopping area, but it didn't feel like it.  Our server was great. He was actually honest about recommendations and would say something wasn't as good if we asked. He was attentive and friendly.  I went for a classic four-cheese pizza, which was enough for me and really could be shared between two people, which would help save you some dough. It was really tasty all around-good sauce, good crust, good cheese.  If you're around the Venetian and are looking for middle scale Italian restaurant, this is pretty solid choice.

Oh my...their bread was amazing though oily. But they were so soft and warm I couldn't stop eating them. When the main courses came out, I was almost full. I ordered a pasta dish with chicken and mushroom. The sauce was so good. The chicken was tender. My boyfriend had the beef spagetti. Both dishes had no fault. It is a small restaurant but very Italian like with the design and location. I loved coming here to spend the night having dinner here.

This has become my go-to dinner spot for every trip to Vegas when we actually have time for something more substantial than room service chicken strips or Earl's Sandwiches.  If you are always tight on time like we are in Vegas, order it to-go! Make sure you call about 30 minutes before you actually want to pick it up though as it does get busy here at dinner time as it's not a fast food joint. I'd love to sit and dine at this quaint little place in the Venetian if I could ever find time.  Fun little extra? All the workers have pretty thick Italian accents and are extremely friendly! Although it makes ordering via the phone a little difficult at times.  Both times I have gotten the Tortellini Alfredo. Medium chewy pieces of tortellini stuffed with delicious cheese in an extremely buttery cream sauce. The portion for this is a bit deceiving visually when you first get it, it seems small, but it will definitely fill you up! Plus, the free garlic knots that come with it are delicious and are a wonderful vehicle for you to scoop up any remaining sauce you have on your plate. YUMS  For 3 pasta entrees the total was around $55. Which for Vegas, isn't bad at all.

This is our favorite local italian restaurant! The food is always consistently delicious and the complimentary garlic knots are to die for! Ricki, our regular server is the bestest. She always makes us feel welcome with her great big smile when she sees us. I just love her! She remembers all our favs and never messes up our order.  You cannot go wrong with any of their pasta dishes. Always comes perfecty al dente and they do not skimp of the sauces. The clams and shrimp are always fresh and cooked perfectly.  Love, love this place!

Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)  1/1 Star: wall ins only. I felt lucky because when I went there was no wait but packed. Got the last table. I didn't have to wait so I was happy, but I can see people waiting.   _____  Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)  1/1 Star: normal service. Clean. Cozy. Pretty small place.  _____  Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)  2/3 Stars: thus place is really good overall! There wasn't just one thing that stuck out as a must try though.   _____  Overall Experience  4/5 Stars   _____  Last Words  Nice little place.

Came here for dinner based on yelp reviews, and was not disappointed. The service and food were both fast and excellent. The place is small but they have tables outside extending into the grand canal shoppe hallway.
What a fantastic experience, both food and service were superb!! The home made meatballs are phenomenal!! We will be back soon!!

This place was not what I expected at all after reading all the amazing reviews. I had couple of friends in town who wanted to do Italian on the strip. I yelped a place and this came up and seemed perfect. First, it took us forever to find the place A pretty well hidden. Then, the place was in reality small, lots of light, and there wasn't anything special about it. We didn't really care - we were there for a good Italian meal and to catch up.  Five stars for service - the service was actually good and everyone was nice and courteous at all times. Five stars For the tiramisu as well. Even though I am not a tiramisu person at all but that was the table's choice I loved it. It comes in a glass and the tiramisu part is really only on the bottom - there's something like a vanilla pudding/creme brûlée filling that was very tasty.  However, the food was ok. Just ok. Absolutely nothing special. We got couple of pizzas that were ok and my husband got the ny strip special ($60 meal) and described it as "the worse steak" he recently ate. For that kind of money you can get a real steak at a good steakhouse and go home happy. I did not completely hate the place but I will definitely not return.

Found this Italian restaurant on Yelp and decided to give it a try.  WOW!!  Authentic and so good.  It's a small place so either get there early or call ahead to check if its busy.  We were lucky and they had a table for 2 available when we got there at 6:30 but it was already pretty busy.  The waitstaff here is excellent and you can tell they are real Italians.  The food is fresh made and seems authentic.  Wine list was decent and we were able to find a nice bottle of red with dinner.  I tried the Chicken Parmigiana and it was quite good.  Portions were pretty good size as well.    I definitely recommend them if you are looking for an Italian place on the strip.
Really good food!!!  Gf pizza was awesome.  Crust was crisp and sauce excellent.  Chicken parmigiana was super good.  Caesar salad was amazing.  We'll be back here for sure
Sooooo delicious can't even describe in words! Great service and best garlic bread ever!!

Love this place!  The food rocks!  The establishment itself is small and it's in a casual area of the Canal Shoppes.  But the Spaghetti Aglio e Olio for a vegetarian really rocks!  There are a number of other vegetarian options.  I believe my wife has ordered the Tortelloni Alfredo and that's really good.    Last time we were there we were with friends.  We ordered a bottle of cabernet sauvignon for the table.  I won't say any names, but our female friend poured her Pepsi into her cabernet sauvignon.  First off, I'm not sure why she ordered Pepsi.  Secondly, I'm not sure why she mixed the two but the pre-party might have had something to do with it.  Lastly, I had to try it out and it wasn't as bad as one might think.  Although, I still won't recommend that!  Order a bottle of wine and keep the Pepsi on the shelves!

Just no. I don't understand how their ratings can be so high. Walking in for a late dinner we were sat immediately. The waiter took our drink order,food order and tossed them at the table like we were unwanted there or he was having a bad day. I ordered a shrimp scampi and when it arrived it did not looked the way I thought it would. They should change the name to stuff shrimps instead. It seriously taste like something from Olive Garden or Red Lobsters. Overpriced,horrible service and mediocre food. I just don't get it.

My partner and I love this restaurant for amazing Italian cuisine. Although it is a no-frills dining atmosphere, the authentic Italian food they serve is the best in Vegas. The prices are more reasonable than any other restaurant of the same caliber. The servings of pasta are always cooked perfectly al dente. In particular, we have ordered the Chicken Parmigiana and Chicken Francese on many occasions. The quality of food is consistent and never disappoints. The Chicken Parmigiana served here is as good as that served in Martarano's, a more upscale/pricey choice which also tops our list of great local Italian restaurants. Are you going? Prepare yourself for an absolutely delicious Italian meal.

Located inside the Venetian, where the shops are, around the corner from Barney's tucked in a little corner is a cute little Italian Restaurant called Trattoria Reggiano.  The tables decor consists of Balsamic Vinegar and Olive Oil.  This restaurant seats maybe 25 people tops with table in the restaurant tightly packed in and a few tables set up outside the restaurant in the mall area for you people watchers.  Yes, of course I'm a people watcher and who wouldn't want to be while your in Las Vegas.  I decided on the spaghetti and meatballs but as our server took his sweet time bringing us our waters, I had changed my mind and now it was set on a pizza.  They brought us bread which was really very good bread.  We made a dipping sauce with olive oil and balsamic vinegar which was on the table.  Holy Cow, that balsamic vinegar was delicious!  Our server said that the balsamic vinegar was brought in especially for this restaurant.  Very nice.  So, the table next to us ordered the spaghetti and meatballs.  It looked and smelled fabulous.  I was pissed I didn't order it.  I know they ordered it to rub it in my face a little, just kidding.  Seriously it looked awesome.  As I sat there being mad at myself for changing my order last minute, here came our server with our food: Marghertia Pizza, Pizza with Pepperoni and Mushrooms, and the Tortellini Alfredo.  One word = Delicious.    The food was really good!  I highly recommend this place.  Our server was from, Siciliy and was extremely authentic.  If you are shopping at the Venetian and your stomach starts to growl, check this place out.  One thing I did pick up on while I was in Las Vegas.... the Italian food is absolutely amazing.  I will definitely return to this restaurant on my next vacation to Las Vegas!  Cheers and Enjoy!

This place is amazing! The food was delicious! I've had the chicken parm, baked ziti, fettuccine Alfredo, lasagna, and spaghetti. So good! Cannoli was so creamy and crunchy, yum! Vodka-tonic was nice and stiff, just the way I like it, lol! Service was great with a short haired blonde lady. In the end, thoroughly enjoyed and will be back again.

Came here on a weekday night during our stay in Vegas, didn't need a reservation for a group of four which was nice. It's a small, intimate style restaurant. Really good for dates or for a quiet dinner with a small group. They offer a large selection of wines and a few cocktails.   Our server was really cool. At first seemed a little grumpy but loosened up during our meal. Their menu pricing is a bit on the higher end, so come prepared. Two of the members in the group got a pizza. Both of the pizzas were really good. Large portions, we had enough left over to take home. I ordered the shrimp scampi, the shrimp were crispy and stuffed with a delicious stuffing. The pasta itself was amazing. I never finish my meal, but this time I did. Every. Last. Bite. The food tastes especially good with some crushed red pepper.   Overall, a good place in the Palazzo to have an ambient dinner.
Hubby brought me here for my birthday last yr . The food was delicious and has a nice view of gondolas . We each had a pasta it was tasty .
The food here is ridiculously tasty. Prices aren't bad for what you get ! Tried the baked ziti and pizza. Can't wait to come back for some calamari

Garlic Knots to start were great, and i had high hopes. I ordered chicken milanese and it was completely overcooked and dry. The server didn't apologize and gave me a look as if I should have eaten it. I ordered eggplant parm instead and it was okay. We probably won't be back. They definitely need a new chef!

Came here yesterday for a nice lunch date with my love, it was good. We sat outside on the patio and being the oven that we are it was surprisingly cool. They have fans and air conditioning I believe ( I felt cold air coming no out of the vents) Any-who. We brought our dog with us and was also surprised that they are dog friendly although the hostess/waitress didn't offer water for her. My SO ordered the pizza margarita and I the meatball sub with fries. The pizza was okay could've been cooked longer at the bottom and the crust was a bit chewy for our liking as well but the rest was like I said okay. The meatball sub however was on point . Crusty bread, tender meatballs in a well seasoned sauce, delicious melty cheese and the crispest fries I've had in a long time. The waitress was very nice. I highly recommend.

Yes it took some laps in order to find this place :)   Placed an order to go. Angie at the bar was amazing! Super friendly, upbeat, and full of menu knowledge and recommendations.   There are six cozy (small) 4-person booths. Then table seating inside and "outside" (out Front does look like outside).   There was Latin dancing music on, which I found amusing. Not too loud tho so didn't really notice. There is a TV showing sports over the bar.  Chicken parm was pretty big. And Angie said it was smaller than the spaghetti and meatballs :o  Packed nicely, with cutlery, napkin, and rolls. Took under 5 min and I was served an ice water while waiting.   #winning
The hosts and waiters were all very nice. I got their Spaghetti Aglio e Olio with a side of Angus Beef filet mignon meatballs - very good...

Wow! A little behind on reviewing this restaurant but I still wanted to leave a review--that's how impressed I was. I really want to thank our waiter for being INCREDIBLY sweet and kind. He checked up on us and was just the nicest waiter I've ever met. I only wish I got his name so I could mention him!  My first impression of the restaurant was that it was a little different. We sat "outside" which was next to where people walked and we couldn't really experience the interior design of the restaurant--but it was still nice.   We started with the infamous filet mignon meatballs which were perfect for two girls who starved themselves before dinner. The meatballs melted in your mouth and the leftover sauce made for great dipping sauce for the amazing garlic rolls (ask for seconds!!). We got two pastas each: a lobster ravioli and another pasta I can't remember the name to. The second pasta was actually one with NO sauce and being really picky eaters, my cousin and I were thankful for the "no sauce". Things can get a little heavy when you have ravioli and meatballs (plus drinks!).  100% would come again just for the meatballs!

I guess maybe it was an off night but this place was Not Good The service was terrible and we were almost the only customers there The server gave us a strange look for asking for more water The salad was drowning in sauce and it was too vinegary The garlic knots tasted funny and we were not offered more so Unlimited was not mentioned The veal was huge that was actually the best part but the Bolognese sauce was bland and unexciting They for got to bring my wine and came back twice without it then overheard us talking about it almost at the end of the meal and then asked if I wanted wine By then I was over this entire meal Sorry would not do this again I wish we would have went to OTTO's but it was packed The only good thing about this place was that we go in quickly Was probably a sign to not eat there Lesson learned

My family & I kind of just stumbled across this gem in the Venetian Hotel.  Unfortunately, half their seating sits right out in the pathway of walkers through the shopping area.  But the food atop of the diner's plates was too alluring.  We sat inside (which is pretty cramped).  Our waiter was pleasant and attentive.  He brought us their complimentary Garlic Knots.  While on the greasy side, they were awesome!  As an appetizer, my family and I ordered the Fried Calamari.  This could have been a meal for one.  Luckily we shared it.  Unfortunatley, it was a bit too fried.  The sauce that accompanied the Calamari was good, but I wouldn't have minded had it been spicier.  We ordered two personal pizzas to share.  Although the pizzas are thin, they are large in diameter and declicious.  We ordered a Margarita pizza and a Prosciutto pizza.  While the Margarita was good, the Prosciutto pizza was excellent.   Overall, our experience was very good.  The food was plentiful and very tasty.  The staff was cordial.  Endulge on the Garlic Knots and pizzas.
Have been wanting to eat here for years! Glad I finally did. Filet Mignon meatballs, lobster ravioli, seafood linguine....everything was delicious! And the service was great!

I have now been here twice in the past week...so kind of speaks to my feelings..  Great food...good service...and the vibe and energy are awesome.  I can sit outside in the warmth of the evening, enjoy great food...great music...and enjoy the end of the day.  I will continue to come back...

Thanks to yelp I decided to bring my family here after seeing Phantom.  It's a small, homey, simple place that you wouldn't expect to find inside the Venetian.  The staff was all Italian and so friendly.  The food was amazing!  You must try the meatballs.  They were so good we ended up getting 2 orders.  We all loved everything we ordered: baked ziti, penne puttanesca, pizza, and spaghetti aglio & olio.  We were too full for dessert and our bill came out to about $90.  We were all pleasantly satisfied and saying how we would definitely come back next time we're in Vegas.
average, I would have given it a 3 1/2 stars.  decent food, but nothing special.  May give it another try bc I have heard good things about it.

This is my father's favorite restaurant, so of course we had to come for father's day dinner!   My family and I prefer this location compared to the Venetian Canal Shop's location.   Hilda was our server and she was a pleasure to order from!   I have ordered the white wine linguine in the past and the penne al a vodka this time around. I will say I preferred the linguine and I can't wait to order it again in the future. Granted, both dishes were DELICIOUS. The one draw back is I love angel hair pasta and it is not an option on the menu nor as a pasta substitute.  I also ordered the Morning Spritz cocktail which is an Italian staple. Trattoria always prepares it just right, with it being the perfect bitter to sweet ratio... not to mention how refreshing it is! The best summer cocktail in my opinion, so good that I wish it came in a bigger glass!   For desert I ordered the carrot cake which had beautiful layers of cream cheese frosting. It was a lovely end to my meal and I saved half of it for later!!

This is the absolute best restaurant!  The food is outstanding, the service is amazing and they have the best bartender ever - Bethany!  Truly every dish I've ever had was out of this world!  The meatballs - you'll never want them from anywhere else.  The Italian Kale Salad - you'll be craving it for days.  The cheesecake and carrot cake - wear pants with elastic waistbands because you'll be licking the plate clean.  This restaurant is a must when friends/family come to visit.  Come, enjoy!!

Went to dinner here last night with a group of 5. This place is set up as high end Italian restaurant, the spaghetti and meatballs are $22. With this said, we had to ask multiple times for glasses of water and were told the long wait was due to not having enough glasses cleaned. Two of the five dinners were wrong and instead of redoing them they simply brought new incorrect sauce on the side. The bread was cold by the time we received it and half of it burnt. The live music was great but management has some work to do with service and good quality especially with the prices being so high.

Absolutely, delicious. It is tucked away in a nook in the Venetian so you definitely have to ask or be on the look-out for it. The portions are large so unless you are a huge eater, you may want to share 1 entree with another person. The price is reasonable and definitely cheaper than any other Italian restaurant in the Venetian or Bellagio. The only thing that prevented this place from being 5 stars is the calamari was mediocre and service is a little slow since there is 1 server running around managing 7+ two tops. Otherwise, we'll definitely be back in the future.

Recently visited here on a date night. Restaurant was very busy and service was quite good. We had an appetizer of calamari, pizza di Parma and I had the Veal Francese with pasta. The calamari was pretty good, pizza was good and the veal was just meh. There was an odd taste to the sauce on the veal and the veal wasn't as tender as I'm used to. The real reason for the low review is based on the price. If you're going to charge nearly $40 for a plate of pasta then the dish had better be spectacular. Our meal was $75 for two entrees and an appetizer (we drank water) and the food was anything but special. I can't see coming back with those prices to try anything else.

We wanted a nice Italian meal so we set out for this restaurant at the Venitian. First of all, our waitress Hilda was so sweet and helpful. We had people in our party that spoke a mix of languages and so did she! After helping me decide what to get, I was glad I took her advice. You really can't go wrong with chicken parmesan! Everyone else was very happy with the food and amazed by the service. We met the manager Dora who also spoke many languages and was very welcoming. It was a really wonderful experience and I would recommend it to anyone!

Okay, I know it says I'm at the Venetian but I'm actually at their new location in downtown Summerlin. Everything was great or exceptionally good. From the compt garlic knots and olive tray. To the eggplant parmesan and the chicken parmesan. The carrot cake was perfect and moist not to mention huge. This is my new favorite Italian restaurant. Robert was very knowledgeable on all of the menu items.

Service was just ok. Waiter Zeki was good but the wait for food is long!  I got chicken parmigiano,  which was so-so.  Spaghetti side was ok but not special.  I thought it was pricey at $26.  Hubs ordered penne Primavera which was also just ok.  There are way too many good Italian places in Vegas (Italian American Club, Casa di Amore,  Mastrioni) for us to go back here again!   Very busy place,  crowded and our table seemed in the way of the servers,  although we had reservations.  I wanted to like this place but I'm afraid not!
great food we enjoyed our meal greatly. the atmosphere is very loud out on the patio. reasonable price for vegas.

Looking at some photos of food from a year ago on here, the food is nothing like that anymore. The garlic knots are pasty and undercooked, the pizza soggy, the meatballs under mixed and the spaghetti sauce way watered down, on both the pizza and spaghetti and meatballs. Very disappointing! If an Italian restaurant can't make a well-mixed juicy meatball and serve it in a fragrant thick and tasty sauce, then it fails as an Italian restaurant in my view...

We ate on the patio on late Sunday afternoon.  It took quite a while for the waiter to come to our table.  The drinks came fast.  The garlic knots were just ok and took forever.  They were dripping with butter.  I like butter, but it was too much for me. The food showed up 30 seconds after the bread finally showed up. We had spaghetti with meatballs which was good but overpriced and a chicken dish, which was good.   The server never checked back and took forever to get the bill much less offer dessert.

Actually called this place by accident, was trying to get the other Italian place in town. Anyway called to order a pizza with salami on it, they said no LOL, what kind of Italian restaurant will not put salami on a pizza?  FAKE ITALIANS THATS WHO.  Definitely not ever going to eat there
Great staff. Nice quaint environment. Delicious salad and margarita pizza. This is our usual stop when at the convention.

Just strolled in here randomly looking for something to eat before watching a movie at Regal next door. First impression was that the restaurant itself is really beautiful. Open kitchen and bunch of open doors leading inside from the patio seating.  Minno was our server and he was super italian and very friendly. I mean like super Mario level italian. Like thats a spicy meat a ball level italian.   My mother and I had the Calamari, caesar salad, and the Margerita with proscuitto pizza (cant remember exact name).  The complimentary garlic bread was delicious with the olive oil and balsamic vinegar.  The calamari was honestly the best I think Ive ever had. Definitely using really fresh squid. Batter was light and crispy and most importantly the meat was still perfectly cooked and tender and the Marinara dipping sauce was amazing. I literally cleaned the whole plate.  Caesar salad was really good too, they are using high quality ingredients here and it makes a world of difference. Beware of the anchovy garnish though because it was intensely salty, do not eat in one bite like I did.  The pizza was honestly the most unimpressive part, I dont know if it was because I was so damn full already which definitely affects how tasty something is, but I just wasnt blown away. Still not bad by any means. Granted I did eat two garlic knots, half a caesar salad, and 75% of the calamari before even tasting the pizza though..  I want to try the pasta dishes next time because they look amazing, and this place is definitely on the more authentic side so Im sure they taste legit too.  If youre at this mall, eat here.
The food was really good. Just a small restaurant, so don't come with a party over six people.

The olives, reggiano cheese and peppers along with garlic bread knots with $$ balsamic vinegar & Olive oil were a great segway to my Chiken Parmesan which was excellent, and no one person could finish, I tried!  My friend along with other customers bragged about the meatballs made with steak. My girlfriend raved about the lobster ravioli in a cream sauce with chunks of lobster. Anytime I want a delicious Italian cuisine, this is the spot!

My girlfriend and I spent a weekend in vegas with our family and decided to have a date night out on the strip. After a show at the Palazzo, we decided to have a nice dinner afterwards at the Venetian. After bumbling through the over priced and busy restaurants, we came across this little trattoria. The menu options and prices upon first glance were exactly what we were looking for. We were seated promptly and our server Paolo was wonderful. He was so sweet and made the effort to get my girlfriend an extra napkin as she was wearing a white dress and he didn't want it to get stained. Our table had a paper covering and some crayons, so we colored and it was a very fun and cute way to wait in between our food. We were started off with the most amazing garlic knots I have ever had, did I mention they were complimentary?! I ordered the spaghetti bolognese and my girlfriend got the margherita pizza. The portions were on the larger size, even for the low price. The filet mignon used in the bolognese made all the difference and was the most remarkable pasta I had ever had. The pizza was a personal size, but again a little bigger as I had to end up helping my girlfriend eat some, and we were still left with some slices to take home! The fresh cheese and beautiful, bright tomatoes were fantastic on the pizza. For dessert we had the cannoli and some coffee. Both were equally as delicious and satisfying, and were a wonderful way to wrap up our meal. I look forward for my next visit to vegas, so that I can enjoy this wonderful trattoria once again!

Compared to other restaurants on the strip, it offered a decent value for a quality meal.  The bread is excellent--better than most free breads I've had at Italian joints, and they provide it in copious quantities at exactly the right price of zero.  The atmosphere is a little mall/foodcourty (then again, so is all of Vegas), but the food is definitely well above that caliber.  The meatballs are made out of filet mignon, so expect some high end protein in your spaghetti.  They also make legit carbonara--no canned cream sauce.  It's a hair off four stars; it would make the cut if the ambiance was a little nicer.  I would eat here again if I ever make it back to Vegas, but I hope to avoid that.
Excellent !! Best pasta Faggioli I've had in a restaurant and the pasta was actually Al Dante and I didn't have to ask.. I had the linguini Bolognese. Very good sauce .
Super amazing food! The gnocchi to the eggplant and pizza even... everything was spot on! The gnocchi especially was my favorite. The pesto sauce was smooth and rich with flavor.

Not divine and bread seemed like day old. Not for foodies and like being in the food court -only a bit away from it. Sat in hallway, next to magic shop where fortune telling machine kept bellowing for someone to notice it.

Our server Zeki was GREAT! We shared the eggplant, caprese and filet mignon meatball appetizers for our meal. It was not only delicious but also filling and we had enough leftovers to take home for another meal.   The outdoorsy atmosphere was beautiful, but there was only ONE bathroom for the whole restaurant and it was unisex. That seemed a little crazy to me.

With all the Italian restaurants in the Venetian, this one is a definite "will not return" in my book. There are so many other, more tasty options at the same price point just steps away.   I got the spaghetti and meatballs as other yelp reviewers raved about it, but it was really just mediocre. The sauce and meatballs were altogether flavorless. The only saving grace of the meal was the garlic knots.   The atmosphere here is also just mediocre, as it's not in the main atrium area by the canal. The other Italian restaurants around the corner have both a better view and better food.

We tried their Veal. I had the veal parmagain and my wife had the veal scaloppini. Both were outstanding!  Meatball appetizer was delicious. The desserts were to die for.  Service was excellent! We will be back!

The service was great. Great atmosphere. I am a big fan for Italian for. My boyfriend took me here for my birthday. Romantic and was very nice. Food was really god. Reasonably priced I think. Cause it was my birthday I got a free cannoli which was amazing.

Barely average. My linguine in clam sauce was incredibly salty, and the lasagna was nothing special. Portions were small as well. Garlic knots were bland, but cheese on them was good. Overall, not worth the price.
huge fan of their food ,their taste is more authentic and less cheesy ...... i eat there everytime i go to vegas !!!! .......

Great all-around Italian Ristorante tucked inside The Venetian. It's a little hard to find, but it's well worth it. It's also not very big, but they managed our 12 person party with ease. Service throughout was very friendly and attentive. Dinner started out with some complimentary buttery garlic rolls... delicious. Everything on the menu seems competitively priced and very affordable; which for Vegas is a plus. If I had to compare, I'd say it's most similar to an Olive Garden or Maggiano's, which is hardly a knock. I went with the vodka penne with grilled chicken breast. The dish with solid, noodles were al dente, and chicken was seasoned and cooked to perfection. We tried a few different desserts, every one of which was freaking delicious. The ricotta cheesecake was ridiculous, and a must for diners with room left. Every person in our party had a great time thanks to the well prepared food and hospitable staff. I definitely recommend them if you're not looking to blow $100 a plate, and still have some great food.... with almost guaranteed leftovers!

Us: "Cheers! Yay for yummy food, wine, and good times!" (as we scarf down our amazing food) Waiter: "You're done with your plate, right? Grazie." (as we're still picking at our plates) Us:  "Uhhh, sure..." (as the waiter takes our food away) Manager: (stares at us and hovers over our table every 3 minutes) Us: (stare back at him while we're trying to have a good time) Us: (finish our wine and conversation, and get up to leave the table) Manager: "Oh, grazie, grazie! Come again, come again." (as he sweeps off our table and gets ready to seat another group) Us: "WTF was that?!" (as our faces contort out of confusion and frustration)  Everything started off really well with the super-cute "it's like i'm in an Italian family's kitchen" setting, the waiter's charming accent, and the aroma of garlic and bread. Food was yummy, that's for sure. BUT service started to decline during the middle of our meals when the staff started playing a game of clean-up.  It was amusing, but irritating at the same time. I totally understand the restaurant business and the need to turn over tables to seat new people, but don't push the damn people out, sheesh!  I will likely not be back to this place. Bummer.

After reading several glowing reviews on Yelp, and viewing several tantalizing photos of a wide selection of classic Italian dishes, I had wanted to sample the offerings of this small restaurant along the Grand Canal Shoppes for awhile, but more than once had found it to be completely filled with diners.  At last, after attending a law conference nearby, after about a 15-minute wait Diane and I were ushered to a table for two looking onto a cavalcade of passersby.  Here we took our time sharing a late-night dinner.  We began with very garlicky large Garlic Rolls and a not too cheesy, not too saucy, and fairly thin Salsiccia Pizza, followed by a tasty bowl of Pasta e Fagioli Soup with big Cannelloni Beans.  Then, while Diane enjoyed Tortelloni Alfredo, I savored very good medallions of Veal Marsala along with first-rate Fettuccine Alfredo topped by fresh Parmigiana Cheese.  In a city filled with innumerable fine Italian restaurants, among them Trattoria Reggiano definitely holds its own.

Dinner was excellent. I was looking for good authentic ilalian food. I was not disappointed in the slightest. My only problem was the table was too small to hold all that goodness. Everytime something new came we had to shuffle the the plates and glasses. This is now one of my favorite restaurants. I will be back again soon.
Absolutely amazing food. Felt like we were sitting in a small restaurant in Italy. Highly recommended for everyone. Service was great.

To be fair, my wife and I were not expecting the highest level of food and service when we reserved a table for dinner at Trattoria Reggiano.  We had already eaten a couple of the celebrity chef venues in the Venetian / Palazzo complex over the prior few days.  Rather, we were just looking for tasty food and good service at a presumed slightly lower price point.  Our waitress was also working behind the service bar, was very pleasant but either not trained or focused on the task at hand.  We were seated at a booth with settings for four.  The extra settings were never removed, (we finally stacked them to the side) we asked to split a salad and ordered two pasta dishes as our main courses.  After a short wait, the salad came with no plates for splitting with the main courses arriving  within a minute after.  I asked that they take the pasta dishes back until we completed our salads, but immediately realized that the dishes would just sit in the back until we asked for them, so we hurried through our salads and flagged down a server to have them returned a few minutes later.  (The table was never cleared of salad plates until the end of our meal)  We ordered a bottle of wine with our dinner, (reasonably priced compared to some of the other venues in this complex) but other than the initial pour, it was self service after, which I'm fine with,  just unusual to not have a waiter or waitress offer to pour more when the glasses are sitting empty even in a restaurant of this level.  The food was OK, safe, unimaginative.  My wife's Lasagna was somewhat dry, (even a little Marinara poured over the top would have shown effort) and the best description that I could come up with for my dish was Hamburger Helper on steroids.  It was (Supposedly Tenderloin) ground beef mixed with marinara sauce over pasta.  The sauce was flavorless, one step above tomato sauce out of the can with a few dry spices added to it..    All that including the wine and tip (yes, I still tipped the waitress 20% since she was pleasant and I truly felt she was just poorly trained) was $130.00 for the two of us.  The manager came by at he end of our meal and asked how our meal was.  I told him very nicely that it was disappointing and overall not what we expected.   He started to offer to get us another dish, but honestly, we had discounted that option earlier since we didn't really see much hope that the food or service would change with a different dish.  I politely declined and he mumbled a thank you for joining us as he walked away.  I'm by no description a food snob.  I've been served much worse, and obviously for many their food is very satisfying.  I personally would chose a dinner at Carrabba's any day over this restaurant in the future if I had the option.....hands down.

I had the mushroom ravioli and it was simply divine.  Great place to grab a hearty lunch before taking the shops by storm!  The manager or owner (middle-aged Italian[?] gentleman) ensured we had remarkable service.  We will be back!

Very disappointed in my meal. The calamari was breaded to the point one could not taste the calamari  The scampi and linguine was dripping in oil. I felt I needed an oil change after eating it. I love Italian food. Unfortunately, this was not the place to get it. At least the meal I ordered. Service was OK

Oh MY God. I love this place..  We decided to duck into the Venetian for some food, after wandering the strip all morning, and ended up here. We didn't want to take leftovers since we weren't headed back to the hotel room for a while so we ordered a dish to share. The Eggplant Parmigiana was delicious! The dish was the perfect size for 2 people, especially since they give you DIVINE complimentary bread to munch on while you wait for your food. Divine! Divine, I say!  The place is really small, only has 6-8 booths & tables inside and about the same number crammed into a space outside. The slight cramped-ness adds to the cozy feel though, I really liked the decor and atmosphere. The walls are lined with pictures of old-time Italian people (just like Buca di Beppo, except better because it's not like the "Illustrated Archives of Italy, c. 1800-1950" threw up on the walls like at Buca...of course the food here is 20x better as well).   The staff are really great, friendly and attentive without being overbearing. It's funny, our waitress so resembled a b&w picture of an Italian woman on the wall that we wondered if they were related. We forgot to ask though!  The cannoli was amazing. Our waitress gave us a great suggestion for wine too, and they were really nice about the fact that the mister brought in his own beer that we picked up at a bar on the strip. They even gave him a proper mug for it so he wouldn't have to keep drinking it out of a plastic cup!  Next time we are in Vegas we will definitely be back!

Should have left when we sat down to notice the silverware was dirty and bread plates not clean.  Appetizer of eggplant rotini was actually good but the rest was mediocre.  Arugula with cherry tomato salad was a generous pile of arugula but only 5 halves of under ripe cherry tomatoes.  The waiter recommended the baked ziti with meatballs.  It was swimming in cheese and didn't have much sauce.  That was probably a good thing since the sauce it did have was on the sweet side.  The meatballs with it were bland but ok.  Hubby is a chicken parm addict but he barely touched what they served him, also because the sauce was sweet.  Wine list has nothing under $40.  The wines they have are marked up four times retail.  They were out of the first two bottles we ordered.  The Meomi we buy for $17 in the store is $15/glass or $55/bottle.  Ferrari Cab was $55 too.  Over-priced for a casual spot like this.  We won't go back.

Amazing food and reasonably priced for Vegas!  You can't get better than that...  Had the linguini carbonara and it was truly the best i've ever had.  The pasta was perfectly cooked al dente.  This place is a hidden gem!
Good food, and they had a little music setup on the patio.  Nice place to people watch, although a bit hot with this Vegas weather.
We love this place!!!!! Shrimp Scampi is delicious. !!! Our waiter, Eric, is here every time we come and we love him!!!!! Everyone has to try this place.
Outstanding! Great food and service. Kid friendly as well. Reasonable prices for food and alcohol. Filet mignon meatballs are as advertised.
Food - ok Service - ok Menu - ok  So, it was ok, but for the overpriced pirice, I expect a lot more.

It was a Wednesday and we took my older sister to Dave & Buster's. Their happy hour didn't start until 9 and we were hungry so we decided to look for somewhere to eat nearby. Of course we checked yelp and this place drew our attention. It looks rather small on the inside, there was a bar, and outside seating. It was a nice night so we decided to go with the outdoor tables. We got seated right away and the atmosphere was really nice. There was live music and the lady who was singing was awesome. She made the experience really fun and enjoyable. My sister and I wanted to share so we ordered the specialty salad and a pasta. The waitress brought us garlic knots to start, delicious and soft!!! Don't forget to dip it in the oil and vinegar. The salad came out right after and it was huge! Enough to feed three people. They also split the pasta into two bowls for us (how nice, we didn't even ask). The food was tasty we finished it all and it was very filling. We enjoyed this place very much.

I don't easily give out 5-star reviews but this place rocks! Great service, great food, and great ambience - you couldn't ask for anything more. Even their simple garden salad with balsamic vinegar was delicious and I don't even like salads!

Best pizza on the strip at $3.50 a slice. I love, love this place. They have a wonderful pizza that is a thicker crust (the way I like it). The atmosphere is causal, the service is good and the food is perfect! They have a wonderful bruchetta that is amazing. It is loaded with tomatoes and worth trying!

OK, so I am not one that reviews very often...I will make this short and sweet. YOU GOTTA TRY THIS PLACE! Prior to this weekend Mastrioni's on Hualapai was my #1 for Italian Cuisine. My son had the Chicken Parm and I had the Linguini Bolognese and it was fantastic! Split the Spumoni and it was most excellent! Check it out!

Eric is the best ever! He took great care of us! He even put up with our "high-maintenance" requests! If you don't go for anything else, you have to have the meatballs!!! I can't leave LV without the Filet Mignon Meatballs! Need I say more?!?

Amazing again, it's been a year since we visited Dora at the Trattoria Reggiano. They've expanded without losing the intimate home kitchen feel. Dora made a strong balanced delicious Italian Sangria for us. The spaghetti puttanesca was full of capers, slices of garlic, kalamata olives, and fresh herbs. The garlic roll rivals the best garlic bread in any restaurant, lavishly brushed with butter and garlic. The bucatini frutti di mare is full of flavorful seafood, clams, shrimp, and little calamari. Of course, the lasagna al forno and spaghetti and meatballs are savory with fresh garlicky tomato sauce that you will want to soak up with the garlic rolls. Everything is fresh and simple, great basics make this Italian eatery a primary stop in the Venetian. It's easily comparable to Buddy V's, Carnevino, Maggiano's or any of the Italian pizzerias in the area. Dora, the manager, always stops by to kindly chat and make fantastic food recommendations. At the end of the meal, save room for a caramel drizzled cannoli and espresso or cappuccino.  July 2016 - We arrived late in the night but they were happy to seat us. We had the antipasto and Sangria with complimentary garlic bread. It was a beautiful presentation. Paulo took the best care of us. We felt like familia. Grazie.

This is a great Italian restaurant located right inside the Venetian.  I definitely had to get myself to "not judge a book by its cover" with this little joint because on the outside (to me at least) it looks like a strip mall food court venue.  Once you step in however, the service and care that is given to both the patrons and foods really makes you feel loved.  The Garlic Rolls are wonderful, soft and flavorful and quite honestly you can really get filled up fast on them, so be careful!  I had the Spaghetti with Bologna, noodles were perfectly firm to the touch and the sauce was very fulfilling.    My wife had the clam linguini and they did NOT skim on the clams at all--I think that probably will get a good 5-7 more clams than you're normally used to !!  I must say however that the dessert is nothing to write home about, I was really having a sweet tooth and decided to splurge on dessert.  Bad Idea IMO, the $8 dollars could've been better spent elsewhere, the cannoli I ordered was way too rich and dense that I really need coffee to break it down.  Next time I come here, I will skip the dessert and save they money.  All in all the dessert was the only downside and it wasn't that big of an issue, just don't get it :) 4 out of 5 stars, great service, great food, great place to get lost in!!
Very nice restaurant. My lobster ravioli was awesome. Great service, they don't rush you.  Restaurant is very busy, so call before to book a table.
The best Italian food ever... We had margarita pizza, lobster ravioli and clam and linguine and loved every bite!

i quite like this place. it's like eating at a hole in the wall -- except you're at the venetian, and the prices show it. however, i like it the atmosphere, the staff, the food... it's run like a small family restaurant.  this is my favorite place to go when i'm in the area. that's not very often, though, so i have no recommendations, though.

Came in from dc and looking for good italian on the strip. Yelp came through again! Food was off the hook! Filet mignon meatballs and pesto ricotta gnocchi were top notch. Cost is about half the other places in the area. Search this place out, it's worth it!  Highly recommended.

Excellent food and wine and impeccable service. The portions are very generous and although this location is in Downtown Summerlin it is still very ambient. They are very warm and welcoming and if not for the fact it is pricy they would get 5 stars. I understand you need to cover overhead but price gauging because you're in Summerlin is tacky. If you want to splurge for a great meal or have deep pockets-GO FOR IT!!!
Best meal I've had in a long time! Great service, super fast, and amazing food! Absolutely no complaints.
This is the most incredible Italian restaurant in all of Las Vegas! The evening entertainment is fabulous (we really enjoy Mark Giovi) and the food is superb!
Had an excellent filet and lobster ravioli. Definitely the highlight. Not the greatest atmosphere compared to others but the food alone is worth it.

Wow--thank you fellow Yelpers for recommending this restaurant. I stayed at The Venetian Resort in Las Vegas this week and did a bit of research regarding their restaurants before traveling there. I then checked Yelp to see what was written about them--everyone was spot on! The Trattoria Reggiano was just what I was looking for--their eggplant parmigiana and baked ziti were wonderful. The garlic rolls that start things out are fabulous but also very filling , so go easy on them. I wish their wine selection was a bit broader though. I did enjoy a "Nero d'Avolo" (Sicilian wine) by the glass which was quite tasty--but, their selections overall were really limited.  We split a large cannoli for dessert and had a few Peroni's to wash everything down. Italian is spoken there--cool!

We arrived at Trattoria Reggiano for a group lunch and from start to finish the meal was anything but exceptional.  The restaurant was pretty empty the entire time, but despite this fact service was not as attentive as I would expect.   We ordered a number of appetizers for the table to share, including meatballs, calamari and caprese salad. I only tried the meatballs and caprese salad, neither of which  were remarkable in the least.   For my entree I decided to steer clear of the pastas and pizzas and offered the salmon with vegetables. Both the vegetables and salmon lacked flavor and I had no desire to eat everything.   The whole table seemed unimpressed with their food so I wasn't alone in my assessment. I don't see myself returning for any reason.

During a recent trip to Vegas my husband and I were looking on Yelp for an Italian restaurant that was in walking distance of our hotel. Upon seeing the reviews and pictures about Trattoria Reggiano we were both sold. I wasn't thrilled that it happened to be located in the Venetian's Grand Canal Shops. I don't like that hotel and I don't like malls. However I will endure a lot for good food. As predicted walking through the Grand Canal Shops in search of Trattoria Reggiano was beyond unpleasant. Vendors and merchants were harassing us and when we paused to consult the directory/map an employee dressed like a Carabinieri offered to show us where the restaurant was. He walked us back towards the direction we had come from and pointed to the WRONG restaurant. Major fail. We ended up walking in a giant circle before Trattoria Reggiano nestled off in a side enclave near a Coffee Bean and the Houdini Shop.   The waitors here are all older Italian gentlemen. They notice customers  and announce how long the wait will be. There is no hostess or sign up sheet. We were told it would be a few minutes as a couple tables paid and got bussed and exactly a few minutes later we were shown to our table. The inside area seats about 20 and there are small tables outside too that probably seat another 20. It's very small compared to the Cucina across the way that was EMPTY!

Decided on Trattoria Reggiano for dinner last night based on the Yelp reviews and my fiance and I absolutely loved it! The waiters were incredibly sweet older Italian gents who were all attentive and friendly. We ordered the special (last night it was handmade cheese ravioli topped with buffalo milk mozzarella) and the gnocchi al pesto. Both dishes were flavorful and the fresh pasta for both dishes was amazing. The gnocchi was up there with the best I've ever had, the texture was creamy and a little chewy (exactly how gnocchi should be!). The pesto was creamy but not too rich. The meal also started out with garlic knots, mmm! We ended with a piece of the seven layer chocolate cake. I rarely get dessert but this cake was pretty good. A little too rich for my taste (ended up having to take half of it with us) but it was still very decadent and moist.   A+ food and A+ service. I loved this adorable little restaurant and will be back the next time I come to Vegas!

My boyfriend picked this place out for our last Vegas dinner before flying home. It's a tiny restaurant in the Venetian. I absolutely loved it.  First--the garlic olive oil bread they give you is absolutely amazing. Just amazing.  Second- The portions are HUGE!! I  Third - I loved the service.  My boyfriend and I decided to split the Linguine Bolognese for $18 and Salsiccia Pizza for $15.   The Linguine Bolognese was great. You can taste the quality of the beef and the sauce was great.  The pizza was amazing too, I ate that thing up so damn fast! Complete fatty status.  We nearly ordered an appetizer as well but thank goodness we didn't because we wouldn't have finished our entrees!   We also ordered 2 glasses of their red wine. They really fill those glasses up! It was much appreciated!  NOM NOM NOM I'm so happy my boyfriend picked this place. It's such a cute place for a dinner date without having to get all fancy. Love it!

This restaurants was overall "alright."   I can't really put my finger on the ambiance. It's like they're trying to be a fancy Italian restaurant with white table cloths. But then the Dean Martin and Michael Buble blaring from the speakers, along with the sound of pounding coming from the kitchen (meat tenderizing? I'm not sure but it was really loud) really threw it off.   I started with a glass of wine - they don't tell you what brand the wines by the glass are, but the cabernet sauvignon I ordered tasted an awful lot like two-buck chuck.   The garlic knots were good. We ordered the filet mignon meatballs to start, but they really weren't anything special. There was nothing interesting about their texture or the way they tasted. The sauce was flat in taste and more watery / homogenous than I would have liked. I ordered the linguine carbonara, which was fine, but was a little soggier / less al dente than I would have liked. My date had the chicken parmegiana, which was also a bit on the "soggy" side.   Vegas is sorely lacking in pasta places and this satisfied my craving for pasta (brought on by Olive Garden commercials on repeat on Hulu.. and I flat out refuse to go to Olive Garden)... but it won't be somewhere I make a special trip for.

Nettes Restaurant inmitten des Shoppingbereichs des Venetian. Hier werden sowohl verschiedene Pastas wie auch Pizzas serviert zusammen mit einer überraschend grossen Weinkarte die es - für Las Vegas Verhältnisse - zu vernünftigen Preisen gibt. Zu den Vorspeisen werden leckere Parmesan Rolls serviert die die Wartezeit auf den Hauptgang verkürzen. Als Main Course gab es Tagliatelle an einer Rahmsauce die gut war, aber nicht mehr. Als Nachtisch wurde hausgemachtes Tiramisu im Glas serviert welches fünf Sterne verdient hätte. Alles in allem ein gutes Esserlebnis zu vernünftigem Preis.
Not so good!! Ho hum taste, forgettable foods!! There was absolutely nothing memorable of this place!!! Tried it and it failed big time!!

Trattoria Reggiano is a must-go whenever I'm in vegas. I've been there a bunch of times, and it has never disappointed me. I think you can tell a lot about the skills of a chef by the taste of their most basic dish, and the spaghetti and the meatballs are out of this world, which tells me they know what they're doing! i've also tried the caprese which was amazing, the carbonara (to die for!), the aglio e olio YUM, and their veal milanese, which they graciously topped with a ton of prosciutto when we asked.   i'm the type of person who tries not to go to the same restaurant twice, but this place i will be visiting EVERY SINGLE TIME i'm in vegas.

Delicious Italian food at a reasonable price. Our waiter was a little sarcastic, but his so-so attitude was made up for by the quality of the food. Recommended for casual, affordable (relatively speaking) Italian on the strip.
